I recently visited the Top of the Rock Observation Deck at Rockefeller Center, and it exceeded all my expectations! The panoramic views of Manhattan from the 70th floor were simply stunning. The stunning vistas of iconic landmarks like the Empire State Building, Chrysler Building, and Central Park left me awestruck.

The observation deck was spacious and wellorganized, making it easy to navigate and find the perfect spot to take in the views. The interactive exhibits and displays added a fascinating touch, providing insight into the city's history and architecture.

The staff were friendly and efficient, ensuring a seamless entry process. I appreciated the timedentry system, which prevented overcrowding and allowed for a relaxed experience.

Whether you're a local or a tourist, the Top of the Rock is a mustvisit attraction. I highly recommend it for its spectacular views, engaging exhibits, and unforgettable experience.

Highlights

 Unbeatable views of Manhattan
 Spacious and wellorganized observation deck
 Engaging interactive exhibits
 Efficient staff and entry process
 Perfect for locals and tourists alike

Tips

 Book timedentry tickets in advance to avoid wait times

 Bring a camera to capture stunning photos

It was an unforgettable experience, and Id highly recommend it to anyone visiting NYC. Definitely worth every penny! This architectural masterpiece is both historically significant and aesthetically captivating. Amazing experience! Perfect for families and created some unforgettable memories. Although weve visited NYC before, we never planned ahead enough to visit the Statue of Liberty. The Crown Tour requires advance planning  we booked our tickets two months ahead to ensure everything went smoothly, and it was worth every penny! Be ready to climb between 200500 stairs. We skipped the pedestal elevator and ended up walking the whole way. The spiral staircase leading to the crown is a real workout, so make sure to hydrate beforehand, especially since summer temperatures can get intense inside the statue. While the food is on the pricier side, its still good. The souvenirs and swag are also fantastic. Wed definitely do it again, but maybe in cooler weather next time! Located in New York Harbor off the southern tip of Manhattan, Liberty Island is best known as the site of the Statue of Liberty, one of the most iconic symbols of freedom and democracy in the world. It can only be reached by Statue City Cruise after leaving Ellis Island yesterday. The colossal neoclassical, copperclad sculpture was a gift from France to the United States as a token of goodwill for America's centennial of independence. The island is well kept and fairly small, but there is enough to see and do for at least a couple hours. Weve been here numerous times, and this time my partner, his aunt and I didnt arrange any special tickets to the pedestal or crown. The surroundings around Lady Liberty offered some amazing photos with views of Manhattan, Brooklyn, and Jersey City. The museum offered a deep dive into the statues significance and the incredible craftsmanship that went into its creation. The exhibits were engaging and educational, highlighting the statues role as a symbol of democracy. It offered a lot of 11 reproductions that one can touch and interact with that truly give you a feeling of the scale of the statue. The digital wall was fun to do by taking your photo and watching as it appeared on the giant digital wall called Being Liberty. The overall experience was inspiring and educational. A mustsee for anyone visiting New York City, which we can recommend. Great experience. Family friendly and wonderful memories! We've been to NYC before but never planned ahead enough to do the statue. MUST PLAN AHEAD FOR THE CROWN TOUR!. We booked our tickets about 2 months in advance to make sure we had it done right. Well worth the money. Be prepared to climb 200500 stairs. We didn't wait for the pedestal elevator and ended up doing all the stairs. The spiral staircase to the crown is a workout so drink water ahead of time summer is hot under a giant copper lady's dress. Food is a bit pricey, but good. Great souvenirs and swag. Would do it again in cooler months for sure. The Statue of Liberty is truly a timeless symbol of freedom, offering an aweinspiring experience that goes beyond ordinary sightseeing. Approaching the monument by ferry, the sight of Lady Liberty towering majestically over the harbor is nothing short of breathtaking. The statues immense scale and intricate craftsmanship are remarkable, from the detailed folds of her robe to the iconic spikes of her crown.
The pedestal, which houses a museum, adds depth to the visit, providing rich historical context. It offers insights into the statue's creation, its powerful symbolism, and its important role in welcoming millions of immigrants to the United States.
Overall, it was a memorable experience that left a lasting impression. Finally up close and personal at the Statue of Liberty in New York City! The entire tour was exceptionally fun and educational. I encourage all visitors from around the world to include the Statue of Liberty tour in your itinerary. Either take the ferry from Manhattan or from Jersey! Explore the entire museum and you will learn so many things about Lady Liberty. Indeed fascinating and the experience will be forever remembered. If youre up for a challenge, take the stairs up and down. Dont worry, theres an elevator. If given another chance to be back, will sure am!

Cant wait to come back again to this rooftop but now I will do the sunset time.

In summary, Central Park is a mustvisit destination for anyone in New York. Its natural beauty, combined with the variety of activities available, makes it a perfect spot for a memorable day out. The Brooklyn Bridge is an iconic landmark that connects Manhattan and Brooklyn, making it a mustsee for anyone visiting New York City. Completed in 1883, it's one of the oldest suspension bridges in the United States and is famous for its stunning Gothicstyle towers and intricate cable design. Walking across the bridge offers breathtaking views of the Manhattan skyline, the East River, and the Statue of Liberty in the distance.

The bridge spans about 1,834 meters 5,989 feet and has a pedestrian walkway that allows you to take a leisurely stroll while enjoying the scenery. It's especially beautiful during sunrise or sunset when the city is bathed in warm light. Plus, the bridge has a rich history, having been a pivotal part of New York's development and a symbol of innovation. Whether you're taking photos or just enjoying the view, the Brooklyn Bridge is an unforgettable experience! The Brooklyn Bridge is truly a New York City icon!  Connecting Manhattan and Brooklyn, it's not just a way to get from A to B, but a destination in itself. Whether you're driving, biking, or walking across, the views of the skyline and the East River are absolutely breathtaking.  It's steeped in history and impressive architecture, making it a mustvisit for anyone exploring NYC. Whether day or night, the experience is magical. Perfect spot for those Instagramworthy photos, too!  An unforgettable part of any New York adventure. The Brooklyn Bridge is a nice landmark to visit if you have some time while in New York. The views of the city skyline and the river are great, especially if youre walking across, but be prepared for heavy crowds, especially during peak hours. Its a wellknown spot, but theres nothing particularly extraordinary about the experience beyond the historical significance and views. If youre into sightseeing, its worth a visit, but I wouldnt go out of my way if youre short on time. Still, its an iconic part of New York, so it can be worth checking off your list. The Brooklyn Bridge offers a scenic and memorable walk with stunning views of New York City's skyline and the East River. Perfect for photos and soaking in the vibrant atmosphere, its a mustvisit for anyone exploring the city. 

Walking across the Brooklyn Bridge is an unforgettable experience! The views of the East River, with the skyline of Manhattan on one side and Brooklyn on the other, are simply stunning. Its the perfect blend of history and architecture, with plenty of photo opportunities along the way. The path is wide enough to accommodate both walkers and cyclists, making for a pleasant and comfortable journey. If youre in the area, dont bother with the Manhattan Bridgethis one is the iconic New York experience you dont want to miss! Make sure to walk both ways if you can, to enjoy the views from every angle!

리뷰:
A Stunning Experience at the Summit

I recently had the pleasure of visiting Summit  One Vanderbilt in New York City, and I must say, its an incredible addition to the citys skyline and a fantastic alternative to the Empire State Building. While the Empire State Building is undoubtedly a classic mustsee, Summit One Vanderbilt offers a modern and immersive experience that is simply not to be missed.

The views from the various observatory levels are nothing short of breathtaking. Whether youre gazing out over the iconic skyline or admiring the intricate architectural details of the city below, every angle presents a stunning photo opportunity. I highly recommend visiting around sunset for that you have to buy in advance  tickets at 6PM.

For those who might be hesitant about heights, I can assure you that the elevator ride to the 91 to 93 floor is incredibly smooth and quickyou hardly even feel it!
The design of this space is so thoughtfully done that even the journey adds to the excitement rather than heightening anxiety.

However, I do want to mention that my visit coincided with quite a crowd. Even though our tickets were timed, it became noticeably overcrowded once we got inside. We had high hopes for a sunset view, but our area was packed with people snapping pictures, making it challenging to capture that ideal shot. It seemed some groups were content to linger by the windows, some seem to be camping sitting down for more than one hour.
I understand that these challenges come with a highly soughtafter attraction, especially during prime hours. I believe The Summit will find ways to improve the flow of visitors to enhance the experience for everyone. It's definitely fun but I doubt I'd ever go again. Wife and kids liked it but I don't feel like it was amazing. Paid for the photo package but photos didn't seem professional quality and my phone was as good or better. We went at night so might be why, they just aren't setup for good night photos. Day photos might be better. If you want to get some amazing pictures high up of the empire State building or NYC in general,I recommend it but the exhibits are okay. Expect long lines and waiting. Loved it!!! The views are extraordinary......not overcrowded even though there are lots of people. Great experience for any age..... with family, friends.....date night. If you want great photos of the NY skyline this is it....the backdrop is incredible. After the experience up by the bar ... The drinks are good and you can sit outside and just take it all in. I have to say for an that gets a lot of people It was very well organized.... I think the only downside is the wait prior to security check but the workers were all great and very informative. I'm just disappointed  I didn't keep my QR code to view the pics. Definitely recommend!!!! I am absolutely speechlessthis place is insanely beautiful! From the moment we arrived, I couldnt stop saying WOW!! We visited on a sunny, clear day, and the panoramic views of NYC were simply out of this world. The experience was nothing short of magical and I was so happy to be there! I would 100 visit againits truly a masterpiece in New York. Highly recommend! Summit One Vanderbilt is a mustvisit for anyone looking to experience New York City from a whole new perspective!  Located atop one of Manhattan's newest skyscrapers, this observation deck offers jawdropping, 360degree views of the iconic skyline. The experience is enhanced with immersive art installations and stunning reflective spaces that make your visit even more memorable.  Whether you're watching the sunset or taking in the city lights at night, it's a breathtaking sight. Perfect for both tourists and locals, Summit One Vanderbilt provides a fresh and exciting way to see the city. Dont miss out on this incredible experience when you're in NYC!

However, its still a mustsee for both locals and visitors. Whether you're after a serene retreat or a scenic stroll, this thoughtfully designed park provides a charming experience amidst the city's hustle and bustle. I enjoy this spot as a place to get away from the city while still being in town. I usually go for a walk during off hours, from 6 pm to 11 pm. It's a relaxing space with very creative art, perfect for clearing your mind. I love the food area as there are many choices for refreshments or a quick bite. I also enjoy the artwork and admiring the amazing architecture. If you enjoy all of the above, it's definitely a place you would want to visit while in New York. Its always hard to pick your favorite moment from the high line. As a New Yorker, every few months I come by here and the park has different displays or ideas. Between the wall admiring infrastructure, people watching and enjoying some kind of art. The 2030 block walk is really fun to do with friends or family. 이름: The Museum of Interesting Things (advance appt only)
주소: Georgetown Plaza, 60 E 8th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
리뷰:
I was looking for something different to do with my young adult boys during a meet up in NYC and thought we would try The Museum of Interesting Things! It turned out to be less of a typical "museum" and more of an authentic NYC experience! I easily connected via email with the amazing host and historian extraordinaire, Denny and secured an appointment time. Upon entering, I knew we were in for a special treat. Denny presented us with many different objects from the 19th and 20th centuries, many related to film, sound and photography accompanied by the historical background and a chance to try out the objects ourselves! Denny is knowledgeable and personable, with a delightfully quirky sense of humor. If you are interested in going back in time, or a nostalgic trip down memory lane, don't miss this! My only regret is that we didn't have enough time to go through each item in his apartment! I saw some gems hiding in there! A unique and fun experience like no other!! Definitely worth a visit!! And if you can please consider going the speakeasies! We were in town for the circus speakeasy, got to play with some cool toys and watch amazing and fun circus films. The museum is hosted by and run by Denny who is very knowledgeable and welcoming! He gives a tour of a few antiques from his extensive collection and puts them in your hands! Very hands on, intimate, and fun experience! I learned so much and will definitely be back! What a small little gem. This is basically a private person's personal collection of old, vintage things covering music, photography and videography. You have to book in advance for a private showing of his stuff in his own private apartment. I went here with my 5 and 7 year old kids and both them and myself had a really great time.

Denny, the owner, is an animated man, telling the backstory and background of all the items he showed with lots of humor and energy. He interacted a lot with the kids and made them laugh  I can imagine his tours being popular at schools. We saw an early Edison cylinder phonograph got to hear it as well, various apparatuses to capture photos or view photos, a old camera obscura,  old projectors, flipbook like private movie watching devices, musical instruments, just really fascinating stuff. We all got to try these items ourselves and the roughly one hour tour ended with us even unboxing other things he recently ordered a photographpostcard of an old, giant calculator.

Truly fun experience. I have to come back without the kids to ask many more questions or come to the Sunday public speakeasy exhibitions. The Museum of Interesting Things was easily one of my top 5 favorite museum experiences of all time. Its set up in an apartment and not only is everything out in the open but Denny the person that runs the museum hands you stuff to touch and try out. When I visited, some of the incredible items included original Edison cylinders, an original 3D photo of Abraham Lincoln, a Nickelodeon that has been opened up so you can see the mechanism, the Hobbit game for Commodore 64, and time card machines made by IBM before they were IBM. And everything has a story. We even unboxed some new donations to the museum. Even for the items I was familiar with, I LOVED how he recounted the history of the items. Dennys charisma and passion for his work shines through. Why walk through a large museum devoid of personality where everything is behind plexiglass when you can experience the dynamicism of the Museum of Interesting things. 1110 amazing experience. Fantastic experience! Denny was such a friendly and knowledgeable and passionate host. A visit to this museum would be great for anyone hoping to learn interesting facts, spend a quirky afternoon with friends, have a fun activity for a date, or go on an educational family outing. Denny has such an amazing collection of items and the positive energy he radiates is contagious. He has so many interesting items to show and so many great stories to share!

The museum would be particularly exciting for those interested in the development of media technology.

리뷰:
Bryant Park is truly one of the hidden gems in the city. Its a beautiful and exceptionally clean park with so much to offer. Whether youre looking to relax or get active, theres something for everyone. I spent a lovely afternoon here and was really impressed by the variety of activities available. They have chess, ping pong, and even board games, making it a great spot to hang out with friends or spend some quiet time alone.

I also had lunch here, and the food options around the park are fantastic! From quick snacks to more filling meals, theres no shortage of delicious choices. Its the perfect spot to grab a bite while soaking in the lively atmosphere. Overall, I highly recommend checking out Bryant Park!

Its an ideal place to unwind, enjoy some fun activities, and take in the beauty of the city. Bryant Park in New York City is an exceptional place to spend quality time and find peace of mind. As someone who visits this park frequently, I can attest to its unique charm and vibrant atmosphere. Nestled amid stunning skyscrapers, it offers a tranquil escape from the city's hustle and bustle. The park is always buzzing with cultural events, adding a dynamic and enriching layer to every visit. The presence of birds enhances the serene environment, making it a delightful experience for nature lovers. It's the perfect blend of urban and natural beauty and truly the best park I've encountered in New York City. Bryant Park is a fantastic urban oasis in the heart of Midtown Manhattan! We had such a wonderful time here with our family. The sprawling lawn is perfect for kids to run around and burn off energy, while parents can relax on the grass or at one of the many tables and chairs scattered throughout the park.

We loved grabbing lunch from the nearby food kiosks and enjoying it in the park. There are so many great options for food and coffee surrounding the area.

The park's central location is incredibly convenient, with the New York Public Library right next door and several subway stations just steps away.

The park offers a variety of free activities and amenities that kept our whole family entertained. We particularly enjoyed the putting green and the carousel, which were big hits with the kids.

The atmosphere is lively yet relaxing, with a mix of locals and tourists enjoying the beautiful green space amidst the city's skyscrapers. We're so grateful for this familyfriendly spot in Manhattan and can't wait to return on our next visit to the city! Bryant Park in NYC is an absolute gem, offering a plethora of activities that cater to all interests and ages. Whether youre looking to unwind with a yoga session, enjoy a movie under the stars, or savor delicious food from the various eateries, this park has it all.
One of my favorite things to do is to relax on the lush grass with a good book, soaking in the serene atmosphere amidst the bustling city. For those who enjoy a bit of mental challenge, the chess tables are a fantastic spot to engage in a friendly game. The park also hosts poetry readings and live piano performances, adding a touch of culture and elegance to your visit.
The variety of activities ensures theres always something new to experience, making each visit unique and memorable. Bryant Park truly is a vibrant oasis in the heart of Manhattan, perfect for both relaxation and recreation. 
Have you had the chance to explore any other parks or cultural spots in NYC? If you haven't visited Bryant Park before, I would make it a point to spend some time. From the large green space to chairs and tables you can sit and have a coffee, the park gives you the needed rest and relaxation from the hustle and bustle of the city. There's also a lovely restaurant and cafe attached to the park where you can grab some drinks and food. On certain Mondays you can head to the park to watch a movie on a big screen and grab a quick snack and sit on the grass. Other days you can stop by to listen to live bands or plays going on.

리뷰:
The Metropolitan Museum of Art The Met is an absolute treasure and a mustvisit in New York City! This worldclass museum beautifully showcases art, history, and culture from different countries and eras, offering a truly inspiring experience for everyone. From ancient Egyptian artifacts and stunning European paintings to intricate Asian sculptures and vibrant modern art, The Mets diverse collection takes you on a journey across the globe and through time.

The Art of the Middle East and Iran is particularly captivating, highlighting the rich artistic traditions of these regions. The stunning Persian carpets, exquisite ceramics, and intricate calligraphy provide a glimpse into the regions profound cultural heritage.

Walking through the vast galleries, you can explore the wonders of different cultureseach room tells a unique story, bringing the past to life. The museums layout makes it easy to navigate through various themes and periods, allowing you to appreciate the incredible craftsmanship and artistic expressions of different civilizations.

Whether youre an art enthusiast, history buff, or just curious, The Met has something to captivate every visitor. The grand architecture and beautiful rooftop views add to the experience, making it not just a museum but a cultural adventure. Be sure to take your time, as theres so much to see and absorb. The Met is more than just a museum its an inspiring journey through humanitys greatest artistic achievements. Highly recommended! This is a great museum. One of the best you'll ever visit. I came for the Sleeping Beauties Exhibit at the Costume Institute. I waited a couple of hours to enter that, but was able to see the rest of the museum. I had a wonderful day here. Thanks to Quinton, who worked in the line to enter the Costume Institute. He was so helpful because the line was so long and the system of using the QR code to get notified of when to enter was new to me.  I thought I had lost my place, but he got me back on track and in line just in time to enter. Very friendly and professional. Crazy expansive and quite the hiking trail if you intend to view every nook and cranny of the museum. We managed a visit to maybe 75 of the rooms and only read the most interesting information plaques. This itself took three hours. Another visit will be necessary. The Met will cater to whatever art interest you have but we particularly loved the periodarchitecture room displays. Plus it is likely undefeated for statues if you find yourself looking for that. It was amazing. I haven't been in so long!
The best part for me was the fashion exhibit that they had and the dresses were so cool! It was so nice to see human creativity.
There is so much to look at. I'm sure we only looked at a fraction of what was in the museum.
The knights were super fun and I loved the paintings. You are able to buy tickets online. There was a long line to purchase tickets when we arrived on a Thursday. It's a pretty easy process to buy tickets online. The museum is huge. You would need a few whole days to take everything in. There is a food court and clean restrooms. My favorite part was arms and armor. Greek and Roman section was also awesome.

I had a great solo museum day my favorite here on a rainy weekday. The building itself is quite lovely and a great size to see everything in a slow paced few hours. The exhibits were incredibly well curated  using multimedia and interactive screens in a super effective way. If you want to learn everything about N.Y.C. history  this is the place!!! Loved the show about classic New York films and the main historical timeline exhibit. It felt like every artifact was perfectly chosenrare for the era being described. Dont miss the dynamic maptimeline of immigration flows depicted by growing tree rings in the restorationconservation exhibit. Everyone working there seemed content as well! And a sweet cafe to boot. This place is great for thoughtful tourists and lifelong New Yorkers alike. Its educational, politically charged and emotional.  The 2 hour tour was like a fun condensed history lesson. The lady was amazingly knowledgeable and fun to listen to.

This history and art museum was founded in 1923 by Henry Collins Brown. Run by a private nonprofit organization.  Its originally housed in Gracie Mansion.  Joseph H. Freedlanders Georgian ColonialRevival design for the building in its current location started in 1929 and was completed in 1932. Museums collection contains approximately 1.5 million objects. If you live in New York City, I highly recommend you to visit the museum. Youre going to have many aha moments there. The museum uses quite creative way to tell the story. It was very fun to see and learn the history of New York City.
If you visit New York City, you might find interesting to know what makes New York City this unique.
After museum, we went to Central Park for a picnic and a nice walk. What a beautiful day!
P.S. My friend used the culture pass to get tickets. The Museum of the City of New York deserves a 5star rating! This museum offers a fascinating and comprehensive look at the city's history, culture, and development. The exhibits are wellcurated, engaging, and informative, providing deep insights into New York's past and present. The museum's modern and accessible design enhances the visitor experience, and the staff is knowledgeable and helpful. Whether you're a history buff or just curious about the city's rich heritage, the Museum of the City of New York is a mustvisit destination that offers an enriching and memorable experience. Visited the Museum of the City of New York on a Sunday. Got the tickets online and went into the museum hassle free. Initially, I did not have many expectation on the quality of the exhibitions due to the small size, however i was proven wrong by the comprehensive exhibitions and films in the museum. I learnt so much about NYCs history. Really recommend to catch the short film on the history of NYC which is shown only at specific timings. The staff in the museum are very helpful and knowledgeable as well  they could answer the questions that were asked.

리뷰:
Visitors can journey up the south slopes carved stone stairs to enjoy the vista at the peak, sunbathe on the lawn, or sit at the stone amphitheater with views to the wooded slopes to the south and east.
Before the creation of Central Park, Summit Rock was a prominent feature in Seneca Village, the predominantly AfricanAmerican community that existed in the West 80s from 1825 to 1857.
The rock outcrop commanded views in all directions, including of Seneca Village and west to the Hudson River and beyond to the hills of New Jersey. You can still see the river though the corridor of 83rd Street. When Central Park was constructed, the elevation made it a natural place for designers Frederick Law Olmsted and Calvert Vaux to build a carriage and pedestrian overlook. The small seating are next to summit rock is one of my favorite spots. Quiet. Peaceful. Great view of the surrounding architecture. Just a nice spot to sit and think Unfortunately the summer time is not good for view the sky line as the trees and vegetation blocks the view So cool visiting the highest part of this iconic park. Definitely recommend visiting. Five stars. Great quiet place in Central Park with views of adjacent areas, with great space for small gatherings.

One World Trade Center, located at 285 Fulton St, stands as a powerful symbol of resilience and hope in New York City. The moment you approach the tower, its striking architecture commands attention, reaching skyward with elegance and strength. The glass facade reflects the skyline and surrounding area, creating a dynamic visual experience.

Inside, the One World Observatory offers breathtaking panoramic views that stretch for miles, allowing visitors to appreciate the city's vastness from a unique vantage point. The elevators provide a thrilling ascent, showcasing a multimedia journey through the history of New York.

The immersive exhibits at the observatory deepen your connection to the citys story and its journey of renewal. Whether you're visiting during the day for stunning views of landmarks or at sunset to witness the city bathed in golden light, the experience is truly unforgettable.

One World Trade Center not only represents architectural brilliance but also serves as a poignant reminder of resilience and unity. Its a mustvisit destination that leaves a lasting impression on all who experience its grandeur. We had the opportunity to visit the One World Trade Center as guests of the country. An unbelievable experience, taking the elevator up and witnessing the development of New York is something to behold. A great place to visit, I would recommend it to anyone visiting the state it's a must do. Went on a Saturday at 230 p.m. in October after visiting the 911 Memorial  Museum, which are next door. So it was very convenient to add this activity.

We paid 157 for my mom, myself  two daughters. Get the family pack option to save a good amount on tickets.

Get your tickets online in advance  skip the long line. We went through security  then headed right in no wait.

The elevator ride is super fast our ears popped. It shows a neat photographic history of New York as you ascend.

The view is amazing of course, being the tallest building in NY. But it's blocked by glass  all indoors. Tons of people, so getting a good picture is a little tricky but doable. You can see the statue of liberty, empire state building  even other states.

I would have liked a little more interactive experience  more info on landmarks that I'm seeing. For 15, you can rent a tablet that's interactive to learn more about the places you see. Maybe info on the walls about the landmarks would have been nice.

Overall, it's just ok for what you pay, but we did appreciate the opportunity to go into the tallest building. One visit is sufficient. Probably wouldn't return. We'll try a different observatory next time. I enjoyed Wilson tower in Chicago much more, as it's a museum on your way up  the views are more breathtaking. Great attraction, queues were not too bad and we arrived quite late in the morning. The elevator ride is an experience in itself. The views from the top are incredible and large enough not to feel crowded. The price is very reasonable compared to other attractions of this type I have been to. One World Trade Center is a powerful symbol of resilience and an architectural marvel. The building offers breathtaking views of New York City from the One World Observatory, which is an unforgettable experience. The area around the tower, including the 911 Memorial, is both moving and serene. It's a mustvisit for anyone looking to take in the significance and beauty of this landmark.

리뷰: Outstanding! It was raining cats  dogs and these 2 saved our afternoon. Amazing tour amazing show elements laughter singing dancing  great! Our fellow riders could have been more fun  else fine! Very entertaining! Absolutely worth it! What a fantastic experience!!!! We visited NYC on Sept 28th from ScrantonWilkes Barre PA and Scotty was one of our hostesses on The Ride. Leaves one wondering how many coincidences can happen in NYC.  You could say we were over the moon impressed with all the performers on and off the bus! It was a rainy day in NYC and it was beautiful still! I will be back to see the show again without the rain  Cant rate this high enough! A must we had the best time and witnessed a first. A kid projectile vomiting into a grate right in front of our very eyes that's the hardest we've laughed the whole trip!!! We loved the guides, Street performances, singing and roaring with laughter! Our guide felt like family, and was so funny!!! I wanted to try out this experience for myself after reading the conflicting reviews. Im so glad I did. I had such a great time. I do recommend The Ride. I found the street performers entertaining and the narrators on the bus informative and engaging. They will have you laughing from start to finish. Yes some of its a bit corny but, dad jokes aside, if you dont have fun its because you decided not to have fun. It is interactive which is part of the experience. The street performers were amazing! The Ride is just over an hour long and you stay onboard the whole time. There are no restrooms or restroom breaksstops. So, plan ahead. I purchased my ticket on the viator app but you can go to The Ride website or maybe save a few dollars on groupon. I had no trouble securing a reservation an hour or so prior to scheduled departure and had several options. I had read great comments on a Facebook ad that this was hilarious so we did it because it was included in our go city tickets.  Would never pay even half of the ticket price.  While it was a decent time it definitely isn't hysterical by any means. The skits on the road are not very funny the female singer near Central park the mic was way too loud blasting inside the bus. The other singers were not that loud.  The two comedians in the bus were fun and I would've rather just gone on a ride around the city with them just being like funny tour guides. They were actually funny maybe could've been hysterical if they didn't have to stop for the acts on the street

Nice pier to check out strolling along Hudson River Park Absolutely stunning view during sun down, breath taking view of the water and the city across the water. Won't disappoint trust me. I remember the way the Hudson river piers used to be a long time ago and the slow and steady progress that they went through. Even when they were rundown and had an ill repute, the piers were a draw to New Yorkers and visitors looking to escape the urban jungle that is Manhattan. Looking back, it seems that revelers thought that the piers were worth the risk, no matter how badly kept and dangerous they were. People still went, but at their own risk. After extensive restoration, the piers are now part of a series of small parks which are known collectively as the Hudson River park.

리뷰:
This is mostly just a place to pick up tickets to go to Liberty and Ellis Islands. Although 7.5 million people arrived here from 18551890 including some of my German ancestors, there are only a few relics around inside, and one room with displays, mysteriously most of them are information about other places in America. I thought there might be a place to look up the names of some ancestors who came through here, but no. This is the only genuine place to buy tickets to ferry for Statue of Liberty. To get to this place is literally a nightmare with all the Red Blue and Green dressed fraudsters holding walkie talkies and pretending to be authority to stop you from reaching this place. Dont believe them! They physically stop you from reaching this ticket counter and the city authorities do nothing about it. These fraudsters must be put behind bars for their bad practices. This is not even called a business, simple fraud. If you can reach this place then you have avoided a lot of fraud today. I have been here a few times now. Its quite an interesting place to visit. The castle has a lot of history, starting out as an island fort connected by a wooden bridge, to being landlocked in Battery Park. Its amazing how things have changed around it.
This is well worth doing. There is a lot of history here. There is also a small gift shop with very helpful staff. This circular sandstone fort is in Battery Park on the southern tip of Manhattan, also known as Castle Clinton or Castle Garden.

Built in 1808, this landmark had held the immigrants before Ellis Island in the 19th century and went on to serve as beer garden, exhibit hall, theater and reportedly, as an aquarium.

I often stop by when I'm in the area. It's centrally located in lower Manhattan. Today I'm here to catch the ferry to Liberty Island on my island hopping trip. Good place for the history lovers..

If you are going to Ellis Island and Statue Of Liberty then you would stop by this monument.

It has come great pictures depicting the history of the place.

Though the monument is small and only one room is accessible but you still will like it once you enter the monument.

리뷰: A single slab of the Berlin Wall. A piece of history that was worth checking out after visiting WTC memorial. I served in Berlin from 1990 to 1994 and had much higher expectation for this tribute.  A single slab of wall and it's missing the smoothed rounded crown at the top of the wall.  I believe this section was called "Chickenlips."  Could have been better.  At least 3 sections with all components to the wall.  If you are going to do it, do it right!!  For anyone who may visit Berlin, do not miss the 1.2km stretch of Berlin Wall at the East Side Gallery. Nestled within a small garden near the World Trade Centre site it is quite hard to find even with Maps pointing the way. It is an interesting relic of the times when western and eastern Germany were separated. It is completely out of context in New York and it is like they have no idea what to do with it apart from put it on display. There is no interpretation or signage. You only know what it is because Maps says it is and you can find mention on websites. An interesting piece of history definitely worth checking out if youre visiting the World Trade Center. Weird one to review. It's a nice little piece of the wall but it's kind of hidden away. Fortunately my tour guide 'wife' had done some research about the area and this popped up.

리뷰:
One of our favourite stops in our walk through Central Park. Bow Bridge will offer you an excellent opportunity to take a great picture. Whether in spring with the cherry blossom or fall with its incredible colours, this place will give you a unique scenic look of the Manhattan skyline and its reflection on the water.
Its reputation as a symbol of love and romance has made it a top choice for engagements, wedding photos, and other romantic occasions. A charming and romantic place in Central Park. The bridge is beautiful and the view from it is amazing. A calm and pleasant place. Around the bridge there are many benches for resting. Many couples come here to take pictures on their wedding day. Central Park's Bow Bridge is a charming spot, perfect for a stroll together. We loved gazing out at the lake, watching rowboats glide beneath the bridge. The view itself is postcardworthy  the graceful arch of the bridge framed by the lush greenery, with the iconic Manhattan skyline peeking through the trees in the distance. It's a picture of tranquility amidst the city's energy. Whether you're seeking a romantic moment or just a scenic pause, Bow Bridge is a Central Park gem This is a highlight spot in the park.  You can rent boats at the boathouse for 15.00 per hour cash only and 4.00 per each additional 15 minute increment.  They do require a 20.00 deposit on the boats.  At the boathouse, the lake looks small but dont be deceived...its quite large and gives you plenty of places to explore!  The lake is filled with turtles who are very used to the congestion of nyc and not at all afraid of passersby.  You can get great photos on a sunny day.  The Bow Bridge is pretty with spring blooms and is often crowded so you will want to expect people to be apart of your photo opportunities!  Great views with the skyline behind! Beautiful spot and you can just see a couple of buildings over the treetops.

Water was green but so was everything else. Lovely reflection off the water.

Pier 35 is an excellent spot for catching a beautiful sunset. The atmosphere is perfect for a relaxed evening by the water. I highly recommend bringing some snacks and drinks to enjoy while you take in the view. Just remember, no alcoholic beverages, as public drinking is prohibited in the US.

Overall, Pier 35 offers a wonderful experience and is a mustvisit for anyone looking to enjoy a serene sunset in the city. Excellent place to go alone, with family and friends. It is ideal for exercising, sitting down to rest or simply walking and watching the sunsetsunrise. The only thing I dislike are people who take dogs and don't pick up the poop, literally everywhere you walk there is dog poop  also people there are so many BIG TRASH CONTAINERS throw garbage into the sea or throw it on the ground  It would be nice if there was some watchman in this area to regulate those situations because a dock as beautiful as Pier 35 is also filling up with homelessness sleeping on the floorseats. I recently visited Pier 42 and it looked new, everything clean, the tennis courts, soccer, basketball, playground, among others. I began to see that more people were going and it gets dirtier and dirtier  It's irritating that people don't respect rules like picking up their own dog's poop or even throwing trash in trash bins... I also saw that currently there are many who want to fish and they cut the security wires, I have also seen that they have destroyed fences to cross faster to the other side of the park... We should be more grateful for our environment and be conscious about keeping it clean because we are the ones who go there to take advantage of what surrounds us.  Amazing and breathtaking spot to hang out with friends and family. The swings and benches are very clean and offer a beautiful view of the Manhattan Bridge along with the East River. Its a great spot to watch sunset by the river, there are 3 swings but most are on queues as people wanted to make pics and videos on social media. Its nice windy on the day I went If you want to catch a great view and just sit, read, or have a conversation with someone, this is an excellent spot. Before entering the pier there are some seats outside in front of the water and is never crowded as the pier is. The views of the Manhattan Bridge and Williamsburg Bridge are stunning!
Grab your favorite book, your journal, a meal, your friend or a partner and come check it out!

The hunt was a nice length too  it took us a little over an hour but that included a drink stop at one of the suggested cafes. I'd definitely do another of these when I'm next in NY. If youre looking for a fun way to explore NYC  finding oft overlooked city specifics  a Questing scavenger hunt is for you!

My daughter and I followed clever clues with the exact right level of difficulty around FiDi and South Street Seaport areas of Manhattan.  It was challenging, fun and informative.

Truly, Questing scavenger hunt was a great find!

It stands on part of the footprint of the old 7WTC which was destroyed on 911.  It is named after the property developer Larry Silverstein who owns most of the WTC buildings except 1WTC.

The sculpture has been changed  gone are the purple balloon things you may see on older images by a big wire three dimensional star thing.... The place is huge. FYI, restrooms were closed and it was only 815pm had to go to Whole Foods supermarket for a restroom. Amazing place for relaxing!

A beautiful park to spend a relaxing day walking the trails or just admiring the views of nature and exploring the landscape of the park. Good to walk with someone else as the trails are very lonely. Cant wait until the fall to see all the beautiful trees changed their colors. Welcome to Inwood Hill Park, a unique gem in the city! This isnt just any park its a vibrant forest rich with history that dates back hundreds, even thousands of years.

As you explore, keep an eye out for cultural landmarks that tell fascinating stories from the past. Plus, the Inwood Hill Nature Center has recently reopenedperfect for weekend visits and learning about the local environment!

Youll find plenty of activities here, from playgrounds to baseball and basketball courts, as well as a natural soccer field. Its a great place to hang out with friends and enjoy some outdoor fun!

As you stroll through the beautiful wooded areas, you might enjoy a break from cell servicewhat a great way to connect with nature! Plus, keep your eyes peeled for the stunning flowers and trees that add vibrant art to the landscape, making every corner of the park a visual delight!

Just a heads up its called Inwood Hill Park, not to be confused with Inwood Park in the Bronx! This one has the HILL!

P.S. Dont forget to study the map so you dont get too lost in all this adventure! 2 thumps up. You might get lost in the wild but eventually ur gonna have 2 come back 2 civilization and pay your bills. Esto es fascinate perdersw en Este monte, y lo han limpiando mucho ya no es un laverinto. Inwood Hill Park in uptown NYC is truly a gem, especially during the weekdays when it transforms into a peaceful retreat perfect for enjoying good weather and sunshine. My husband and I love to take leisurely strolls around the park, soaking in the stunning views of the Hudson River. Its our goto spot to unwind and connect with nature amidst the hustle and bustle of the city.

The park holds a special place in my heart, bringing back fond memories of my childhood. I remember watching my dad play baseball with his local team, though my attention was often captured by the surrounding nature and wildlife. The joy of exploring the natural beauty of the park is something I cherish to this day.

Another highlight of our visits is stopping by Inwood Farm Caf. Their coffee and pastries are the perfect complement to our park outings. Plus, its a bit special for us since we both worked there briefly together... Say hi to Tom!

Inwood Hill Park offers a unique blend of tranquility, nostalgia, and natural beauty, making it a perfect spot for relaxation and reflection. Whether you're a nature enthusiast, a history buff, or just looking for a serene escape, this park is an absolute treasure. Started here before walking across Manhattan. The view was great and it was really cool to be at the tippy top of Manhattan!

The upper portion of the bridge was originally constructed in wood, making it the only wood bridge to carry the weight of the carriage drive. It soon deteriorated and was replaced with stone in 1885. A beautiful spot for relaxing, strolling  unwinding.
Visited it with a group of artists to sketch some natural scenes. Would love to go again  explore more. Beautiful rustic arch just east to the Pool and a small waterfall. The original design was rock piers supporting wooden walk and railing, completed in 1865. Approximately in 1885, the wood portion was replaced with rustic rock. The Glen Span Arch follows an ancient European style which blends really well with the green of the central park. A great photo opportunity. There is a small manmade stream running beneath the arch along with a small road leading to a more quiet place in the park, where you don't find too many people. It does look like you're in a fairy tale. Beautiful Scenery surrounding the Arch! nice quiet place to relax, take pictures, and enjoy the view

리뷰:
Brooklyn Heights Promenade offers one of the most breathtaking views of the Manhattan skyline, the Brooklyn Bridge, and the Statue of Liberty. Its a perfect spot for a leisurely stroll, especially during sunset when the city lights start to twinkle across the East River. The promenade is beautifully maintained, with benches lining the path where you can sit and take in the panoramic views.

It's a popular spot for both locals and tourists, making it a great place for peoplewatching and photography. The serene environment, combined with the stunning views, makes it an ideal place for a quiet moment of reflection, a romantic walk, or just a break from the city's hustle and bustle.

The surrounding Brooklyn Heights neighborhood adds to the charm with its historic brownstones and quiet, treelined streets. This promenade is a mustvisit for anyone looking to experience a more peaceful side of New York City while still soaking in the iconic skyline. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Brooklyn or looking for a scenic view of NYC. Nice place for a walk. Good crowd, lots of benches to rest on and a good view. From some points the World Trade Center seems so near. The Brooklyn bridge, the river, boats, in front and the iconic brown stone buildings behind you is a great feeling. I am a frequent visitor whenever I am in New York. One of the best places to watch a sunset and see the city lights come on. The view is framed by the statue of Liberty and the Brooklyn Bridge. You are elevated above the waterfront and looking across to South Manhattan. Nice benches to sit on while you enjoy the view. Before the sunset, take a looping walk through the adjoining Brooklyn Heights neighborhood. A lot of beautiful homes with great architectural details.  The Dumbo area is a short walk from here. A great selection of restaurants to enjoy as well. Brooklyn Heights Promenade is an absolute gem. This serene walkway offers stunning views of the Manhattan skyline and the East River, providing a peaceful escape from the city's hustle and bustle. The energy here is wonderfulcalm, yet vibrant. It's the perfect spot for a leisurely stroll, a quiet moment of reflection, or simply to enjoy the breathtaking scenery. The wellmaintained gardens and friendly atmosphere make it a delightful place to visit. Whether you're a local or a tourist, this promenade is a mustsee. Absolutely gorgeous. If you're looking for fresh air and beautiful scenery,  this is a fabulous choice.   Pack a lunch, there's plenty of benches to sit and relax. The vibe is super chill, and the views are amazing.

주소: 290 Broadway, New York, NY 10007, USA
리뷰:
This place is a part of American History I hardly learned about growing up in 1960s and 1970s! I felt honored to experience this exhibit! As one narrator said, this is the Ellis Island for the Africans who arrived in America! As slaves they were abused and suffered tremendously! The movie I saw in their theater brought tears to my eyes! NYC was built on the suffering of these people! I greatly want to thank Ms. Doris for her great customer service and dedication! She was like our personal tour guide! Everyone here had a smile and were courteous the staff and security guards! May I mention that the entrance is currently free to the public! There is a souvenir shop that uses the proceeds from the sales to support the facility! Please purchase somethingjust my opinion! Thank you! This is a very interesting place to visit, but you also need to go to the visitor center, where the true history of the site can be found. Its quite amazing some of the things our ancestors were capable of and sites like this are a reminder of how far we have come. The African Burial Ground National Monument is a profoundly powerful and emotional place that touches the heart and soul of everyone who visits. As you walk through the gates, the weight of history and the significance of the site become immediately apparent. Theres an almost tangible sense of power and reverence that permeates the air, making it clear that this is hallowed ground.

As you begin reading the plaques and the messages inscribed on them, youre struck by a deep sense of sorrow and reflection. The thought of so many people buried here, many without their names known, is a somber reminder of the injustices they endured. Yet, even in the absence of their names, the presence of those buried here is felt strongly. The silent recognition of their lives, their struggles, and their humanity is an act of remembrance that speaks volumes.

In this space, where the unknown should be remembered, I found myself saying a silent prayer for those who rest here. Its a place where your heart and mind are naturally drawn to honor and acknowledge the souls who contributed so much to the foundation of this city and this country, yet were forgotten for so long.

The African Burial Ground National Monument is not just a place of sorrow, but also one of respect, remembrance, and deep connection. Its a place where the unknown are brought into the light, where their lives are honored, and where visitors are given the opportunity to reflect on the history that has shaped us all. This site is a mustvisit for anyone seeking to understand the profound impact of African Americans on the history of New York and America, and to pay their respects in a place that is as sacred as it is powerful. This is an important place to visit. I was a bit disappointed I couldnt go in. The place was supposed to be open to the public on Tuesdays, but for some reason it was closed. Easy to overlook this place with a powerful and fascinating story while you are in the city but take the time to stop by and learn a piece of our history. The NPS attendants were helpful and the presentation was very well done, especially as much of the story is in the history of the site being rediscovered in the 1990s and the public response. Doesn't take long at all to go through the museum and monument but well worth the time even with all the cool stuff in NYC.

리뷰: Very good views from here. You can even catch a glimpse of the Statue of Liberty, although it's too far away to get any decent looking pictures. It's also just a super nice area to have a stroll or even a jog. Great views and head down for some volleyball while your out! This promenade is beautiful and wellkept, of course, but I was especially pleased to see an ADAcompliant picnic table installed. While Id love to see more seating along the promenade, this a great start so good work, BPCA! After 12 miles of walking around Central Park and seemingly everywhere else Manhattan had to offer, I thought I would end my journey for the day. As I headed back to catch the train I saw a group of people playing volleyball. What a dream to be able to head to the pier and play a game with likeminded people. Ditching all plans to head in for the night, I headed in to watch the game. A step or two later, I realized Id stumbled upon one of the most incredibly vibrant sunsets Id witnessed in all my years walking around this planet. I watched until the night sky took over and even then the beauty of the city bouncing off the darkened sky astounded me. I often go back to this spot in my memory to relive the feeling of being in my favorite painting. Do not miss this spot on your journey through Manhattan. Very nice place to relax and watch sunset.

주소: New York, NY 10080, USA
리뷰:
Pumphouse Park at Brookfield Place is a hidden gem that truly comes alive in spring. The vibrant tulips create a breathtaking display, painting the landscape with bursts of color. As you stroll through the park, the combination of the blooming flowers and the stunning waterfront views of the Hudson River offers a serene escape from the city's hustle and bustle.

The parks design complements the beauty of the tulips, making it a perfect spot for relaxation or a leisurely picnic. Whether you're capturing photos or simply enjoying the fresh spring air, Pumphouse Park is a delightful oasis that celebrates the season in all its glory. It's an absolute mustvisit for anyone seeking a moment of beauty in the heart of New York. Pumphouse Park is a breathtaking escape for anyone who loves nature and flowers. The park is especially stunning during the tulip season, where vibrant blooms create a spectacular display of colors. Its not just tulips, thoughthe park is wellmaintained with a variety of other beautiful flowers that make every visit a delight. The paths are perfect for a peaceful walk, and the benches strategically placed throughout allow for moments of quiet reflection or a lovely picnic. Pumphouse Park is a mustvisit for locals and tourists alike, offering a tranquil retreat right in the heart of the city. Nice little park across West Street from the Freedom Tower. Rear side gives you entrance to the docks. Very lush, tree lined and shady park. Plenty of benches. Small and relaxing. 1 Great Park for walking, running and walking dogs.
2 Nice view of the whole New Jersey City from this park.
3 No tulips blossom yetI'll go there again when it's covered with tulips. Pictures from April 22nd, 2024

So many beautiful tulips on a sunny Monday at Brookfield Place

주소: 9 Jay St, New York, NY 10013, USA
리뷰:
I come here daily to take photos and to take a break from work. A great neighborhood in NYC,it is safe and clean. Chambers street subway station is a few blocks away. The Staple Street Bridge is a truly remarkable structure with a fascinating history. Originally part of a hospital, the bridge was used to transport patients between buildings, adding a unique and functional aspect to its design.

The history of the bridge adds to its allure, as it provides a glimpse into the past and how architectural elements were creatively used for practical purposes. Today, the bridge stands as a reminder of its past while also serving as a picturesque landmark in the heart of New York City.

The location of the Staple Street Bridge is indeed stunning. Nestled among the bustling streets of Manhattan, the bridge offers a peaceful retreat, surrounded by historic buildings and charming cobblestone streets.

Visiting the Staple Street Bridge is a must for anyone interested in history, architecture, or simply looking to explore a hidden gem in the city. Its unique design and rich history make it a truly special destination in New York City. As a photographer I like this historical place. Romantic and truly unique. Interesting little bridge ! Very cute in a very small street.
It can be a great place to take professionalmodel pictures I think. Located in Tribeca neighborhood and considered one of the  must photo ops spots in the city. Staple street is one of the shortest streets in the city only spanning across the 2 blocks so it is very easy to over look that location. Skybridge, that at one time connected 2 parts of the hospital, is great background for fun photo shoots. At the moment theres construction going but you can still enjoy the architecture and get great pictures.

주소: 185 Greenwich St, New York, NY 10007, USA
리뷰:
A bronze sculpture of an octopus cradling an elephant, gorilla, bunny, and rhinoceros has made its home in Lower Manhattans World Trade Center campus.

Artists Gillie and Marc  Their latest work of art, The Arms of Friendship, depicts the worlds largest bronze octopus. The octopus  36 feet long and weighing 7 tons  holds some endangered creatures within its eight limbs.

The interactive artwork, titled The Arms of Friendship, features some of the world's most endangered species curled up in or sitting on the octopus's giant tentacles. Visitors are invited to get up close and personal with the 7tonne sculpture and sit on its tentacles to get a different perspective on the animal.

In the last 50 years, wildlife populations have plummeted by 69 globally. We are now facing the worlds sixth mass extinction, as per their artist.

This breathtaking 36foot artwork invites you to sit on its tentacles and experience a close connection with some of the planets most iconic endangered creatures. Their goal is to inspire everyone to love animals, learn about their plights, and be motivated to help protect our planet. Get day time photos here and don't climb on these. Interesting place full of art. Beautiful and funny animal sculptures. There needs to be more of these funny places. They are little magnets, and also a distraction, between the concrete blocks.

주소: 20 Chambers St, New York, NY 10007, USA
리뷰:
This was one of the best walking tours I have ever been on.  Scott is so engaging and knowledgable about Alexander Hamilton,and his role in US history and New York City history.
If you are looking for a wonderful immersive Colonial history walking tour with Alexander Hamilton you should take this tour. I love history, and this tour made it come alive. The tour was very interesting and our tour guide, "Alexander Hamilton," was in character from the moment we showed up. His mixture of history and the lyrics from the Musical including identifying the points that were inaccurate were both funny and educational.It was a great time. If you love history this tour is absolutely for you. What a great tour! The guide was knowledgeable, engaging and thorough. We learned so much we didnt know about Hamilton and his interactions and relationships with the other founding fathers. We also learned a couple of things that were inaccurately depicted in the musical. Lastly, the first person account made it more interesting. We were amazed how he stayed in character the entire time. If you are a fan of the musical and love history, you will enjoy this tour. It did not disappoint. If you love Alexander Hamilton, or the history of New York, you will love this unique walking tour.   We went to so many historical spots that I as a New Yorker did not even know existed. The knowledge 'Ham' shared in this tour is amazing and it really makes you feel as if you were there talking to Hamilton. What an amazing experience. I recommend it for kids and adults. Fantastic tour! Our Hamilton guide was funny, engaging, and knowledgeable. Highly recommend this tour for Hamilton fans who are curious about the musicals accuracy or want a spacial exploration of colonial history.

주소: Hudson River Greenway, New York, NY 10013, USA
리뷰:
This was my first time kayaking, and this was picturesquely awesome!
On Sundays they offer free kayaking starting at 11am. Lineups starts before 10am.
They also offer lockers to keep stuff which you dont want to get wet. And mind you, you will get wet! So dress accordingly. And theres no changing room here.
If youre 18 , know how to swim, you can sign a waiver and get a free Kayak for 20min.
If below 18, a guardian must accompany you and can double.
You have to sign a waiver before kayaking.

Route is beautiful. You can see the Manhattan skyline and Jersey skyline as well, even Statue of Liberty is visible.

And please donate after the ride! Finally got to try the free kayaking at Pier 26 on a Sunday morning after Labor Day. I didn't have to wait long to be suited up in a life vest, paddle in hand and helped onto a kayak. The water was a little choppy, but navigating with the paddle was fairly easy. It was my first time kayaking, and the guides were helpful in giving tips. They're at the dock and in the water, helping people who may need it. They say we're supposed to have 20 min on the water, but nobody checks. I had fun, I would do it again. FREE kayaking on the Hudson River with gorgeous views of downtown Manhattan and New Jersey. A must do in the summer in NYC.

Note that they do not allow dogs on the kayak here. Also free lockers provided. You will get wet so dress accordingly. This is an awesome free activity Saturday and Sunday You get to go kayaking for about 20 minutes. There are lockers for you to put your belongings in. You will be asked to take your shoes off, unless you bring some water shoes or sandals. The riverside park at Pier 26 on the Hudson River in Manhattan has beautiful scenery and is suitable for leisure and entertainment for the whole family.

주소: 117 MacDougal St, New York, NY 10012, USA
리뷰:
What an incredible experience! I brought my 18 year son and my boyfriend. We enjoyed every comedian, definitely had our favorites but the line up was amazing. I would recommend to go over and over again. A true New York gem. AMAZING! My husband and I went to both the 930 and 1130 shows and had an unforgettable experience. I love how intimate the room feels, like youre in some exclusive club. The comedians on Sept 24 were just absolutely hilarious but the content isnt for someone who is not able to let loose. The crowd also makes the show, so I dont recommend going if you dont have an open mind. We also got the shock of our night having Louis C.K. take the stage!! We love coming here and the comedians are always hilarious. The host has the crowd amped up and is always on point. We have seen some of the best comedians here, all kinds of comedy too. Whenever we are in NYC, which is a few times a year, we come here every night we're in town. Highly recommend.. best comedy clubs in the country. Such a cool place to go to! Inside is very intimate and cozy  maybe too much, since we were elbowtoelbow with strangers, but everyone was fine with that.

We made reservations ahead of time, but the seating is first come first serve. You'll definitely get a seat, but you won't get to choose. There's a 2 itemperson minimum food counts! with a 14person cover, which I think is reasonable.

I'll definitely be going back on a night with new comics, and getting there earlier for a better seat. First time visiting. Everything was fantastic from the comedians to the waiters and waitresses. I laughed so hard I cried. Every comedian killed it! Our emcee Jon Laster was amazing. I highly recommend going to the Olive Tree Cafe before a show. I cant wait to go back again! Its a must for any comedy fan! A true bucket list experience! Thank you for an amazing time!

This place is great for families. The staff was awesome. We had an amazing time. Some places you can go and say your glad you did it but u probably won't go back but not the color factory. We will definitely return maybe another location because we have had enough of New York for a while. My favorite room was the dance room but they were all so much fun. This place brought the kid out of my husband and I. We were all able to let our hair down and enjoy each other. They gave us ice cream at the end, which was pretty tasty. The ball pit was awesome, and I love that they have cameras where you can scan your code and get the pics after right to your phone. A 10 out of 10 experience. I came here with my friends and their kids. It was adorable and the adults had just as much fun if not more fun than the kids! Its a bit pricey, so definitely take your time and take lots of pics.   We had a lot of the rooms to ourselves so that was nice! We went on a weekday before noon, so it wasnt busy at all. I can imagine the weekends could be crowded. Mehh..I was not sure how to feel about the exhibits and the whole experience.  It was costly for me and my eight year old son.  I think most of the exhibits were large space to put stuff.  The confetti exhibit was about the best, and its the only exhibit that i liked and my son did too  The best part and what it seemed like everyone enjoyed was the ball pit and most people seemed to just go the museum for that reason.  they do offer a place to check your bag mine traveled with me but i gave them my coat I highly recommend visiting here. My daughter and I had so much fun from beginning to end. Love the cameras that will capture every moment and every room you visits. I love the idea of treats in every room like candy, chocolate, ice cream and souvenirs for take away. The best experience ever. You use your senses to explore colors, its a fun place that lets you explore your child like wonders. I will say its main focus is pictures. I did not spend the time it says it will. I spent around an hour there. Its a cute place to have a date and get to know a person more.
Fun interactive experience for all ages. I will say better to do this with someone else and not alone.

리뷰: The feast was great with tons of people and lots and lots of food. The bathroom situation was not good. I couldn't find any of the portable bathrooms and the garbage cans were very scarce. Other than that it was fabulous. The Feast of San Gennaro celebrated by generations of Italian immigrants that settled on the lower east side of Manhattan, each region settled on a different street. The Neapolitans settled on Mulberry St. In 1926 with keeping their Neapolitan traditions they decided to have a party for their patron saint and protector of Naples, San Gennaro which continued year after year something that has now and for decades become not only a New York icon but a world known 11 day event which stretches throughout 11 blocks of the Little Italy neighborhood. For many years this feast has always been an important part of the Little Italy neighborhood and New York City. San Gennaro festival...food family fun, food food and food Went to the St. Gennaro festival with great company. Couldn't wait to get zeppole and ride the ferris wheel. Amazing food fest!  No one makes food like that

The trip on this boat is awesome. I like it, also I can fully recommend it for those who are first time at NY, such emotions 
We bought tickets in advance, its easy to find them on the internet, so you dont have to wait in a queue to buy your ticket. It took us just up to 10 mins to wait for our ferry. We had the pleasure of riding with Steve on our NYC harbor cruise on July 1st, 2024. The only thing Steve loves more than his job is his hometown. This guy was FANTASTIC. He had SO much information... we could have rode with him for HOURS and still only get a fraction of his knowledge. He was also super funny and, of course, very friendly. Everything you'd want in a harbor cruise guide. Also, the rest of the crew were equally as friendly, which made for a smooth, fun adventure. Great job, everyone! We took the 1.5hr landmark cruise. If you want to sit outside there is limited covered seating so get in line early. The tour guide was amazing, he was very knowledgeable and funny. The boat is nice as well. We did the landmarks sightseeing cruise.
We suggest to book it online in advance, and if it is summer don't forget your cap and solar cream.

The view and landscape you can see from this prospective will be unforgettable.

Follow us for other suggestions on Instagram
Hungrytravelers

More to be endured than enjoyed.

리뷰:
In my opinion American Museum of Natural History is the best museum to visit in NYC. This museum is very interesting and big, I would recommend you to come here in the morning so you have plenty of time to explore the whole area of the museum. The museum has a lot of interesting and different sections to see. In my opinion, the most interesting part of the museum was 4 floor that is about primitive and advanced mammals. Also on the 4 floor you could find fossils of different types of dinosaurs. In addition to my review, I was impressed by the unusual lobby, the lobby has interesting quotes on the wall and in the middle of the lobby there is a fossil of a giant dinosaur. When I went into the museum, I didnt need to wait a long time to get in, but it would be better for you to buy tickets online so you have dont have to worry about the line. Visiting the American Museum of Natural History in New York was an incredible experience that captivated both my inner child and adult curiosity. The realism of the exhibits was truly impressive.

As I wandered through the animal dioramas, I was struck by how lifelike they were. Each display seemed to transport me into a different habitat, with animals looking so real that I almost expected them to move. The detail in the taxidermy and the recreated environments made it easy to lose myself in the wonders of nature.

The crystal and mineral exhibits were equally stunning. I marveled at the vibrant colors and intricate shapes of the crystals, each one presented with such clarity and beauty. It felt like stepping into a dazzling world of natural artistry.
The museum did an excellent job of making the exhibits engaging for all ages.
Overall, my visit to the museum was both educational and aweinspiring. Its a place where the natural world is brought to life in a way thats both magical and meaningful for visitors of all ages. I advice to book your ticket in advance. Wow, this museum is massive! It is huge and so interesting! if youre the type to read most things inside a museum be prepared to spend over 5 hours here. This museum is perfect for people of all ages! I went here solo and I was having a blast. I honestly wished I had more time to read and explore. Pro tip, all CT, NY and NJ residents can pay as much as they want I personally paid a single dollar, just bring your ID. I highly recommend this museum! It is a really fun place, however, it is hard to rate it higher given several of the factors associated with making the trip. First thing to consider is I do not live in NY, I live in central NJ, so getting into NY is an unfortunate factor to add into the equation. Museum parking for more than 5 hours is 46 dollars. That is not bad given NYC, just something to factor into the equation if you plan on driving in. The next thing is the ticket prices. It can be free, however, I wanted to take my girlfriend to the butterfly vivarium. The way the ticket prices work is if you want one of the additional events you need to purchase a general ticket first and then the event of interest is added on afterwards. This means if you are interested in attending the butterfly vivarium, its around 30 dollars a person for the 20 minutes you may be spending there. I suppose it is worth it if you really want to make someone you care about happy, but otherwise that does not seem super realistic. Another factor to consider is the crowds. I went on a Thursday from 11am to closing 5pm. The only time it was even remotely quiet was in the reptile room a relatively remote area of the museum at around 330pm. otherwise the crowds and commotion can be pretty grating. Thinking about it, I wouldn't mind the pricing of everything as much, if it was an actual museum experience, as opposed to the amusement park experience that was presented to us. I am aware if you want to attend the museum after hours from 6 to 8pm you could do that with the membership, however, the membership is somewhat expensive, isn't the most practical for someone living outside of the city, and frankly a strong enough experience was not made on me This museum is incredibly expansive, and I found myself needing to return to fully explore all it has to offer. The exhibits are captivating and I particularly appreciated how the message of interconnectedness was emphasized throughout. I would recommend setting aside 45 hours to truly immerse yourself in all the museum has to offer.

리뷰:
An Urban Oasis Full of History and Fun


Having visited Flushing Meadows Corona Park five times, I can honestly say its one of the most diverse and vibrant parks in New York City. Its a perfect escape from the urban hustle, offering something for everyone, whether youre looking to relax, exercise, or explore.

The park is massive, and every visit reveals something new. The iconic Unisphere is a beautiful centerpiece, and walking around it, especially on a sunny day, feels almost magical. The views are spectacular, and its a great spot for photos. The park also has plenty of wide, open spaces for picnics, family gatherings, or just lounging on the grass.

If youre into sports, there are plenty of facilitiesfrom tennis courts to soccer fields, to biking and running trails. Its a great place to stay active or just enjoy a casual stroll. The playgrounds are wellmaintained and perfect for kids, making it a great familyfriendly destination.

One of the parks biggest highlights is its cultural significance. You can visit landmarks like the Queens Museum, with its Panorama of New York City, or catch an event at the USTA Billie Jean King National Tennis Center. Theres always something happening here, whether its a festival, a concert, or just the daily buzz of New Yorkers enjoying the outdoors.

Flushing Meadows Corona Park is a wonderful blend of nature, history, and activitya place I cant help but return to again and again. If you havent been, I highly recommend checking it out! Flushing Meadow Corona Park is a true oasis! From the moment you step in, you're surrounded by lush greenery, wellmaintained paths, and the serene sound of nature. It's the perfect place to escape the hustle and bustle of the city.

The park offers something for everyonewhether you're looking to take a leisurely stroll, enjoy a picnic, or get some exercise. The playgrounds are fantastic for kids, with plenty of space to run around and explore. I also loved the scenic walking trails, which are great for a peaceful walk or a morning jog. Dont forget to check out the world sphere  a landmark in Queens, NYC!

The grounds are impeccably clean, and the landscaping is beautiful, with vibrant flowers and wellkept lawns. There are plenty of benches and shaded areas to relax and take in the surroundings. Overall, Flushing Meadow Corona Park is a gem of a park. Whether you're spending the day with family, walking your dog, or just looking for a quiet place to unwind, this park is perfect. Lovely experience. We went walking at the Pat Dolan trail but of course you can try other options also its a huge park and many interesting trails. So quiet, with amazing smell of flowers and trees and sounds of nature. Many birds can be spotted and rhe lake is beautiful. Highly recommended. Clean trails and safe. Just one issue was that not many bathrooms and seating is seen on the trails. This park retrieves my soul from the gravity of the city, as I pedal around broad roads with no cars and few pedestrians, enjoying the wide open pastoral spaces. Few places can rival Flushing Meadow Park, especially for a runner or a bicyclist, at least in New York City. We visited Flushing Meadows Corona Park for the Queens Street Market. We walked from the metro station through the park. We saw the Unisphere. It was huge. The park was well used with many families and groups on the Saturday night we visited. The street market was amazing. There was foods and drinks from all around the world. We tasted many items and enjoyed all of them. There isn't very much seating in the area of the market. I would suggest bringing a blanket. There was a lot of grassy areas to sit on and enjoy your tastings.

If you live in the city and want to experience getting away from the city, without going far, then the Central Park Zoo is a great place to go.
