리뷰:
Theodore Roosevelt Park in New York is a delightful urban oasis that offers a perfect mix of natural beauty and historical significance. Nestled near the American Museum of Natural History, it provides a serene escape from the bustling city streets. The wellmaintained walking paths, lush greenery, and charming benches make it an ideal spot for a leisurely stroll or a peaceful moment of reflection. The statue of Theodore Roosevelt is a notable highlight, adding a touch of history to the park's ambiance. While it can get crowded on weekends, the park's tranquil atmosphere and scenic views make it well worth a visit. Four stars! So much to see!  Come early, stay late and you will still miss so much. The exhibits, collections and documentation is astounding.  To have the chance to glance into the past, is one that should not be wasted The American Museum of Natural History is one of the worlds preeminent scientific and cultural institutions. Since its founding in 1869, the Museum has advanced its global mission to discover, interpret, and disseminate information about human cultures, the natural world, and the universe through a wideranging program of scientific research, education, and exhibition. The Museum is renowned for its exhibitions and scientific collections, which serve as a field guide to the entire planet and present a panorama of the world's cultures Very cool experience!!!

American Museum of Natural History
If you are interest in a museum fun trip, Id highly recommend and if youre planning to bring your car they have parking available which in NYC that is always a must.

And theres so much to see and do. I actually visited the Museum of Natural History with my  daughters ASL class and teachers from Truman HS, and my two other kids. We all enjoyed ourselves. The planetarium, butterfly room and the invisible room are Awesome. I haven't been here since I was a teenager.. brought back good memories.

리뷰:
Iconic park! Must visit in NYC so much happening all at once its wonderful. Was worried it might be a bit too much for my cat but she had a great time and we just stayed away from big crowds which is actually possible here. Even with the fountain on full blast, people playing music on speakers and a large protest happening it was easy to converse without interruptions in relative peace. Perfect place to have any kind of park experience you want. Essential New York visit! Washington Square Park is a lovely spot, situated right next to NYU, making it a perfect place for students and locals to relax. The park is always lively, with people sitting around, enjoying the scenery. The central fountain is a standout feature and adds to the calm atmosphere. Its a nice, small park ideal for chilling out, reading, or just peoplewatching. With its prime location and welcoming vibe, its a great place to take a break from the hustle of the city. There is a lot of energy at this park, and it's worth a stop. First of all, it's beautiful. Second, you never know what you'll find. I feel like this is still a very bohemian hang out spot it's full of artists, demonstrations, dancers, drum circles, and just about any and everything you can think of. It's a very exciting vibe, and it's nice to snag a spot to sit and just watch the world, watch the art, watch how other people react to things. It also has an extremely interesting history that I think adds to the overall energy of this spot. In my opinion, there's no other place in the city quite like it. A great park with a huge marble arch, a fountain, lots of benches and lots of NYU students and some very eccentric characters.  The park has a kids playground and very clean rest rooms.

The park is very safe even later in the evening.  Always a very enjoyable and entertaining experience.

Highly recommend this park. Fun and lively park to hang out. This park holds nostalgic value to me since I went to NYU and I spent lots of time at the park in my 20s. My daughter loves this park so much so we come here often after dinner and walk around.
Live music, painter, bubble blowing, performance and so much fun things to watch.

Lovely private park. Famously proposed in 1831 by Samuel B. Ruggles 17991881, the park continues to be an oasis of calm in a lovely neighborhood. I first saw the park from the inside when my parents visiting from Germany used to stay at the old Gramercy Park Hotel. Now I am fortunate to live in the same neighborhood. Don't miss the statue of Edwin Booth 18331893 in Roman cloak at the center of the park. Nice place to walk around and rest.Many species of flower. Loved it. Beautiful park. Locked for residents. I bet it has a lot of history. Lovely photo opportunities. I would say its a pretty park but I cant say that bc I couldnt go inside bc there were locks   I didnt even know manhattan had these exclusive private parks for the rich ppl. Its kinda crazy walking around the park and seeing ppl close the gates which were then locked and on the same block seeing a homeless person walking around Beautiful neighborhood, but park not open to the public except on Christmas Eve. Nonetheless, its a charming area surrounded by historic buildings, and the garden always has something of interest to view. Its now midMarch, and the daffodils within and surrounding the park are in bloom, and the magnolias are either flowering, or about to flower.
My favorite season is fall midNovember to early December the ginkgos  are blazing yellow.

The spacious habitats allow the animals to roam freely while still offering visitors fantastic views. Definitely a hidden gem on the streets of NYC. Still a gem in thr middle of the city, but with the construction going on across the street,it takes some imagination to feel peaceful. Every time I visit NYC, I like to spend time checking out new to me parks. On this trip, I found a couple that had waterfalls which seemed unique for a city.

It's a very small park, but it's cute. The waterfall adds a nice element to it. There isn't really grass or anything here, but there are plenty of trees so it's nicely shaded.

I'm not sure I'd add it as a must visit, but it would be a nice spot to eat lunch.

This is a nice local spot to bring your kids. The environmental center has a few small animals like rabbits, guinea pigs, chinchillas, snakes, birds, etc. Depending on the time of day, you may be allowed to pet some of these animals.

There are a couple of trails you can walk through, with lots of trees and marshes by the water. You can walk the entire trail in about 20 minutes. It is obviously beautiful during the summer with lush greenery all around.

You can host a kid's birthday party at this venue for a very reasonable price. We have definitely been here before the renovation and are extremely happy with the new upgrades to this place. Looking forward to our next visit. A hidden for families and environmental science lovers! This place is a community center that educated people about the local salt marshes and the preservation of natural spaces in NYC. The center has a display of small animals, including rodents, reptiles, amphibians, and birds, and programs for children. There are a few trails outside the center! A great place to take your kids. Ive been eyeing this Center since they were being built. Glad its finally opened! Nice nature trail through the back. Im sure it will be even prettier as the weather warms up. The people who worked there were very friendly. One of them even offered the kids animal petting. Not opened on weekends! This is a super fun place to come with young children. You can enter free and see a lot of different types of animals up close in their cages such as birds, turtles, lizards, snakes, bunny rabbits, Guinea pigs, and much more! A neat educational experience for young ones. My son loved it here and so do I. The classes were great and affordable. He loves visiting the animals!

Beautiful and very peaceful. Amazing views of the Manhattan skyline. It's also not overly crowded and mostly locals walking their dogs or kids. The best time is late afternoon to early evening to wind down, enjoy the sunset reflecting off the East River and the buildings across. Or come for an early morning walk to have a calming start to your day. There are plenty of seats along the pathway to just take a few minutes to sit and breathe in the scenery. Perfect for a romantic stroll or a picnic with your family. My favorite spot in the city, with phenomenal views of midtown in a stretch of beautifully manicured promenade with plenty of sunny and shaded benches and loungers. With a wide variety of different use public spaces, people come here to walk, picnic, sunbathe, eat, play beach volleyball, take the ferry, play soccer, fish, and generally hang out under the metropolitan backdrop across the river. Close by Vernon Blvd, there is also plenty of great dining situated nearby! Superb place with nice wind, nice city view, huge Pepsi Cola view. Peaceful. Clean. Short walk from subway station. Train 7 from Manhattan. Nice park at Long Island City next to Hunters Point park. Can sit there for hours seeing the view and feeling the clean wind! Gantry Plaza State Park in Long Island City is an urban oasis that offers a serene escape from the hustle and bustle of New York City. Nestled along the East River, this beautifully landscaped park provides stunning panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline, especially breathtaking during sunset.

The parks design is a perfect blend of greenery and modernity. With its lush lawns, meticulously maintained gardens, and unique gantry structures, it offers a picturesque setting for a leisurely stroll, a family picnic, or a romantic evening. The riverside boardwalk is ideal for walking, jogging, or simply sitting on one of the many benches to soak in the views.

One of the highlights of Gantry Plaza State Park is its peaceful ambiance. Despite being close to the city, it feels like a world apart, providing a tranquil spot to relax and unwind. The park also features playgrounds, sports fields, and fishing piers, catering to visitors of all ages and interests.

The wellthoughtout layout includes plenty of shaded areas, making it a comfortable place to spend time even on warmer days. The proximity to cafes and eateries in Long Island City adds convenience, allowing for a perfect combination of outdoor enjoyment and culinary delights.

Overall, Gantry Plaza State Park is a gem in NYCs collection of parks. Its scenic beauty, thoughtful amenities, and calming atmosphere make it a mustvisit for both locals and tourists looking to experience the natural charm of the city. Beautiful park with views of the NYC skyline, East River, and the southern end of Roosevelt Island. Its not too crowded, with plenty of space to walk around or layout a picnic blanket. And I really loved how much seating they had, perfect to grab a spot and read in.

Brooklyn Bridge Park is an absolute gem! Walking along the park is a delight, with stunning views of Manhattan both day and night. The skyline is breathtaking and provides countless photo opportunities. The park offers plenty of spots to relax, whether you're enjoying a picnic on the grass or lounging on a bench. There are also playgrounds, sports facilities, and gardens, making it perfect for all ages. It's a fantastic place to unwind and soak in the beauty of the city. Highly recommend for anyone looking to experience the best of Brooklyn and Manhattan! This park is one of the most beautiful places in the city and has some amazing views, plenty of hidden spaces, nature, trails, eating areas. All great. The one hold up is with some of the bike and paths infrastructure, the bike path is not as clearly separated from the main path leading to many people blocking the bike lane and a lack of a bike path at all on the part north of the Bridge. Other than that a great place! I just so LOVEEEE this park in Brooklyn! Been here in all seasons but of course love it during summer. A very good place to hangout, sit somewhere, read a book, watch people, have a picnic and best of all see the beautiful facades of Manhattan. A great place for dating too. Theres a lot of restaurant options when you get hungry and coffee places when you just need an espresso shot or macchiato. You can come and see this beautiful park after a long walk at the Brooklyn Bridge and DUMBO. Brooklyn Bridge Park has quickly become my new favorite spot in New York. The breathtaking views of the Manhattan skyline and the iconic Brooklyn Bridge are nothing short of spectacular. The park is impeccably maintained, offering a perfect blend of nature and city life. Whether it's taking a leisurely walk along the waterfront, enjoying the lush green spaces, or simply sitting back and soaking in the scenery, every moment spent here is pure bliss.

What really stands out for me, though, is the basketball court. It's the perfect place to shoot some hoops while being surrounded by such an incredible backdrop. The court is always lively, and the energy is contagious. I plan on making this my goto spot for both relaxation and a little bit of play. Brooklyn Bridge Park truly offers an experience unlike any other in the city, and I can't wait to keep coming back! Great place for children to roam around! At the entrance or what I believe to be an entrance had a park near by for kids to play around, and was pretty big. As you go more deeper you'll eventually make it towards a riversorry if I'm wrong with an amazing view and you'll get to see both bridges on both end, also if you have a stroller, a kid, etc, you're just in luck, if you walk past the stair case and continue to walk straight you'll see a gate exiting and turn the first left and it should be steady enough that you won't have any trouble walking through. There's also public bathrooms near by inside a building, except the line can get a bit long if you don't make it time. It is clean although!

리뷰:
My Fourth of July visit to Hudson River Park was a memorable experience. The park, stretching along the western edge of Manhattan, offers a stunning blend of natural beauty and urban vibrancy, making it the perfect spot to celebrate Independence Day.

The atmosphere was festive, with families, friends, and couples all gathered to enjoy the holiday. The park's expansive lawns provided plenty of space for picnics, and many people had brought blankets, food, and drinks to set up for the day. The community spirit was palpable, with everyone sharing in the excitement of the day.

As the sun began to set, the view over the Hudson River became even more breathtaking. The golden hues of the sunset reflecting on the water were a sight to behold, setting the stage for the evening's fireworks. The park's wellmaintained pathways and gardens added to the overall charm, making it a pleasure to stroll around and take in the sights.

The highlight of the evening was, of course, the fireworks display. Positioned perfectly along the river, Hudson River Park offered an unobstructed view of the dazzling show. The bursts of color lighting up the night sky were spectacular, and the collective "oohs" and "aahs" from the crowd added to the excitement. It was a joyous and patriotic moment that truly captured the spirit of the Fourth of July.

In addition to the festivities, the park's amenities were excellent. Clean restrooms, ample seating areas, and wellplaced trash bins helped keep the environment pleasant and tidy. The presence of park rangers and security made the event feel safe and wellorganized.

Overall, Hudson River Park proved to be an exceptional choice for a Fourth of July celebration. The combination of natural beauty, wellmaintained facilities, and a festive atmosphere made for an unforgettable experience. I highly recommend visiting this park, especially during special events like Independence Day. Amazingly beautiful green space along the Hudson River on the west side of NYC.

Plenty of areas to sit and relax either on a bench or on the grass at one of the many garden areas.  The walkways take you along the river or through some of the parks that have been built for people and pups to enjoy.

Smart idea and NYC is doing a great job. Spent a leisurely Sunday morning walking up river from Pier 57 to 76. Just a gorgeous morning before the heat. Cute place! Doesn't even feel like you're in ny! Beautiful views! It was a great day.quite good environment for running and just a summer day out

주소: 155 Cedar St, New York, NY 10006, USA
리뷰:
Liberty Park is just a short walk away from the World Trade Centre and 911 Memorial and Museum.
The park brings together some new aspects of New York City and respects what has gone before, in a tasteful and visually pleasing way.
The park and views from it are stunning and its a nice and quiet place to reflect and take in the history of this area of Manhattan. This place was so moving. Over 20 years since this tragic moment in history ... and you can still feel the pain. It's a quiet yet bustling atmosphere. The 911 memorial booth there is very nice and the grounds are as serene as it can be. I spoke to one of the security guards there, thanking him and  asking him about about potential threats they come across. To see security, police and military on the grounds made us feel really safe. This will be an annual trip for us.
We bought this memorial back home with us, We shall never forget  Walk up or take the ramp  and find a tree lined space to sit or stroll through. Fabulous sights include the Freedom Tower and an Orthodox Church. There is also the remnants of Koenig Sphere, which sat between the two towers. With access to the walkway over West Street. Liberty Park is a hidden gem in Manhattan, offering a peaceful oasis amidst the bustling city

 Elevated Park Liberty Park is situated atop the World Trade Center's Vehicle Security Center, providing a unique perspective on the surrounding area
 Green Space This oneacre park offers a tranquil atmosphere, complete with lush greenery, teak benches, and a "living wall" featuring various plant species
 Public Art Liberty Park is home to several iconic sculptures, including Fritz Koenig's "The Sphere" and Douwe Blumberg's "America's Response Monument"
 Historical Significance The park overlooks the National September 11 Memorial  Museum and is adjacent to the St. Nicholas National Shrine

My Experience

 Peaceful Atmosphere Visitors can enjoy stunning views of the World Trade Center campus while relaxing in a serene environment.
 Accessibility The park is open daily from 600 a.m. to 1100 p.m. and is easily accessible by public transportation or on foot.
 Points of Interest Take in the sights of the Memorial Plaza, One World Trade Center, and the Oculus while exploring the park. There are several interesting things to see at Liberty Park  mostly the sculpture The Sphere, which was heavily damaged on 911 when the twin towers fell on top of it. Its also open at night and we came by here the first night we were in New York just to sit and talk.

Under the full moon at Hunters Point, the world slows into a dream. A soft glow spills across the landscape, turning the sea into a mirror of silver light. The air is cool, carried by a gentle breeze that feels like a secret, brushing against your skin.

The moon, heavy and luminous, rises high, casting long, delicate shadows across the earth. Waves shimmer as they meet the shore, quietly reflecting the nights calm. The breeze carries the faint scent of salt and earth, mixing with the stillness of the evening.

Everything feels hushed, yet aliveperfectly balanced between light and dark, motion and stillness. Here, nature seems to breathe with you, its rhythm soft and steady, inviting you to pause, to linger. In this quiet beauty, theres a feeling that time dissolves, leaving only the moon, the breeze, and the quiet pulse of the night. Beautiful views, not only on Manhatten but also on the new buildings on Green point side, and Williamsburg bridge. The park itself is nice for a 30 min walk with great sections of restored native plants.  There are a lot of great restaurants in the area, and a ferry trip to or from the park is fun Very nice park with boardway and multiple piers. Nice view of the city. At the end of it there is diner with nice music to chill with. Multiple fixed benches around. Lovely! What a lovely park! I just discovered this jewel recently when I was visiting this neighborhood. Im upset that I wasnt aware of it sooner because I wouldve spent most of my summer here. The park is really beautiful and clean.

There is truly something here for everyone. There is a sand park, a playground for the kiddies, ample grass to have a picnic or just lay out to grab that good ole Vitamin D.

I will definitely frequent this park moving forward in the future. Great place to remove your monotonous life. We took the ferry it was really good enjoying the whole night view and the calm breeze

One of our favorite parks. It genuinely feels magical to both parents and kids you almost forget where you are! The way its natural elements appear and move between crowded columns of high rise apartments is top tier design. The tall slide is super fun. We like to start at Teardrop Park, then go over to Rockefeller Park, and finally run down the Battery Park Esplanade to get out the remaining zoomies. Its open again! My very favorite spray park in the city, tucked into the trees and rocks with plenty of shade. Be warned, the wood deck is incredibly slippery and everyone will probably wipe out at some point. Decently sized park in the midst of an apartment complex with lots of rock formations to explore  Epic and epically hidden slide nestled away like a secret treasure, it beckons adventure seekers of all ages. Heres why its a hit with kids and parents alike. Imagine stumbling upon a hidden passage in a magical forest, concrete jungle. Thats the feeling this slide evokes. Its unassuming appearance conceals a thrilling descenta rollercoaster ride in miniature.
Our childrens eyes widen with delight as they discover the slides existence. Their laughter echoes through the air as they take turns sliding down, their imaginations soaring. Kidsapproved!
The park becomes a canvas for their game of hide and seek, a haven. The slide is a whimsical journey. Each descent is a miniadventure of fear and adrenaline.

Ah, the delicate balance! While the slide captivates the kids, we play park sentinels.

So, next time you visit, embrace the magic of The Slide. Its not just a piece of playground equipment, its a portal to wonder.   I love the water sprinklers here! That big slide? Amazing! There is also a really nice sized sandbox. However, the water is not working on that side. However, this little park is a great hidden gem.

Definitely felt like k escaped the city for a little

It's a beautiful hidden gem in the city. Great for getting away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Very calming to hear the water cascading on the rocks, very Zen! It's not super huge and I wouldn't call it a park, but to each his own. I enjoyed my time here, with my Mom and my ExWife. Looking forward to my next visit. Also, it's very clean and wellkept. I love small private park by the synagogue and am impressed by its cleanliness and the kindness of the staff. It is the safest sanctuary in the city.

Chatting to their park rangers, amazing gentlemen, I learned about the hard work they put into maintaining the park  from washing the streets at 67am daily to cleaning the park multiple times a day.

In addition to the cleanliness, the design of the park is absolutely gorgeous. They always have seasonal plants, I love the stone tiles on the wall, and of course the waterfall in the back of the park gives a soothing white noise. I come here not only when I am passing by, but when I want to meditate or focus or relax. Especially when the park is less busy, it gives so much serenity in my mind.

I have nothing but respect and gratitude for their dedication, making this park a beautiful and welcoming place to visit, and the safe place in our neighborhood. Not too far from Paley park. Meticulously curated landscape, structural and horticultural design. This has to be one of the loveliest place anyone could visit. There are a ton of chairs and tables all around, you can see it close up or close enough or even watch the water fall from the second floor or what I like to call a balcony area. it may be a bit confusing trying to find it,almost like a hidden gem so I offered how the entrance looks like. There are also trash Can's around, it's mostly quiet with the sound of the water fall mostly taking around. I would definitely come visit if you need some calming time or need time to yourself. If it starts raining cause of horrible luck you have, or the sun is to bright there's a balcony as I stated before and it has a roof you can stay under.

One of my favorite spots in Central Park. Really, you can have a picnic here, walk around, play sports and see the amazing views of the city. The Great Lawn in Central Park is the perfect spot to unwind, whether you want to relax on the grass, play sports, or simply peoplewatch. Surrounded by trees, this vast, open space offers beautiful views of both nature and the city skyline. Its a peaceful retreat from the city's noise, yet you can still feel connected to the energy of New York.

The lawn is ideal for picnics with friends, sunbathing, or even a casual game of frisbee or soccer. During summer, it becomes a lively gathering spot for concerts and performances. I was lucky to catch a free event here, and the atmosphere was incredible!

Its also wellmaintained, clean, and feels safe, making it a great place for both locals and tourists. If you're visiting Central Park, I highly recommend stopping by The Great Lawn to experience a little slice of serenity in the middle of NYC. This place is a great pitstop  when visiting Central Park!  The Great Lawn  is a wonderful green  space in the middle of the park. This is a great place to relax and unwind, have a picnic , play frisbee , and take some Instagramworthy  photos  of views  of the city!  I wish I came here more often! It was a very convenient place and atmosphere was great. Me and all my friends enjoyed being here and love the nature of the place. Picnic on the 4th of July is a great idea for summer!

It's towards Costco, on the east River. Need to cross this bridge over to the island. Bridge view and scene is nice... But the moment I reach the island park, gives me the notsafe vibe. Trash, gatherings not the kind at central park and most importantly, 3 police cars and officers were there, standby with lights all lit up, 1 cop car was patrolling as well. Certainly don't see that in any other NYC parks. Not recommended. Too bad. Nice place but safety concerns. I recently had the pleasure of attending the Pokemon Go 2024 festival at Randall Park, and I must say it was a fantastic experience. The park was wellorganized and maintained, and I was impressed by the cleanliness of the toilets, which had been recently cleaned.

However, there was one minor issue that affected our enjoyment of the park. Due to the morning rain, there was no proper draining, which resulted in some areas being waterlogged. This made it a bit inconvenient to navigate through the park.

Additionally, myself and many other attendees noticed a significant presence of spotted lanternflies in the park. It would be beneficial for the park management to consider spraying to control their population and ensure a more enjoyable experience for visitors.

Despite these minor drawbacks, the park was bustling with people and the atmosphere was truly amazing. Being part of the festival was a memorable experience, and I would like to express my gratitude to the organizers for putting together such a fantastic event.

Overall, Randall Park is a great venue for events and gatherings. With some improvements in drainage and pest control, it has the potential to be an even more remarkable destination. Thank you! I was there for gofest. Really nice spot. Great views. Nice athletic field Really great staffing by NY PD and emergency personnel as it was extremely hot. A place full of beautiful views and playgrounds for variety of sports. Plenty of picnic and bbq spots. Went to Pokemon Go Fest. The park is beautiful, very big with views of the city.

As for the restrooms, they only had porta potties but I don't know if it was because of this event. We didn't see any other restrooms.

리뷰:
Peaceful park with plenty of leafy shade and seclusion. The walk to the FDR Memorial itself is an enjoyable and uncrowded experience giving visitors a sense of momentary relief from the congested city. Louis Khans posthumous monument delivers a nice processional experience ending with a framed view of Manhattan and Brooklyn facing south. Great place to see views of the city. Also really nice to have a picnic there especially with warm weather. Also really good for photography with the tree archs.
Note the park has different closing times depending on the season generally before sunset. Definitely a must visit while in Roosevelt Island, this park offers amazing views of the east river and New York City. We could just sit for hours here, relaxing, talking or reading a book. Beautiful park and architectural monument to FDR. It is a testament to Louis Kahns talent and vision as parks architect. Views of Queens and Manhattan make the experience memorable. Noticeable fresh breeze at the tip of the island in hot summer day. 5 stars rating  is reflection of overall park  museum experience itself rather than appreciation of FDRs controversial legacy. Restrooms are located just outside of county park upon entrance to Southpoint park. Franklin D. Roosevelt Four Freedoms State Park is a public memorial to former President Franklin D. Roosevelt, whose term lasted from March 4, 1933 to April 12, 1945. Here youll enjoy the FDR Hope Memorial, the Banned Book Library which is so interesting, the breathtaking views of the Hudson and surroundings, the Tram, the Blue Dragon sculpture, among other beautiful natural beauties like the ducks and geese.

Astoria Park has quickly earned a spot as my second favorite park, right after Brooklyn Bridge Park. While Brooklyn Bridge Park edges it out with its iconic city views, Astoria Park has so much to offer that its become a close contender. This park truly caters to anyone looking for a mix of relaxation and activity. It boasts a basketball court, tennis courts, a soccer field, and my personal favorite, a wellmaintained track and field. The track is perfect for running, and the entire park is wellkept, making it an ideal spot for anyone looking to stay active or just enjoy the outdoors.

What sets Astoria Park apart is how it combines both the serene atmosphere of a neighborhood park with facilities that encourage an active lifestyle. Whether youre into sports, running, or just taking a leisurely stroll, this park has something for you. Im definitely planning to visit often, especially as I focus on getting in good shape. With its ample amenities and wellmaintained spaces, Astoria Park is a hidden gem that Im excited to make part of my regular routine. Highly recommended for anyone in the area looking for a versatile and inviting outdoor space! Amazing place to walk, relax, be in contact with the nature. A beautiful view to the river. On Sunday you will always have something to see. Excellent place to plan a picnic or if you want to eat something you have restaurants near by. Amazing park a lot of families... lots of activities... Park on the water that provides a cooling breeze a lot of trees for shade open spaces for concerts and groups to play lawn games! Pool, sprinklers, park, bike friendly, Hot dog vendor sometimes...ice cream truck near big lawn near the water. Track, tennis courts and a soccer field All beautifully maintained. Very nice park, I was there for a birthday party in the north area of it. I will definitely go back to explore it more. Also full of restaurants around!!! I highly recommend it for a walk with your dog, with your kids and for a nice date and enjoy an amazing Greek meal after a relaxing day in the park!!! Enjoy  Beautiful park! We went as a group and brought our blanket and enjoyed snacks and chats. Lots of open space and nice scenery of the bridge, ferry, and water. There were ice cream trucks but I wouldnt recommend it since they were pretty expensive for what it was. 1 vanilla with sprinkle cone was 9. But it was nice on a hot day. The playground was great for the kids. The pool wasnt filled but I went at the beginning of spring so I wouldnt expect it. The one Cherry blossom tree was so cute! Highly recommend for running, walking, picnic, and naps as it feels very safe and clean. There was also a public restroom which is always great.

리뷰:
Liberty State Park is an absolute treasure, offering stunning views and a serene atmosphere that you can enjoy day or night. During the day, the park is vibrant and full of life, with expansive green spaces perfect for picnics, leisurely strolls, or just soaking in the incredible views of the Manhattan skyline and the Statue of Liberty. However, I definitely recommend visiting at night. There's something magical about the way the city lights shimmer across the water, creating a peaceful and almost enchanting atmosphere. The park feels like a tranquil escape from the hustle and bustle, making it the perfect spot for an evening walk or just to sit and take in the beauty of the night. Whether you're a local or just visiting, Liberty State Park is a mustsee destination, especially after the sun goes down. After visiting Statue of Liberty multiple times from Manhattan, this was the first time we went from Liberty State park. I would recommend anyone to take the ferry from this side if possible. You can avoid the Manhattan busyness and the views from this side are totally worth it! It's beautiful and you can see the whole city much closer. We went on a Monday morning and it wasn't crowded to get into the ferry. The only downside we had when we went was that there was a walk to the ticketing area from the parking lot Liberty State Park is truly a gem and one of my favorite places to visit. The park offers breathtaking views of the Manhattan skyline, the Statue of Liberty, and Ellis Island, making it a perfect spot for anyone looking to enjoy some stunning scenery.

The expansive green spaces are perfect for picnics, leisurely strolls, and family outings. There are plenty of walking and biking paths that wind through the park, allowing you to explore and appreciate its natural beauty. The playgrounds are wellmaintained and provide endless fun for kids, while the Liberty Science Center nearby offers an educational experience for all ages.

One of the highlights of Liberty State Park is the accessibility to the water. Whether you're taking a ferry to visit the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island, or simply enjoying the marina, the proximity to the Hudson River adds a refreshing element to the park.

The park is so clean and wellmaintained, with ample amenities and facilities to ensure a comfortable visit. The staff and rangers are friendly and always willing to help with any questions or needs.

Overall, Liberty State Park is a wonderful place to spend a weekend. Whether you're looking to relax in nature, engage in outdoor activities, or soak in some history, this park offers something for everyone. Highly recommended for both locals and visitors! The best view of the statue of liberty by land. A true gem of Jersey. Great for long walks, bike rides, or any exercising. Even if you want to sit and marvel at the views. This park is spacious, well kept and paved with safe pathways. I cant wait to be back! This is a great recreation area. They have paved paths throughout which are great for running and biking. I like to bring a picnic and find a spot under a tree or on the grass overlooking downtown Manhattan. There is plenty of parking and restrooms are available. The most recent time we went, there was an ice cream truck in the parking lot. This park is also pet friendly.

A very underrated city park that is often overshadowed by the other more wellknown parks. You'll find very few tourists and no cyclists. The beaches are never crowded. The best time to visit is probably in the dead of night. Mill Rock Park is a unique, gross unless seagull poop is your thing, cramped and hard to get to little pile of rocks in the East River. Ew. As I slipped back into my kayak after walking around, I couldnt shake the feeling that flesh eating bacteria were now a part of my day.

On the flip side, the views of Manhattan, Queens and Randalls Island are second to none. Truly stellar. So, 3 stars instead of 1.

Bring your camera, some nose plugs and a few gallons of bactine for the paddle bavk. During the War of 1812, the War Department built a blockhouse with two cannons on Great Mill Rock. This fortification was part of a chain of blockhouses that was intended to defend New York Harbor and protect the passage into Long Island Sound against the British Navy Love circumnavigating this island. There's an inlet on north end to rest from river currents. Island is a protected bird sanctuary, so there's absolutely no going ashore. Beautiful when green. Super cool .

Donnelly Memorial Park is a hidden gem nestled in the heart of West New York. This park offers stunning views of the New York City skyline, making it a perfect spot for a peaceful stroll or a relaxing afternoon. The wellmaintained grounds feature plenty of green spaces, benches, and shaded areas, making it ideal for picnics or simply unwinding with a good book. The park also has a playground, making it a great destination for families with kids. Whether youre looking for a scenic view, a place to exercise, or just some quiet time in nature, Donnelly Memorial Park provides a wonderful escape from the busy city life. A mustvisit if youre in the area! Come here often, one of my favorite night spots in the area to just breathe and catch a beautiful view of the city.  It's always clean and has a fun lil dog park for the lil critters to have fun and socialize with others.  During the day it's pretty much families and all you can hear are the voices of children playing in the nearby park.  I find it to be one of the best views you are going to get of the city on the neighborhood.  Also, it's a great spot to see animals you don't normally see... like a personal mini zoo Nice clean park, with amazing views of NYC, took this photo of Midtown Manhattan while out with my family for the day. It is family friendly but only advice I would give is there are many bigger kids there who run wild with no regards to the toddlers, so keep an eye on your little ones, because most of the parents are too glued on their phones to read their children, but overall a nice park, with plenty to do. Such a lovely place to look upon Manhattan skyline!

Didn't actually see an event here but did visit as part of a New York Pass tour. What a privilege to follow the footsteps of some of the most famous artists to have performed here. Very informative tour guide from it's history and back stage access. An iconic institution  Attending an event at Madison Square Garden is truly a remarkable experience. Known as "The World's Most Famous Arena," it lives up to its reputation in every way. The venues iconic status is matched by its excellent facilities and exceptional service.

From the moment you arrive, the energy and excitement are palpable. The seating is comfortable and offers great sightlines from virtually every spot in the arena, ensuring that you have an incredible view of the action, whether you're there for a concert, a sporting event, or a special performance. The acoustics are superb, delivering a clear and immersive sound experience that enhances any event.

The staff at Madison Square Garden are professional and courteous, making the experience smooth and enjoyable from start to finish. Their efficiency in handling large crowds and addressing any concerns is commendable.

Additionally, the range of food and beverage options is impressive, catering to a variety of tastes and dietary preferences. Whether you're grabbing a quick snack or sitting down for a meal, the quality and variety are sure to satisfy.

Overall, Madison Square Garden offers an unforgettable experience with its blend of historic charm, modern amenities, and topnotch service. It's a mustvisit venue for anyone looking to enjoy worldclass entertainment in a legendary setting. We took a private tour of the worlds most famous venue, Madison Square Garden. I have personally never been to this arena but it was awesome. The amount of history that has gone through this building is crazy. Have to give it up to our tour guide who was very funny and friendly. Also, they were setting up for a Justin Timberlake concert! Great time. The world's most famous arena, I'm so excited I finally got to visit for the Hans Zimmer concert. It's quite the building and right in the middle of busy Manhattan. The food and drink prices are even more insane than you can imagine, but I should've still expected it I guess. Great place! The staff is professional and helpful, making the overall experience pleasant and pleasant. It's no wonder it's called "The World's Most Famous Arena"  every event here feels special.

The atmosphere was electric, and the highlight of the night was watching Aaron Judge hit a home run. It was an honor to be part of that unforgettable experience. Had an awesome time at Yankee Stadium suites! The space was super comfy and had amazing views of the field. The stadium itself is pretty cookie cutter and nothing remarkable, but the staff, fans, and amenities make it an above average ballpark. To say this place is like a coliseum is an understatement. The facade is grand and inside of Gate 4 you just feel like youre in some place special and important.

If could give 6 stars I would.  This is one is the tastiest meals I've ever had.  We wanted authentic Korean bbq and we found it at missKorea.   We ordered the pork dumplings fried, glass noodles with sauteed seafood and vegetables and marinated beef short rib. All were incredible.  Service was exceptional.  Only drawback is price.  But still totally worth it We just stumbled upon this place and went in, had no idea about it being in the Michelin guide list. It was really expensive, didn't expect it to be that pricey. The food was good, but don't order the chicken, it was over cooked and dry. Great service. In hindsight I'm sure I would have gotten better korean food at a much cheaper price. In the end it wasn't worth the price tag. I've visited this BBQ restaurant twice after participating in a running events near Central Park, 2 weeks in a roll.

One of the standout features of this place is its consistent availabilitythey're open all the time, making it a perfect postrun destination. The quality of the meats, especially the beef, is exceptionaljuicy, flavorful, and prepared to perfection.

I particularly appreciate the option to choose between marinated and nonmarinated beef, catering to different preferences.

The staff are friendly, attentive, and contribute to a welcoming dining experience. Miss Korea BBQ in NYC offers highquality ingredients, particularly notable in their beef dishes. The atmosphere is lively and bustling, contributing to a fun dining experience as everyone seems to be enjoying themselves. The staff assists with grilling orders right at your table, enhancing the experience. For a party of 23, I'd recommend ordering a large beef set. However, the restaurant and its facilities could use better maintenance, as they appear somewhat rundown. Despite this, it doesn't significantly detract from the overall experience, and I would still recommend a visit. I stopped by at the midnight and staving.
We ordered two types of meat, and one soup.
The waitress name Elizabeth takes care of us. She's professional of cooking and very kind.
The beef was awesome and soup was so good.
Highly recommend to try this place.

There are so few mom 'n' pop spots like these left in Manhattan, and you typically have to venture to the edges of the island in either direction to find them.

Hats off to Bulbap for keeping it real large portions, low prices and solid flavors. The Tofu Bites were deceptively flavorful and crisp. The Jae Yuk Bowl could have been spicier, but the creative Galbi Burger was like the gorgeous happa offspring of the most beautiful Korean and American couple you've ever met. Yumdiddlyum! We tried this restaurant as convenient and close option from our hotel. Didn't expect too much since this gem korean restaurant is quite far from actual Korean town. I am so glad that we decided to eat here because foods taste was amazing, the ownermanager looking gentleman was extremely nice and kind with his service. Foods came out super quick and fresh, the portion of Stone pot bibimbap was incredibly great! Supreme galbi burger, as my picture shows it was gigantic, juicy with full flavor!!
Highly recommend here if you are around. And i will definitely come back for next NYC visit. There seemed to be just one waiter, but he was good and very responsive. The food was great. I believe authentic because there were a number of Asians dining there as well. Great experience! We went on a Monday and got seated right away since there was no wait. We were excited to try the highlyrated Korean food and ordered tofu jap chae, janchi guksu party noodle soup, and the bulgogi bowl.

However, we were disappointed that only kimchi was served as a side dish, which is unusual for an authentic Korean restaurant. The food looked nice, but the jap chae and bulgogi bowl were both too sweet and salty, and tasted the same. The party noodle soup was bland.

There was also a lot of noise, banging, and yelling from the kitchen, which was disruptive. The waiter was eating during his shift and didnt seem to care about the noise. We had to call him over several times to get our check.

Overall, I gave them two stars for the food presentation and the portion size, but the noise and inattentive service made for an unpleasant experience. We wont be coming back.

And FYI, they do not offer small side dishes banchan, only kimchi and so little of it! No refill btw. burge bun was hard, owner said it's  supposed to be like that, but it's not. chicken wings were super hard and tasteless. Also, the owner asked us to leave  through the other door, afraid of us telling other customers to go to another restaurant because of the horrible food. He didn't  even hesitate  to fix our bad experience at his restaurant.

This was the best tasting menu experience Ive had and it was 100 worth it. We left feeling full. I cant stop thinking about the watermelon dish. Highly recommend for meat eaters and vegetarians! Pictures are of some of the vegetarian dishes Amazing service. Food was absolutely outstanding. Every course was surprising and illuminating, some of the best food we've ever had. We paid 476 for two, without the wine pairing. A few notes that the music was quite loud and the wagyu did not come out hot. They also asked us to leave midway through the last dessert course even though we waited more than ten minutes for some of the courses to come out and were not loitering whatsoever. Was a bit surprising. Food really wasn't an ordinary experience. The courses were interesting with fine ingredients, good taste. The staff explained the courses and were flexible accomodating wife's vegeterian preference for some of the courses. The A5 Wagyu upgrade was worth it, my wife and I felt the quality of the meat. We were also very pleased with the extra desert offered by the restaurant for celebrating our  wedding. The deserts were really exceptional. The service was very pleasant.

If I have to nitpick, I think the atmosphere can be improved. I expected more out of a Michelin star restaurant. The place is fairly small, the bathrooms could have been cleaner and taken care of. The place only had to offer metal chopsticks, I believe for trying to make it a fancy experience, but as a person that is used to wooden chopsticks my whole life it came out really inconvenient to hold much heavier chopsticks. Finally getting around to leaving a review. Better late than never.

My wife and I dined here the summer of 2023. We splurged on the chef's table experience and loved it. The food was impeccable, the hospitality was warm and welcoming, and the atmosphere was cozy yet comfortable.

Good hospitality and great food. We said "yes" to all the upgrades. Worth it. Flat iron steak to A5 wagyu, black truffle supplement, sea urchin supplement. I recommend this spot to anyone looking to venture North of the craziness in Midtown.

주소: 72 W 36th St., New York, NY 10018, USA
리뷰:
Every time when Im craving a steak its always Keens. Classic and famous NYC steak house. I have been here many times. The food and service is amazing. They have plenty of seat so walk in is easy.

My favorite appetizer is baked blue cheese puff. I like to eat it with the complimentary bread. So so good 

For entree we love prime rib king the size is good for 2 people. The meat is great quality and juicy. Perfect cooked. Mushrooms side is very tasty. It has a little bit tangy favor. I'm really surprised by how disappointing our birthday dinner for 6 was, all around. We've been to several comparable steakhouses, and were excited for Keen's. Service was bad, all around. Our waiter move slowly, seemed grim, and didn't read us any specials, checked in with us once the whole dinner, and was noticeably frustrated when we had to ask for the dessert menu several times. We sat and waited for our food for probably 40 minutes. Nobody bussed our table and plates sat finished for 20 to 30 minutes. When our orders were finally brought, the busboys were confused about who got what. Our order was straightforward.

My cocktail was highway robbery at 19. At that price, an old fashioned should have a large ice cube, not whatever came out of the fridge ice maker. It was straight up bad.

The food was soso below par for a steakhouse of this magnitude. The medium well steak was overcooked.

The sides were great! Desserts were small, but delicious. We had dinner here for our anniversary with another couple.  Our first time here, other couple has been here before so they ordered for us.

We had cocktails, Jumbo Lump Crab cocktail, Thickcut Smoked Bacon, TBone for two and Chateaubriand Steak for Two, Carrots with Brown butter and Mashed potatoes.

The steaks where over cooked a little, but tasty.  The staff was friendly and not pushy.  We were able to take our time and enjoy everything. We dined at Keens Steakhouse and ordered both the steak and lamb. While the steak was good, we both preferred the lambit had a unique flavor and was cooked to perfection. Unfortunately, the atmosphere wasnt as enjoyable due to a loud argument at the table next to us throughout the meal, which made it hard to fully relax. Despite the disruption, the food was excellent, and the lamb especially stood out Keens Steakhouse is absolutely one of the best steakhouses Ive been to in NYC! I went with a group of 10, and the experience was phenomenal from start to finish. The steaks were cooked to perfectionjuicy, flavorful, and exactly as ordered. The classic ambiance added to the charm, and the service was topnotch, handling our large group with ease and attention to detail. Everyone in our party left impressed and satisfied. Keens Steakhouse is a mustvisit for an exceptional dining experience in the city!

리뷰:
We had a great experience here overall. We went during happy hour and ordered a few items on the happy hour menu and some regular ones as well.

There was a little confusion when we ordered corn cheese not on the happy hour menu. The server must have heard something else crunchy tofu? and thought we ordered it on the happy hour menu. It arrived at our table I have a photo of it and we let them know it was not what we ordered.

We didn't touch it and they did take it off our bill, but only after we insisted that it was not what we ordered.

We got a couple of their soju cocktails as well. Both were delicious. Food was pretty good, too. I had such an amazing time introducing my friend to Korean food for the first time here! The menu offered a variety of delicious options, and every dish was packed with flavor. We left feeling full, satisfied, and so happy with our experience. The atmosphere was warm and inviting, making it the perfect spot to share a meal. Highly recommend for anyone looking to try unique Korean cuisine! If you want traditional Korean food, this place wont be a good choice. Foods are more like fancy but small portion fusion foods. Overall the taste is a bit sweet. The uni bibimbap is a good choice! Went for dinner with my family to celebrate my sons birthday. No wait time, we were seated right away. The food were amazing. Loved everything we ordered. Sadly couldnt try the soju cocktails but definitely going back for those. The place itself is nice  cozy. Service was great. Would recommend. The food was good but not great especially as it didn't taste authentic Korean. Ambiance was amazing. Drinks were funky and gave a nice pop.

More Instagrammy than anything...

리뷰:
Amazing food presentation. I started with five different dishes. I loved every bite, but other dishes were just soso for me. The dining room is clean and modern. However, I deducted 1 star because I finished my glass of wine, and no one asked me for another. They simply served the food and left. I had to find someone to order. and my 2nd glass too. So I decided to finish for a drink.  But overall was very good for my birthday dinner. Totally awesome atmosphere, chill music and foods!!  Highly recommend this restaurant. I wanna go this place on Christmas.  servers were nice and gentle so I entirely enjoyed my dinner. Thank you  I went there to celebrate my boyfriends birthday and the service was amazing. They are very friendly and very nice. However, the food was a bit salty for almost every dishes. Overall it was ok but we loved the desserts there, it was refreshing and not too sweet.

I would recommend you guys to try it once for any special occasion or regular normal meal. A great meal that lives up to the high cost. Theres lots of different flavors here, the banchan was standout, and we left full. The sake flight was great and unique.

Loses a star though because theres less interest to return given the menu doesnt seem to have changed at all in a very long time. Also kinda awkward that there didnt appear to be any Koreans working in the entire front of house while we were there. A unique experience, ten courses with wine pairing was truly amazing. Diversity of rich flavors in the food and paired wines were great. The service was excellent.

주소: 104 E 30th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
리뷰:
My dinner at Atomixs Chefs Counter was the best dining experience Ive ever had. Each dish was thoughtfully conceptualized, cooked to perfection, and beautifully presented. I also got the wine pairing and fresh truffle addons, both of which were well worth the money. Its difficult to pick my favorite course, though I would say I think about their japchae every other day. Finally, the service is truly exceptional. The wait staff is beyond professional yet still warm and personable. The atmosphere is very relaxed, which isnt always the case at Michelinstarred restaurants. Truly exceptional. We have done the downstairs tasting seating prior, and it was fantastic, but this review is for the bar tasting upstairs. I had the nonalcoholic wine pairing, and Im usually a bit disappointed at other places, but in this case I was blown away. Each of the dishes or something special and unique, with so much craft and care put into each. The amuse bouche or first course is out of this world. Stupendous  One of the best restaurants I have eaten at to date.
To me, this restaurant is proof that michelin stars system is bogus. I've eaten at 3 star places that pale in comparison to this place.

Pretty much everything tasted amazing. They were transparent about their ingredients. We got the non alcoholic pairing. 2 of the drinks were kinda mid.
Reservations are hard to get
I thought it was kinda expensive at first but after trying it I felt it was worth every penny. 100 would come again given the opportunity. Undoubtedly the best restaurant in the US. 6th best in the world. The title is well deserved. No questions asked. Exquisite service and hospitality. Delectable food selection. We dined at the bar for our special occasion. Atomix is an experience that bears true to passion and love for fine dining. Thank you for raising the standard, for pursuing excellence and for understanding what food represents in the Korean culture. I will absolutely come back again  Such a special experience at Atomix. Chefs commitment to showcasing the very best of Korean flavorsingredients in the context of New York City is so unique and interesting. Each course presented something new and came with a dedicated card from Chef. Love this special attention to detail, so thoughtful! My favorite dishes were the crab and eel, especially surprising because I normally never eat eel and didnt expect to love it this much! The drinks are phenomenal and the staff went above and beyond. Highly recommend!

Recently came here for the first time for a date night and we absolutely LOVED it! I appreciated the server we had who explained the concept of the restaurant to me since it was my first visit and i appreciated the servers that followed who instructed us on how to get the most out of each dish. this was the best meal I've had since coming to NYC. The food was somethingelse where every dish was packed with flavours. The resturant was quite hidden but once inside the atmosphere was dark mysterious. I did not know what to expect once inside but when I got the dishes. Man o man ...... My new favorite Korean place! Our server was very charismatic and nice. Last but not least, great atmosphere. just amazing. super unique flow in the dark cocktails in a bag. korean inspired and such great flavours in each dish. you really cant go wrong here. very busy so put your name down early. please go here if you get the chance. Wow! This place is AMAZING. Food is spectacular, the service is good and the drinks are creative and fun. If youre looking for a fun experience while dining out, dont miss this opportunity!

I cant recommend this place highly enough. Its not just dining, its a whole experience. Superb hospitality and such an elegant setting. And the quality of the meal was unbelievable  fresh, delicious, so satisfying. Best kimchi Ive ever had? Probably! Service was great, KBBQ was absolutely out of this world. The appetizers were pretty wack and took of a star, but besides that it was wonderful.

We started with the hamachi crudo, which had a strangely extra fishy taste and left a weird taste in my mouth. We also got the galbi dumplings which were disappointing.

The barbecue, however, was outstanding. Even the meats that werent marinated just melted in your mouth. It was AMAZING. Probably the best quality meat Ive had at kbbq in NYC. It was so out of this world.

The restaurant itself was very clean and upscale and the service was attentive. The drinks were great too! I got one with lemon I forgot the name and boyfriend got a mango maksomething? They were fantastic.

100000 would go again, just not ordering appetizers next time. Amazing  I went there by myself so couldnt order more dishes but I had  and it was a full of flavor and lots of baby squid!  I wish we have this restaurant in SF city! Definitely go back next time when I visit NY! Very good Korean barbecue. Seriously impressive how much flavor they pack into their meats, especially the marinated kinds. Perfect for if you have a special occasion and want a welcoming atmosphere. Also the kimchi is amazing. We had an amazing dinner here!

We went for the bbq  with the marinated rib and the brisket. The meat was delicious! We also had the Busan Neighbourhood Pancake  dont miss it!

The staff was also really friendly and nice. The guided us through the menu and giving their recommendations on best dishes, how much and how to eat.

Fully recommended!

리뷰:
Quick and attentive service! They had authentic food and everything came out flavorful and hot. Not much wait for a weekday evening for table of two. Passed by the entry of the restaurant and smelled delicious broth  ended up going in to try the food and they did not disappoint!! Came back to our "spot" after more than 10 years. The place is the same as it was back then. We were excited to be here. We got our favorites which were still as delicious as before. The staff were very friendly and attentive, and the venue has a warm, comfortable ambience that made the dining experience relaxing. Exceeded our expectations and surely deserves a higher .
For a Saturday night, they were able to seat us without having a reservation. Service was prompt and excellent.
All the dishes came well prepared and quite authentic compared to what I have tasted before in Korea.
The cold noodle and bibimbap were the highlight in all our dishes ordered. Straightforward, delicious Korean food. Both times I went here, the bibimbap had a great crunchy charred texture. The banchan are solid. Lets be honest if youre looking at reviews of this place, youre probably struggling to find a seat at one of its massively hyped neighbors and youre considering Han Bat as a backup option. Its good. I actually like it a bit more than its neighbors. Its a perfectly fine Plan B. Came here with a friend for dinner, and we waited about 30 minutes. Definitely not worth the wait.

First, they seated us at a tiny table that couldnt even accommodate our dishes. We had to place our items on the bar in order to be able to fit everything.

The service also left very little to be desired. Customers who were seated after us received their bonchon before we did and when I inquired about this, the server gave me a major attitude.

As for the food, we ordered vegetable pajun, dolsot bibimbop, and sullungtang . They gave us seafood pajun by mistake and offered a perfunctory apology when we pointed this out. Everything tasted too salty and had no depth in flavor. The bonchon also lacked flavor, and the kkakdooki was especially heinous.

All in all, I would not come back to this restaurant again due to the poor quality in food and service.

You pick your own fooddish from a rack but the dishes are mostly cold and u heat it up using microwave.  I prefer the fried chicken and beer place across the road instead where they have hot table to keep the food hot. Woorijip marries convenience with wholesome food. I picked up food around 10am for lunch and snacks in my train ride.  Many of the trays on the shelves were empty but steadily being stocked. The dishes brought out were still slightly warm from being prepared earlier that morning. Each shelf was marked with date and time prepared for food safety reasons. The flavor and preparation of each dish was perfect and thoughtful. The check out process at the counter was efficient and friendly. The clerk added rubber bands to each of my containers to secure the contents.  I'd go here often if it were closer! Super smart way of having food ready to go. The food was super tasty and worth it. We were able to quickly eat there at a reasonable price.

My only complaint is how little beer there was in the bulgogi. It looks like there's a lot, but the meat is a thin layer that's spread at the top. Various options to choose from. I choose tteokbokki, Chicken and kimbap platter with a side of Milkis. Quick and tasty meal if you are confused on where to eat in Ktown. Will definitely come here again. This is succch a cool concept in midtown and I feel its super convenient for people who commute everyday to work. Freshly packed, ready to eat, premade lunch boxes to go that are also healthy. Theyve got a ton of options to choose from and theres something for every dietary preferences. They dont have a lot of processed food items instead from what I saw it was a lotta protein, greens and fresh fruits and veggies. Their menu keeps changing and every food counter had the time and date each box was packed and until when its good to eat. They have a minimum 10 for card transactions. There were a few tables inside to sit and eat too, nothing fancy because this is more of a grab n go kinda spot. I got the japchae and it was super flavorful. I thoroughly appreciated it and next time Im in town I know where Im going again.

주소: 32ND STREET ENTRANCE 1250, Broadway 39th Foor, New York, NY 10001, USA
리뷰:
Went for the steak omakase for a birthday dinner and the meal was a great experience. High quality meat, great uplifted versions of classic Korean food, and attentive service. Gaonnuri continues to be one of my favourite upscale Korean restaurants I want to bring people to for a good memory. Views with a Side of KBBQ A Feast for the Eyes, Not Necessarily the Palate

Soaring high above the city on the 39th floor, Gaonnuri is a New York destination that blends modern elegance with Korean barbecue traditions. The clean, modern decor and breathtaking panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline make it an Instagrammer's dream. It's the perfect spot to impress a date or anyone seeking a unique dining experience. The service is topnotch, and they've even managed to elevate the KBBQ experience to feel refined and luxurious.

However, the food itself presents a different story. While it's not bad by any means, it doesn't quite live up to the rest of the experience. We opted for the omakase menu, featuring beautifully presented dishes and delightful amusebouches. Despite the stunning presentation, some dishes lacked depth of flavor. Surprisingly, the highlight wasn't even the meat which, to their credit, boasts premium cuts. It was a simple vegetable salad, which speaks volumes. The banchan selection was also disappointingly limited, with basically just kimchi on offer.

The Verdict All About the View

If you're willing to pay a premium for the stunning views and luxurious ambiance, Gaonnuri delivers. It's a great option for a unique NYC dining experience, but don't expect to be wowed by the food alone. While it's certainly Instagramworthy, it might not satisfy your taste buds as much.

In short

Views Breathtaking! 5 stars
Service  Ambiance Topnotch! Feels luxurious. 5 stars
Food Not bad, but some dishes fall flat. Presentation is impressive, but flavor is a 3 out of 5.
Value It depends. You're paying for the experience, not necessarily the food. If that's what you prioritize, it's worth it. But KBBQ purists might be disappointed.
Foodies, especially those with a love for Korean cuisine, may find the offerings underwhelming. The portions are modest as well, so don't go in expecting a feast. Ultimately, Gaonnuri is a place where the food, though decent, takes a backseat to the impressive backdrop. Perhaps the best restaurant Ive ever been in NYC. It was fantastic! Views are amazing! We were treated so well!! We didnt have reservations but we were well accommodated and when a window table got available, they moved us there without us even asking! The food is spectacular, meat is fabulous! We cant wait to go back to NYC to have dinner there again!!!! Thank you for the experience! Great view, but the meat quality was not good.
195 for 7 1oz cuts

Of the 7 cuts, 2 were of acceptable quality, the rest were tough and stringy.  I'm unsure how this  could be but some of our party didn't even finish their meat.

The soup was underseasoned and did not taste like a seafood soup, severly lacking depth.

They did not have daikon wrap and when we asked for lettuce and garlic,  the end of the garlic clove was not trimmed, Kitchen fail.

We had 3 diffrent severs through our meal which made the experience fragmented and less cohesive.

Finally the Value was just not there by any means.  I understand you pay for the view,  but the food in general was inadequate at best.

Would not recommend One of the best Korean restaurants in NYC! Refined, authentic traditional Korean food and delicious dessert. The yuzu creme brulee was too beautiful to eat and tasted awesome. The restaurant has fantastic views and a luxurious atmosphere. I really enjoyed their professional service, especially from servers Chris and May and the attentive manger.
영업시간: no operation time

주소: 2 W 32nd St, New York, NY 10001, USA
리뷰:
As a first timer trying malatang, i would recommend this place. Overall nice vibes and i just liked the idea that i get to handpick the ingredients in my own bowl and hand over at the counter where they cook and serve it to you. Although one thing i noticed was the ingredients weren't super fresh so had to take a closer look to find the fresher looking ones..! Anyways the service was nice, very attentive. I don't think malatang is for me.. i just don't really like that weirdly tangy flavor that spice? I don't know how to describe it accurately but i think experiencing once was enough for me. Still recommend, very just lowkey, nice vibes. I recommend the breadsticks tho! Also the fried pork thingy too!! I honestly enjoyed them more than malatang lol As a die hard mala fan, I was hoping to give this place 5 stars. I ordered Mala Xiang Guo to go, and the host was so lost, he didnt know how to help me. For the price I paid, youd think they would add a bowl of rice as well as some sort of protein for free. This place is overpriced and not even tasty. Very disappointing. It was our first time here, and we loved it. The food was delicious. We got the Malatang, it was great. The service was great, staff were super nice and helpful. The manager helped us out when we felt lost. They were very hospitable. Im definitely, coming back! Loved my recent lunch in KTown trying Korean Malatang for the first time.

This was such a fun, experiential, dining experiencedelicious too!

A must try spot for my Korean food fans who havent tried this out yet! They also have a full menu and we got to try their famous Tempura Shrimp.

So basically you choose whatever ingredients you want from the fridge, from different meats, veggies, noodles then, choose your spice level, and if you want stir fry or a soup. This is an unbelievable stir fry dish. A perfect spot to enjoy Kstyle malatang!
The broth is flavorful, striking a great balance between numbing Sichuan peppercorns and fiery chili.
Rose Mala Xiang Guo is surprisingly good. So rich and creamy, making the experience of eating vegetables extremely satisfying.
The creamy shrimp wows the whole table! Each piece is so huge, fresh, and bouncy.
Mala rice ball is a brilliant invention! It is filled with all sorts of ingredients with different textures like crunchy pickled radish, sweet corn, umami seaweed
Love the fried bun too! So crispy and soft at the same time! Will come back and try more!

리뷰:
Came for lunch. The food  galbi and all the many included appetizers were delicious. The service was good, as well as the seating in the restaurant itself. And the lunch special was a great value. What more could you ask for in a restaurant? Ive been told its the best korean barbeque in NYC and for now, I wont deny it. Service was great, food too, everything really fresh and tasty. Fun to eat here. Wonjo is one of the oldest restaurants in Ktown and its apparent with how traditional and authentic their food tastes. If youre looking to come in for lunch you probably dont need a reservation, but closer to dinner it gets extremely busy. We ordered the Wonjo Combo with spicy tofu soup, Dduk Boki, and seafood pancake. The spicy tofu soup was extremely rich in flavor and just an amazing start to the meal. The Wonjo combo itself was a bit smaller than I wouldve liked, but the marinated prime ribeye was incredibly tender, juicy, and just all around amazing. It was definitely the highlight of the combo, but it was a bit unfortunate that the combo was so small. The dduk boki came last and it was great, the rice cakes were very chewy and the sauce was just perfect. Everything we ordered was great and tasted very authentic. The only problems I had were the combo portions were small and our servers completely forgot our rice and forgot to add an item for us, but honestly everything was so good that it makes up for it. I will definitely be coming to Wonjo again and I look forward to trying different things! I thought all the restaurants in Korea town had the same tates when it comes to soft tofu stew, seafood pancake, and hot stone Bibimbab.  However, I found them slightly different from others today at this restaurant.  It was a bit more delicious . More savory and deep tastes.  I would definitely go there again.

The staff was very kind. The location was good to find. However, their dishes and containers were a bit old and chipped, but okay to enjoy the traditional foods. It's all about the charcoal! The meat is excellent quality and all the sides that come with your BBQ meat selection are amazingly tasty. It's not the fanciest joint in Korea Town but it's definitely one of the best restaurants on the strip.

리뷰:
I went here for lunch and had the BO Special see photo which is the short ribs. It was solid. It was just very slightly sweet and salty, and came with onions. They also brought out a bunch of additional smaller foods see photo like kimchi, sprouted beans, beef  garlic. I liked the smaller plates a lot. It was a solid amount of meat. It also came with white rice and I left a little tired. One of better k bbqs in NYC, we really enjoyed the meat here. They try to give traditional wooden floor exp which is cool, but it is not the most practical way of getting in and out not to mention I felt bad for the dude cooking the bbq on his knees for inside table. Overall pretty good quality of food, service, and vibe. Reservation recommended for dinner time. The side dishes were all clean, not too strong in flavor, and delicious. We ordered the fresh short ribs, and the meat was clean and cooked perfectly by the servers, making it even more enjoyable. Meat always tastes better when someone else grills it for you!

For dessert, we ordered bibim naengmyeon spicy cold noodles. It suited my taste, but the seasoning was a bit too strong, which was a bit disappointing. I think the mul naengmyeon cold noodles in broth is cleaner and tastier. Additionally, we ordered the lunch special combo with bibimbap and doenjang jjigae soybean paste stew. The bibimbap sauce was delicious, and overall, the dish was flavorful. The doenjang jjigae was mildly seasoned, not too strong, and just right.

The atmosphere was great, and overall, the food was excellent. I highly recommend this place! Fantastic meal. Server will grill all the meat for you and potion it to the number of diners. Only down side, it gets smoky in here and the ac is a little weak. Time to upgrade those smoke vents !! We were looking for a Korean BBQ that allowed bookings and wasnt too overpriced. This is it.

If you dont mind the matter in which the seating works, ie you need to climb into your seat, then this place is great.

The bbq options are extensive, thou more pork options wouldnt go a miss.

The service is a little manic but its what you come to expect in a place like this in the heart of KoreaTown.

The martinis were good, so much so we had several

Our only real negative point was the noise levels. Hard to hear each other.

주소: 6e E 38th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
리뷰:
THE BEST BREAKFAST BAGELS!

We stayed at the Kitano around the corner on Park Avenue having travelled over from the UK and wow we were so happy when we bumped into this little cafedeli on Madison. Weve had a lot of bagels in NYC, ignore all the hype around Liberty Bagels its average compared to this place. Go to Ritenow, you will not regret it.

We went everyday!

They also do amazing coffee and other food items for breakfast and lunch. Its a must visit! My wife and I grab breakfast here whenever we're in the area. Much cheaper than hotel breakfast and always on point.
We always recommend this place to friends. This has become my regular place for breakfast before work. The breakfast specials change regularly and are a great deal  especially for Midtown! The staff is consistently friendly and great you with a cheery  "Good Morning!" every day. They have generous portions, tasty muffins, a wide selection of omelets with toppings, and make excellent french toast. Such quick service and THE best staff. They always remember my coffee order. 1010!! Excellent quality and service. They do a 10.99 lunch bowl superior to Dig Inn. Such good veggies and roast turkey.

주소: 51 W 35th St, New York, NY 10001, USA
리뷰:
I visited from Midwest just for a trip. This restaurant was the first korean restaurant I tried in NYC and it's been already my favorite!! I got jjajangmyeon combo  japchaebapit is served with jjambbong broth. Me and my sister really enjoyed! TLDR If you are craving for KoreanChinese in the city, it'll get the job done. Go for lunch time and take advantage of the combo that gives a small sweet and sour beef with the spicy seafood or jajangmyun noodles.

I had walked by this place so many times so I figured let's give it a try. Price was decent, the interior is a bit dated but let's focus on the food.

Fried dumplings. Standard, crispy almost too crispy maybe lots of filling but what you'd expect. Crunchy, greasy, fatty meat, lots of garlic chives.

I opted for the jjampong and small sweet and sour beef combo. The beef is already dressed which I don't love the sweet sauce in general but it was still decently crispy. Spicy seafood noodles were decent, good wok flavor.

For 21.95, this kind of combo in this area it's not bad. Best Korean Chinese restaurant in ny in my opinion. Their jjajangmyun and jjambbong are amazing and also most of other dishes as well. You cant go wrong with any dishes here If yall havent had Korean Chinese food, what are you waiting for?! I went to Hyo Dong Gak, which is right outside of ktown NYC and ordered their 19 split bowl, which came with a big portion of jjangmyeon and a big portion of seafood jampong.

The noodles were perfectly chewy without being too soft. The jjangmyeon had the right amount of sauce and came with tiny pieces of pork.

The jampong had a TON of seafood including big shrimp with the head on, baby shrimp, mussels and octopus. For 19 you really cant go wrong, thats almost unheard of in NYC!

The restaurant was crowded on a random Tuesday evening, but I didnt have to wait long to get seated and I never felt rushed. The staff was extremely friendly and even gave us small packaged candies to take home with us! I will definitely be back!

Follow me on instagram for more! angiesfoodieadventures A little walk from Korea town proper but the 5 minutes is worth it for the seafood blackbean noodles , flavor is authentic to Korea.

was busy during our visiting but not sure overall you may have to wait a little but it will be worth it as price is reasonable and the portions are big
