주소: 32 W 33rd St, New York, NY 10001, USA
리뷰:
We were excited to try this restaurant, but unfortunately, it didnt quite live up to expectations. Despite wearing a sweater, the AC made it uncomfortably cold inside. The food was a mixed bag  while the oysters were fresh and the BBQ meat was of excellent quality, it came at a steep price. The seafood pancake had a slight sour note, which was unexpected. Service was another downside. The restaurant was packed, and with only a few staff on duty, it felt like they were too busy to properly manage orders or deliver food in a timely manner. Sadly, this experience didnt leave us eager to return. We are 2 people and order combo for 2come with 2 different beef and  pork belly,  Both beef was delicious, but the pork belly was a little overcooked. Next time i will only order beef,  not combo. It was a vibe. Know u have to spend a minimum of 50 per person. We got the kings feast and it fed 6 people really well. The beef quality was great. We got as appetizers, the beef tartar and cold green tea noodles. Pretty unique. Came in during a weekend night. Atmosphere was nice, though a bit dark on the inside.

The service was great, they cooked the meat for you, and explained the cooking times and portioned the meat for each member of the party.

The food was great. We ordered the large feast known as the King's Feast at the time and the Beef Tartare. Some members of our party aren't fans of raw or rare meat, but they really enjoyed the tartare. It was light and flavorful, and the addition of the pears and seaweed made it taste great. Each cut of meat on the large feast was flavorful, had a nice marinade and felt really high quality.

For the price, this would be a place mainly for special occasions. If you are really hungry, I would expect to spend over 100, though the meat is quite worth it. We had 630 reservations for a Wednesday night via Resy. Two out of six of us arrived 15 minutes early, but they wouldnt seat us until the whole party arrived. Which normally would be understandable, but there was no one else dining at the restaurant at that time.

We ordered

Seafood pancake  I normally dont love pajeon because theyre mostly soggy, but this one was pretty good
Mushroom japchae  surprisingly, I did not miss the meat. It was very flavorful overall, but the portion is small
Beef combo  I cant remember exactly what cuts there were, but there were four different kinds. Since Im pregnant, I had to eat all my meat well done but even then, it was still really good  with the exception of some chewy pieces. The marinade is done very well
Banchan  this comes with the combo, though Im not sure if it comes with all meals because Rib No. 7 is not your typical Korean restaurant. But this might be some of the best banchan Ive had in a while. They put their own spin to some of the dishes, which I really liked. We had fish cake, cucumber kimchi, frozen daikon kimchi, pickled daikon sheets, kimchi, scallion salad, and cold seaweed steamed egg, which was my favorite. I probably could have made a whole meal just of this. Free refills are available but only upon request
Mango cheesecake  this was decent
Matcha cheesecake  lots of matcha flavor, which I liked
Black sesame ice cream  this was my favorite of the three desserts. There was lots of black sesame flavor. However, we found out after the fact that it was 15 for two scoops of ice cream, which is the definition of highway robbery

Overall, it was a great meal but it is pricy, even for Ktown. But I would say its worth the once in a while splurge, or if you want to go here for a special occasion.

주소: 315 5th Ave fl 2, New York, NY 10016, USA
리뷰:
All the food was delicious, needless to say. Even their service was the best I have ever experienced. Although it is a pity that they only accept Amex and cash, I think that is the rule of the store and everyone should follow it, and they are not to be criticized at all. I have been there 5 times so far and I am so grateful that I have had a good time with my friends every time. Soju Haus is an absolute gem in the city. The ambiance is vibrant yet cozy, making it the perfect spot for both a night out with friends and a more intimate dinner. The food is outstanding, with an impressive menu featuring authentic Korean dishes that burst with flavor. Their soju selection is extensive and wellcurated, offering both traditional and unique flavors that pair perfectly with the meal. You must get the coconut soju cocktailit's refreshing, delicious, and the perfect complement to the rich and savory dishes. The staff is exceptionally friendly and attentive, ensuring that every visit is a delightful experience. Whether you're a fan of Korean cuisine or new to it, Soju Haus is a mustvisit destination. great for large groups and very well priced with large af portions. we ordered so many dishes and drinks and enjoyed them all. my personal favorites were the kimchi radish fried rice, bbq chicken and cheese, and the salmon sashimi. the complimentary rice they serve before 8pm is also deliciousits served with purple rice, anchovies, and an egg! the staff were all so kind and provided all we needed for my friends birthday dinner. ill definitely be back! Delicious food and drinks! Perfect for large groups or enjoy by yourself. We had a party of 4 and loved all the food options. Everything we ate was great and service was fast and friendly. All staff were very attentive and helpful.

We ordered intestines, squid, chicken gizzards, pork belly, and pig trotters. Again, everything was so good! I highly recommend trying them out! They will not disappoint. First time coming to this place with some friends and it was a great experience!  The food was pretty good, but the draw is the different kinds of soju available!

While Im not a big fan of soju in general, there were a few premium sojus that I enjoyed!  The atmosphere is nice as is the service!

See photos of what we ordered! Recommended.

주소: 133 E 31st St, New York, NY 10016, USA
리뷰:
Eating at Handsome rice was such an fulfilling experience. Its not typical Korean but its rather advanced Kfood that reaches out to greater American market. Ive tried the Galbi, Janguh sea eel and Jeyuk and all of them were great  to be honest the Galbi and the eel were my favorite which were perfectly marinated.

The people who prepared the meals there were great also. They seemed to working happily with such ownership. The chef Kim must be a good employer! haha.

Looking forward to another visit which will be my 4th time for Handsome Rice when Im in Manhattan next time. Oh their banana pudding was a pleasant surprise. Delicious!

Overall, excellent food and experience.
    !  With all of the amazing food in NYC, I always kick myself when I get conned by fake reviews. But thats clearly whats happening here with all of the flowery overzealous reviews saying this is the best Korean food in NYC. I trekked 45 minutes in 95 degree heat to get here and ordered the combination meal, which was inedible. It tasted old, gristly, fatty, sitting on top of fatsoaked rice. The vegetables were from the 1900s. The side of dumplings were nominally better but no different from what you might buy from the freezer at the grocery store. So disappointing Great for a quick lunch. This isnt gourmet Korean food, but its delicious and reliable at a good price. Its a takeout spot that happens to have some outdoor seating  but they dont come out to give you the dish and they take a while to clean their trash so pretty much expect to selfserve all the way. The handsome combo with all the meats is a good way to try everything although the truth is that the galbi is the star of the meal. Id just do that the next time Im there! I usually don't give 5 stars unless it's exquisite taste.
I would give this burger 100 stars if possible.
I like hamburgers. I love New York City's delicious homemade hamburgers so much that I've tried them all.
I found the best burger of my life at Handsome Rice!
The patty that softly wraps the mouth and the grill with fire flavor was enough to excite my eyes and taste, and the fresh vegetables seemed to care about my health.
And the fragrant, crispy outside and soft inside of the French fries captured my heart.

If you are traveling to New York or live in New York, it must be on your bucket list of musttry meals.

I confidently and strongly recommend this Handsome Rice.

Good Luck!

리뷰:
Been coming here for years. My favorite Korean spot in town. Their food is delicious, but the star is their drinks! Large fruit bowls of anything refreshing! I highly recommend the watermelon. They also have phone charging banks for rent as well, so keep the night going! Watermelon soju  pineapple soju were awesome !!!! Its a must try if you visit pocha.

Also, stir fry beef was absolutely delicious, but the pork dish was very spicy. Celebrated a birthday for my friend here and everyone was exceptional. The servers were attentive and our food was served promptly upon ordering. We had problem deciding what to order initially so we kept asking for more time, and they were very kind to wait for us. They were able to accommodate one of my friends who had a shellfish allergy for the rice cakes by not adding in fish cakes. And they also gave us a candle and played the birthday song for my friend. Vibes and atmosphere was great! Gratuity is already added on the receipt with extra tip on the bottom. I tipped extra for the great experience. We came only for the drinks!! We were just walking around and we found this spot and we LOVED IT!! We came 2 in our staying in NY because it was so good!! We try all of them and our favorite was the Melon!! And watermelon!!!
This place is great for some drinks and a fun time with friends Chicken soy garlic wings was GOOD!!! Its crispy and tender

The water melon soju was mostly ice and not a lot of soju in it definitely

The soup was decent and comforting and not really spicy however it is definitely not enough for 4people.

리뷰:
Had a wonderful experience at BCD Tofu House! The authenticity of the Korean cuisine really stood out. The side dishes were a highlightfresh, varied, and full of traditional flavors that perfectly complemented the main dishes. We ordered the beef and tofu soup, and it was excellentrich, hearty, and packed with flavor. The tofu was silky and the beef was tender, making for a comforting and satisfying meal. The atmosphere was cozy and welcoming, enhancing the overall dining experience. If youre looking for authentic Korean food, BCD Tofu House is definitely worth a visit. Ill be coming back for sure! We went to meet our daughter's Mom and Sister there for lunch. This is our first time meeting them and eat at BCD Tofu House. The meeting was great, we greatly enjoyed their company. It was a unique experience eating at the restaurant.  We ordered the Bulgogi combo. It comes with a lot of food. The beef and everything else were delicious. We have great conversations, great environments, and great companies that's to mee equal to great experience. I hope there was a BCD Tofu House in Houston, TX.  Definitely recommend visiting this restaurant in Korean town in NY, City.

Note The restroom is downstairs.  Follow the stairs case... This is an authentic and delicious Korean restaurant chain. They even serve marinated raw crab, which is hard to find in many places. Ive eaten here many times, and every dish is consistently good. However, the prices have been going up quite a bit recently. Other than that, no complaints! A classic Korean spot serving hearty Soon Tofu soup with a variety of banchan options the fried croaker is a standout. The combo option is a great way to try a stirfry and a soup dish. The tofu soup is rich and comforting with silken soft tofu, while the spicy pork we ordered was sizzling hot and wellseasoned. Overall, a satisfying meal, though expect a wait during peak hours. This was an awesome place! There was a bit of a wait, but service was extraordinary fast, which is good because we had to catch a flight. They brought many extra side dishes, all of which were delicious. The food was incredible overall. No complaints. They even had a place to lock up our luggage!

리뷰:
To put it plainly, the food here is not good for the price requested. We ordered the ChaDolbagi thinly sliced beef and the Sandubujigae tofu curd pot stew with seafood. If you order only one meat plate, they cook it in the back. Normally Im fine with this but the beef came out incrediblly overcooked with some pieces totally burnt. The tofu curd pot stew had fairly cheep ingredients. The tofu and seafood were clearly prepackagedforzen. Additionally, the stew had this sour smell that made it unpleasant to eat.

Normally Im fine with low quality food if it is reflected in the price. But these two dishes and 1 service of rice cost is 56 before tip 2024.

The service was fine but not good. We were initially seated and serviced by a kind young lady and gentlmen. However, after the order we never saw from them again. Instead an older lady started to bring out food and got our order wrong. She later fixed her mistake. Then when it came to tipping, they were stringent that we tipped in cash.

Overall, I will not coming back here again. I got off the 7 train on my way home from the beach. First time here . Had the Sweet and Sour Fried Pork about 25 it was enough for 4 people and mostly meat and it was Delicious. Paid 3 extra for white rice. Had a Korean bottled beer for 7. On the side they give you separately potato, cabbage, fish, broccoli. The service was great , professional traditional friendly style. Ill be going back soon . Honestly this is like accidental moment me and my friends had, cause after comeback from walmart we crave some food to eat for dinner and when we decide to go to dimsum place, i saw this place on red light position, then we ask if it's still open? And finally we come to dine in, and the foods are so delicious. Recommended for everybody who looks for late dinner cause they open till 3AM. The rude old lady that works there ruined my birthday dinner.  Payed over 50 dollars for bbq and a soup and she didnt bring out lettuce or dipping sauces that usually accompany a bbq. She got annoyed when I asked for it and when we ran out of lettuce there were only like 6 lettuce leafs she had the nerve to snap at me that  lettuce is expensive ! How rude!!  So after spending 50 dollars for a bbq and soup she up charged us another 5 dollars for another preciois 6 leafs of lettuce. Ridiculous. My friend who treated me to my birthday meal  didnt tip her after her rude service and she wanted to know where her tip was. She can take it out of the 5 dollars she uncharged us.  We will never be eating here again.  Which is unfortunate because I love Korean food and this place is so close to my house I would eat here every day of the lady had not been so rude but there are other Korean places near by I can go to instead. Really enjoyed the food, although wouldn't say it's the cheapest Korean restaurant I've been to. The restaurant is also quite spacious. Re the service, the waitresses were slightly on the colder side, not overtly friendly or rude.

리뷰:
Delightful Lunch Experience.

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Cafe China. And thoroughly enjoyed my visit. The overall experience was outstanding, thanks to the delicious food, cozy atmosphere, and attentive service.

Our bartender, Edward, provided exceptional care, ensuring our lunch at the bar counter was memorable.

The menu offerings did not disappoint. Standouts included the savory Ma po tofu, flavorful purple and white rice, perfectly cooked string beans, and tender shredded chicken with yellow chives.

The spicy cucumber appetizer, however, fell short of expectations. Instead of the anticipated spicy kick and perfect marinade balance, it consisted of fresh cucumbers topped with a few red peppers, lacking flavor and seasoning.

Despite this minor misstep, I highly recommend this place.

Reservations are essential, as wait times can reach 4060 minutes. Our bill totaled 112 for two people, including six dishes and hot jasmine tea  a reasonable price for the quality and quantity.

Kudos to the team for the elegant business card design, reflecting the restaurant's attention to detail.

Our rating  4.55.

Thank you and good luck. Came here for an early dinner a few days ago and from the food to the drinks to the service to the ambiance, this place is amazing. We were helped my Alex who made great recommendations, especially because some members of our group had dietary restrictions. I think the stars of the show for me were the eggplant and green beans, the mapo tofu, and the fried fish! Everything came out hot and fresh. We also had cocktails mine was a Corpse Reviver 2 which was beautifully balanced and tasty.  It complimented the food nicely. My friends were also really pleased with their drinks.

If youre going to dine at cafe china, I would recommend coming with people who want to share family style is definitely the way to go here  Jul 24

Dinner 4 of us

All very delicious food

Service 910 quick but maybe because we are seated near the kitchen. See below.

Ambience 710 maybe because we are seated at  behind near the kitchen and under the stairs but overall the decor are nice. And the place is big inside. Good spot for Sichuan cuisine. Some of our favorites were the Husband  Wife Special tripes, the Fish Blossom and the Curiously Tasty Chicken. The Eight Jewel Rice Pudding dessert was also pleasantly refreshing. It's a decent place for some Chinese and it's a pretty big space so we had no trouble being seated. The food was ok but suffering from the usual pitfalls of being very oily or fatty especially the scallion pancakes. I only got through half of my portion of pork ribs before surrendering to it in shame.
A strange point I had to mention about the shiitake mushrooms stir fry is that it has an ingredient in it that somehow numbs your mouth and leaves behind a strange, dry aftertaste. It's likely I'm just too white for these ingredients but I felt it's worth mentioning for other equally melanin challenged folks who may want to visit.

리뷰:
Honestly i have a bit of mixed feelings about this place. Food was good in a sense that I can feel that they use good ingredients and the soup tastes sophisticated . it's just pretty much presentable. But i don't think it's worth revisiting. Maybe i had my hopes up too high. Bit disappointed that there was nothing special about this place. Also the bar seating was uncomfortable. The vibe wasn't like where you can enjoy the time and the food but more like once you are done eating you have to hurry your way out. Just several things that could be complemented i guess. If you are dying to try, check it out, but if not then i guess there are better alternatives out there. Entering a sleek, modern barstyle restaurant, I discovered a culinary delight. Their pork gomtang was just wonderful. Each sip revealed a deep, but clean flavor that paired perfectly with a bowl of kimchi, creating a healthy and satisfying combination.
Despite the upscale atmosphere and Michelinstar quality, the prices were surprisingly reasonable. This place is a true gemhighly recommended for anyone seeking a unique and delicious dining experience! very simple, but good soup. everything is pretty much prepared so service is very fast, they just have to assemble the soup.

the kimchi dumplings are very soft, and had some sort of tofu crumbs inside. they werent my favorite though.

the dweji gomtang is a simple, clear soup, similar to chicken noodle but with pork and rice. its very comforting and the portion is decent. they recommend adding a spicy paste onto the meat but it didnt really pair well with the flavor of the soup. First time!
Ive heard about this place a lot on social media.
Unfortunately I have to say that the rave reviews are somewhat over rated its not a surprise that they didnt get Michelin last year.
I do not have any complaints about the Gomtang. I enjoyed it quite a lot.
But they better watch out for the quality of Kimchi Mandoo. It was over steamed so it became mushy. And I dont know where the over powering spiciness is coming from and it numbs your taste buds so that you cant properly appreciate the Gomtang.
In terms of Maesil aid, I barely tasted plum in it. Mostly tasted like club soda with lemon and mint. At last experience the hype.
Single menu. Also ordered barley soju.
Good but not sure returning.

Speakeasy bar inside interesting.
 rice bit undercooked for me.

리뷰:
We ordered the course menu for 4 people and the food was nice. The amount of food was a bit too much, and chicken is not a really traditional type of chicken in korean style.
But overall foods were nice, quite fancy.
I think it's also good to order a la carte menu as well.
I love the moods, and want to visit again! Service was great, their food was delicious. If you order one dish as your meal, I doubt you'll be full unless you get an appetizer. My group of 3 ordered a bunch to share we did 5 dishes to share but only needed 4 in the end.

Highly recommend the soy poached black cod and the braised short ribs. They both come with a bowl of rice.

We also ordered the makgeoli beer. It came in a cup and was a very generous cup. It's just a little smaller than a standard Ikea glass cup

We say outside and they had AC there as well. We made a reservation through the seated app but it didn't seem full when we got there at 6pm. However it did seem to fill up after 3040 min. Loved it at Danji! Its an intimate restaurant but they have great dishes. My family and I tried the tasting menu, which included all their popular dishes plus dessert. Flavor packed and genuinely delicious. Would absolutely go back! See my food instagram sipsandsizzles for more! Really great Korean restaurant! We loved every dish that we tried, from the dumplings to the tofu and the bibimbap. Everything was flavorful and fresh. We sat at the bar and the bartender was excellent. Cant wait to go back! Sooooo soooo sooo good!!! Danji is AMAZING. The food is so filling and each plate is perfect to share between two people. The staff is so nice and attentive, really amazing people. One of the best Korean food in nyc and I mean it!! Second time here and my family and I love it. The best is the cod and the spicy chicken wings, and the shrimp scallion pancake, and the bulgogi sliders. There is not one thing we did not like.

리뷰:
A off the Main Street restaurant around Korean town.  I was surprised by the food.  It is actually really good.  The intestine dishes look crispy and crunchy. I dont eat that personally. All other dishes are quite easy for my stomach even though it is spicy.  I like the pork belly as usual.  Cold noodles are very refreshing.  Drink menu are not too diversified.  Overall a good gem hiding in Korean town The perfect spot for feasting on Korean foods!
The new menu item OX intestine BBQ was superb! Perfectly seared with the right balance of meatiness and fattiness. The giant rice ball was packed with tuna, seaweed, pickled radish very rich in flavors and textures.
Rose tteokbokki was creamy. Love the smoky sausage!
The pork soup tasted really healthy, was comforting on stomach.
The portion of the seafood pancake was generously big!
My alltime favorite LA Galbi never fails.
The naengmyum was so refreshing and perfect for summertime! Ox bone soup, spicy rice cake with ramen, sodduck, , cold noodles are all what I ordered. Tastes great in general. Love 24 hours availability. Music might be too loud. Went here with a friend for a late lunch and loved everything! I'll breakdown my review into three categories

1 AmbienceDecor the restaurant is very nicely decorated with high ceilings, beautiful wood accents, and traditional Korean inspired decorations. It is spacious, clean, and a peaceful place to grab a bite amidst the chaos out NYC outside we went around 3pm on a Friday

2 Food We only got ordered two itemsthe Perilla Kalguksu and the Bibim Naengmyun. Both were delicious and served in HUGE portions. The naengmyun was incredibly refreshing after stepping in from the summer heat, with noodles bouncy and chewy and the broth being not too spicy. The kalguksu was also delicious and rich, and the clams were NEVERENDING. A great bang for your buck, especially in the city. And we got banchan of kimchi and radish kimchi which were also both very yummy 

3 Service The staff were kind and the food came out quicklyno complaints

 Just had an awesome meal at Tosokchon  the tofu stew was out of this world! The flavors were so rich and just the right amount of spicy. The tofu was super soft and soaked up all the tasty broth. You can tell they use fresh ingredients and know what they're doing. The service was friendly and the place had a cozy vibe. If you love Korean food, youve got to try their tofu stew

주소: 32 W 32nd St, New York, NY 10001, USA
리뷰:
Terrible Service Experience

I've been to The Kunjip before and enjoyed the food, so I decided to give it another try for dinner. However, the service experience was beyond disappointing. Upon arrival, we requested a table for two and were directed upstairs where there was no one to greet us. After inquiring with a server, we were finally seated without any communication. Midway through perusing the menu, a male staff member rudely informed us to wait elsewhere as it wasn't our turn, without any prior indication of a waitlist. His demeanor was unprofessional and unwelcoming. When asked about the wait time, he impatiently instructed us to just order. Moments later, another staff member rushed us to place our order, displaying a similar hostile attitude.

Although the food was delicious, the service throughout the meal was appalling. Not once were we offered any side dishes, nor were our glasses refilled with water. We spent barely twenty minutes in the restaurant, yet multiple staff members approached our table without attending to our basic needs. To make matters worse, before we could even finish our meal, the bill was abruptly presented, signaling they wanted us to leave. As my friend was still at the table, a server immediately cleared it for the next guests.

As we left, the entire staff seemed indifferent, except for the kind receptionist at the entrance. Despite the tasty food, the overall experience was marred by the atrocious service. Mr Song hosted us incredibly well! I couldnt believe how hospitable, kind and attentive he was during our Korean BBQ meal here. The team have been fantastic. I would HIGHLY recommend coming here. Its a must in Korean town NYC!

We will be coming here again from London, UK! I recently dined at this Korean barbecue gem in Koreatown NYC, and it exceeded all my expectations! The beef and meat selection was incredibly fresh, making every bite a delight. The shrimp shumai dumplings were a pleasant surprise, bursting with flavor and perfectly cooked. And let's not forget about the kimchi stew, which was comforting and packed with authentic Korean flavors. The service was topnotch, and the ambiance added to the overall experience. Highly recommend this spot for any Korean barbecue enthusiast or anyone looking for a memorable dining experience in the heart of NYC! Good Korean food. Service was great. The free appetizer choices is not as great though. Seafood pancake was good and their cold noodle good too. Dumpling was good too but bit greasy Really reminds me of Koreans' restaurant in Korea. Love the side dishes. Service was quick. Food came out delicious and hot.

주소: 342 E 6th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
리뷰:
I tried Raku in Toronto before and wanted to see how the one in New York compares.  I got a dipping udon with tempura. The udon was nice and chewy and I really liked the tempura  especially the shiso leaf one. The tempura was not too oily and had a good texture. The dipping sauce was nice as they put the condiments separately and you can add it as you desire. I think the wasabi was mixed with something,  which was not really to my taste.
The staff were fast and attentive and the seating area is nice.
Overall it was pretty good! The best udon I've ever had. The texture of the noodles was springy, chewy, and desirable. The broth was super clean tasting. Such a simple bowl of noodles had so much flavor. I arrived for lunch just as they were opening and was immediately seated. The establishment is small with only a few seats so I would recommend coming early or during off times on the weekdays if you don't want to wait for a seat. After I ordered, the food arrived quickly. The server was attentive and checked in on me to see if food was to my liking. Would highly recommend this spot.  This place makes my must try foods when visiting New York. Came with a few friends for lunch and was extremely pleased! We were seated very quickly outside and got our food in a timely manner. The outside seating was also a bit hot as we only had a small fan.

We got the fried chicken, two soup udons, one yakisoba, and one katsudon. The fried chicken was extremely juicy and the sauce was a nice complement. The udon had the right texture and the soup was very flavorful, some of the best udon Ive had in the city. The katsu was also great, very crunchy and juicy. Overall we had a great experience and would love to come again! The food was just okthe udon is a bit too soggy, and the dessert was just subpar. The service was one of the most unfriendly ones I've encountered. Solid ramen spot. Tasty broth and noodles are extremely chewy and delicious. Meat in the ramen was also above average quality for ramen places. Fried chicken was so great, but maybe a bit under salted as it was somewhat bland. Service was pretty good although you might have to wait a bit for a seat.

One thing to consider is the restaurant doesnt have any air conditioning, or if it does it doesnt work very well. Was easily above 80 degrees in there while eating, and much hotter than outside. Still, recommend this spot for decent ramen at an okay price.

Our menus were customized, the menu was diverse and they worked to accommodate all dietary restrictions. The photos don't do it justice  would highly recommend.

The pancakes were made to perfection. I tried all the sauces available on the table 4 in total  with my chocolate chip pancakes  they all tasted amazing.

I will definitely come here again  if you love pancake, you should too. The crepes were very soggy and were no flavor. The pancakes were extremely dry and no butter was on top of the pancakes. I love French fries, any restaurant I go to I order French fries and this specific IHOP restaurant French fries were disgusting! The tender was overly crispy, it hurt your gums and the sauce it came with wasnt even visible. The French toast was soggy and overly drenched in strawberry syrup, you could even see the bananas. When I first order a hot chocolate, her face expression was as if I shouldnt be ordering that on a summer day. She made me feel uncomfortable placing any other order. She didnt have any patient while my friend and I was explaining what we want, etc. I dont recommend Cassandra R. And or that IHOP location to anyone, its not worth your money and time. casual business meeting at iHop. Food was freshly prepared. Our server was super friendly with great interpersonal skills. IHOP is a huge corporation constantly building new locations they just dont care about this one apparently. And the kicker 90 for two people for BREAKFAST after tip. 주소: 26 Eldridge St, New York, NY 10002, USA
리뷰:
We were genuinely surprised by how affordable the prices were. Also the food were very delicious. Standout has to be the chicken dumplings.  Those were some of the best dumplings we ever had! Their fried dumplings were also very good. Their service was super fast, even though it was very crowded inside. Our total bill came out under 20. Visited NY for 11 days and tried to do some research on good affordable eats. This place is my top find. Delicious food at affordable prices and always busy. Stand out dishes, the fried chicken dumplings and pork noodles. So glad we came here 3 times! This is a solid small Chinese restaurant with quite a few good hand pulled noodle soup options and some of the best dumplings I've found in a while.
We ordered the beef noodle soup and the spicy beef noodle soup as well as the Sichuan dumplings. The beef broth was rich and thick with the right amount of saltiness. The beef slices were tender and a good mix of lean and fatty. The spicy level of the beef soup was satisfying but not over the top if you like spicy food. The noodles had good a good texture and were not overcooked. All our items were served piping hot. Prices were just a little high in my opinion, but not unfair considering inflation these days, and the portions were admittedly large.
Our favorite was the Sichuan dumplings though with their spicy sauce and generous amount of fresh cilantro. Delicious!
I'll definitely stop in again next time I'm in Chinatown and craving noodle soup. I'm interested in a lot of other items on their menu, but the dumplings will always be part of my order. Recommended. The Chicken Dumplings were just ok in my opinion. The noodles with beef and hot spicy soup was not spicy at all and they could do better with the beef. The fried dumplings looked really good, if you eat pork then I would suggest that. It is very popular on their menu. Honestly, you go here for the food, not the ambiance or environment. Hole in the wall spot in Chinatown with exceptional food. The fried pork dumplings and the schezuan dumplings are phenomenal . The sauce the schezuan dumplings are soaked in are perfect to mix incover the friend pork dumplings.  Very well priced at 12.85 total for two entrees. Do not expect to find a seat unless you mind sharing a table there are about 56 small tables in a 8 ft by 20 ft floor plan so it is tight. Again, you do NOT go here for the ambiance you come here for authentic superb dumplings and noodles at a very cheap price . Minimum of 12 spend.

It might feel a bit unsettling to dine in a restaurant located below ground level, but this place was a pleasant surprise with its cleanliness.

The food arrived quickly and was wellprepared. However, be aware that the portions are large and meant for sharing, which can make it challenging to sample a variety of dishes if you're in a small group. For a party of three, I would recommend ordering just three items to avoid being overwhelmed. Best hidden gem in Chinatown! They serve you hot tea the moment you sit! The servers are very funny, sarcastic and attentive.

 CASH ONLY, NO CARDS! Gratuity is included in the bill
 There is an ATM less than a block away.
 The restaurant in in the basement, stairs only, no elevator.
 The foods I recommend

1. Salt Squid with Hot Pepper
2. Peking Duck Served in 2 separate plates, comes with Bao bun  sauce

4. Sauteed Watercress I knew the food was going to be great, when we were the only white people in the restaurant. Food was excellent. Service was great. FYI, Cash only. 18 tip included on bill. TLDR RUDE WAITER, BAD SERVICE, AND BLAND FOOD

I've never had to leave a bad review but this was beyond terrible. I've been here a handful of times, mostly prepandemic. But I am NEVER coming back because of the way I was treated yesterday. I have never had to raise my voice at a waiter ever in my life. I have worked in the restaurant industry over 10 years. I ordered the chicken and broccoli, beef fried rice, and the eggrolls. The chicken was dry, and the rice was bland. The eggroll was NOT EDIBLE because it had 3 layers of wrapper and the inside was NOT COOKED. I tried waving down a waiter because I was unsure if we even had a singular waiter for our table. A couple of them saw me but just ignored me. No one came to check on us maybe because we were shoved into a corner and no one could even pass to get to us, no water refills, no asking if we needed anything else. So much time passed I was just waiting to pay the bill so we could leave. Ended up walking towards the waiters since they weren't coming to me. I told them there was something wrong with the eggroll and that we didn't eat it so to take it off the bill. Before even looking at said eggroll the waiter says "It's good, its good, you don't know how to eat!" I then go back to my table to grab the plate of eggroll to show him that it is raw. HE DOESN'T EVEN LOOK AT IT! I try to show him the raw dough inside. He says that its cooked noodle. Why would there be cooked noodle in an eggroll?!  He then says, " We have been open for over 50 years, you don't know how to eat!" It is wild that he did not even look at it to see if something was off which could possibly happen even by accident. I paid for the other items reluctantly and left in a rage. For being open since 1938, you would think they would have this place running smoothly by now. The food and service has gone down tremendously while the prices have gone up. If you want terrible service, rude waiters, and bland food this is the place for you

The service here was fantastic. We were very happy with our shrimp cocktail and crab cake appetizer. The porterhouse for 2 was cooked perfectly and tasted delicious. The complimentary drinks and dessert for our anniversary was a pleasant surprise. We will back! What a pleasure ! There are many steakhouses in NYC, but this small, quaint one had it all  atmosphere, service and amazing food !
I was traveling alone and sat at the bar seats for 4 at the bar proper and a few cocktail tables
My host for the evening was a lovely man from Albania, Sheriff. My steak was perfectly medium rare and the wine recommendation paired perfectly. There is a small area for outside seating on a beautiful night and the staff if friendly and accommodating. From the moment we stepped in, the ambiance exuded warmth and elegance, setting the perfect tone for a memorable afternoon.

The service was impeccable our waiter was knowledgeable and attentive without being intrusive, ensuring every detail of our meal was just right.

As for the main eventthe steakseach bite was a testament to culinary mastery. Cooked to perfection, the cuts were tender, juicy, and bursting with flavor. Whether you prefer a classic ribeye or a perfectly seared filet mignon, Royal 35 Steakhouse delivers on quality and taste.

Complementing our meal was a wellcurated wine list that offered excellent pairings, enhancing the overall dining experience.

In conclusion, Royal 35 Steakhouse is more than just a restaurant its a destination for steak aficionados seeking an unforgettable meal. With its impeccable service, exquisite steaks, and inviting ambiance, this place has rightfully earned its place as one of the finest steakhouse experiences in New York City. Highly recommended! Classic atmosphere very classy restaurant food test great everything was perfect. Highly recommended. Also a great quality meat.5 stars We were greeted immediately by the staff and shown to our perfectly situated corner table. Our appetizers, salads and steaks were delicious and well seasoned. To finish our meal, were provided with a complementary cheesecake.
It was the perfect weekday meal to end our trip in NYC.

리뷰:
Popped into this New York institution for a solo lunch and it was a worthwhile experience. I got a free glass of champagne for dining solo and ordered the Black Label Burger.

I really appreciated the quality of the meat they used and it was cooked perfectly. It was missing a bit of salt and the bun soaked through but one of the best burgers I have had in the city. The service was excellent and hoping to return to try the bone marrow another time. Divine food, atmosphere, cocktails and dessert. When you enter the restaurant it feels as if youre into an old, luxurious New York jazz club. 100 recommended but make sure to book weeks in advance or else its highly doubtful youll find a table on time. The place is pretty nice with a cozy ambiance, dark and classy decoration. The food is pretty rich in flavor and detailed with ingredients although I felt like for the price you may pay it can be considered overpriced or overrated.
We ordered the steak frites and the minette burger and both were really nice with fresh ingredients and good quality.
The service we got from Luis was 1010, really attentive and charismatic. In general the service is amazing.

Regarding the place, I felt a bit squeezed and with no space to move although every table at the restaurant is the same, the concept of a tavern is a small place with lots of tables and people.

Overall a nice experience. Really excellent food served up in this iconic restaurant. The setting, staff and menu is really good. There was so much on the menu that Ill have to return to try some other things. I went for the big name tickets and I wasnt disappointed.
 The 8.510 Black Label Burger was top notch. The onions, patty and bun blended so well. Id like a little more attention to detail on the bun either fresher, toasted or  coated in some interesting flavour it was just quite plain. That would be fine if it t was leaving space for the flavour of the patty or onions but it wasnt the case. The seasoning of the patty could have been better to really get that 1010.
 The 8.510 Bone in New York Strip was another strong hit. The fat could have been rendered better and there could have been more flavour from the flame but the cooking of the strip was very good. The best part was the peppercorn coating. Sharp and strong  special! Minetta Tavern, an oldfashioned French bistro known for their meat dishes, particularly the burger, the steak, the thickcut bacon and more.

The exterior is quite elusive showing nothing inside. The lightning is dark inside, with a light jazzy music. Upon entrance I was instantly hit with the a buttery aroma. Even when I am not that hungry, the classical conditioning made me salivate a bit.

The rumor is real, first and foremost, they do give lone eater a glass of champagne on the house, freshly and bubbly. Even for one person they gave a big loaf of semi baguette with butter on the side. The bread is chewy, warm, and crunchy on the outside. I do feel the butter is a bit lacking flavor though.

The Black Label Burger
The toasted sesame bun is toasted with butter and tasted moldy sweet, has a bit cottony texture, yet when eaten with meat the meat flavor dominates. The top bun has a lot of nutty sesames, and they are super crispy when eaten. The bottom bun, on the contrary, soaks up all the meat juice and is crushed into a thin layer. Since it is dryaged, the meat patty has a cheesy flavor besides beefiness even without the cheese. The patty is seasoned well, and they put an additional finished touch of salt on the surface. Outside is bit crusty, and inside is all juicy. The tomato is not watery, it has a texture when eaten with the patty and the sweet, mushed, caramelized onions. The pickle is outstanding acidic, juicy, mildly sweet, and has a bit of crunch.

I replaced the fries with petite salad, which was coated with olive oil and salt, not bad and not super. I also had the thickcut bacon, which comes in with 2 pieces. These are thick, fatty, come in on a hot plate so they still sizzle a bit. When hot, the smoked flavor really is prominent, I like when it is a bit cold so the smokeness doesnt compete with the porks intrinsic sweetness that much.

The service is outstanding my waitress is quick and accommodating. The food came within 5mins of ordering yeah mediumrare burger doesnt cook for long lol. I ordered a burger and bacon side but I went home a lot of leftover bacon with a semibaguette, and a stomach full of happiness.

주소: 146 Essex St, New York, NY 10002, USA
리뷰:
I recently had the pleasure of dining at Beauty  Essex, and I must say, it was an unforgettable experience! Dont let the pawn shop at the entrance fool you once you step through the hidden door, you are transported into a vibrant and exotic atmosphere that sets the stage for a culinary adventure.

The food was absolutely delicious, with a diverse menu that caters to a variety of tastes. Each dish was beautifully presented and bursting with flavor. The cocktails were equally impressive, expertly crafted and perfect for complementing the meal.

The staff at Beauty  Essex truly made the experience exceptional. Our hostess was incredibly friendly and welcoming, and despite the restaurant being packed, we experienced minimal waiting time for our reserved table.

Overall, I highly recommend making a reservation at Beauty  Essex when visiting NYC. Its a delightful blend of fun, fantastic food, and a lively atmosphere that you wont want to miss. I cant wait to return on my next trip. I always wanted to come here. Loved the idea of a guitar jewelry store that opens a door to a restaurant! Super cute!! Visited during restaurant week. The kale and apple salad was really good and I mean really good. I'm a picky eater and usually don't like kale, but compared to the other options, that was the only thing I would get, and at least I'd get my veggies in. It was the best appetizer, and everyone at the table agreed. The salmon was a little on the salty side but tolerable. The chicken dish was really good. And Everyone loved their dessert! I would definitely recommend and will be coming back here!! The food was good, but the overall experience was not. Our reservation was for 845, but we got there early and were given a table right away the table was not in the main dining area. While at that first table, we ordered drinks, then were advised by the waitress to order the appetizers and mains all together, and explained that our order would be phased in 2 courses. While waiting for the food, the table next to us got up and alerted us of a big roach going under our table. The manager moved us into the main dining area immediately. Shortly after moving to the new table, the appetizers and food came all at once. It felt from the start like we were being rushed. After another complaint, the manager comped our appetizers due to the restaurant's error. We also overheard the table behind us complaining about another issue, and they were comped with a couple of shots. The drinks we ordered were a hit or miss the same drink came in too sweet or two strong. Don't think we will be coming back. It seems that the overall quality and service of the place has greatly declined. This place is definitely a vibe! Walk through a small pawnshop like front room, into a dark, sexy space. Food was on point. Especially the steak tartare. Drinks tasty. A must visit. Date night, girls night or just to have a delicious meal. Had a wonderful time in the barlounge area for a quick drink and bite before another event.  Bar snacks were fabulous and the room itself is beautiful.  Special thanks to Jose at the bar for taking such good care of us.  Have been to BE for their full dinner in the past, but we only had time for a quick stop at the bar and we had a great time nonetheless.

주소: 342 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
리뷰:
First time coming to New York we had to try momosan.! Fist thing that caught my eye was the atmosphere and ambiance really a unique ramen restaurant. As we entered we were immediately greeted with a warm welcome. Both Johan our server and Beki the supervisor on duty were both so kind and welcoming.on top of that with the amazing  recommendation of appetizers to the ramen and sake made our night truly special definitely coming back in the future. One of the best ramen Ive ever had. Service was excellent, was able to grab a seat at 7 on a Friday and thoroughly enjoyed our dinner and drinks. The soft shell bao and all star ramen were definitely our favorites.  NOT WORHT IT. The ramen tastes like liquid lasagna  Very small portion. High prices. You are basically paying for the cutsie bar decor and the ratings on Google. Stay away if you ACTUALLY WANT good ramen. The ramen was alright I wouldnt come back for the ramen.. we also ordered two ramen sets. The Gyoza was alright too.. for the price I expected a lot more but youll find the same meal anywhere else for cheaper. What did Ayana our was the soft shell bao. I enjoyed that. The server guy was super sweet. Joe? He was great. Momosan, located in New York City, is a culinary gem that offers a delightful fusion of Japanese flavors and innovative twists on traditional dishes. Helmed by acclaimed chef Masaharu Morimoto, this vibrant restaurant is a mustvisit for anyone seeking an authentic and unforgettable dining experience.

As you step into Momosan, you are greeted by a lively and welcoming atmosphere that reflects the energy of the surrounding city. The dcor is modern and stylish, with sleek wood accents, industrial touches, and an open kitchen that allows diners to watch the chefs in action. The ambiance is vibrant yet intimate, making it equally suitable for a casual meal with friends or a romantic dinner.

The menu at Momosan is a showcase of Chef Morimoto's creativity and expertise, featuring a wide range of Japaneseinspired dishes that are both innovative and comforting. The Ramen, a signature dish at Momosan, is a standout, with rich, flavorful broth, perfectly cooked noodles, and a variety of toppings to choose from. The Tonkotsu Ramen, in particular, is a crowd favorite, with its creamy pork bone broth and tender slices of pork belly.

In addition to ramen, Momosan offers an array of small plates, sushi, and izakayastyle dishes that are perfect for sharing. The Pork Gyoza, crispy and savory with a juicy filling, are a musttry appetizer. The Spicy Tuna Crispy Rice, a modern twist on a classic dish, features crispy rice topped with spicy tuna and a drizzle of spicy mayo, offering a delicious contrast of textures and flavors.

For those looking for something heartier, Momosan also offers a selection of yakitori skewers, grilled to perfection and served with a variety of dipping sauces. The Wagyu Beef Yakitori, tender and succulent with a smoky char, is particularly indulgent and flavorful.

The beverage menu at Momosan is equally impressive, with a selection of craft cocktails, sake, and Japanese whiskies that complement the flavors of the food perfectly. The Sake Sangria, made with fresh fruit and premium sake, is a refreshing and vibrant option, while the selection of Japanese whiskies offers something for every palate.

Service at Momosan is attentive and friendly, with staff members who are knowledgeable about the menu and eager to provide recommendations. The pace of the meal is relaxed yet efficient, allowing diners to enjoy their experience without feeling rushed.

Pricing at Momosan is reasonable, especially considering the high quality of the ingredients and the creativity of the dishes. It's a great value for the unique and memorable dining experience you receive.

주소: 13 W 36th St., New York, NY 10018, USA
리뷰:
I think the food was pretty good but the place is a bit overhyped. The appetizers we ordered, the gyozas and the dumplings were both excellent. Flavorful peppers and juicy gyozas. However, the ramens were just ok. I didn't love the smoked dashi I ordered, and while the tonkatsu was better, it was far from the best and there are plenty of better options in NYC. Also didn't love that they were really trying to get us to leave after we were done with our noodles. I have been so excited to try this place after seeing tik Toks and reviews and I was so underwhelmed and disappointed. I reserved and got in right away. Sat at bar but did not drink..none of cocktails screamed at me. I got lunch special with the salad. And sad to say the salad was the best thing about my visit. Their ginger dressing is very good. I actually asked for more and got a side of dressing to take. The ramen was meh. I added spice but it was not spicy at all. The pork looks like thinly sliced ham you get at the deli. Was not a fan at all. The egg was perfect. Broth ok. Noodles were thick and curly. I asked. For thin noodle but was not able to change it. I got spicy wings to go for my new Yorker fiance'. He actually described them as "trash". I had high hopes for this place but left highly disappointed. New York has other ramen spots that blow this place away. Service was good. My new favorite ramen spot in the city. We got here at 8pm on a Saturday with no reservation. We got a table in 40 mins which was shorter than the expected wait time. The service was excellent and relatively quick. The food is so delicious!! We got the mushrooms buns, chicken wings, classic tonkotsu ramen and matcha shaved ice. It was all very flavorful. I look forward to returning to try other items on their menu We like it here ! Ramen and all other side dishes tastes very nice. And since half of our group are vegetarian l, we are very happy that we can have nearly the same menu.
Service is very friendly too. Walked in around 330 pm on a Tuesday and managed to get a spot for 2 at the bar the community table was also available. It was interesting to note that theyve been given a Michelin recommendation for the last few years in a row.
They had happy hour offerings available, but we didnt order any drinks. They didnt have any physical menus and no wifi  this gets tricky for those visiting New York from outside the country!
We ordered 1 ramen and 1 cold noodle dish.
The ramen has a bit of a kick, and its really tasty. It contains cashews, which is not something one encounters frequently in ramen. It brought some nice crunch and texture to the dish. It wouldve been nice if they gave a whole egg in the dish instead of just half though. The cold noodles were better than the ramen imo. They are saucy and creamy and the toppings are just right!
Would recommend going here to enjoy the food.

Came here on the recommendation of a friend. He made the reservations so I cant share the process. Upon our arrival, we shared that we had a reservation and we waited less than 5 minutes to be seated. My friend came in with crutches so we had to seat somewhere easily accessible for him.

Our waiter was either sleepy or not interested in serving us. The service was very uninspiring. We order our drinks and meal at the same time. Our meal arrived with no water and other beverages ordered.

We both ordered the Mala Dry Pot which was pretty pricey for the portion and quantity of meats and produce. The Mala Dry Pot was filled with herbs and flavors but the semi spicy flavored dish was saturated with oils in the center making the experience a tad unbearable.

They served up purple and white rice on the side to augment the dining experience.

Im hoping to give this spot another try or one of the other MaLa Project spots in the city.

Location is great for two to four people based on the seating options. The atmosphere needs some improving. It's like eating in a cave dark and loud from all the other conversations. That said, the food is good. The dry pot had lots of rice noodle, too much, but worth a try. I recommend the small plates the most With recent disappointments with fried rice, I ordered noodles. I was extremely happy as beef noodles were super delicious. I began to suspect that they added some flavour enhancer  Hot herbal tea was good as well. However, vegetarian dumplings werent flavourful, so I am a little disappointed. Spicy hot pot was flavourful and at the maximum level before being unpleasant. The environment is so cozy and it smells amazing throughout the restaurant. Server was very attentive and knowledgable. Did the little spicy Veggie bowl. it was a lot of food so be sure you come with too hungry. Perfect and a truly delicious meal. I had no idea the restaurant had so much decorative space in the back!

The dry pot was very tasty and filling.
The little spicy still made me sweat, so I cant imagine how much the Very Spicy must be!

All the meats and veggies were perfectly cooked into the noodles and sauce. Will definitely try it again!

주소: 95-11 Banpo-dong, Seocho District, Seoul, South Korea
리뷰:
New York Steakhouse delivers an exceptional dining experience that truly transports you to the heart of Manhattan.

The cozy atmosphere, combined with its cheeky interior design, creates a setting that feels authentically New York. From the moment you step inside, you're enveloped in a warm, welcoming ambiance that makes it easy to settle in and enjoy your meal.

The service is topnotch, with attentive staff ensuring that every need is met promptly and courteously. The menu selection is perfect, offering a wide variety of dishes to suit any taste. What stands out is the inclusion of sides like salads, soups, desserts, or coffee with every meal, adding incredible value to the dining experience.

The quality of the food is excellent, making the pricetoquality ratio almost unbeatable.

My only minor critique would be the burger meat, which had a bit too much pepper for my liking. However, this small issue did not detract from the overall enjoyment of the meal and steak!

Overall, New York Steakhouse is highly recommended, and I definitely plan to visit again. Whether you're looking for a casual meal or a special night out, this restaurant is sure to impress. I really liked everything about the restaurant. I expected their steak to be original and "retro" which was what I got. But out of the two dishes, one meat had a certain smell. I assume that it was not as fresh as it should be. Otherwise, it was a lovely dining experience. I tried this restaurant for the first time and I can say that the quality of the meat is high.
I tried the steak with Aioli and it remember me the taste of south of France. The aioli was creamy and well seasoned.
The steak, tender and juicy.
The service is fast and the waiter really polite.
there is different kind of steaks with different prices.
You start your journey by a pumpkin soup and then your main dish arrives. I also tried the fries and they were crispy and soft inside.
You finish your lunch or dinner by a dessert either a creme brulee, a coffee or a mango jelly. I tried all and everything was good.
The restaurant is well located, clean and for three people we didnt pay a lot compare to other steak house.
For sure, I will go back because everything went well. The steak was very good. The service was not nearly as good as the steak. The waiter and chef are not very aware when it comes to allergies and the ingredients in their foods. After saying they understood that we had a person with CoeliacCeliac disease and another with a sever egg allergy, they brought us salads with bread and a mayonnaise based dressing. After returning these and moving on to the steak and sides, they brought out fried onions with mayonnaise on top.
It is a small almost cramped space. The prices are good, especially considering the neighborhood and quality of the food.
Disregarding the allergy issues, the service is still not very good. Old plain steakhouse at Seorae village. valet parking available.

주소: 195 Broadway, New York, NY 10007, USA
리뷰:
Fantastic food and wonderful service in a gorgeous setting   I always enjoy visiting the different Nobu locations and though sitting in the dining room looking for celebrities is fun, I love sitting at the bar. And Nobu Downtown has a beautiful bar and lounge area! It's a perfect place to sip and snack while catching up with friends  Came here and got lucky to sit at the sushi bar. I got two rolls of the vegetable sushi and tofu new style. Tofu new style was so bad. Just no. The vegetable sushi was so good. It was so fresh. I also got the donuts also very good. The lychee martini was delicious as well. Service was good but a bit slow. The interior is beautiful as well. Such a nice time. Went to Nobu for my birthday dinner and ordered the Omasake with winesake pairing. All the plates were not only stunning but unbelievably good, I couldn't pick a favorite amongst them. If you are not so much of a drinker I would order just one wine pairing instead of two, for us it was a bit too much alcohol per plate but overall definitely worth it! We had a wonderful experience at Nobu downtown! The food was delicious, and the staff was very friendly. My favorites were the black cod miso and crispy rice with tuna. The sushi was fresh and delicious. Overall, I enjoyed my dining experience here and highly recommend it! Have been to a different Nobu location before but this one had the most beautiful space Ive ever seen for a restaurant, especially the upstairs portion. Whole place is gorgeous though.

Service was 1010 as usual with Nobu and most dishes were amazing, but the cost  value is why Id say 4 stars on the food.

Overall a really incredible experience and would definitely return. Id especially recommend for any business related purposes.

주소: 10 Columbus Cir, New York, NY 10019, USA
리뷰:
We have been to a few two and three star restaurants that did not live up to our expectations, but Per Se did. The food and service exceeded our expectations. When we first were seated at our table overlooking Columbus Circle, the hostess pointed to a small stool and said, "This is a rest for your purse." This small touch tells you about the attention level in the restaurant. Each course was perfectly timed and bursting with flavors. The sizes were perfect. By the end of the dinner we were full but not stuffed. And then came six or seven tiny desserts. At the end we got a bag with tasty morsels as mementos, as well as a menu of what we had signed by the chef. It was a memorable dinner. This was an excellent experience. The service staff was phenomenal. They were very professional and friendly. They helped guide us through the menu and ensured our dietary restrictions were not a concern at all.  The main dining room and 9 course tasting menu comes  with a hefty price tag but it is worth it. The food is excellent and you will certainly leave full but not stuffed. This was one of the best meals we have had to date. Walking through a mall to get to a 3 Michelin Star restaurant is off putting but the view once you get there helps you forget all about that. I'm very happy we had the opportunity to eat in the main dining room and next time I am in New York I will do my best to get a reservation there again. Definitely add it to your must eat list when visiting NYC! When you book at a Michelin 3 Star restaurant expectations are pretty high. Especially when you fly in special to New York for your wifes milestone birthday.

Could it be that good?

The short answer is yes.

Amazing view. I couldnt believe our table overlooking Central Park.

Wait staff. Totally matched our vibe. Attentive, funny and the right mix of leave me alone with a hint of answering questions and lightheartedness. Shoutout to Eric!!!

The food. Its all about the food, right? Upon the first bites in your mouth you wonder what youve been chewing your whole life. It certainly wasnt this. I have the palette of a kindergartner and even I was blown away from the flavors, textures and sensations.

To top it off a few special extras for my wifes birthday. Worth the special trip.  Couldnt imagine having done anything else. It's spectacular, it lived up to it's reputation. It's a seven course tasting menu, although if you count the number of desserts it's more like 11. We both had the wagyu supplement which we would highly recommend.

We have done a number of Michelin three starred restaurants, some deliver and some disappoint. In New York Per Se and Le Bernadin are both extraordinary. We were really underwhelmed by Jean George. This place is so hard to review. Obviously the cooking is at a worldclass standard, but aside from a couple of dishes like the classic oyster and pearls and the quail. Nothing really blows you away. The eight or nine different desserts is a nice touch at the end and theres some real crackers in there the thing thats most surprising about this place. Is that the atmosphere the decor feels like a Hilton lobby. Which when youre paying 400 a plate feels very underwhelming, Ive definitely had better. Michelin star Dan experiences and I would not say this is a must do.

But unfortunately the service was really bad, three minutes after she sit us down she was rushing to take the order, ask some questions but didnt answer them and after we were done eating about to pay with card and then saw a percentage from 20, 22, 25 to 28 like after a bad service and still want a least a 20 tip? Just from serving two cans of drinks and two dishes? Dont take me wrong I usually tip 10 alone if it is a good service but really caught my attention how high the percentage are in here. I recommend paying in cash if having a bad service I was craving some ramen so I dropped by and Im so glad I did! I didnt realize there was a happy hour that was starting in 20 minutes so the staff member let me wait until then before I put my order through. For 19.99 I got a drink, salad and my miso veg ramen. It was definitely worth the price and tasted delicious. The salad dressing was so good and I got the yuzu turmeric drink. Would definitely recommend if you are in the area I ordered a Sesami chicken Don for takeaway at 1215 pm on May 10, and what I received was far from satisfactory. The attached picture speaks volumes a measly three pieces of chicken adorned a plate that once held a generous portion. This glaring reduction in quantity left me utterly disappointed. Save your time and money for a place that values their customers' satisfaction. I cant stress how amazing the service is. My water was never empty, the food came out quickly, and everyone was so polite. I wish I lived in NYC so I could make this one of my regular places. Food was fantastic. I got the pork ramen and the broth is very good.

We loved this restaurant!!!!! After seeing the Empire State Building,  we googled best restaurant nearby and they did not disappoint. One of the best steaks I ever had and we are from Texas. Great wine, atmosphere and service. The porterhouse that we got was cold and tough. It looks fine when you look at the outer part of the steak but the inside was cold and felt like it was not even cooked thoroughly. Although we did say we wanted the steak to be medium rare, it felt more like rare but cold.

The overall service was ok but didnt exceed my expectations as this is the fine dining steakhouse in nyc.

The atmosphere was great though. This Park Avenue steakhouse is Wolfgang's original restaurant and our favorite of all the locations, mainly due to its history. The ceilings are beautiful, and the servicefood is topnotch like all of the other Wolfgang's locations. I know I've said this before, but Wolfgang's absolutely make the best steak sauce that we have ever had! My family and I ate here on Mothers day for dinner. One of our waiters came off super rude at first and did not look happy to serve us. He was hurrying to pour our seltzer water it almost knocked our glasses over. Food came out fairly quick which was a plus but when we got home 4 of us were super ill the following night coming into the morning, me included. We all had nausea, vomitting, diarrhea, and body chills.. we realized had food poisoning from this meal. Im super unhappy and still feeling horrible after this dinner One of the best steakhouses in all of New York City! Wine list is also terrific. The service is top notch. Always worth the money!

리뷰:
Seafood heaven at The Lobster Place in Chelsea Market! I indulged in the most delicious and fresh seafood experience. The lobster roll was succulent and flavorful, the steamed lobster was cooked to perfection, and the lobster bisque was rich and creamy. Each bite was a taste sensation! The quality and freshness of the ingredients truly shine through. If you're a seafood lover like me, this place is a mustvisit. Don't miss out on their mouthwatering lobster dishes  your taste buds will thank you! A friend of mine brought me to Chelsea Market for the first time. After walking the Market, I said I wanted to try the oysters. While he went and got sushi, I got the oyster sampler which was one each of the dozen they had available today.

They provided hot sauce Tabasco? and mignonette sauce. Loved the oysters although two were a bit salty for my liking.

I would have liked to have a placement card so I could identify which was which.  This would be particularly helpful if I had been inclined to order more.

There was a size vs salinity chart which was interesting but not if I didnt know which I was tasting.

Great atmosphere and service. We werent rushed and were able to sit and visit a while. Highly recommended for any seafood lover! I like to come here for the sushi bar and and watch the chefs prepare our oder at the counter. I also like to come for the Maine lobster rolls loaded with fresh lobster. The big shrimp and oysters are also excellent. They also have some other unique seafood creations that I like to try. This place has a wide variety of options and a fun seafood market vibe. FOOD surprisingly good.
 Shrimp Katsu Sandwich actual shrimp in there, not so crispy but decent. Needs more flavor and greens.

 Lobster Roll very good one, loaded with lobster. The lobster is fresh, juicy and not fishy, bun is also soft and buttery.

 Clam Chowder not the best clam chowder and a little salty but it's not bad.

SERVICE all self serving, it's a busy place so take awhile to get the food.

INSIDE very limited seats, floor is a bit dirty and sticky. Delicious, fresh lobster  lobster rolls!
Clam chowder fries were heavenly.
Had an enjoyable time with my girlfriends

리뷰:
No words are needed for this twostar Michelin restauranteverything was exceptional. I loved every course they served, except for the final chocolate bites. The vibe and service were definitely worthy of two stars. While the portions were on the smaller side you might not feel full at the end, youll absolutely appreciate the unique flavors of each meticulously crafted dish. FOOD best tasting menu restaurant I ever had. Dishes have a really good balance, great layers of flavor in each course, amazing presentation. For the first time ever I love all the courses  on the menu.

Dessert was a very fun part to eat, love the idea of micro ice cream cone, dry ice crunchy bits with passion fruit.

DRINKS long list of drinks to choose from plus wine pairing.

SERVICE top notch service, open kitchen with chef cooks everything in front of you and serve. The waiter takes care of drinks has great communication and really fun.

VIBE very upscale yet not too formal, the dark grey interior does give a cold and heavy vibe in there. Was there end of August in their new location. You are no longer seated at a chefs table and instead at individual tables.

Overall, the food was fine, but not outstanding. One of the desserts tasted freezer burnt. There was no bread course. Nothing stood out.

As far as service, at some point during the meal it smelled like intense smoke to the point I had to step outside. I believe this was for the meat course but they need to figure out a different filtration system a friend also had this same experience when they went. First of all, I have been to many restaurants around the world, up to 3 Michelin stars. This restaurant tortured my tongue. The whole menu was an extreme dose of salt and sugar. I can't believe people write good reviews about this pretentious restaurant. This was by far the worst food I have tasted in my life. The service was good, but the food made my tongue feel like pickle. If you care about good food and not pretentious horrible presentations of salt and sugar, stay away. We loved our main waitress and the staff. However, I must say that that one of the staff was not niceprofessional. It was not a problem for me, but multiple of my guests were not happy about him.

Unsure if he is the manager or owner?

For the food and atmosphere, pretty good. But for this kind of place we expect to feel very welcomed.

주소: 219 Mulberry St, New York, NY 10012, USA
리뷰:
Nestled in the heart of SoHo, Little Ruby's is a delightful gem that perfectly blends charm and sophistication. The moment you step into this cozy eatery at 219 Mulberry St, youre welcomed by a warm atmosphere and an inviting decor that feels both modern and intimate.

The menu is a delightful journey through creative dishes that highlight fresh, seasonal ingredients. I highly recommend the avocado toastits a standout! Paired with perfectly poached eggs and a hint of chili, its a deliciously satisfying option for brunch. The coffee is equally impressive, expertly brewed and served at the ideal temperature.

Service at Little Ruby's is attentive without being intrusive. The staff genuinely care about your experience, making excellent recommendations and ensuring you feel right at home.

Whether youre stopping by for a casual brunch or a cozy dinner, Little Ruby's offers an experience thats both relaxed and refined. Its a mustvisit for anyone in the area! We came here without a reservation during the middle of the week for lunch and were able to get a table in 15 min. The interior is simple but enjoyable as you can look out to the street. Service was friendly and the food was fantastic.  We got the grain bowl and burger here. The burger was solid and the sweet potato fries and aioli that came with it were tremendous. We ate every last bite of both of our plates and look forward to coming back and trying more of their items. Place gets very busy even during early hours and for good reason. The place is cute, walking distance to good shops and of course the food is good.

Service was quick but maybe not the most friendly. They were not unfriendly though but just kinda lacking like meh lol not necessarily a complaint but rather just an observation. anyhooo, service was also prompt and orders came in correctly. Pancakes were verrry good! light, fluffy and delicious with great syrup! Avocado toast was nice and filling and the juice was refreshing!

I can see why its an easy goto place for a lot of people and glad we were able to try it out! 4.3 stars. Nice location. Good food but nothing noteworthy. We had a variety of dishes including what looked like a chicken salad, hamburgers, sweet potato fries. I had a breakfast bowl with eggs and greens. It was good. The grilled Brussels sprouts stood out. Food

These are my reviews on the things I ate, not what was all ordered as I came in a group.

Fries with Truffle Aioli
Crispy and had a good potato consistency. Not much taste to the fries even with all the seasoning. Sauce gave a good kick to the fries, which was much needed. The sauce, though, tasted just like ranch.

Crispy Brussel Sprouts
Brussel Sprouts weren't too soft or too hard, a good medium. Dressing and herbs gave a good mix of taste, barely noticed the quinoa. Dressing all fell to the bottom and soaked the bottom leaves, leaving them to be very salty and hard to eat.

Ruby's Ragu
Braised Beef had a strong kick to it, well seasoned. Mixed with the sauce, the beef became a little too salty to eat on its own. The pappardelle pasta was cooked al dente. The pasta didn't soak up any of the sauce taste. it definitely needed the beef with each bite. The burrata didn't really add much, but it did help with the taste for the pasta.

Bronte Burger
Ciabatta was toasted just fine. It wasn't too hard but definitely wasn't too soft. The meat to slice ratio was a little off. One slice had a lot, and the other slice the meat was barely there. The slice without a lot of meat caused it to slide around after each bite. There was a very herby taste to each bite with the meat. Spinach and tomato were just the right amount to not overpower the burger or cause it to be too big. Sweet chili and mayo were only tasted during bites without the meat present.

Iced Tea Peach

Was unsweetened tea with peach flavoring. The flavoring gave slight hints of peach, not enough to be considered as peach flavored. Did come with a slice of lemon.

Place

Consisted of outdoor and indoor seating. Outdoor seating was a little hard to sit, as it was on the street the terrain wasn't flat and level. Indoor seating was slightly cramped, but there was enough room to eat comfortably. Was sat on the side of the kitchen. With that being said, the air is not cool enough inside to have an open kitchen. I was sweating through the entire meal without feeling like I was cooling down. Nice place but needs more air.

Service

The host was very nice, and our first 2 waiters were as well. We originally sat outside, but we asked if we could be moved inside as we were having trouble with seating on the uneven terrain. The host was kind and allowed us to switch inside. Our waiter helped us move our utensils and menus inside. The second waiter came out to take our order and was very attentive to what we were saying and answered all our questions kindly. Though it did take around 10 minutes of waiting before we had our order taken. Our third waiter wasn't as kind as the others. We were wrapping up our meal and empty dishes were on the table, without saying "excuse me" or any kind saying, the waiter just snatched dishes and cups out of infront of us and reaching over the table as some of us were still dining. When we finished eating and were given the check and a take out box, the waiter just dropped it on the table.

Final thoughts

The being a quick meal, it was enjoyable. It could have been better but was a decent enough meal.

The food was absolutely delicious! Everything we had was very tasty and no one complained about their food choices. Our dishes came out as they were cooked. The soup dumplings were amazing. I also got the shrimp with a delicious fruit sauce. Everyone was very happy with their meal. It was busy and a lot of people were waiting, but we were able to get in pretty quickly. Shanghai 21 is an absolute gem in New York Citys Chinatown! I had an incredible dining experience here, and its definitely one of the best Chinese restaurants Ive visited. The restaurant has a cozy, inviting atmosphere, and the service is quick and friendly.

We started with their famous soup dumplings, and they were outstandingperfectly steamed with a deliciously savory broth inside. For the main course, we ordered the General Tsos chicken and the spicy beef noodle soup. Both dishes were packed with flavor and authentic spices that made each bite unforgettable. The portions were generous, and everything was reasonably priced, especially considering the quality of the food.

Overall, Shanghai 21 offers delicious, authentic Chinese cuisine with great service in the heart of NYC. Ill definitely be coming back to try more dishes. Highly recommended for anyone who loves Chinese food or is looking to explore Chinatowns culinary scene!

Enjoy your next visit to Shanghai 21! I had an incredible experience at Shanghai 21. The food is spectacular, especially the shrimp dumplings, which were the best Ive ever had. The quality and flavor of the dishes are exceptional, and the service is equally excellent. My wife and I were very satisfied with our visit. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting Chinatown. Five stars well deserved! I highly recommend their Crab meat and pork soup dumplings! I go here just to order them. The shrimp dumplings are also a favorite! The wait isnt too long either  the longest Ive waited for a table was about 2030 minutes. Staff is friendly and attentive. Such amazing food! I recommend the General Tsos chicken over rice. The variety of the menu is great. They also have delicious dumplings. I would come here every day if I lived here!
