주소: 2 Columbus Cir, New York, NY 10019, USA
리뷰:
Last Sunday, my friend and I had a wonderful dining experience at the Robert restaurant. Each of us had an appetizer, a main dish, and a dessert all dishes were absolutely delicious, and the presentation was fantastic.

A complimentary amuse bush and mini dessert cakes were also a nice touch.

The service was good and unobtrusive. I was a bit surprised that we were seated at the small corner table while plenty of other tables were available. The seat was not very comfortable, as I was hitting the wall with my elbow all the time, but the view compensated for this inconvenience. The view from the window is absolutely stunning. You can see Central Park and Broadway from above, and it compliments the bright, modern interior of the place. I am definitely will be coming back here. I recently visited Robert Restaurant located in an art museum close to Central Park during my 2day trip to NY with guests. The ambience was fantastic and the service was topnotch. Our server was very informative and helpful, especially with guiding my vegan wife through the menu. We all had a great time and I would definitely recommend this place to others. It's a perfect spot for dates and business dinners. Overall, a wonderful dining experience at Robert Restaurant! Such a great spot for brunch and gatherings with the view of Central Park. Took family from out of town here and they loved the experience. We were able to grab a table by the window around lunch time on a weekday  I think those tables are first come first serve. We got the prix fixe lunch menu plus two sides shishito peppers and lettuce wraps. I really liked the chicken  it was done so well, juicy and well seasoned, the salad was also great. Wasnt too impressed with the lettuce wraps. But I would definitely come back again  they even brought out a cute dessert to welcome my family to NYC! We actually made the reservation to celebrate my mom's and my birthday, we requested a reservation by the window. Upon arrival Matthew the host greeted us but sat us in a place where we had no view of absolutely anything and offered us another table in an area where no one was enjoying dinner, he had a table by the window which he said was reserved but the truth is that they always had a table available all night near the window and they did not want to seat us there, he never consulted the manager at the time to see what they could do nor did he make any attempt to please our request. Francisco also did not make any effort to try to change the situation until the end which seemed a little annoying to me since he was aware of the situation but he only offered to move us when we were going to order dessert which I found super offensive, we waited around 20 minutes for them to collect the main course plates so we could order desserts. The food is very good but the service is very bad, especially on special occasions, on a Monday, when they may have about 10 reservations for the whole night. I do not recommend it. The server Moises and his server support were the only reason we stayed to enjoy dinner. We were a 60th birthday party of 6 and the last time I was at Robert was 10 years ago. It was divine back then. What happened? And full disclosure  I m a foodie who worked back of house in a fancy restaurant like this  but I maintain, food doesnt have to be fancy. It just has to be good.

Halibut  at 39  was criminally overcooked  resembled a dry chicken breast. You cannot serve one of the most premium fish varieties like this for that price. My friend and I were so dazed and confused by it as we traded bites we didnt think to wake up send it back  and we should have. It was clearly left to sit and overcook.

Branzino  ok, filleted was good sans bones to worry about. But this fish works better a whole fish  because unlike say, buttery Chilean sea bass, it has that stringy snapperlike texture.

Risotto  way too small.

Sea scallops  3 on a plate and 1 overcooked at over 10 bucks a piece.

Desserts  were a total, unmitigated disaster. We shouldve just gone to Van Leeuwen across the road. While we appreciated the birthday dish of 6 squares of red velvet cake and a cream cheese frosting  the desserts proved they need a dedicated pastry chef. The pistachio brle was like a bad childs kitchen experiment. The blackberry cheesecake  more like a mauve mouse  just didnt work. The brownie was just a brownie.

The only thing that was very good in the whole evening were the crispy fries and the 49 fillet steak  and it would want to be at that price.

The server Chris  a brilliant photographer by the way  tried his best, was diplomatic to a fault  and really sold us on the desserts. As he should  this is a business. But the kitchen let him down.

I know how difficult is to run a business particularly a restaurant, but it astounds me how these kind of mistakes can happen at such a highend location with very high rent. At this price point, you have to be good. I dont like to see businesses fail, but with this lack of attention to detail   which seems to stem from not visiting even casual excellent restaurants like C as in Charlie, Jun Men, Genesis House, Little Rubys for their short rib pappardelle  to experience the standard being served  a place like this would be doomed. It is lucky it is more of a touristtype restaurant so probably benefits from getting a stream of visitors from outside New York. But the fact that it was half full and they still managed to overcook the fish   maybe that says everything.

If you come perhaps order the 26 vegan zoodle  dish, 2 of the appetizers in lieu of a main and maybe a vat of the mushroom soup amusebouche will save the day. They cant possibly mess those up.

리뷰:
YUBU is a small Korean restaurant located in SoHo specializing in the tofu pockets its name is based on.

The atmosphere is like a smaller cafe, with many smaller tables sprinkled throughout the restaurant and quick and efficient service. The menus are plastered on the walls as well as at the counter, so it's easy to determine what you want.

We tried the Bulgolgi, Pork Jaeyook, Spicy Chicken, Spicy Tuna Mayo, Seared Salmon, and Spicy Salmon Yubus. The rice was compacted into the tofu skin wrap, with it being a bit mushy and easy to fall apart. However, the rice ratio to the toppings was good, and the flavors overall was pretty decent. The spicy ones weren't too spicy, but still had a bit of a kick. It was 25 for 8 of them, so decent price for the portion and number you get.

Overall a great place to grab a quick bite in SoHo. it was awesome! the service was amazing and it had a nice clean interior. the only thing that could use some work is the rice ratio the rice is definitely really compacted in there so it can be a little mushy. the toppings were amazing and well seasoned! The rolls are incredibly delicious! I decided to order a few for lunch after trying them once, and I was instantly fell in love. I had to come back and order more. The spicy salmon is my favoriteabsolutely mouthwatering! Highly recommend this place for anyone. Loved it! It could have a pinch of salt to elevate it, but nonetheless it was really good. Loved the crabstick! And the strawberry iced matcha latte is to die for! Love honest business that is generous with the toppings cause look at that strawberry stacked!! Didn't feel shortchanged or whatsoever. Yummy and well priced! 10 for all 3 of my choice. Lovely environment and lots of seating when I was here. Only thing is  they have a no laptop policy. So not a good place to work or study. But to meet up with friends  yes

This restaurant has a long history and is wellknown. They offer a wide variety of dim sum and Cantonese dishes, with many being quite good. However, since the menu is extensive, not every dish stands out equally. It's best to focus on their signature dishes recommended by the staff. Additionally, their service is professional, and the spacious dining environment enhances the overall experience. Very fancy Chinese restaurant
In our case the food was nice and tasty
The only thing we did not like it is they do not have baby changing pads or any space for it.
My husband got the pork with Pekn spice and he really enjoyed  it
I had rice with veggies  and it was really  nice
The portions are big
The tea in the table it is exquisite The very best dim sum in lower Manhattan. Golden unicorn has been a sought after lunch destination within my family since I can remember. It is a vast plane of tables being constantly circumvented by carts packed with the most delicious dumplings. There is always space yet never empty. The rice noodles are transcendent and the pig buns are as cute as they are delicious. Dont let any new spot fool you, this 1996 top 5 restaurants in nyc NEVER disappoints. For Chinatown in New York, which should be the pinnacle, the food was only fair. Shrimp seemed slightly undercooked and didnt taste strictly fresh, and the sticky rice lacked flavor or many discernible bits of sausage. Shu Mai were good. Service was pleasant, and I liked the old school ambiance and cart service, especially where they fry your dumplings tableside. Google suggested there might be a wait on a Saturday afternoon, but I got right in., A nice spot in Chinatown. We didnt have to wait on a Friday evening. The food was really good here! When we went, there were only dim sum dishes available and a few options off of the normal menu. The chicken was delicious. The buns and dim sums were quite good. The staff is friendly. In terms of interior design, there is a little much going on.

주소: 679 9th Ave, New York, NY 10036, USA
리뷰:
WORTH IT 100
Best tasting menu Ive ever had.
Mari is a Korean hand roll tasting menu restaurant with a Michelin star
They offer a 13 course tasting menu of street food inspired Korean hand rolls
three appetizers, 7 hand rolls, 1 main course, and two desserts
Every course we had was absolutely delicious!!
The tasting menu is 145
If you can sit up at the counter I highly recommend it, it was such a experience seeing the chiefs prepare and present each course in front of you
It was worth every penny
Service was also very good

Truly one of NYCs best restaurants!
Would 100 come back!! This is one of my favorite restaurants in NYC! Ive been here many times for dinner since it opened a few years ago. The food is amazing, delicious and creative, and the restaurant is great about changing up the menu periodically. The craft cocktails are also great. The staff is very friendly and the restaurant is well designed. I highly recommend dinner here its one of the best tasting menus Ive had. I have lived in NYC for 16 years and this just entered my top 5 restaurants in NYC and my top 2 favorite asian restaurant toss up with Rule of Thirds in Brooklyn.

What makes a great restaurant? Food, Flavor, Presentation, Service and Mari excels at all.

The pacing was perfection. We never felt rushed and never felt neglected. We always felt attended to and never felt like we were pausing.

The courses come out efficient and perfect temperature. And they just keep coming and coming.

The flavors albeit maybe a hair salty are PACKED with flavor. The spicy tuna could be my favorite bite of sushi.. EVER. It was so good and without diluting it was the most elegant spicy flaming hot cheetos crunch ever on top.

The desert  which usually is an afterthought  was equally up to the task and the presentation was impeccable.

Yes its pricey but if you paid by plate its way more reasonable than you realize. Will def be coming back. Everything was so good! Their tasting menu is such a good deal  145 for 13 course meal. Every dish was beautifully executed and scrumptious. Staff was very nice and accommodating. It was also great to see the open kitchen where chefs were thoughtfully making all the dishes. I recently visited Mari restaurant in New York City and had an unforgettable dining experience. We indulged in a 13course dinner that included three appetizers, seven main courses, and two desserts. The array of Korean hand rolls was absolutely amazing, each one crafted to perfection. My favorite was spicy tuna hand roll.

The servers were outstanding, ensuring that every dish was meticulously described, enhancing our appreciation of the meal. The ambiance of the restaurant was serene and inviting, adding to the overall enjoyment of the evening.

My whole family had a fantastic time, and we especially loved the tasting menu. If you're a fan of Korean food, Mari restaurant is a mustvisit.

리뷰:
Simply exceptional in every category. This was one of the few experiences where I didn't provide any constructive feedback at the end of my visit.

Sam, Isabel and Gabe and the entire team provided a comfortably elegant experience. Seated at a table overlooking the courtyard I was able to view the entire dining area as well as hear the beautiful energy coming from the Bar Room.

After a brief consult with Sam we opted for "Abstractions" with the paired wines. This turned out to be an exceptional choice.

Every dish and every wine proved to be a beautiful symphony of flavors  simply sensory perfection. What an incredible and unforgettable dining experience at The Modern. From the moment I walked in, I was warmly welcomed and made to feel like the only guest in the entire restaurant. The level of service was exceptional, with every detail attended to with care and attention. Despite my dietary restrictions, the staff ensured that the tasting menu was safe for me and tailored to my needs.

As for the food, it was truly exceptional. Each dish from the tasting menu was perfectly portioned and impeccably presented. The duck and the cheesecake ice cream were standout highlights from the Impressions menu. Every bite was a burst of flavor and creativity. The experience was well worth the investment, and the opportunity to dine inside the MoMa only added to the overall enchanting ambiance. Eggs on eggs on eggs was worth the hype, easily one of my favorite dishes in recent memory. Other than the duck dish fell flat, everything was to our liking. Cocktails were delicious, especially the espresso martini. We had an early reservation and the restaurant was fairly empty but filled in part way through. Part of the meal was done outside in the garden which was nice. I booked the Kitchen Table and it was an incredible experience. The food was absolutely amazing and you left feeling full but not stuffed. The atmosphere was very fun and it was unique to see all the chefs in action. This experience was worth every penny and was right up there with any 3 Michelin Starred restaurant. The staff made us feel very comfortable and it was a very enjoyable experience. We had dietary restrictions and they were able to accommodate with ease! If you are able to get a reservation for the Kitchen Table or the dining room for the tasting menu while in NYC, do yourself a favor and book it! Amazing restaurant with signature dish eggs in eggs on eggs that just begs you to come back. Rest of tasting menu is also great, same as wine pairing. Its pricey but totally worth it. The room is a bit cold but the view on the garden in the museum is very special

주소: 75 Washington Pl, New York, NY 10011, USA
리뷰:
The food was good but nothing impressivespecial. We did the wine pairing which was a huge mistake, it didn't go with the food at all. Honestly we should have known the wine pairing wouldn't be good since the chef changes the menu each day based on what's fresh hence it'd be difficult to get the most optimal pairing. The servers also didn't know anything about the wine.

Overall, the food is fine but not good enoughunique enough to justify the price. Truly exceptional, but didnt we know that already? They customized vegetarian meals for me and dad while my partner ate the freshest fish and meats to his hearts desire. They truly know how to make ingredients sing. We also had the wine pairing and I dont know when Ill have wine like that again nothing hits the same anymore. Cant wait to make a trip update to the farm one day  Blue Hill in Manhattan is a wonderful place that I'd love to visit again.
 Their farmtotable concept is simply amazing. They started with a restaurant in upstate New York and now have one in NYC too.
 What I really liked is that their veggies are grown on their own farm, and the meats and fish are provided by their partners. You can taste the fresh difference!
 The interior has a simple yet classy vibe, with lovely flowers adorning the space.
 The food is served as a mix of different dishes in a fourcourse tasting menu.
 They did an excellent job accommodating my dislikes and allergy requests.
 The staff is incredibly attentive and friendly. Had an absolutely lovely evening dining here. Food was delicious and the staff were wonderful. Not even sure where to start with the food but every dish was delightful except the crudite, it wasn't bad but I could've done without it. One of my favorites was the bread they served. So soft, so warm, I could've eaten that all day. I was absolutely stuffed by the end of the night. Sometimes you're afraid that you'd leave these Michelin starred restaurants wanting more but nope, not here. A great place for a classy yet homey meal. Overall, the entire experience was more on the disappointing side. This is not our first time dining at a "locally sourced ingredients" establishment or a Michelinstarred place. We also tried not to leave any food uneaten, knowing that the products were locally sourced, but this does not reflect our thoughts on the dishes.

The meal started on a fun note with different types of cucumbers paired with a green dip that was quite delicious. However, from that point onward, the main course was disappointing, despite the theme of the lunch being French brasserie.

The salad and ratatouille were nice, but the mussel dish tasted bitter due to the sauce, and the steak and potato plate was quite dry and rubbery. I've had similar dishes many times before, so it wasn't an issue of trying them for the first time.

As for the dessert, it was a large donut with apricot filling. It was served without any utensil to cut it, which might have been fine. However, the donut itself seemed to have been sitting out for a whilethe bread tasted oily, and the filling inside was unfortunately quite sour. Even my partner, who usually enjoys all types of desserts, did not enjoy this one.

Lastly, regarding the service, everyone was friendly, but given that it was a menuless place, we would have appreciated some explanation about the dishes without having to ask about each one.

We are not sure if we'd like to return to this place, although we might give it another chance since the menu changes seasonally. However, it's a big maybe for now.

리뷰:
Her Name is Han offers a small lunch menu of classic Korean meals, but what they do, they do very well. The flavors are wellbalanced, and the quality of the ingredients are solid.

I loved the cream croquettesthey were a highlight of the meal. However, the fried chicken was average and not something Id recommend. The bulgogi hot pot was also a bit too sweet.

The set lunches are generous in portion size and can easily be shared, making the prices fair. The service was also excellent, adding to the overall great experience. Visiting NYC for work and this place came highly recommended and did not disappoint. Definitely grab a reservation as this place was poppin on a Thursday.

Service was great and super chill. Table went with the Korean Fried Chicken, Pork Belly and Fried fish. Definitely get the sesame ice cream, make room for it
All dishes were excellent and will definitely come here again when I visit again for work. I went there twice with friends and my boyfriend. We very impressed on the marinated shrimp and every dishes that we ordered is so delicious. We would love to go back again and try other things. Highly recommended to check it out and make a reservation might be better so you dont have to wait. Visited for weekend brunch and thoroughly enjoyed the set menu  the Monkfish  Mussel Sujebi was comforting, creamy, and garlicky  perfect for a cold, rainy day, with just the right portion size. Another standout was the black sesame tofu, featuring soft tofu topped with a rich and refreshing black sesame sauce. The menu offers a modern take on Korean cuisine, and overall, it was an enjoyable dining experience with great flavors and friendly service. I feel like my biggest issue was the portion sizetoprice ratio. Ive had bossam with much larger serving size and the same price in many other places. However, I like how everything on their menu tastes clean and nongreasy at all. The raw marinated crab was delicious. The service was good. The ambiance and restaurant itself was cozy.  But will I come back again? It was worth a trip to try once, considering all of the media attention its gotten lately. But most likely wont be coming back.

주소: 75 9th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA
리뷰:
It was my first time at this almost 20 yearold Asian fusion cuisine restaurant. Why did I wait so long to enjoy one of the best meals I've had in a long time. Despite its age the restaurant looks and feels brand new. There is a slight scent that reminds you of being at a fancy spa. The decor is sleek and very attractive. The service is attentive and helpful without being overbearing. The food arrives and you understand why this restaurant has not only survived but prospered in the difficult New York City restaurant scene. We started with the chili rock shrimp and the short rib and scallion pancake. Both dishes were just marvelous. We then moved on to another beef dish and ginger scallion chicken which did not disappoint. We also had the lobster fried rice which was pleasantly sweet and enjoyable. To cleanse my palate I had the coconut tapioca pudding. It was light and tasty just what I required to finish a wonderful experience. Just one final note, they keep it rather dark so you'll need to use your phone lightflashlight to read the menus. Ive always wanted to dine at Buddakan since I heard Martha Stewart talk about it on her show years ago and I finally got my wish when I went to celebrate a friends birthday. The food was excellent and deserves a Michelin star. The Royal cocktail was delicious. Our server was fabulous. I havent had excellent service like that in a long time. Our server was so helpful and pleasant and treated. Buddakan NYC is a hidden gem! The atmosphere is stunning, with a chic and modern design that sets the perfect backdrop for a memorable meal. The staff was welcoming and attentive, making us feel right at home.

The food was absolutely incredible! We tried a variety of dishes, and each one was bursting with flavor. The Black Pepper Beef  was the highlight. I also loved the creative cocktailsthey really complemented the meal.

Whether you're looking for a special night out or a casual dinner, Buddakan delivers on all fronts. I cant wait to return and explore more of the menu. Highly recommend! Hands down one of the classiest dinner experiences we've had! The ambience in this place is something else... simply gorgeous! The food was excellent! We loved the dim sum tasting for 3  the shrimp and carrot dumplings were the best! Loved the fried rice, the broken chili chicken, and the sweet and crispy jumbo shrimp! Everything was delicious, and the service was good too! Fantastic food and the general ambiencevibe was great.

Our server which I did not get the name of, did a fantastic job making sure we were good all the time despite being quite busy. He recommended everything we had from our preferences and we were very happy! Very professional and helpful.

주소: 1221 Ave of the Americas, New York, NY 10020, USA
리뷰:
I recently dined at Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steak House in New York, and it was an exceptional experience. The NY Strip steak was absolutely delicious, cooked to perfection with a wonderful sear and tender, juicy interior that true steak lovers will appreciate.

To make our anniversary even more special, the staff generously offered us a complimentary slice of their rich and creamy cheesecake, which was a delightful surprise and a testament to their excellent customer service.

While the prices are on the higher side, they are quite reasonable considering the high standards and quality one expects in New York City.

Overall, Del Frisco's Double Eagle Steak House delivers a memorable dining experience with superb food and attentive service, making it well worth a visit. I have been there twice in the past 6 months. The first time was in March. That experience led me come back again in September 2024. When I visited the first time, I wanted to have a nice meal and a wine just before I left NY. Bartender Dan was kindly advising me a meal that is not in the menu but was fitting perfect for what I was looking for. He then paired it with one of the best red wines I tasted. This welcoming, attentive and friendly experience led me to visit again in September. Unfortunately I learned that Dan passed away since the last time I saw him. I am very sorry for his absence and I wish his soul peace. His skilled colleagues keep the place in check. I will always visit this place to honour his memory. R. I. P. beautiful soul. Del frisco is definitely different from what it was a couple of years ago and I now understand why it's very easy to get a reservation at this place.

They have plenty of tables available even on Friday evening.  They have a couple of staff who look like managers and will only take care of the table on rare occasions. Servers do not introduce highlights of their menu or make food drink recommendations any more.

Now for the food steak is okay. I like the fact that they have a fattier cut. But they tend to overcook. It's also under seasoned.

Overall, I was not impressed by my latest experience at Del Frisco's and this place would not rank as 1 NYC given where they're at right now.

For tourists, honestly, the halal food truck just outside of the steakhouse is even more worthy than visiting here. I dont come here as often as I'd like but went tonight with my daughter to celebrate my upcoming 50th birthday. Menu had new items such as sushi and octopus. Both were delicious. The dry aged steak I had was to die for. So much flavor and so tender. Our waiter, Gerard G was fantastic. He was so attentive without being pushy and his recommendations were on point. I will ask for him whenever I visit. That's how much I loved his service.

Took food home and had the new hibiscus cheesecake to share. Last but not least was a take home order of their lemon cake because its always been one of my favs.

Yes, it's pricey but worth it. Treat yourself, you wont be disappointed. I like the lobster, crab cake and rainbow salmon crab sushi roll very much. The chicken, scallops are not good for me. I like the happy birthday cake gift

리뷰:
Came with a Korean foodie friend and we both ordered the 3course tasting menu plus some additional side dishes. Everything was delicious and beautifully presented. Our waiter was incredibly knowledgeable and thoughtful and the chef also met with us and provided additional information on the dishes we had ordered. Beautiful experience. I visited this restaurant during New York Restaurant Week and was thoroughly impressed by the 60 dinner. The food was thoughtfully prepared and artfully presented, with each dish resembling a work of art. The diversity in ingredients, flavors, colors, and textures was remarkable. The chef's creativity and craftsmanship shone through each delicate dish, delivering one delightful surprise after another. A good chef knows how to keep diners engaged with the unexpectedit's like an intriguing dialogue.

The restaurant itself isn't very large but has a unique, chill, and warm East Village vibe. The comfortably dimmed lighting enhances the intimate and relaxed atmosphere, making it the kind of place where you just want to sit all night, sip wine, and watch the world go by through the window. This is one of the restaurant I would recommend.  Fusion of French and Korean cuisine.  What surprise me is the duck breast.  Skin is crispy and meat is so tender but not too raw and chewy.  Perfect    The beef tartar  blend in so well with fried seaweed and crispy rice.  Scallops with Korean melon pure is so delicious.   The Wellington beef is also well prepared. Came on a Tuesday night 813 and must say we really enjoyed the foods here but unfortunately was ruined by couple of hit and miss inexperienced servers. They were three servers on the floor that night which should be adequate for a weeknight crowd. What bothered me the most was the lack of  basic fundamental knowledge about restaurant service. The first server who came to our table to take our order looks confused and even unable to answer some simple questions about the dishes on the menu. To make the matter worst a different server who open the wine bottle we ordered was just as ignorant. He just popped the bottle and serve it to everyone and drips all over the table as he pours. No bottle confirmation, presentation, pour of taste and so forth. At this point we just want to order and finish up our meal dinner then leave, let alone enjoying the meal but then came a server name Fin. An energetic, knowledgeable, attentive and very experience young man with a positive attitude. He went through the whole menu with us with a very professional manner. It was like a day and night. He stopped by our table periodically to check on us to assure we have a great experience dining there. We learned that through our conversation that hes only been working there for about a month. To the owner and manager of the restaurant, we really enjoyed the foods here but the service truly needs more than just a polish. Hats off to Fin Tried this place for the first time a couple weeks ago and it was absolutely amazing. I always worry about going to places that have the smaller portions but by the time we left, I was pretty full. We did the chef's prefix menu. Everything that came out was so fresh. The food combinations were an explosion of flavor, each with their own uniqueness. Even my picky eating friend was willing enough to try everything and for the most part liked it all I would find it impressive if a picky eater liked foie gras.  We had a group of 5 of us so we were able to try a little bit of everything. The halibut just melted when you took a bite was a pleasant surprise consider it tends to be a tougher fish. They bring out the whole beef Wellington before they cut it so you could see the golden goodness and then they cut it into portions to serve with a side of veggies. It was cooked to perfection. The duck was also good, I'm running out of words to emphasize how delightful everything was. The drinks were also very good. The sorbet for dessert was light and a perfect post dinner treat. The chocolate cake was the perfect balance of sweetness. Lastly, get the uni app. You will not be disappointed. I cannot rave about this place enough.

리뷰:
Incredibly delicious food, with flavors perfectly arranged on the plate. After visiting many places and trying their food, some better than others, this one will remain dear to our hearts.

The atmosphere was relatively nice, but the music was a bit too loud, so everyone had to raise their voices slightly to be heard.

Its worth noting that both the place and my thoughts on the atmosphere are purely personal. A popular Mediterranean themed restaurant in lower Manhattan. Very tough to get seated without a reservation. Food was ok probably not my favorite mix of flavors. We tried a few different dishes and my favorite was probably the eggplant. The shawarma fries were surprisingly very flavorful without being overly salty.

They have plenty of indoor and outdoor seating which is great in warm weather. Booth seating inside was very uncomfortable. I think its worth a shot to try this place but I probably wont come back We celebrated my birthday here! The place is usually super popular, but we were able to make reservations on the day of my birthday.  We ordered a bunch of small plates that we shared and it was more than enough. The cherry dish happened to be one of my favorites. The music was good,  but not too loud and we were able to sit outside. Shukette in New York City is an absolute gem for Mediterranean cuisine lovers. From the moment I stepped inside, I was transported to a warm and inviting atmosphere filled with the aroma of fresh herbs and spices.

The menu offers a delightful array of traditional dishes, each prepared with care and attention to detail. I started with a perfectly seasoned hummus, served with warm pita bread that was soft and chewy. The main course was equally impressive  I opted for the lamb shish kebab, which was cooked to perfection and incredibly tender. The flavors were bold and authentic, showcasing the restaurant's commitment to using highquality ingredients.

The service was impeccable, with our server being attentive and knowledgeable about the menu. The ambiance was cozy and relaxed, making it the perfect spot for a leisurely meal with friends or family.

If you're craving a taste of the Mediterranean in the heart of New York City, Shukette is a mustvisit. I highly recommend it! everything was phenomenal. the bread is a must with any of the dips. we got the hummus and it was super smooth and creamy. we also got the eggplant featuring a sweet and spicy component. divine. the main was the scallops and they were honestly the highlight. melted in your mouth. the tahini soft served tbh wasnt great but everything else was amazing. would recommend.

I took a business associate, plus one other, for dinner at 'Club A Steakhouse' when in New York and the whole experience was first class.  The ambience and greeting on arrival was great, as was the decor and vibe.  A great menu with some top quality dishes to choose from and impeccable service from our waiter.  I was also impressed by the fact that the restaurant owner, Bruno, was in the restaurant talking to, and serving, guests... A nice touch that was appreciated, a very lovely man and one that deserves to have a successful restaurant such as Club A.  I had the Shrimp Cocktail, the NY Strip, with sides of Broccoli, Creamed Spinach and Onion Rings, shared with my dining partners who both had the Chilean Seabass.  Everything was delicious and to a very high standard.  We did not order dessert but Bruno presented us with a dessert sampler platter and all of the desserts were amazing.  The costs for the meal was US294 including tax but before tip which was reasonable compared to other American Fine Dining Steakhouses I have eaten in over the years.  I can't recommend 'Club A' highly enough and I take my hat off to Bruno and his whole team for providing such great ambience, service and food.  Thank You. My partner and I have dined at Club A several times over the years. We decided that Club A is the best steakhouse in NYC. 
The restaurant is beautiful, the service is always pleasant, great cocktails, great wine selection, and the food notably the steaks are excellent. The complimentary dessert is always a nice touch!
A great spot spot for a nice dinner. 30May2024...We celebrated my 60th birthday here. The food, the service,  and the attention given to us was awesome! The picture of the table at the end was an amazing touch! The ambiance was so good. The fried calamari was delicious. I highly recommend the mac and cheese. The filet mignon was perfect! B The best steakhouse for us as a couple  My favorite restaurant I found on my first trip to New York  I went to 5 or 6 stores and chose this one, and this one was a big hit  Not only the taste of the steak, but they will also recommend wine that will go well with the dish. The service is good, and the staff are smiling and kind  Inside the store, live music is played at a moderate volume and the atmosphere is good. This is one of the stores I definitely want to visit when visiting New York  Club A Steakhouse

리뷰:
My fiance and I were in the area and were looking for a great restaurant in NYC. Decided to call to make sure we could get last minute reservations for the two of us. The staff was very friendly and we were lucky enough to be able to get a table despite it being restaurant week we had no idea!. The atmosphere was elite, and the food was exquisite! Our server Dennis made great recommendations and he along with the entire wait staff went above and beyond to make sure our experience was phenomenal! The food was so good that Im already looking forward to coming back the next time we are in the NYC area. FYI there is no valet parking but there is a garage directly across the street from the restaurant for easy and safe parking! I've eaten there a few times and the food was constantly good. I was there this time for the happy hour. They served east coast blue point oysters, which were better quality than I expected. The glass of champagne was nice, too. The service is good. They greeted me very warmly upon me sitting down at the bar, which made me felt welcomed. I just went there for restaurant week and wow. Food choices were great, and the service was even better. The atmosphere is modern but is still warm and cozy. Staff is so polite and friendly and on point. I'm definitely going to return to this restaurant even though I'm not a fan of going to Manhattan. I went here during restaurant week.  They had a three course meal for 45.  It wasn't crowded but it filled up slowly.  They seated us right away.  We ordered bib salad, octopus, calamari, squid ink pasta, salmon, branzino, steak, tiramisu, mango sherbet and cheesecake.  Everything was cooked perfectly and they were nice size portions.  You know it's good when four people eating a three course meal cleaned their plates.  Not a grain of rice was left.  Definitely going back. During a second visit, the Sea Fire Grill, situated in a prime location, once again promises an exceptional dining experience. Before taking your seat, a visit to the bar is a must. Their drinks, especially the Avalon Invicta, are topnotch. Enjoying colossal shrimp with traditional cocktail sauce is a delightful treat at the bar. Timmy, the bartender, is the besthe makes you feel at home with his courteous demeanor and extensive knowledge of various drinks.

Once seated, the main course options truly shine. The squid ink pasta featuring fresh Maine lobster stands out for its delightful flavors. Equally impressive is the salmon served with black rice, complemented by Brussels sprouts with sweet and spicy Marcona almonds. For dessert, the cheesecake with blueberries offers a perfect conclusion to the meal.

Overall, I highly recommend the Sea Fire Grill. The elegant decor and impeccable service further elevate the dining experience. I'll definitely be returning for another delightful meal.

리뷰:
Went to Nobu 57 for their 30th anniversary special. Upon arriving on time, we were told that our table wasnt ready yet. After tables have been set up, we thought it would be omakase experience by the bar but were sat on table. Which was totally okay. The issue was, they were quick to get our orders but the time it took for 5 dishes to arrive took a lot longer than expected. There were gaps as long as 30 minutes just waiting for the next course. The staffs were very quick to remove the finished plates off the tables but for the next menu to come out there were numerous awkward time gaps between. The guests next to our table left after being upset. We managed to receive all our menu and took us about 2 hours. The staffs did apologize every time our dishes came out but still was not something I expected.

Worst part is when they come out with the dishes and explain the menu, you cant hear them even though they are right next to you. The music sound and restaurant noise made it impossible to hear the explanation. We just ended up nodding our heads and eating and guessing. Reminded me more of a bar due to the loud noise and music.

Food was good but wait time and atmosphere were far different from what I expected. Wouldnt recommend this place if you are looking for an authentic or close to Omakase experience or Japanese food. For just a casual dinner out, would recommend. Nobu 57 in NYC delivers an exceptional dining experience from start to finish. The ambiance is sleek and sophisticated, perfect for a special night out. The food is simply outstandingevery dish is beautifully presented and packed with incredible flavors. The signature Black Cod with Miso and the Yellowtail Jalapeo are absolute musttries. The sushi is fresh and melts in your mouth. The service was attentive and knowledgeable, offering great recommendations throughout the meal. Though on the pricier side, the quality of the food and the overall experience make it worth every penny. Nobu 57 is a dining experience you wont forget! Highlight for me was the crispy rice with a caviar. You cant go wrong with these two. The rest of the dishes were pretty good but we were a bit puzzled by the squid pasta as the serving wasnt really substantial as an entree dish and it tasted like wokfried veggies. So wasnt really pleased by that. Decent soju too. You come to Nobu for the scene but not to have punchy Japanese dishes. Super happening restaurant!
It was super busy on a Saturday night, lots of people waiting, luckily we had booked a table.
Restaurant has a great vibe, great music as well.
We ordered a few dishes to share, all of them tastes great and very fresh!!
We got few cocktails, a nice bottle of warm sake, we had an amazing evening at Nobu 57!! Having dined at Nobu locations around the world, I was excited to try Nobu Fifty Seven for the first time. Even with a lastminute reservation, the experience was nothing short of fantastic. The staff were attentive and accommodating, making the evening smooth and enjoyable from the moment I walked in.

The food lived up to the high standards that Nobu is known forfresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. Every dish met my expectations, reinforcing why Nobu remains a favorite wherever I travel.

Overall, my spontaneous dinner at Nobu Fifty Seven was a wonderful experience. Whether youre a longtime Nobu fan or new to the brand, this location delivers on all fronts with great service, superb food, and the signature Nobu atmosphere. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a refined yet relaxed dining option in New York City.

I visited two days ago. It was a weekday but we were waiting at least 30 minutes. I am not a fan of long waits but its worth it.

The servers are also the performers and they have talents!! I didnt know the songs theyre sining but i really enjoyed it.

The food has great taste. I would recommend the crispy wing. The sauce was really good.
You should be aware of that tips are already included the price. This place is just magical! It's like youve entered a dreamyBroadwaDisneyland. I was left speechless when I realized how talented those people are. We came here randomly for breakfast, just briefly run through the reviews to check if the food was decent, but we had no idea what to expect. At first, it felt strange that one of the servers had a microphone and was loudly sharing her story at 10 AM. But then they started singing, one after another, the lightshow went crazy, and confetti was flying around... It was literally like being in a dream. One moment your waitress is taking your order, and two seconds later, shes standing above you singing like a Disney princess! As a tourist, I cant imagine a more American place, and Im so thankful for this experience. You guys are fantastic and incredibly talented. Also, since this is a restaurant after all, I have to say that the food was amazing. Even though the staff is singing all the time, you wont wait longer for your food than you would at any regular place. Once again, you truly made my US trip special, and Im genuinely amazed and grateful for the show.

P.S. Its such a shame that I cannot post videos here, but you have to go and see it for yourself !!! If youre looking for high class food, this place isnt for you. Its standard American fare and its a diner. Still not a bad hamburger to be found in the house.  The waffle fries they serve are good.

However, its the singing that overshadows the ordinariness of the food.  I dont think theres any other place in NYC, outside of being at a Broadway play, that you will be captivated by some amazing talent.

Yes, youll be crammed into a seat with someone to your immediate left and right giving you little room to move. But once the staff breaks out in song you wont care.

Your food will come fast. Your server is very attentive. And they throw a 20 tip into the bill that goes to all staff

But make sure you give an extra tip that is collected in special buckets they will pass around.  This goes to help the amazing talent that sings. Server said You dont come here for the food. You come to be entertained! This is bang on accurate. The food is regular pub grub and was lacking flavour on all counts.

The entertainment was like no other place. Amazing singing and atmosphere. The place was buzzing. The servers are the singers and they sing to the whole restaurant while they serve. You are immerse in entertainment. Its pretty cool actually.

No reservations allowed and the wait was almost an hour long. Im not a fan of long waits so Id likely not go again but glad I went once. One other negative was the push for tips. They literally pass a bucket around while you are eating and then ask for a tip with the bill. What a great experience. Was a little apprehensive about the food seeing the reviews, but, we werent disappointed. Went for breakfast at 7am and were treated to songs virtually every 10 mins. The atmosphere was great despite the early start and staff were in good spirits. We had the Holy Moly french toast and breakfast burrito both were delicious.

주소: 155 W 51st St, New York, NY 10019, USA
리뷰:
My husband booked a special "birthday" lunch for our NYC trip. We arrived a little before our 12pm booking and the dining room had seated 2 tables a couple and a party of 3. Immediately you notice the cool air, high ceilings, low lighting and large medallion "necklaces" worn by the sommeliers. at least 3 spotted We chose the smaller tasting menu. The wine pairing recommendations were great. The bread basket presentation and choices were delightful. The raw and lightly cooked dishes were interesting and satisfying. The service staff balanced being there when you wanted something and being inconspicuous near walls and doorways when not in customer service mode. I ended up buying the Seafood Simple book after tasting the menu here.  Thank you for a wonderful dining experience and for making my birthday special. We went to Le Bernardin about two months ago. The restaurant itself is very elegant and it is amazing for seafood lovers. We had the chefs tasting menu as well as the vegetarian tasting menu. All of the food was great but the langoustine and the chocolate tart was exceptional. At Le Bernardin they gave huge importance to all of the sauces. The sauces made the dish even more fabulous. We also got a special kitchen tour where we got to see how all the delicious food was being made. It was overall a great experience. You can only imagine how thrilled we were as seafood lovers to visit a 3 Michelinstarred restaurant specializing in seafood, and it exceeded all expectations. We chose the chef's tasting menu, and it was truly out of this world. Each dish was unique, yet all harmonized beautifully, leading to an unforgettable experience. The dessert was absolutely divine.

However, I did subtract one star in the ambience category as it felt quite packed and was a bit noisy, though I acknowledge this is very subjective. It's my favorite place in the city. I appreciate the ambiance and dim lighting, so it feels like you have some privacy. We got a tasting menu, and it was a lovely food adventure. Each course had its own flavor and texture. I appreciate that it is not easy not to overwhelm the taste of fish with sauses and condiments, and Le Bernadin does an excellent job with that. Deserts were excellent, too. It is nice that you can choose whether to have a tasting menu or a 4 course meal and choose your own dishes. Stuff is very attentive, but to be honest, sometimes it feels like there are so many of them that there is a lot of traffic in the dining room and it is a bit hectic. I would come back anytime though, love this place. Came here to celebrate a birthday, and the service was impeccable. Each and every team member was very friendly and helpful.

Special mention to our very friendly sommelier!

We decided to go before our booking to enjoy a drink at the bar. However, we were about to get a table within 30 minutes of our arrival.

Cocktails made perfectly 

The food tasted great, and everything was cooked perfectly. Perfect presentation.

Perfect for seafood lovers.

The highlight was the sauce in every dish. So well balanced  delicious!!

True 3 Michelin stars restaurant

The decor  feeling of the dining room felt a little outdated.

주소: 5 W 31st St, New York, NY 10001, USA
리뷰:
First time here and its was immaculate. My friend usually makes a reservation and she didnt this time. I got here at 530 pm and it was packed because we couldnt get a table. I got a tall table and it was starting to get busy as the night went by. We got happy hour drinks. We got the whole chicken, the rice cake with mussels and a salad octopus dish. It was soooooo yummy and they had a speakeasy. Its wonderful. Ill do it again. Next time reservation is necessary for sure. Came here with a friend accidentally because Baro by Chef's next door was closing up. We just walked in Friday 1130 PM, no reservations. It was still brimming with people.

The atmosphere was great! Service, amazing  the runners and the servers do their very best to put on a friendly accommodating attitude. Would come back just for their energy.

That being said, the food was very delicious. My friend and I already ate dinner and wanted drinks  snacks. We were already so full, but still managed to inhale everything we ordered because it was just that delicious. Please note, portions are small but dense in flavor.

We ordered
Seafood Ros Tokbokki 25
DaenjangFoie Gras Mousse  Toast 24
Grilled Scallops Skewer 9

All three were delicious, the sauce for the Tokbokkk was creamy, hint of spice and a whole ton of seafood umami. The liver mouse was savory, smooth, I ordered a second helping of bread jsut to slowly enjoy its beauty. Scallop, fresh, standard. I would come back to try the rest of the food menu.

We ordered Osamil and Limeito drinks. They are strong. I liked my drink, but wasn't blown away by its flavor. My friend's limeito was a lacking. The drinks as made with a kaffir lime leaf infused rum, the kaffir didn't come through. The sweet  sour balance was a off. I think it would be better as a drink with crushed ice vs cubed ice.

I would give a different drink another try for happy hour. But at full price, possibly not. Place is a 55 no questions. We were walkins on a Monday 7pm and it was busy! Got the last seats by the counter  which was great. Be mindful that the food is spicy! The fried sweet potatoes were a must for me to balance the flavor. Skewers were super flavorful pork belly for the win, the tartare was different dont go for it if youre expecting the french kind, but for us was worth trying. Absolutely delicious!! One of my top places in NYC so far for late night food. We went with a reservation and I think that's a good thing because the place was PACKED. It was pretty loud but we didn't have to raise our voices too much to have a conversation. Reasonable prices when you're sharing a lot of dishes with a group of friends 30 without alcohol. 1010 would come back!!! NOTHING MISSED. The pork shank is to die for so favourful and tender the cold slaw is Korean styled super refreshing to balance out the fattiness of the pork. The tartare was so marinated and didnt taste like nasty raw meat. The squid fries werent that special but was delicious overall amazing meal. It was also not super hard to get a table we sat at the high table the night I went. Great value for great food!

리뷰:
Thai Villa and had a mixed experience. The ambiance was truly remarkable, with beautiful decor and a warm, inviting atmosphere that made for a great dining environment.

The appetizers were the highlight of the meal. The Scallop Skewers were perfectly cooked, with tender scallops that were rich in flavor. The second appetizer, which resembled tacos though I cant recall the name, was a real treata crispy exterior with juicy, flavorful meat inside. It was a taste explosion and really got me excited for the rest of the meal.

However, the chef special entre didnt quite meet the same standard. It was too sweet for my palate, with the sweetness overwhelming the other flavors. It turned out to be a dessert for me.

Entrance faces southwest. Entrance is wheelchair accessible. Outdoor seating available.

Despite that, the appetizers and ambiance made the experience enjoyable, and Id recommend it for anyone who enjoys sweeter Thai dishes or is looking for a dining experience with great ambience great spot. I may return for classic menu. Wow, a great experience here. The food is authentic and excellent. We had a great time.There were four of us.We ordered four different menu items and shared our food.And I have to say, I will go back We were notified upon arrival that there was a 90minute limit on the tables but this wasn't an issue cause food came out quite fast. Everything we ordered was flavorful and fresh. One flaw that stood out to me was the completely unseasoned shrimps for the papaya salad. Service was quick, warm, and attentive. This is the best Thai food I've had in New York hands down. We didn't book ahead of time and sat outside, which wasn't too bad. We would have preferred to sit inside, but it was a 40minute wait. I'd strongly recommend booking ahead to get a table inside, and the vibes looked amazing. The food was amazing, so light and fragrant. The staff were so friendly and helpful and explained the menu which is large. We will be back for sure when we're next in the city  55 stars. I celebrated my friends birthday with a dinner here and Im so glad that we chose this restaurant. The service is amazing our server was so attentive and nice. We did not have to wait long for food and the ambience is so pretty inside I was in awe of the place. Very happy with the check because it was only 50 per person for a group of 4. With such excellent service and food i would say it is worth it!!!

주소: 1 Water St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
리뷰:
Found a last minute reservation for a table of four to celebrate a birthday and it did not disappoint. Everything was spectacular from the service to the food to the music. The history and charm of the establishment is delicately spoken throughout the interior and the staff are very professional. The menu is prefixed at 195 per person before taxes and tips. With drinks, it is about 250 per person. The food was meticulously well presented and tasted wonderful. The atmosphere is elegant and it is not loud at all to have a conversation. The dress code is consistently enforced, so be prepared.

Advice the waitstaff responsible for clearing the plates and the table can use help for larger tables of four. When there was only one waitstaff available to clear the table, he resorted to clearing the table in between two guests, on the right side and the left side of one and the other guest, instead of taking the time to clear away from the guest rather in front of the guest. This caused a steak knife to come centimeters away from grazing one of the guests eyes as he was clearing the plates. This review is for the bar only, as we were lucky enough not to dine here. I've passed by this place hundreds of times, and it always struck me as whimsical and romantic. A restaurant with this kind of waterfront view cant disappoint, right?

Recently, after dinner, we decided to finally stop in for drinks. We were dressed appropriately and had no issues being seated at the bar.

However, the smell inside was overwhelmingan oldfashioned, musty aroma that made me wonder if the ventilation system needs a serious upgrade.

As for the drinks, we ordered 'A View of Manhattan,' one of their signature cocktails, and a French Martini. Both were terrible, and at 22 each, they werent worth it. We couldnt finish them, paid, and left. I definitely wouldnt return for drinks.

One more thing I found out that The River Caf used to have a Michelin star, but lost it in 2023no surprise there. The River Cafe is a really special place. We had our rehearsal dinner here last year, and Allyson was by far the most communicative and lovely vendor we worked with. When we returned for our anniversary dinner this year, the staff recognized us and made us feel so welcomed by giving us some extra treats to enjoy throughout our meal. The food is phenomenal, and the ambiance is perfect for a romantic evening. Cant wait to return and make this an annual tradition! Super romantic restaurant! Good for dating or celebrating. Can see the Brooklyn bridge, especially pretty for night view. Every chair can see the view so it doesnt matter where you seat. Would highly recommend for dinner  First of all, I have to praise the chef and chefs
The meal was delicious! Let me add points to the restaurants taste

Next, I felt that there was something wrong with the restaurant service.
The white people at the front desk and taking seats are very racist! !

Leave the flowers at the front desk and keep them refrigerated! Put the flowers upside down!
The water from the bouquet was all over it... and my original bag was wet.
She doesn't even apologize for doing this!
It is strongly recommended that your store should indicate on the website what items cannot be brought! Such as a bouquet!

The racial discrimination of the white male attendant is very serious
I made a reservation very early for 1930 because it was my birthday and I wanted to reserve a seat by the window.
He said he would not give me a seat until 2130
Asked me if I wanted to wait until 2130 and I said where was the second row?
He said it would take three people to sit down
I said I saw that two people can sit in the second row.
He doesn't take it seriously
Keep asking me if you want to wait until 2130 or sit next to the wall first
After I sat down, I told the other waiter that I wanted to see the manager and I wanted to change seats!
After complaining, my friend and I were served a dish each!

I'm very grateful to the Asian waiter who took the white man's seat at the back.
He helped the restaurant improve its service quality!
I was willing to pay 20 tip, but the original bill was marked with 20!

The white male waiter is shown in Figure 8. You can ask him not to lower the quality of the restaurant!
After all, the food in the restaurant is delicious and the service quality of other employees is good!

I even saw two tables in front of the front window at 2030 that were empty.
There are also two people in the second row at one table!
It really makes people feel bad!
But because of the delicious food made by the chefs, I am not so angry and crazy.

I just went to the restaurant to celebrate my birthday. There is no need to have a bad meal at your restaurant!

리뷰:
Highly recommend experiencing this Korean fusion restaurant. It's entirely worth the Michelin star. Food is excellent, and stuff is very attentive, but just when you need them. The design of the restaurant is also very nice. Lighting and use of natural material creates this calming environment. One of my favorite features was that even though it is a tasting menu, you get to choose among 3 options for each course. We ordered different options to try more things, and all of them were excellent. Drinks are very good as well. The 5 course tasting menu was quite filling and we enjoyed every dish. Our favorites were the uni and sweet shrimp bowl and the sea bass. Service was excellent and attentive throughout the whole night. Beautiful and clean restaurant. We celebrated Chinese valentines day recently and they brought out a little dessert for us for that. We ordered cocktails but they also have a very extensive wine menu. 1 Michelin star 

Oiji Mi was such a fun experience! The seafood was super fresh, and the modern Korean dishes were on point. The vibes at the bar were amazing, the bartender was cute, and the assistant manager took great care of us  now I see why its impossible to snag a reservation!

The bossam and duck were to die for! Brilliant! Absolutely delicious tasting menu. Excellent service. Food is sublime! Definitely opt for the uni bowl and the seared Kobe appetizer. The cocktails are FANtastic
5 stars Awarded a Michelin onestar, this modern Korean restaurant in NYC is a mustvisit for foodies who love Asian fusion cuisine.

Celebrated a friends birthday here. We enjoyed the dining experience for its rich flavors, artistic dishes, beautiful ambiance, and stunning presentation.

Oiji Mis dining experience made me feel like she was tasting a perfect blend of tradition and modernity in the heart of New York. Try it out when you have a chance!

리뷰:
Went in as a party of 4. We enjoyed the atmosphere and the overall settings of the restaurant. The service was top notch as well. The on the house salad, beets and pickles were pretty good, specially the beets tasted great. On the main courses we selected the Disco fries, their original burger and butterfly shrimp fries with tarter sauce. Their disco fries were awesome, the melted cheese n mushroom gravy wasnt too overpowering rather made the fries very delicious. Their shrimps were of really good sizes and they were fried with batter perfectly. The burger also looked really good and delicious. This location is right by the theaters and a little smaller and simpler than the 49th street location, which has a bigger and more Times Square vibe. However it is the same excellent, large serving size food the steak burger was large and delicious, friendly staff, and expensive but iconic cheesecake. Even when the line is out the door into the street, you will probably be seated in less than 20 minutes, and often you can grab seats at the bar. Food is always brought out fast. The vibe is diner and very casual. Overall any Juniors location is something we hit during every NYC visit and always find it reliable and consistent. Juniors serves up great food with large portions, making it a satisfying stop for anyone looking for a hearty meal. The menu prices are on the higher side, but the quality of the food makes it worth considering. Service is excellentfriendly and attentive staff who really enhance the experience.

However, the seating arrangements left much to be desired. We were squeezed into a tiny table, and they had to physically move it just to let people in and out, which was a bit uncomfortable.

Overall, its worth the trip just to check it off the list and say youve been there, but the seating situation might make you think twice about going back. I grew up in the Big Apple. The grand city with all of its charm and in spite of its history good and bad. It remains filled with wonderful memories for me. My family arrived in New York looking for a better life for us all. We were amazed at the variety and quality of the food. We were introduced to pizza and cheesecake! Both of which Juniors is famous for. I live in Florida and was surprised and happy to discover that I was able to order these delicious , delectable treats by mail. I received my order quickly and I was pleased with my order. It was very tasty and worth the price. I also got the Juniors coffee mug. I love it and use it to serve many things other than coffee and tea. Ive served lemon curd, chili, olives, relish, fruit, and salsa. Its my little bit of authentic New York! First time visit. The food was on point. This place was highly recommended to me by a coworker and I'm very happy that his recommendation was on point. My lunch was the Reuben sandwich. It was absolutely delicious and so full of flavor. The Key Lime cheesecake was phenomenal. I got lucky as it is seasonal and going out of season soon. This was a great first time experience and I will definitely come back again when I'm back in New York.

리뷰:
Friday night, walked in as we thought there would be a long waiting, but we got sat at a bar and dined by the pizza furnace and enjoyed watching food coming out as well as the food.

Our server Gabriel is attentive and entertaining!

Loved the food and the vibe. Definitely coming back. The place has an amazing ambiance, you feel in a little village in Italy, lots of plants and good music. The service was good even though we got sat in a corner and the server didnt really pay much attention to us and we had to go find someone to ask for salt and pepper because the food was a little bland, not a lot of flavor in the pasta or the sauce. The pizza was good. Yea so anyways, I celebrated my 1yr anniversary here with my gf, and it was a wonderful experience. I wasnt really sure what to expect but it was really comfortable to eat there, we had outdoor seating, and the greatest waitress ever, Anelo. The atmosphere was both tranquil and lively when we entered and were promptly seated had a reservation but was early. Anelo brought us complimentary champagne shortly after we were seated to celebrate. I wasnt really sure what to order as Im not native to Italian cuisine so my gf and I went for the safe picks. I forgot to mention they give you bread, olives in olive oil, and water while you sit and wait to order. They ate with the presentation, and to whomever made the food I hope you know how happy we were to eat there that night. The ricotta was so creamy and delicious I will be going back just for it idgaf if its 15. My gf and I got the carbonara and honestly I had only seen them online at this point and never actually tasted it. The first bite was amazing but I realized something in it made my mouth a little tingly, allergies oh well, BUT I DEFINITELY KEPT EATING IT. I loved it so much I wanted to lick the plate and so did my gf. She was enjoying herself and the evening was so peaceful and happy. Then we got desert which they provided us on the house we are still very grateful. Overall 1110 experience, W restaurant, W Anelo, W Chef. Food is always good here. We came here so hungry and was serviced quickly, appetizers and bread w olives was served quickly which helped tide us over till we had our pasta. Our server Lucas was really quick and attentive, and friendly too! We had the carbonara and seafood pasta. Everything was cooked perfectly nothing overdone. Really hit the spot! A beautiful restaurant in West Village. Staffs were friendly and service was quick. The tartufo pizza and seafood pasta we got was ok with barely any seafood in the pasta but what really stood out was the espresso martini which is smooth and strong as well as tiramisu which taste delightfully unique vs tiramisu weve had at other Italian restaurant. Highly recommend for those looking for carbs in a beautiful setting. This restaurant offers indoor  outdoor seating and is dog friendly.

리뷰:
I recently visited Au Cheval in New York, and let me tell you, the burger was absolutely out of this world. The perfectly cooked patty, paired with the soft, buttery bun, was a match made in heaven. And don't even get me started on the baconcrispy, smoky, and just the right amount to take every bite to the next level. Every element of the burger was incredible, from the rich flavors to the juicy texture.

We were also celebrating a birthday, and the staff made the experience even more special. They surprised us with a complimentary glass of Prosecco and a scoop of ice cream for dessert. It was such a thoughtful touch that made the lunch unforgettable. The best burger Ive ever had. I would definitely recommend getting the bacon and egg on top. The General Janes appetizer was perfect.  We also had the Prime Rib Sandwich, Mac and cheese,  and chopped wedge salad. All was great. Completely lived up to the hype. I recently had the pleasure of dining at Au Cheval, and I must say, it was an exceptional experience from start to finish. The ambiance of the restaurant is both sophisticated and welcoming, striking the perfect balance for a memorable evening out. The decor is stylish, with a warm, inviting atmosphere that makes you feel right at home.

The staff at Au Cheval are nothing short of amazing. Friendly and dynamic, they go above and beyond to ensure that every guest feels special and well taken care of. Their enthusiasm and knowledge about the menu really enhanced the overall dining experience.

Now, onto the food  the highlight of the evening was undoubtedly the burger. It's wellknown for a reason juicy, flavorful, and cooked to perfection. While I'm personally not a fan of brioche buns, the quality of the burger itself more than made up for it. Each bite was a delight, and it's clear that a lot of thought and care goes into every ingredient and preparation method.

Overall, Au Cheval provided a fantastic dining experience that I can't wait to repeat. Highly recommended for anyone looking to enjoy a great meal in a wonderful setting! Enjoyed a nice dinner at Au Cheval! Theyve done an excellent job of providing a cool atmosphere with fast, accommodating service. The Double Cheeseburger here has been on my list for over a year so it was great to finally try it. I added bacon and thought it was too thick and fatty for my liking. However, the burger itself was great, not super unique, but definitely a high quality burger. The fries and garlic aioli are delicious together. The Steak Frites was just as good, if not better than the burger. Cooked to tender perfection with naturally meaty flavor. We loved it! For a fine dining experience with quality food and a hip vibe, I recommend Au Cheval! I've tasted burgers across the globe, but nothing prepared me for this masterpiece. The patty was a symphony of flavors, the bun a soft, toasted embrace, and the toppings? Perfection. I'm tempted to say, "I'm gonna need a gun to ask the chef for this recipe." That's how good it was. If you're in town, skip the sights this burger is the real attraction.

주소: 4 Clinton St, New York, NY 10002, USA
리뷰:
Brunch at this spot in New York may require navigating a bit of a rough neighborhood, but hey, it's NYC  thats part of the charm! Once inside, you'll be greeted by an inviting modern decor and warm, attentive service that immediately makes you feel at ease.

Let's start with the cocktail an apple cider creation that was pure culinary artistry. It was the perfect balance of fall vibes but versatile enough to be enjoyed yearround. The apple flavor was bold, clearly locally sourced, and refreshingly crisp  not overly sweet, just perfection in a glass.

Now, for the real reason I'd catch a flight back to NYC the pancakes. These are not your average pancakes. Pancakemaking requires real skill, and this chef knows exactly how to get it right. These beauties were fluffy but never soggy, with crispy edges that didnt taste burnt, and a texture so light they almost melt in your mouth. Sweet but not sugary  its a delicate balance, and they nailed it. Honestly, these pancakes are in my top five of all time. Hats off to the kitchen for the love and mastery poured into every bite. Youll be rethinking your whole life with these pancakes! Absolutely phenomenal. Pretty good brunch spot  food was decent, albeit on the pricey side, and views great. If it's a nice day definitely grab a seat outside to get a nice view of the waters and bridge.

You pay when you place your order at the front and they give you a buzzer that will notify you when your food is ready for pick up. I made reservations for 3. Upon arrival, the waitress said that my table wasn't ready and to go outside and she'll call me when it's ready. The wait was about 10 to 15 minutes. Once we got in, we ordered a ton of food. We wanted to taste everything to see why this place was raved about. The food came quickly. It was the best breakfast that I've ever had. It tasted like grandma's cooking with more flavoring and no mistakes. The pancakes and french toast come with maple butter syrup. The grits were just right. The bacon tasted like honey or a light maple. The eggs were scrambled in real butter and tasted amazing. I forgot what  scrambled eggs were supposed to taste like. The last time it tasted like that was when I was a child. The latte was good and my friends said that the liquor was good. A tip is to get the southern breakfast and then pancakes or french toast on the side. That way Honestly, I dont get the hype about this place.
Its a nightmare to try and make a reservation and once we finally got it  well it did not live up to the expectations. The place was ok, ordered the fried chicken as a side  and it was good but not what I was expecting  the coating was peeling off the chicken and falling apart when cutting. The chai latte was decently made. The star of the meal was def the burger! It was well seasoned, fries reminded me of childhood nostalgia from the old school burger joints.
The deception, the pancakes should bring more blueberries not dried out and only a couple on the bottom stack. The maple butter syrup was delicious. The food is worth the hype! We came randomly on Tuesday morning when they opened and we did not have a wait at all which was amazing!. The food is delicious! Def get the pancakes with the maple syrup  Ill probably be dreaming about them for the next few weeks! Edited to add, WILLIAM our server was THE BEST! Like Id go back and request him again hes that personable, kind, and warm! I love when servers acknowledge my children when it comes time to place orders, its a nice touch. Thanks William!

주소: 42 E 20th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
리뷰:
We had a fabulous meal, everything was delicious! We loved the dips so much we ordered a second round. The oysters were the best! And of course, the chocolate chip cookie for dessert! Highly recommend everything. Also, the service was great and Alicia took excellent care of us and we had fun with her! Definitely recommend! I came here for a birthday celebration. The food was good but not outstanding.  Their service was just ok. After serving each dish, they did not even bother to ask how s the taste of the dish. I guess they either were confident that customer would like the dishes or the restaurant did not care of their customers.  Their dessert was quite disappointing, they were too sweet.

I think I would not go back there again. I loved every experience we had at the Gramercy Tavern. We were celebrating our 10 year anniversary and they really went out of their way to make it extra special.

The steak tartar and the duck mousse liver were incredible. So much flavour and excellent portion sizes. There cocktails were fantastic! Flavourful, unique and delicious.

The atmosphere has a great vibe. We were in the tavern and it was perfect.

We will definitely go back to the Tavern next time were in NYC. Came for their dining room menu. We got one of each things on the menu. Everything was delicious and so special. I loved the carrot, cabbage, and raviolis. They gave us a carrot cake since we're here for a small celebration and two lemon poppy seed pound cakes to go. Overall, this is one of my favorites restaurants in NYC! Would definitely come back here again! Went to this restaurant for restaurant week. Definitely great value at that price! The lumache was one of the best dishes I've had in NYC. Staff is also very friendly and cool decor. Also good free bread.

I do think the desserts however need improvement. They were too sweet and did not feel elevated compared to the other items.
