주소: Rink Level CO, 610 5th Ave #04, New York, NY 10020, USA
리뷰:
Food was delicious and service was great. Our waiter checked on our table after serving every cocktail and dish to make sure we were enjoying them.

Ordered the famous kimchi fried rice and pork sandwich and they were worth the hype. Their salads arent really salads so dont expect something healthy.

Cocktails are unique and delicious. They wont replace the liquor though and will only serve as written in the menu.

Their dessert menu was almost as long as their actual food menu. The bingo was delicious and mangos were perfect.

Not sure if Ill return anytime soon though because their menu is very short, but Im sure Ill crave it again at some point! At NARO, every course is a taste of refined Korean cuisine, where ingredients shine with unexpected flavors. 

For the starter, I highly recommend the Snow Crab  it's delicate and sweet, complemented by the earthy sprouted grains and the rich, nutty pine nut milk that adds a smooth creaminess. It's a perfect balance of texture and flavor.

Summer Tomato 
bursts with natural sweetness and acidity, paired beautifully with fresh summer squash and the unique citrusy aroma of chopi leaf. The dish is a symphony of brightness and refreshing textures that capture the essence of summer.

Moving to the main course, the Pork Jowl is meltinyourmouth tender, with the bold and savory pinecone ssamjang giving it an umami punch. Paired with the refreshing cilantro salad and hearty barley rice, it's a satisfying bite every time. 

Red Snapperis a true standout  perfectly seared to achieve a crispy skin while the delicate flesh remains tender and juicy. The richness of lardo complements the mild flavor of the snapper, while the squid adds a touch of briny sweetness. The soybean brings a subtle, creamy earthiness that ties the whole dish together absolutely love it

End with the playful Oksusu dessert, where sweet corn ice cream meets a crispy wafer and luscious corn jam, with just the right hint of chocolate for a surprising yet comforting finish.  The layers of texture and flavor here are simply irresistible.

Watermelondessert  is a burst of light and refreshing sweetness. The playful combination of lemon verbena soda and cantaloupe provides a crisp, invigorating contrast, making this dessert the perfect palate cleanser. The interior echoes a bit, so it's not the best for conversations. However, the harmony between the ingredients was so fresh that it made eating enjoyable. It felt like every detail was carefully considered, and the dessert at the end, a corn ice cream that had a Korean style ingredient yet felt like a proper dessert, was quite memorable!! Food is pretty solid. Odor control is needed for the main dining area, since it is full of seafood odors because of the king crab dish which may not smell pleasantly. That said, the king crab dish tastes excellently as well as main protein dishes with barley rice. I think we did this backwards. Neither of us have eaten at Naro before and the first time we did it was for this special collaboration event.

Dont get me wrong. The experience and the meal was outstanding. The fact that it is a once in a lifetime meal that we can never have again is both special and sad.

Right from the getgo the staff was friendly warm, and welcoming. We were quickly ushered to our table, and presented with options for water and a drinks menu.

All the drinks were amazing. The Woosoo cooler was like a fizzy dance in the mouth, and the Naro Hawachae was like a refreshing spring breeze, very earthy and mellow. The Sonamu truly was unique, and the fact that it was only available for today and never again is  hard to describe.

The dishes themselves were something else. Each dish was a very high end take on very traditional Korean cuisine. They were all comforting, and at the same time extremely extravagant.

The Mulhwe set the stage. Very light and refreshing, some citrus, some acidity, and top tier fish. The scallop was my personal favorite. The scallop was so meaty and the mouse it was in was so complex and delightfully delicious.

From there each dish had its own shinning point. The use of zucchini and shrimp in the butter fish, the abalone stood out so beautifully in its dish. The taste of perilla in the cucumber. The duck spoke for itself, the barley crackers in the peach, and finally the entirety of the Doenjang. I commented out loud after I was done with the final dish, I miss it and am sad it is gone. I truly was.

At the end of the meal we were each presented with a box of two chocolate Canels.

The whole meal was wonder and this was a collaboration that I will remember for a long time to come. I will be back to try their main menu to see more of Naro. Fantastic meal, friendly staff, and beautiful ambiance. Hat more could you ask for?

주소: 11 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10010, USA
리뷰:
Eleven Madison Park impressed us with its elegant, modern design and impeccable service. As one of the best restaurants in the world, each dish was presented beautifully and tasted incredible. The attention to detail in both flavor and presentation was unmatched. Fun fact the restaurant holds three Michelin stars and recently switched to a plantbased menu. Another fact its known for its sustainable dining approach. The only downside? Its a splurge, but the experience, from the food to the atmosphere, made it absolutely unforgettable. Just about the best restaurant experience I have ever had. I have been to a couple Michelin starred restaurants, however Eleven Madison Park takes the cake! Its an all vegan Menu and every dish is an experience of its own. My personal favorite was actually the tomato tea with fresh local tomatos in a type of savory cookie. It was a way of consuming and experiencing the aroma of a tomato I had never had before and absolutely blew my mind. So simple yet so unique and absolutely incredible flavors. The service was perfect. They were very friendly, inviting and relaxed while retaining utmost professionalism with an astonishing attention to detail. All in all, a flawless dining experience, Id come back in a heartbeat. None of the photos I took do this place justice. It is an absolutely divine place to have an experience like no other! The food is elegant and carefully prepared to take your taste buds on an adventure of a lifetime. This is the first Michelin star restaurant we've ever been to, and it really set a standard for fine dining. We didn't know what to expect with a vegan restaurant, and we proudly say we'll come back again and again. Outrageously attentive service and everything feels so special. A real treat! Honestly, I've been to this restaurant once before, about 34 years ago, for my husband's company Christmas party. I remember enjoying the meat that was served back then. So, unaware that the restaurant had become vegetarian, I made a reservation and went again two years ago. I probably wouldn't have gone if I had known it was vegetarian. Anyway, it was still a pleasant experience. Normally, I hardly eat if there's no meat or fish protein, but I seriously considered trying vegetarianism after dining at this restaurant.

I still can't forget the clean and pure taste of the food and its heavenly aroma. The most delicious part was the appetizer bread and the butter, it was so amazingly tasty. However, I remember the portions not being a lot. We had beverage pairings, and even after finishing them all, I didn't feel full. I'm not sure if the portions were small, if I was missing meats, or if the food was just too delicious and I wanted to keep eating.

After the meal, we got granola from there, which was so delicious that I've been making my own granola since then and eating it every morning.

There's no doubt that it's a place influenced my life. We were absolutely stunned by the work done in this place, the service was on point, always here to keep everything clean on the table and prepare for next service, keeping the water and drinks always fresh.

The ambiance was very New York, jazz music, dimmed lights, cool vibe.

And the food was just a delight. We chose the 5 courses dinner and wine pairing, the wine was gorgeous, well chosen, always matched the taste of every course. We were very surprised by how much food we had, and felt like we ate for hours, which we did! Portions were perfect, the presentation was beautiful and not too over the top. The taste was on the salty side but never overpowering the taste of the different flavors in each dish.

An experience we would 100 recommend and do again in our lifetime!

주소: 236 5th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
리뷰:
This is one of the BEST Lebanese restaurants in NYC. The food is so delicious and authentic. Every bite is full of flavor and rich and satisfying! Customer service is excellent. The atmosphere is very elegant and nice. I wish I could give more than 5 starts! So good!

Aldo, they great selection of Lebanese wines that are really good. Delicious Lebanese food in the heart of New York. The restaurant is beautiful and elegant. The food is excellent.
The only issue, it took them some time to bring us the menu and waiters were coming and going and not paying attention that we didn't have the menus yet. Once we ordered, they served everything pretty fast. It is also very noisy in there. But in general it was a good experience. The food tastes really good and the portions are big! We ended up with a lot of leftovers to take home.
BTW, the White Coffee is not coffee!!! It's orange blossom tea! Food was great! We started with spicy margaritas. Meal was several mezzes, including an unbelievable hummus and beef sausages.  The duck shwarmawas good too, but the sauce a bit sweet.

Would have preferred seating in the main room but I guess parties of two are not seated there  We enjoyed the variety of Lebanese dishes. The branding was perfectly roasted and the brussels sprout  was delicious garnished with fresh grapes and walnuts.

The hostess Jana was super friendly. The bus boys were attentive. In comparison, our server was aloof

주소: 2880 Broadway, New York, NY 10025, USA
리뷰:
As a huge Seinfeld fan, visiting Toms Restaurant in NYC was an absolute thrill! Seeing the iconic exterior from the show in person was a surreal experience. The restaurant itself is charming, with that classic diner feel, and its really cool to be in the spot thats such a big part of television history. While its more about the nostalgia than the food, the overall experience was amazing for any Seinfeld fan. Definitely a mustsee if youre in New York and a fan of the show! Awe man, i can't tell you how excited I was to come here.  The very restaurant the Jerry Seinfeld was taped. Seinfeld is my favorite sitcom.  The food, service, and atmosphere were excellent!  I got the Ruben Pastrami sandwich and it was delicious. I'm from El Paso TX. As a result of being a fanatic of Seinfeld the show, by default I immensely adore this joint and made a second visit coming across several states away. While much of the stuff I can speak highly about, but today I was extremely disappointed with our sever. We really werent hungry and came out of town with our little one and decided to pay a visit just for being fans of this cozy joint a true American household brand. So, we ordered an omelette to share and a bowl of veggie soup for our little one. The food was very decent. But the shock came when the server quietly squeezed in there some 3.50 on top of a regular price without even letting us know before hand. He only told us after the fact that this 3.50 is a form of punishment for sharing the entree as he served us with an extra blank plate! Can you believe it?  I really didnt want to fight it as it was very unethical business gesture and we really didnt have much time. But I did let him know that this wasnt a cool move and itll certainly leave a bad taste. Im really unaware of anywhere in the world of a restaurant doing anything mean to their guests like that. Definitely uncool  This is definitely the place!

The food is good. The people are good.  The servers are nice and theyre friendly!

If youre a Seinfeld fan, this is Paradise! Seinfeld buffs know it's here! Great location and typical diner menu in NYC .. fun decor based around the show. Food was very good eggs and veggie burger

주소: 24 W 55th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
리뷰:
Big fan of Michael's. Worked in the area for several years and had great business lunches a few times a year. Because I lived in a different part of the city, I never thought to try it for dinner. Recently, I was looking for a classic NYC fine dining restaurant in midtown good for families with kids for a family birthday celebration. A friend suggested we try Michael's and they delivered! The lovely hostess made it magical for our kids upon entry, we were treated with the table in the window, the food was fresh and tasty and the kids loved it!  There is not a kids menu but they will do kids pasta, simple burger, steak, chicken, etc. One of our kids  the pickiest eater   ordered a butter pasta and said it was the best they ever had. We all tried it and agreed, had to order another!
There is a pretty limited wine selection but all were very good.  Beer selection could be improved. The classic room has been the setting for many business deals and I have fond memories of a few, enhanced by our recent family experience. Love the laidback but firstclass vibe and unpretentious service. Highly recommend! The food was good and the staff was superb. The dining room is also beautiful. We went for a weekday lunch and it was very much a business crowd. The vibe is borderline stuffy, but the staff was so kind that their warmth offset that. Michael's is the perfect fine dining experience. I came here for my mother's 40th birthday and I really want to thank the staff for making it memorable. A complimentary birthday cake was given to us and the staff sang her happy birthday. The setting is luxurious and the wait staff have everything down to absolute perfection. The margarita pie was warm and cheesy and the fish was well seasoned and presented. I want to thank the manager Basdeo for making our night so special. Food is ok, not spectacular as I had expected from previous reviews. The tomato was very good, but the rest was not very tasty. Service was great, the  waiters was very attentive. The chair was badly worn and is in need of some tlc. It was not very busy when I was there. I had the perfect dinner here for Valentines Day! Great food, atmosphere and staff all around. Appetizers to dessert was all delicious. I am not even a fan of Kale but even their Kale Caesar Salad was so tasty I finished it.
I definitely recommend this place.

주소: 255 Vesey St, New York, NY 10282, USA
리뷰:
I came here after visiting the 911 memorial. Its around the corner.
The staff were lovely and when my server was about to leave the new server came  introduced herself. We dont get customer service like this in the UK.  thanks guys!
The food was delivered quickly and was quite tasty. The only negative was that the chicken breast was a little dry. The leg bit was delicious but the breast needs a bit of work. The rest of the meal was pleasant.
Staff are lovely  I would definitely return to this establishment.
I also had a delicious cocktail but I forgot to take a pic The beef rib and pastrami spare ribs are amazing. The Mac n Cheese is so creamy and worth a try too. Staff are extremely helpful and friendly and made the whole dining experience a wondering one. Tried the ribs platter and it could easily feed 3 people. Would definitely be back again the next time Im in New York. This restaurant is amazing! My boyfriend and I are on the quest to find the best BBQ in NYC. He grew up in the South and has fairly strong opinions when it comes to BBQ. Two of my colleagues recommended this place when I told them about our quest. We started with the Alabama white wings and buttermilk chicken bites. I was dying to try the white wings after reading all the positive reviews and they did not disappoint. I ordered the ribs and my boyfriend ordered the brisket. Blue Smoke makes the best ribs and brisket Ive tasted!! The ribs and brisket instantly fell apart. We ordered three sides to share the mac and cheese, coleslaw the best Ive had, and the cornbread. The cornbread was very good. We shared the chocolate chip cookies which were baked to perfection. The customer service was excellent and our waiter gave us great recommendations. We also really enjoyed the music. Our only critique was the interior design felt very modern. We did like the southern map though. Well be back for the delicious food and music! I like this place. The food is delicious and the atmosphere is very pleasant. My favorite on the menu is the Alabama wings. They have happy hour where you can enjoy delicious and refreshing drinks and cocktails. They have a varied menu, the restaurant is nice and the service is good. This place has been hit or miss for food quality and we still come back hoping for a hit but not any more. This last order was embarrassing and should not have been acceptable to management. Maybe takeout orders have poor quality control. The ribs barely had meat on the bones and the little that was there was dry and burnt. The chicken sandwich was missing most of the chicken. Its time to find another BBQ place.

주소: 181 Thompson St, New York, NY 10012, USA
리뷰:
The food is good, but there are better Italian places. The reputation exceeds the quality. However, if you do get a reservation go, it is good, just expensive. The vodka pasta is great. The meatballs are overrated. My favorite part is always the complimentary appetizers. I had a very pleasant experience for it being my first time!

The entire staff was exceptional hospitable. I was promptly seated by the kind hosts and our waiter Mark M was amazing! He assured us that our food was prepared accordingly to my fiancs food allergy, was extremely nice, patient and checked in on us frequently to make sure we were enjoying our meals. He provided an exceptional service that I dont see too often.

The food was delicious! The Caesar salad was fresh and one of the best I ever had. Although every plate was delicious, I was a little disappointed in how frugal they were with the ragu sauce for the tortellini. It was a little runny, and did not have a lot of meat.

Other than that, I think Carbone is definitely worth the experience, and Im very pleased! The impossible reservation! Until I just randomly got a table on a Wednesday. I heard so much about this place. The food. The history. The ambience. The front of house staff were wonderful, this feels like a 5 star restaurant. We sat and were greeted by our server, who seemed polite. Until we took a little too much time deciding what to eat. There was certainly a feel of being rushed, but despite this, our food arrived and it didnt disappoint! We had a selection of their pastas and then ordered any recommended deserts. Other than the service during the meal,
It was overall an enjoyable time. I wished there were 12 stars as Id probably give it 3.5. Dont forget the Italian candies at the exit Carbone is one of the best restaurants I ever been to. They really hit the mark in every way. From the quaint but vibrant atmosphere, impeccable service and absolutely delicious food.
Our server Antonio was on point. Great suggestions, speedy service with a friendly touch.
The burrata with caviar was my favourite dish with its complex and tantalizing flavours.
The Veal parmigiana was also incredible with a tasteful presentation.
The warm mozzarella not on the menu was also a special treat.
Id highly recommend the Caesar salad and the spicy rigatoni as well.
Carbone is a special experience with impeccable service and fantastic food.
I highly recommend it. Carbone is an exceptional culinary establishment. The dining experience begins with a delightful assortment of bread accompanied by mozzarella and salami, setting the stage for a memorable meal. The menu boasts a delectable array of dishes, including the tantalizing spicy vodka rigatoni, succulent meatballs, flavorful veal parmigiana, and a heavenly cheesecake. The service provided at Carbone is exemplary, ensuring a seamless and enjoyable dining experience. The ambiance of the restaurant is meticulously curated, creating the perfect atmosphere for a refined culinary journey. I highly recommend Carbone for an extraordinary dining experience.

주소: 101 Liberty St, New York, NY 10007, USA
리뷰:
It is a great location to find hidden imported gems for Italian food lovers.  They have many options from open lunch style eaterys, prepared and cooked togo meals, fresh produce and meats, as well as packaged goods such as coffee and cheeses.  Prices aren't too bad, and the atmosphere is awesome.  Recommend taking a spin through the store if you are nearby and haven't seen one before. We went out for my best friends thirtieth birthday and we had a great time. The appetizers were so fresh and delicious. The lasagna I had was very layered and filled with flavor. All the beverages we had were excellent. Our waiter was very attentive and made sure our experience was on point. I would highly suggest this place for a casual dinner or a nice event. A beautiful view of a very sad and memorable place for every American... A very beautiful game of words in the name of the institution. Pleasant atmosphere, good service and quite delicious food. But the burnt sides of pizza may be considered the top of culinary art in some country, but I don't like it very much... That's why I rated the institution a little lower. It's not scary, but it's not perfect in my opinion... Drinks are expensive, and in general the place is not an inexpensive restaurant. But we had a great time with friends and I can recommend this restaurant to visit. The design of the institution, by the way, is quite original, interesting and pleasant. Great place to eat.

Everything tastes really good. The portion sizes can be a bit small. The pizza is smaller than it looks and is very thin.

I went during the weekday at around 6. There was a small line but the wait wasn't very long.

I definitely recommend it, the food is fantastic. Stopped here before heading to the memorial tour.  Service was quick with menus and ice cold water.  We started with the calamari.  Probably top 5 I've ever had.  The outside was really crispy and the calamari was tender but the taste of the calamari, shrimp, and zucchini was excellent.  Our pastas was cooked perfectly and seasoned.  Nice stop for a quick lunch in the middle of the city.

주소: 120 Broadway, New York, NY 10271, USA
리뷰:
My recent visit to Capital Grille was an unexpected delight. While renowned for its prime cuts, I discovered a haven for seafood lovers and cocktail enthusiasts alike.

The star of my meal was an exquisitely prepared tuna dish. Seared to perfection, it boasted a crisp exterior giving way to a succulent, meltinyourmouth center. The chef's expert touch was evident in the balanced flavors and thoughtful accompaniments, proving that Capital Grille's expertise extends well beyond beef.

However, the true highlight of the evening was the bar experience, courtesy of the talented Nicole. Her cocktails were nothing short of extraordinary  each sip a harmonious blend of flavors, showcasing both creativity and precision. From classic mixes to innovative concoctions, Nicole's drinks elevated the entire dining experience to new heights.

The ambiance struck a perfect balance between upscale and inviting, ideal for both special occasions and refined casual dining. Attentive service rounded out an impressive evening.

Capital Grille has successfully broadened its appeal, offering a diverse, highquality experience that caters to various palates. Whether you're craving a perfectly cooked steak, exploring seafood options, or seeking toptier cocktails, this restaurant delivers with finesse
Definitely check this place out Great service  delicious dishes. Im giving it a 9 out of 10 because the complementary bread was not fresh at all. Lobster  Crab Cakes are one of the best crab cakes I have ever had. Seared Tenderloin with Butter Poached Lobster Tails is a small portion but both tenderloin and lobster were unexpectedly perfect, tender and almost melts in my mouth. What a great experience Nice chain steakhouse that reopened earlier this year after 14 months due to fire damage. Steaks, appetizers were good. Nothing too impressive but servers were fast and food came out very quick which is always appreciated. Steak was cooked correctly at medium rare. This was my first time dining at a Capital Grille and rest assured, IT LIVED UP TO ALL THE HYPE! NYC always has the best food, but the dishes we had here at their Wall Street location were phenomenal. I ordered ribeye steak and mashed potatoes, and I promise you, that was the best steak Ive ever had in my life. The mashed potatoes may have been the best Ive ever had, as well. We were also delighted with yummy lollipop lamb chops and calamari for our apps. I dont even really like calamari, but, it was delish! For dessert, we had cheesecake and flourless chocolate cake. Not a huge fan of flourless chocolate cake, but that cheesecake was so divine, Im still thinking about it now. Lol. On top of some of the best food Ive ever had, the service was beyond five star. I am late to the party, but officially a huge fan of Capital Grille. Cant wait to go again! Consistency is what makes this place unique.  Thanks Chris for taking care of us. The porcini rubbed steak was softer than butter  ,  so was the lobster  mac n cheese . Definitely worthwhile.

주소: 40A 10th Ave, New York, NY 10014, USA
리뷰:
Amazing authentic Korean cuisine. Genesis House is a mustvisit. We ordered 'Tasting Menu.' The highlights of our meal consisted of a balanced mix of both fish meat and animal meat. Each course was served in moderate proportions, leaving us satisfied at the end. The staff were attentive and friendly, providing assistance throughout the session. Highly recommend!

Now, I am curious about their other menus! enesis House is one of the most fascinating places Ive visiteddefinitely one of the best car showrooms out there. Ive been to all the car dealerships in New York and the surrounding areas, but this one tops them all.

The folks at Genesis have outdone themselves by turning a regular dealership into a free exhibit that feels like a modern art museum. The design and presentation are absolutely stunning and go far beyond what youd expect from a typical car showroom.

Theyve truly created something special here. Theres also a restaurant onsite that serves Korean cuisine, which I didnt get a chance to try, but Im definitely coming back for it.

If youre in New York, this place is a mustseewhether youre into cars or just appreciate great design and innovative spaces. I went with my friend for a workday dinner. We were super amazed by the elegant atmosphere with a library area and beautiful view of Little Island by the Hudson River great for sunset. For food, we got scallop pear salad, beef tartar, lamb chop our favorite!!, risotto also great and deonjang caramel pudding its super special and we loved it. Overall the experience is awesome. However for the high price, Id expect food with more layers of flavors. Would still highly recommend as a nice experience for creative Korean food It was a comfortable and peaceful spot for a weekday lunch. Most of the dishes we ordered were light yet flavorful. Although I hadn't tried much Korean cold noodle in the past, this one was definitely a good choicerefreshing and ideal for the upcoming summer. Rare nonfusiony Korean food outside Manhattan. Would recommend going during the day for just tea and desserts. Appetizers were ok, but mains were a little underwhelming. Space is very pretty and quiet, so still a good spot to take someone.

이름: The Chef's Table at Brooklyn Fare
주소: 431 W 37th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
리뷰:
Ive been to this restaurant four times in the last two years, and each time is a special, surreal food experience. Each course is like a piece of edible artwork. Chefs Marco and Max have taken what was already an incredible dining establishment to new heights. My most recent visit on August 15th was my first time sitting at the counter and was unquestionably the best dining experience that Ive ever had. Already looking forward to my next culinary adventure there. Had high hopes and expectations and they were surpassed. One of the best meals youll have. The first few couple of tarts that start the meal are outstanding and the rest of the meal keeps pace. And watching the team work is unlike any other chefs table Ive sat at. Its amazing Would highly recommend this place for those who like seafoodforward tasting menus.  I was quite impressed by the balanced flavor combinations, beautiful presentation, friendly and welcoming service, and knowledge of the staff.  Every dish I had was phenomenal, including a Hokkaido Uni served on a warm piece of belgian waffle, an abalone dish with mushrooms, and a langoustine dish with a coconut and hibiscus foam.  The huckleberry dessert as well as the fujisan bread were also outstanding.

I found the staff to be professional and warm.  I was not drinking that evening and had some of the nonalcoholic drinks.  The cucumber lemongrass drink is highly recommended.  I was sitting at the counter so could also hear the sommelier's explanation of wines for those seated next to me.  Her knowledge and stories about the vintners, terroir, and nuances of the wine were impressive and fascinating to listen to.

As some may know, this is the second incarnation of Chef's Table. When it moved to its current location and changed chef's Michelin treated it as a new restaurant and "took away" its stars.  I'd say that Chef Max and Chef Marco are well on their way towards Michelin stars for the current iteration of the restaurant. Really cool spot in the back of the grocery store.

Great music most of the night sorta tailed off at the end of the night.

I would have given it 5 stars but for 560 with tax and tip I was still really hungry by the time I got home.

Everything was delicious except the crab dish which really didnt do it for ne and the presentation was on point.

I would love to go back but because of the price and most likely needing to eat a meal before I go I wouldnt go back. Food was delicious and the taste was unique. If you like seafood, then this place is definitely worth your try. Usually, Im worried if the fine dining food is too salty. Im glad the food here was not. My favorites are the starting courses. Definitely recommend here for a try. Cute place hidden in a supermarket.

주소: 200 5th Ave, New York, NY 10010, USA
리뷰:
I was amazed  in awe of this place! We were just there for a quick visit walk through on our way to dinner reservations somewhere  I wished we were eating THERE!  My friends daughter knows we love Italian stuff  wanted us to see this place. We were lucky to have a little wine tasting w cheese that was offeredeverything looks so fresh  delicious I wanted to buy so many things!! The presentation was absolutely beautiful! You can purchase ingredients to prepare food at home or purchase what is made to take out or eat there at several diff spots within this complex. I must go back someday! I loved the overall vibe of the place. Pizza was good, desserts and coffee were delicious. Staff was very friendly. My husband and I went there a couple of times just to sit, relax and have some coffee after a day of walking through the city. Throughout our trip to New York we went here for breakfast, excellent sandwiches, fresh and tasty, the coffee is generally great. But the tastiest thing is the ice cream, beyond all praise. Thank you, I will recommend it to everyone. Great Italian food court, with several dining choices, like Pesce, Pasta, Pizza, Meat, Cafe, and wonderful Wine selections.  There you can buy food super tasty to carry on or just dine there. Also, I  suggest that you order a board of assorted cheeses and cold cuts accompanied by a good wine with your beloved one or your friends. And if you still want a fabulous desert,  ask for the Tiramis Ricetta della Nonna  and a great Espresso to top off a wonderful evening. Fun spot that is mostly grocery store than restaurant. Hidden in the very back youll find their pizza and pasta restaurant. Waitstaff was friendly and attentive. We arrived a little after 5pm and were told we needed to finish by 615pm since theyd need our table.

We thankfully finished on time, but you could see come dessert time they were getting ready to rush us a bit.

Food was good, vibes were nice, and the Italian cola was delicious.

리뷰:
Went for a girls afternoon out on a Sunday. Servers were friendly and food was on point. The dishes were all flavourful and the desserts just hit the spot. I really really liked the corn mashed side with the chicken. It wasnt too crowded on a Sunday evening and felt cosy. Would recommend. This was the perfect spot for a Sunday night dinner date. The restaurants interior was charming and cozy, perfect for a relaxed yet elegant evening. The standout dish for me was the zaatar salmon with beet coulisa beautifully balanced, bold, and creative dish that really impressed me. A big shoutout to the exceptional wait staff, especially Lauren, who made the night even more memorable with her attentive and personable service. It was a perfect evening from start to finish! Thanks Juliette! Love their happy hour menu  make sure you try their truffle fries ask for aioli instead of ketchup. Its incredible  also the most delicious rose wine, which is only 9 per glass during happy hours. The bursts from the regular menu is very fresh and delicious.
Mussels are my personal favorite, very soft, fresh and the sauce is delicious  I really enjoyed my time at Juliette! Our server was wonderful and very talkative and very attentive to our table. The food was wonderful. We did the fresh oysters as a table which were delicious and for an entree I had the Lamb burger. I highly recommend the lamb burger. It was definitely one of the best burgers Ive had in a while! Please get it cooked medium though. Atmosphere was lovely and very chic and french. We ate on the rooftop area. The ambience is very nice. I was not able to get pictures of everything I ordered. Every single plate we ordered was delicious. We also had cocktails with our lunch. The waitress was attentive and kind to us. Overall delicious food and a fun place to get drinks with your friends.

주소: 5 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10010, USA
리뷰: The restaurant provide a high quality service and introduce the menu to customers very well and provide a good description when serving. The atmosphere is great with the elegant interior. The food is great. The appetizer is good, but isnt surprised. The steak and the salmon is cooked perfectly but a bit lack of flavor. The dessert is really good. The toffee pudding is sweet but with some caulk an ice cream, it balances really well Went here specifically for the beef Wellington a birthday gift to my partner. It was, unfortunately, served very undercooked. The filet was almost raw in the middle and the inner pastry was doughy. It was very disappointing. However, I must say that the staff did an excellent job trying to make it up to us. They were outstanding. They gave us complimentary drinks, desserts and sides as there was not enough time to make another Wellington. All the other food we ate was delicious. I'd try this place again, if the Wellington had been in the oven for 10 more minutes I'm sure it would have been good. The atmosphere was very warm and calm and relaxing. I didnt make a reservation but the host very nicely helped sit me in. The food looked plain but tasted pretty good especially the potatoes. The restaurant week menu is cute. The only comment would be that most of their dishes go super hard on spices. I can't really distinguish the tomato with such a strong taste of rosemary in the chilled soup. But the crunchy cucumber bits were delicious. Wished there were more of those in the soup. Breads were delicious. The entrees are okay, up to the standards of a 60 restaurant week meal. I really enjoyed the greens by the salmon. Panna cotta was super tasty. The toffee pudding dish is too sweet for me or my friend. It doesn't help when it's paired with sweet icecream. The cream on the side was interesting  it tasted like oats. We put the cream and crispy pecan on bread as a delicious spread. Lovely atmosphere, but the food was a little off. The scotch egg was a bit raw not sure if that is how its supposed to be cooked, I still ate it but it was a bit flavourless as well. The beef Wellington was very rare, traditionally it is cooked medium rare and there was too much duxelle. The notable part of the experience was the service, our waiter was absolutely fantastic. Overall, it was a nice dinner but the food needs work!

주소: 1 Central Park W, New York, NY 10023, USA
리뷰:
I mean, would you expect less than 5 stars for a 2Michelin Star restaurant? The food was delicious, but beyond that, creative and thoughtful. I picked JeanGeorges for my Michelin Star dining experience because the menu sounded stellar. Too many restaurants either oversimplify or overcomplicate food. JeanGeorges walks the line of creativity and sophistication without crossing over into absurdity. I will definitely be back once my budget recovers! The full experience was great. 6 courses is a lot of food, but 10 is not impossible to accomplish.

1. Let the sommelier do her job. We went May 4th She is incredible. Her wine choices for us was absolutely perfect. The best sommelier I met. As a reference, I eat in great restaurants from Hawaii to Tokyo.
2. Enjoy. Enjoy. Enjoy.

Perfect service. Perfect food. Great place. Can't say enough about how wonderful our experience was. They made our anniversary so special and were able to accommodate my gluten allergy with gluten free options and substitutions which made me feel looked after. The wagyu was one of the best I've ever had, and that's saying something. We visited numerous Michelin star restaurants in our New York City visit and all were great but JeanGeorges blew them all out of the water the food was spectacular service was personal and exceptional the sommelier was personable and accommodating the atmosphere was just beautiful the table lighting was beautiful and unique. My wife and I both agree on our last trip JeanGeorges was our favorite and exceeded all our exceptions. I would highly recommend and I want to thank the team for providing us a lasting memory and even allowing us a picture at the pass exceptional!!! This experience was incredible! I honestly cannot say anything negative about this fine dining experience. We chose the Six omnivore tasting. This was 268 per person. From the start, we had an incredible server. All encounters with JeanGeorges staff were positive. My favorite course was Course 3, the Peekytoe Crab. My least favorite which was still great was Course 4, the Black Sea Bass. I can only say I had a least favorite course because Im just not much of a fan of Sea Bass, but if you, you will enjoy it. Flavorful is such an understatement when describing the food we were served. Only great things to say about JeanGeorges! Thank you. NOTE Dress up! Even if you feel overdressed  youre not. Everyone in this restaurant was in either a suit or a proper dress.

The food was really good! Everything was really flavorful. We got the cauliflower with pork belly, eel,  cumin lamb, and steamed egg. The eel was our favorite! Would definitely come back to try more dishes, they have so much on their menu. The service and atmosphere were great! We ordered half of the Peking duck and the cumin lamb on a sizzling plate, and both dishes were absolutely delicious. We also tried their new green jasmine iced tea, which was fantastic. Everything was wonderful, and we'll definitely be returning! Everything we ordered was delicious. Only one item was quite light, HandPeeled Crab Meat, it was listed on the chef speciality. Probably the chef wasnt there on that day. 
I have a sweet tooth so I recommend Steamed Lotus Roots Stuffed Sticky Rice for dessert, you could find this item in Appetizers. BTW, the complimentary Chinese kimchi was very tasty.
Another thing I had to bring up was the service, its not professional, we got three different waiterswaitresses came to ask us if we are ready for the check yet. Jiang Nan was quite the experience! We ordered the whole Peking duck, and they give you a really nice thin wrap to eat it with. Order the green beans!!! They have a great pineapple beer that is served with a presentation over dry ice. Excellent meal and it was a 1010! Lovely atmosphere for delicious and fresh food. Amazing service on top of everything and highly supportive. The portions are perfect to share and prices are reasonable.

주소: 43 E 19th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
리뷰:
Craft was a lovely experience throughout from the hostess saying hello to our server. The food was incredible, loved the different varieties of food and flavours. The restaurant is beautiful and provides lovely atmosphere throughout. We received compliments of the house soups to clean our palette, followed by great pairing of drinks, my friend and I shared a light and refreshing beet salad, and had our individual dishes of pasta, followed by a lovely dessert. Great place to connect with a good friend. Highly recommend. As a tourist, this restaurant was recommended by a local, and it did not disappoint!  Each staff member was extremely polite and attentive. The food was delicious and the portions were large my friend and I split a salad, entree, and side and still had left over. Would recommend to anyone visiting the city Overall a wonderful date night. Great staff, drinks and vibe. Some of the food was great  but much of it tasted just OK, and the duck I was served was a big let down. The waiter mentioned this was a family style restaurant  and that the gist of "Craft" is putting together your own smorgasbord of items to mix and match as you eat. I can see how this would be a much better dining experience food wise with a group. When you can only order a handful of items, stakes are high if something doesn't hit.

Here's a run down on our order, and as always, you might just love something that I was not into and vice versa.

Arugula Salad  unexpected winner here. the fresh greens, dressing and pine nuts all come together to make a surprisingly excellent salad. Almost skipped this, kudos to the wife on insisting.

Aligot  this is basically an incredibly cheesy mashed potato, possibly the best I've ever had. If you like cheese and potato's this is a must. It also made the duck much more palatable.

Hen of the woods  Lots of mentions of this in other reviews. The way they prepare it definitely lets the mushroom shine for itself. Tasted fresh, good flavor, but not mind blowing or anything.

Milk Braised Lamb Pappardelle  the lamb portions were great, extremely tender and flavorful. But the lamb and relatively plain pasta wasn't really enough to wow me. In this case, I might just be too much of a red sauce glutton to appreciate it.

Scallops  the scallops were very well done, perfect I'd say. They do provide more of the sauce on the side if you wanted to have some on every bite, but they were flavorful enough as initially presented.

Duck  This one was unfortunately the saddest part of the meal. It was a large portion, but the breast has no crispy skin on it at all. It also looked much different than some of other photos of duck others have posted. I unfortunately just wasn't into the way the duck breast was prepped this time around. The confit was the better half of the dish, but honestly, this was the dish I was most excited for, and yet it created the greatest regret. If you do order this, find a photo of it in the reviews that you like and ask if that's what it'll look like. Feel like I got catfished.

Chocolate Souffl  the ice creamgelato on the side was excellent and its a very good souffl. I was pretty full at this point and wish I had room to try the crme brulee cheesecake.

They also provided a final little treat, and an yet another treat on our way out. A nice "just one more thing" touch!

Again, the drinks were all very good. Our waiter was very informative and friendly. Can't say I was wowed food wise  although a couple of dishes were fantastic.

Overall, if I were to visit again, it would be with a larger group to try more things. Still, had a wonderful time. Excellent service and food was solid. The agnolotti and duck were our favorite dishes. Nice touches throughout the meal with the amuse bouche, sourdough bread, and complimentary dessert. The service was outstanding and the staff went above and beyond to welcome my mom to NYC. Theres a reason why Craft has been around for so long.. its an NYC staple and I cant wait to come back. Craft has an extensive and expensive selection of side dishes, including some very pricey mushrooms. The fingerling potatoes were nice and crispy. The papardelle with braised lamb was tasty. Everything was delicious but nothing that youre still thinking about the next day. Great menu for sharing to try a little of many things.

주소: 70 Pine St 63rd Floor, New York, NY 10005, USA
리뷰:
We had such a lovely time and this spot did not disappoint. The atmosphere was fantastic as you had to go all the way up to almost the top floor to access to the restaurant which was beautiful. We arrived in time to see the sunset on the balcony which we opted to stay out there to have our pre dinner cocktails and small bite. It was breathtaking. The dining room had an incredible 360 view all around. Food was so unique and delicious and the service was stellar. Our sever was extremely attentive and at the end they all sang happy birthday and brought me a tiny birthday cake! All the small touches made the experience so memorable and special. Highly recommend this restaurant! The moment you exit the elevator and enter the restaurant, this place impresses at every turn. It strikes the perfect balance between sophistication and style without feeling too formal though some guests were very dress up, others were more casually dressed. Before the meal even started, we were welcomed with special cocktails and escorted to their unbelievable patio overlooking the city. It was clear that this experience was going to be unique, and it only got better from there. Each dish was a masterpieceflavorful, beautifully presented, and perfectly balancedthat tasted amazing with every bite. The 7course tasting menu is highly recommended. I can't praise this restaurant enough. One of the best restaurants Ive ever been to  wouldnt be surprised to see them with 3 Michelin stars in the very near future. Beautiful restaurant with exceptional cuisine to match. A perfect dining experience for a special occasion. We experienced the 4course menu, and every dish was a home run. The progression of dishesfrom caviar to dryaged black cod to the 2week dryaged duck breastwas phenomenal. The Moroccan tea was a lovely and memorable touch. Dessert was nextlevel, with five different items.

We especially appreciated the less stuffy, more approachable atmosphere. This allowed us to enjoy our evening in a more comfortable, relaxed manner. Yet the level of execution by the kitchen was just as elevated as restaurants with more formal settings.

Special thanks to AJ, Kevin, and Juan for taking such wonderful care of us. Service was seamless, gracious, and personal. Chef James truly built something wonderful in Saga. He would be so proud of how the team is continuing his legacy. From the buildings lobby, to the welcome drinkbar, and patio, this restaurant is truly topnotch. Its a perfect blend of elegance and chic, but not too over the top or fancy dress codes though of course some people will wear suits etc. Before food was even started, I told my partner that this was likely the best restaurant Ive ever been to, and it only got better. Every. Single. Dish was flavorful, unique, and perfectly balanced. Would absolutely recommend the 7course tasting menu. I truly cannot recommend this restaurant enough. I made a comment in the beginning joking about how it feels like theyre trying for three Michelin stars, and its a remarkable effort that very well might prove to be worthwhile in the upcoming years. Cant wait to return. I wanted to like it more. Not least because of the price tag. My fianc and I came here for my birthday. My main complaint is about the service anxious and uncoordinated, and my secondary complaint is about the food a few standout dishes but some were forgettable and the menu as a whole lacked cohesion. When we got out of the elevator, there were several nervous servers looking to whisk the different parties away for their welcome half cocktail and to take in the views. The views were amazing, and the cocktail was refreshing.

We were seated and there was a thoughtful note on our table wishing me happy birthday, and they even knew my age. Our primary server welcomed us but didnt explain the flow of the menu or experience to us. And when we told our sommelier that we would start with a cocktail and switch to wine, he promptly folded the menu shut and walked off, as if in a huff.

On the menu, the sushi treeforest was beautiful and each bite was delicious. The rest of the courses were good but not outstanding, until we got to the duck course, which was full of flavor and wellportioned. We also did get two glasses of wine, after all, to our somms delight. The special dessert for my birthday was a chocolate espresso cake and it was delicious. The standard desserts, however, lacked flavor and werent memorable. And in the style of Michelin or Michelinaspiring restaurants these days, they offered five small desserts instead of just focusing on one or two desserts and doing them well.

The service the whole night felt awkward and anxious. Servers are facilitators, and if the facilitator is nervous, the audience is going to feel it, too. Id recommend that Saga Hospitality provide some coaching to their servers on how to just have a little fun with the experience. We were waiting the whole time for the ice to break with our servers, but they were all so stiff that we felt not at ease ourselves.

리뷰:
We had a nice dinner here last night. Ive been to their other locations and I can say that theyre pretty consistent. Always a nice experience. The lovely Marissa took care of us and here recommendations were definitely on point. We started with the Arancini and it was really delicious , I loved the hint of truffle. Their burgers are always good which my cousin really enjoyed. I had the Shrimp Tagliatelle and it was really good as well. The desserts here are always good. Dont skip on them. I always get the Sticky Toffee Pudding which is always amazing, but decided on the Blueberry pie since Id like to try something new and it definitely didnt disappoint! It was really good!! The crust, filling and the vanilla ice cream on top was perfection. I really love this restaurant and highly recommend it whether youre visiting or not. Nice staff as well! We had a really nice experience at The Smith. We got there just as they opened and sat on their lovely patio.
We enjoyed a nice cappuccino along with the avocado toast. Our meal was accompanied by a refreshing salad.
There was a nice breeze as we watched the world go by.
The service was excellent and attentive. It looked like a really nice atmosphere inside as well. High ceilings and nicely designed.
If youre looking for a nice spot to enjoy a great meal The Smith is the place for you. THIS PLACE. Drinks were amazing. Food was amazing. Our server amazing. We got the burger which was maybe the best one weve had, this was debated at the table for quite some time. The calamari was fried perfectly and the salmon crispy rice was so so great. We all shared and it was the perfect amount. We were so excited to order the quarter pounders three big chocolate chip cookies but our server came back and told us they only had two left and they would give it to us but on the house! How sweet!!! They also have the cutest Photo Booth downstairs. I just landed from my flight from Jacksonville and I was really hungry. After checking into my hotel this restaurant popped up in my feed and it looked like some place I would really like.

On Sundays this location has a burger and a beer promotion and I'm happy I took advantage of it. The burger was excellent, the fries were nice and crisp, and the beer was quite refreshing.

This restaurant has a very large raw bar option as well. Although I'm not big on seafood or oysters the table across from me was and it seemed like they were thoroughly enjoying themselves.

This is a great place to visit if you're in town. I will happily revisit in the near future. Decided to stop here to grab a drink while we waited for the Rooftop bar to open. It was a beautiful New York day ! The temperature was cool and breezy. The restaurant had all the doors open for lots of fresh air and sunshine. My cocktail  was perfect ! It was a Wednesday and not too crowded. Next time I'm in the area I would try their food but their cocktails were made perfectly.

이름: ONE Dine at One World Observatory
주소: 117 West St, New York, NY 10007, USA
리뷰:
One Dine at the One World Observatory is a restaurant that pleasantly surprised me with its pricing, especially when compared to other tower restaurants in Asia. Although its not cheap, at around 70 per person, its relatively reasonable for the experience you get. It's essential to make a reservation in advance, and note that you also need to purchase elevator tickets to access the restauranthaving just a reservation won't suffice.

The view from One Dine is absolutely stunning, particularly at night. I highly recommend going for dinner rather than lunch to fully appreciate the amazing atmosphere after dark. However, while the ambiance and view are topnotch, the food itself is quite midquality. It's a decent dining experience, but don't expect gourmet cuisine.

Overall, One Dine offers a memorable experience thanks to its breathtaking views and evening ambiance, making it worth a visit despite the average food quality. If you're planning to go, make sure to look at the pictures and reserve your spot well in advance. The view was amazing! Not sure if its worth almost 250 per person after taxes. When you go here the view is what you are paying for. The food was decent, change the location and it would not have been worth the price at all. The quality of the tables the space and the loudness it doesnt match the expectations that comes with the priceThe steak was not super hot and seemed like it had been sitting in the kitchen awhile before brining it out. I found a piece of paper in my dessert. The staff in restaurants was very nice, but when we went down to the observatory deck the staff was rude and unprofessional. If youre going to complain about your job and the guestswait until no one is around. It's a place where you're paying first for the excellent views of the NYC and secondly for food.
Restaurant accessible only if you have a ticket to One World Observatory so counting the price for tickets  make reservation with dining package.
If you're visiting just as part of One Deck Visit, be ready for a wait to be seated unless you're planning for a bar.
Cocktail prices are about 2325. This is a one of a kind dining experience! Highly recommend getting the lunch experience package. The food was delicious, the views were incredible, and our service was the best. Haque was an awesome waiter! I went here this past Sunday. Everything was amazing, the whole experience. The restaurant is on the 101st floor and I highly suggest you make your reservations around Sunset time if you want a beautiful picture. I got the charcuterie board a small plate and the steak and fries for the main and I got three vegan chocolate chip cookies and it came with ice cream which was amazing. The view from where we sat was incrediblebreathtaking!

리뷰:
The dining room has not been updated in 25 years since it opened. The food is very good but not amazing. Picking out your own fish is silly and ends up feeling like a rip off on price. The salt baking takes an hour and can only be done with very expensive larger fish not worth it, grill is best preparation.  Tomato salad is their best item. Fries are 15 per serving!! The zucchini chips are 30 each!  Everything is a la cart. Desserts are disappointing. Service was not well coordinated and a bit odd personalities. This place is part of a chain with not great store level management. Still was packed on a rainy Sunday night. They have a 3 course pretheater menu for 65 pp.  Our bill for 5 people was 564 plus 100 tip my husband is a generous tipper. We felt it was overpriced but we still like it and would probably go back because we do like good Greek food. The atmosphere is very nice and open. The service was great. They took us to the booth to pick our own fish. And choose what we want them to be cooked as. The food was really good and we also choose a great chardonnay to go with the seafood. For the dessert, the creamy pastry is really great. I would bring my parents here next time Brunch at Milos in New York is an experience not to be missed! From the moment we arrived, we were welcomed with warm hospitality and impeccable service. The ambiance is elegant yet comfortable, making it the perfect spot for a relaxing brunch.

The brunch menu is a delightful blend of traditional and innovative dishes, all prepared with the freshest ingredients. The seafood selection is particularly impressive  we enjoyed the sashimi and the tuna, both of which were incredibly fresh and flavorful. The lamb chops were delicious. The Greek yogurt with honey and walnuts was a perfectly sweet ending to our meal.

The service was great

The quality and presentation of each dish were impeccable, reflecting the restaurant's dedication to culinary excellence.

Overall, our brunch at Milos was a truly wonderful experience. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a toptier brunch spot in New York! It is a restaurant specialized in fish, they bring it 3 times a week from Greece, you can also find incredible cuts of meat and lamb! We tried fish carpaccio, lamb and a rib eye with 21 days of aging, everything was incredible! The service, presentation, and atmosphere were incredible! It is an elegant and special place to share! 100 recommended! I would travel from Miami again just to eat here! Milos is a wellknown restaurant in the United States. However, compared to some other places I've visited, I found that their menu lacked variety. The appetizers were the highlight, but the main courses didn't have the same wow factor. The service is excellent, and the atmosphere is classy. One of the best things about this place is its fixed menu for pre and posttheater dining. The restaurant stays open until 12 a.m., making it a great option for a postBroadway show dinner.

주소: 228 W 10th St, New York, NY 10014, USA
리뷰:
Loved the food, didnt love the wait.
Worth a visit I think, and will revisit to try their other menus as well but be prepared to wait.

We arrived several minutes later than our reservation time, yet had to wait 20min to get our seats, then another 10min for the server to finally notice us when seating another table next to us to bring water and menus. But once the food was ordered, everything was much faster.

There were a lot of frustrated diners crowding the lobby before and after our meal, who would often check in with the host on the status of their tables, so I dont this was a one off experience just for us. Also had a glimpse of their system and they pack the table schedules in so tight, with no buffer between seatings. Youre bound to wait here.

As for the food, we ordered 2 pastas, 2 appetizers, and 1 glass of wine for lunch, coming at a total of 100 before taxtip for two. Reasonable for the area and food quality. No complaints on the food whatsoever, it was good portioned and tasty. This has been on my list for so long and happy to say it did not disappoint! Tried out the buccatini and carbonara, and the burratta salad. Salad was yummy, the ingredients were so fresh. I wish we got more of it! The pastas were also great, perfectly portioned and we were able to finish both of our dishes. We topped it off with orange blossom panna cottage cheese and salted chocolate cake, both exquisite. Chocolate cake was not too sweet, although it was kind of heavy after such a carb filled meal haha. Panna cotta on the other hand was so light. Loved it. Got a last minute reservation for lunch on a weekday. Loved the summer watermelon beet salad. The shiso peppers were super tasty with a slight kick to it. Squid ink pasta with tomato sauce was fire! Low four. This place is overhyped and theres honestly a lot of better places in the village. However, the food is freshly prepared and they have a nice selection of pastas. Service is pretty timely. Outdoor seating was rough with the wind, as all the plants were getting knocked down. On the whole, I dont feel the desire to go back. Housemade Focaccia  great flavor from tomato salsa and pecorino, even better if it's warm

Pici Cacio e Pepe  it's the perfect texture for me, I'm normally not a big fan of cacio e pepe but this isn't as heavy as I fear

Tagliatelle  love the bolognese, meaty but light and a little zesty

Olive Oil Cake  the famous olive oil cake!! The syrup is entirely unnecessary for me but otherwise it's good, pairs even better with complementary birthday gelato

이름: 뉴욕바 - El cafe latino - Newyork bar
주소: 827-3 Yeoksam-dong, Gangnam District, Seoul, South Korea
리뷰:
The best Latin place in Seoul, actually they were so humble to recommend me the nasty place that didnt want me to go in because it an ancestral mentality, yes racism. Good music and drinks If you like Latin music and salsa salsa bachata, this is the place to visit.
It's usually open until late, but on weekdays it depends on the situation. Many people gather after 12 PM on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays. Dear New York Bar  A wonderful place with music that makes your heart flutter and great people. A New York bar that creates a new change in salsa culture. We would like to express our gratitude and encouragement to Aki, Injeong, Sua, Patrick, and the staff who worked with us.  I hope you continue to develop a lot New York Recognition I added a second chappa where you can drink while dancing bachata, and it is clean and the floor is in good condition.
I'm not sure if it's the owner or the staff, but they're all friendly.

리뷰:
I saw somebody posted pictures of Mac  Cheese Burger and Oreo Fries from here and I had to visit here with my wife and wife's friends.

First of all the beef patty of the burger was JUICY AF. I read that this place got a patent for their way of grilling and yes they deserve that indeed.

And the Mac  Cheese on the top was a  perfect match with the burger.

The Oreo Fries? I didn't try them because I don't like sweet things but one of my wife's friend is American and she said it was good so... I think It's worth to try this thing out.

I liked interior and vibe of the place as well.

Price range is reasonable for this quality of food.

This is the place you should visit if you want to have a quality burger in Hongdae. New York Apartment Burger.  is it real American style ? MacCheese Burger reminded me of younger life in States that i used to eat macaroni and cheese with my family for dinner. Good place with good foods specially loved the Hawaiian jack sauce burger A good burger and beer place, in a good location and with a nice balcony.

주소: South Korea, Seoul, Gangnam District, 48길 28
리뷰:
Vibey bamboo path leads to excellent bagels and coffee. Skip the ridiculous line at London Bagel Museum and go here instead. The absolutely best bagels Ive ever had. Ive traveled all around the world and these bagels beat them all. Theyre soft, chewy, with a perfectly balanced blend of sweetness. The fig cream was also to die for. I cant wait to try out the rest of the bagel flavors. I took a bag home because I had to show my family.  Amazing and addicting.

The decor was also another amazing part of the experience.  The entrance makes you feel like youre entering another realm away from the street. Perfect place for a date or to just relax. My virgin bagel experience. I didn't have much expectations. I mean, it's just bread right? I couldn't be more wrong.
Hearty, thick bagels with a spreading of heavenly cream cheese. So many flavors! I tried the fig, and the cinnamon walnut cream cheese. This changed my life forever. I'm a convert now. I need more cream cheese bagels. Delicious and with a variety of bagels and fillings that surpassed my expectations. The space is also very good, with outside tables and bamboo trees. I love the atmosphere there. Amazing bagel and cream cheese selection. The price is pretty high, but the quality is great! Ive been back on several occasions and Im never disappointed. I highly recommend if youre a bagel lover

주소: 13 St Marks Pl, New York, NY 10003, USA
리뷰:
Spot Dessert Bar is a delightful gem in the city, offering an array of delicious and innovative desserts that are sure to impress. Each dessert is crafted with care, combining unique flavors and textures that make for an unforgettable sweet treat. From their popular matcha lava cake to their creative seasonal offerings, there's always something new and exciting to try.

Despite its modest size, which can result in a bit of a wait during peak times, the experience at Spot Dessert Bar is well worth it. The cozy atmosphere and the quality of the desserts make it a mustvisit spot for anyone with a sweet tooth. If youre looking for a place to indulge in some truly exceptional desserts, Spot Dessert Bar is highly recommended. Delicious dessert bar
Our time here wasnt elongated like at most restaurants, instead we walk in they tell us its a 15 minute wait yet it was much shorter, we order, then just 5ish minutes later the food comes and was so good.

The cookie camp was good and had a burning hot cookie with a cold ice cream atop

The golden toast was kind of mid compared to the cookie but it was still very tasty. Tried Spot Dessert Bar for the first time and enjoyed the unique Thaiinspired desserts crafted by their chef. The flavors were interesting and wellexecuted, though it was a bit pricey. Overall, a worthwhile experience for dessert enthusiasts! This place is really nice and cozy.  We tried the Golden toast and the Harvest and both were really good. The service was really fast, we order and waited for about 5 minutes for the desserts to be ready. Definitely will come back again ! This is cake at a whole new level. Everything is about presentation now and this place brings it to a whole new level. Beautifulartsy, interactive and very delicious. Love how courteous the staff is. Truly a shining gem in the realm of sweets.

리뷰:
Shaved ice from this place are delicious.
We ordered the mango and matcha. Both are huge, we have 6 people to finish both. It is really worth the 20 minutes wait to get in.
You should try to go earlier in time, it seem to be less wait We got hot coffee not great. Boba drink might have been a better choice. The cheesecake was okay. Have had better. Not sure this was really a basque cheesecake as Ive made one recently myself. The serving size for 1 is pretty large so come ready to share. Grace street is definitely a must visit if you want to have a quick treat. You dont really get service, you place an order, wait for your buzzer to ring and pick up what you got. The actual look of the shop is rustic and kind of thrown together, which I believe its more like a food court inside. That aside, the food is phenomenal. The ice cream is creamy, churro waffles are a must have, super warm and soft. The drinks are also very sweet. Burnt cheesecake is decadent. If youre in Ktown you gotta stop by. Very popular place for desert in Korean Town.  You can see a long line outside.  The green tea shaved ice is very good.  The portion is medium and can be for one or two persona.  The service is very efficient even though the line is long. Cozy albeit crowded spot in NY Koreatown. Open til late at night. Excellent service and great desserts.
Waiters take your orders first before seating you and your party. It's self serve once inside. You pick up your order when it's ready, grab what you need by their self service station Utensils, cups, water. Overall great place to get dessert in the city

주소: 143 W 29th St, New York, NY 10001, USA
리뷰:
It's no Harajuku, but this spot is probably the closest we'll get to a true Japanese theme cafe. There are no Pokemon throw pillows or the like, but there are cute decor touches in the tables and utensils that give you a brief kawaii moment.

Most of the desserts are huge and pricey 1522, but the 7 Matcha Float is just as satisfying without breaking the bank. Then again, you could splurge on the Matcha Made in Heaven float like my friend and, well, float away to matcha heaven.

Mmmm, matcha heaven. Cute and insanely delicious desserts! Very authentic Japanese style icecream. Beautifully presented and the venue inside is super cute. My girls and I really enjoyed our time here and I've gotten so many compliments on our photos of how delicious everything looks! The treats are just as tasty as the pics look! After a heavy meal elsewhere on a warm evening, the Palm Peach snow sundae with pudding was the perfect ending. The positive statements in neon lights and quick friendly service were excellent.

BTW Entering the place feels uncomfortably stuffy the thermostat showed 77F... but as you eat the cold desserts, that stuffy humidity ends up feeling great, and you can finish the dessert without your teeth chattering. Smart thinking from the owner! We were on the hunt for some refreshing shaved ice bingsu and stumbled upon the delightful Sweets Laboratory by Hanamizuki  on Google Maps. While the bingsu certainly didn't disappoint, the true star of the show was their incredible croffle  a delectable hybrid of croissant and waffle. It was so good, we had to order a second one! The service was fast and friendly, adding to the overall positive experience. We highly recommend checking them out! Very cute place!  We had mango and tea snow ice just perfect individual size. Both tasted so yummy. Awesome service will be coming back with friends.

리뷰:
Ive been coming to this restaurant for the past ten years, and it never disappoints. The waiter recommended the spicy rigatoni vodka, and it was outstandingbetter than what Ive had at some of the famous Italian restaurants in NYC. I also tried the pumpkin spice hot chocolate, which was the perfect drink especially if you prefer something thats not overly sweet.

Overall, the quality of the food, service, and atmosphere is consistently excellent, and I cant wait to return and explore more of the menu. Food was OK, but if you've been to Australia and had it there, this isn't the same menu  didn't think it was half as good as Oz.
Our waiter was good though.
They also have a non dessert menu if you don't want sweet things.

Food
 Cookie
 Brownie Sunday
 Strawberry Crepe Came here for my sons graduation brunch. We were quickly seated as there were not many people in attendance at the restaurant. The server was amazing, he was very attentive, continued to check up on our table and ensure we had everything we needed. As an appetizer, we had spinach artichoke which was delicious. My oldest son ordered the brenner burger with an egg and he stated it was so good. The rest of the table has pasta Alfredo with salmon and shrimp, it was absolutely delicious. Me and my sons dad also had drinks. The boozy lemonade was a bit tart but still good and the mimosa was really good as well as the margaritas. Overall the experience was great. Thank you Max Brenner Restaurant is a chocolate lover's paradise! They have the best chocolate martinis and chocolate desserts I've ever had. The martinis are rich and indulgent, and each dessert is a decadent masterpiece. The food is also good, making it a perfect spot for a full dining experience. The service is topnotch, with friendly and attentive staff ensuring a delightful visit. Highly recommend for anyone looking to indulge in incredible chocolate treats and great food! Loved all the dishes that Ive tagged to this review. Max brenner has become my favorite now. Hazelnut waffle was out of the world. I loved the ambience as well.

Love the asian inspired desserts. I got the taro port floss cream puff. It wasnt that sweet and there was plenty of salted egg yolk. Very unique mix of flavors and textures. I recently visited a delightful dessert spot and was thoroughly impressed by their unique offerings. The dessert in the photo, featuring a soft, fluffy texture covered in a light dusting of sweet powder, was a true treat. The combination of the rich, smooth filling and the subtle crunch on top created a perfect balance of flavors and textures. The presentation was also impeccable, making it a feast for the eyes as well as the palate. Its just PERFECT!!!!!
Im not super into dessert but this!!! Ugh love ittttttt cant get enough of
Not overly sweet. Not cheaply sweet. Just good! Chinese French patisserie!!
Highly recommend  This is one of my favorite dessert spots in NYC! They also have seasonal desserts so there are always some surprises. The taro and vitellus custard profiteroles are the best.

리뷰: The Mango Bingsoo was delicious. The dessert is definitely on the sweeter side but if youve got a sweet tooth this is the place to be. The shaved ice comes off really easily so its a little hard to not make a mess but just be gentle with your spoon. There are little cheesecake bites at the bottom of the dish that pair amazingly with the ice cream up top. They also serve it with a little side of condensed milk. Too sweet. But it's worth it. The atmosphere is clean and pleasant. They have delicious desserts. Today was my first time going and I tried an oreo flavored shaved ice cream. I couldn't finish it so I'm happy I received a large amount for an acceptable price  I will recommend it and go with friends for the next one. The staff is friendly  this is my FAV cafe ever i always end my chinatownsoho excursions here and this is my go to for when im craving something sweet or if i  want to take someone somewhere cute i love the interior, its super cozy and cute for taking photos. Ive come here COUNTLESS TIMESSS throughout the last couple years and theyre consistently good! workers r also friendly, just an overall nice environment. Also there is a bathroom D my favorites are their matcha cheesecake bingsu, their choco oreo bingsu, and their red velvet latte on the sweeter side!!!  their latte art is so so cute too Simple and trendy. Good for the young crowds. The place is tiny but with ample seating space. There are pictures of KPop boy bands along the pillars. Ordered a matcha and cheesecake shaved ice. It's so big. It's good for 34 people to share. The staff behind the counter work really fast. They're very efficient and they communicate with you about the order. Deff would go here again. All I am going to say is delicious , I recommend , I went today with my friends and we agreed this spot is good. I like the menu. I ended up getting a strawberry matcha and some macaroons. I will be going back to try out more.

이름: ChikaLicious Dessert Bar introduces…•Tahitian Vanilla Burnt Basque Mille Crêpe
주소: 203 E 10th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
리뷰:
One of the most unique desert experiences NYC has to offer. Unique doesnt alway mean good but in this case it means amazing. The deserts always hit and give my taste buds a completely new experience that we always love. Highly recommend the tasting menu it always hits no matter what their current deserts are. Also the nicest people work here and they prepare everything right in front of you. Its is a little small and cozy inside but it doesnt even bother us. All around fantastic worth the trip every time! An extremely pleasant dessert omakase experience!
Ordered the new product tiramisu mochi and was immediately impressed! The texture was cloudlike, yielded to your teeth easily. The coffee flavor and the creamy flavor blended so well together. I would recommend order one for each because you will hate to share!
The oui quenelle set was thoughtfully designed. It started out with light, refreshing fruity flavors, then rich and buttery chocolate ones. You get diverse textures too  crispy, crumbly, crunchy, jiggly, fluffy
The presentation was beautiful. It truly pleased your eyes, nose and mouth at the same time. This morning, I had the distinct honor of being one of the first in the city to experience chikaliciousdessertbarnyc new revolutionary 7minute egg.

Yummmmmmelicious!

Chef Chicka combined her Japanese background with her French cooking expertise to create this perfect egg on a savory biscuit. Totally delicious  For an amazing dessert spot to satisfy your sweet tooth, this is the spot. These desserts are amazing and well thought out with tons of unique flavors and textures. I have been coming here for awhile and I am never disappointed in what I get. Make sure to get a personal tea pot to elevate the experience.

Staff were super friendly and bathroom was clean. Cozy spot so max 4 ppl for optimal experience. Reservations encouraged by not required. Wow, as a diabetic this was a real sweet but fun treat! Trying Omasake for the first time with desserts was definitely a tasty experience I enjoyed very much! All their options were amazing, and the tasting is new, so make sure you try it out yourself! I loved their homemade tea, too. It definitely was a fun solo time I'd definitely return. Make sure you check out the video of my experience on IG JadaExploresAll
