리뷰: Visited this cafe recently, and I had a fantastic experience! The customer service was topnotchso friendly and welcoming. The coffee was absolutely delightful, with a rich flavor that hit the spot. The barista was especially kindhs name is Matt, Highly recommend for anyone looking for a cozy spot to enjoy some great coffee and warm hospitality! Patisserie Chanson located in Flat Iron District has a summer afternoon tea menu with bottomlessmimosas. Come get your fix of booze, savory bites, sweet desserts, hot tea, and scones! Graba table and their friendly staffs will start preparing your afternoon tea delights. Afternoon tea includes seven different savory bites, six different sweets, and hot brewed tea. Supplement with bottomless mimosa for that extra kick. Pop a bottle of Prosecco and mix it up with fresh seasonal juices for four different flavors to enjoy. Everythingtastes as good as it looks. Different flavors of each bite and each glass of mimosa is simply too good to be true. After Patisserie Chanson closes in the evening time, theres also a speakeasy inside called Thyme Bar for a historical Prohibition experience. Come try one of NYCs best afternoon teas around! stopped here while running errands in the Flatiron. big spacious modern space very clean and brightly lit with some seating. there are counters of many different pastries. ordered a Kouign Amann to go and was a good choiceflaky layers of rich cake with a decent amount of sweetness. definitely pairs well with coffee. overall, the service was pleasant and quick. definitely would stop by here again if in the areathe prices bend to the higher side though. Tried their dark chocolate olive oil cake. It was nice and moist! The crunch cake was also delicious! It reminded me of a ferrero rocher cake If you are going to this place for a Kouign Amann, dont fool yourself. I was a regular customer pre covid and would always get the plain one. It used to be my favorite dessert in NYC. Today I was extremely disappointed after ordering a KA there that didnt look or taste like one at all. It looked more like a croissant in a cup, if you can picture that. On top of it all, it was stale. I asked them and I was told they have a new chef, which explains the whole situation. I did not try anything else recently so this review is based on my last order. The server was very sweet despite the low quality of the pastry.

주소: 17 Cleveland Pl, New York, NY 10012, USA
리뷰:
Sooo good!! A must try New York style cheesecake, that hits the spot . The shop is quite small and for the most part it's just a grab and go situation, as it's a popular spot that gets crowded quickly line moves very fast.

Taste is a bit lighter than traditional NY cheesecake like junior's, not too sweet yet still richcreamy and flavourful no matter what you go with loved the caramel, and classic strawberry, which is why I enjoyed it so much along with my friends definitely a crowd pleaser!. Even my friend who usually doesn't like sweets wanted to go back for more  I've never seen her like that!

I also like that they have all the flavours in a mini round size which is perfect for trying different flavourssharing an assortment. There's also a little roadside public space right across the street with lots of benches if you need a spot to enjoy your cheesecake, weather permitting.

Overall highly recommend, and I will be returning the next time I visit the city. This is definitely the most addictive cheesecake Ive ever had. It probably has a lot to do with how it comes in small bitesized servings making you instantly reach out for another one. Maybe also because it comes in so many delicious flavors and youd have to get through a lot of combinations to find your favorite. Or maybe its really just rich and tasty and perfect in so many ways. This was my favorite pastry spot in New York. Small, cozy, and full of charm. The staff is incredibly friendly, and the cheesecakeswhether classic or with fruit toppingare amazing. Theyre not huge, but they dont need to be because the quality is outstanding. A fivestar recommendation and a mustvisit! Tried 4 flavors of their personal sized adorable cheesecakes  mango, coconut, pineapple, and strawberry.
Absolutely loved the mango, strawberry and pineapple cheesecakes, coconut was very mildly flavored as compared to the other three. The mango was the best !!!
The staff are super friendly, warm and welcoming. They have all the cheesecakes on the display. The service is pretty quick, and the line moves quickly, so it is not much of a wait. They accept both cards and cash payments.
This is a cute and cozy shop, with limited space to stand and eat, so we ate some and packed some more for later. Their packing was pretty good too.
100 would recommend coming here to try their cheesecakes. The portion size is perfect, and it's not too sweet and the flavours are yummy, but not overpowering.
Loooooved this place so much ! Delicious cheesecake. I got strawberry and Oreo. Oreo is usually my goto wherever I get cheesecake but I actually liked the strawberry more here which was delicious. The place was small, its a grabandgo joint. The line moved quick and we were in and out in no time. Id go back. It was good but I wouldnt make it a mustvisit type place.

리뷰:
This is AWESOME. This place has everything you need for a sunset experience in Manhattan.
I got the BON. The combination of Nutella, vanilla ice cream and the waffle is fantastic. Best waffle Ive ever had in my life the WMD! Made fresh and just as delicious as the name. Staff is very friendly and service was very quick. Service was nice BUT they dropped the plastic top of the milk on my coffee and I only noticed when I was finishing it and I thought there was a huge bug in my cup. People were nice but for an 8.00 coffee it wasnt worth it. Plus oat milk and regular milk are not far in price so they shouldnt be charging more for it. Especially not 2. Also they advertise coffee on a ceramic cup but only offer take out cups. I wasnt gonna leave a review.. but the plastic cap inside my coffee scared the ish out of me. Tables surrounding place are taken by homeless, which is not the coffee shops fault but it made it hard to stay and enjoy.. had to take it on a walk. This place was cool, I tried their smores waffle, I loved it so much!!!!

Service was really bad, they did not respond properly for the questions I asked. I thoroughly enjoyed my cup in the hearty of NY. The service was great. The pricing was a bit pricey.

리뷰: So happy theres a new hoteok spot in ktown! Its a nostalgic snack that I used to get when I lived in Korea and its a perfect snack during the cold months! Its crispy outside and chewy inside with nutty and sweet brown sugar center! Initially I thought it was a bit pricey but its big size made up for the price! Also the owners were so sweet and attentive!! Very good onsite blended yogurt. Have to consume in 30 minutes or they become liquid. Many flavors with real fruits. Ive been wanting to try this dessert spot and finally did, the drinks are not overly sweet and taste refreshing.  I had the strawberry banana yogurt drink and was surprised to taste the chunks of real banana.  Honestly this should be marketed as a breakfast meal, it was very filling but didnt make you feel like you were consuming something overly unhealthy.  Would recommend to try the drinks atleast once. The workers were attentive and polite. They seemed knowledgeable about their products and offered samples. 1010 would return. Nice taste and options. Got the pistachio and marshmallow scoop, two scoop is minimum apparently. Both tasted good.

주소: 55a Bayard St, New York, NY 10013, USA
리뷰:
Cute little dessert spot with a good variety of different fruity and savory options. They have bubble teas and some mango and coconut based deserts. We ordered the Three Sisters and the fruity coconut pudding. Both were great but the Three Sisters was excellent. Amazing mix of different textures and sweet flavor. This Taiwanese dessert spot really outdoes itself with an impressive variety of treats. We tried the Taro Coco, which perfectly highlighted the earthy flavors of taro with a delightful mix of coconut in various formsnoodles, jelly, and milkcreating a tantalizing dance on the palate. The addition of sago made for a phenomenal combination.

We were also thoroughly impressed with the Mango Pomelo Sago drink. Not only was it a feast for the eyes with its bright yellow and orange hues, but the flavors were outstanding. The sweetness of the mango and the tangy punch of the pomelo complemented each other perfectly, offering a taste sensation we hadnt realized we were missing until now.

The ambiance of Sugabox adds to the experience with its cute, authentic decor, clean and inviting tables, and fast, friendly service that makes you feel right at home. A true gem in Chinatown and a mustvisit for dessert lovers! A true gem in Chinatown! We stopped in on a 90 June day and were greeted with a warm smile and friendly faces. Our party of five split the Taro Coco bowl and a traditional boba tea. The Taro Coco bowl had so much in and was so fun to eat! We all loved the noodles and boba as well as the fresh fruit and all this had to offer. I highly recommend and would make this a stop on my next trip to Manhattan! 10 out of 10! New dessert and drink spot in Chinatown.  Nice atmosphere,  ordered the Taro mochi milk tea and added water chestnut pop boba as extra topping, love it.  Their dessert looks very special, will definitely come back to try. 3.75 Three Sisters  a lot of fun textures but flavors were very mild. I especially wished the pandan and the osmanthus tea jelly was more strongly flavored, as everything taste wise was easily drowned out by the coconut milk.

주소: 225 E 60th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
리뷰:
Nice diner with unique and delicious frozen hot chocolate and other items with a "huge" menu, literally . Fun, colorful and festive decor. A tourist destination or trap , it's still a  great rest stop to recharge with sweet treats and American fare of comfort food after a long day of sightseeing and walking . And definitely kids friendly  but recommend reservation to have the best timing for seating  The atmosphere was to die for from the street! Its so charming and colorful and airy. And the food was amazing. Im not sure how people managed to eat dinner AND dessert, but someday I will! We only did dessert this time but every time food walked by it looked and smelled amazing!! If only you could get ice cream to go. This will have to be a place to visit every time were in town. This was our third visit, which did not disappoint!  Food is always yummy while the Frozen Hot Chocolate was SCRUMPTIOUS!!
Leo, the Manager was so pleasant and most accommodating to our requests. Looking forward to our next trip! Serendipity is a mecca known for chilled desserts like the celebrated Frozen Hot Chocolate. Located in the tony Upper East Side in a townhouse that is decorated with flair, it is hard to miss it on East 60th Street. Opened in 1954, this restaurant has had many customers including lots of celebrities. Their large menu is a delight and takes a while to read.

We were a party of five and three of us were celebrating birthdays. Es ordered the Forbidden Broadway Sundae which had a large slice of Chocolate Blackout cake, vanilla ice cream, hot fudge, whipped cream adorned with a cherry. Annie and her daughter also had the same sundae. Allan always chooses the Strawberry Fields Sundae which looks like two could share but he had it to himself till the end when he could barely eat another bite. This colorful sundae had cheesecake, strawberry ice cream, fresh strawberries, whipped cream and a cherry on top. I am fond of the Hot Fudge Sundae which I have had numerous times and know what it looks like. However what I got looked more like a composed dessert rather than the voluptuous sundae I was used to enjoying. My sundae had butter pecan and vanilla ice creams, hot fudge, whipped cream and a cherry. The fluted glass was slimmer and there was hardly any hot fudge dribbling down the sides of the glass nor had it gathered in a pool on the plate. I was bereft and asked for more sauce but it didnt quite do the trick. I ate as much as I could and Annie took the rest of the sauce home.

Service is fine here and everyone celebrating a birthday is given a lit candle on their dessert and the whole restaurant joins in to sing the birthday song. A unisex restroom which has lovely wallpaper is on the ground floor. The interior is a sight to behold. It is a very small place. The staircase is narrow so some may have difficulty walking up and down. I was sitting upstairs by the stairs and was run into a few times. The salad is a large size. The iconic frozen hot chocolate was good! I got the salted caramel one. It is good to try once but spending more than 20 for one is a bit much to me. Two salads and two frozen hot chocolates came out to 90 before tip.

주소: 119 Baxter St, New York, NY 10013, USA
리뷰:
Taiyaki NYC offers some of the most unique and delicious Japanese ice cream in the city! The soft serve in the fishshaped cone is both Instagramworthy and incredibly tasty. The flavors are rich, and the toppings are a fun, creative touch. However, at 9, its a bit on the pricey side for a dessert. While its a splurge, the experience is definitely worth it, especially if youre looking to treat yourself to something special. Just be prepared for the price tag. Overall, a delightful and memorable experience! The ice cream is decent, but not memorable. I had expected the cone to be larger considering that the average price for a serving is over 9. Overall, the concept is very cute and aesthetic, but the food is nothing special. Would order again if I passed by. Taiyaki NYC is an absolute gem! From the moment you step inside, you're greeted by the warm and inviting aroma of freshly made taiyaki. The soft, fishshaped waffles filled with creamy, rich ice cream are nothing short of perfection. The combination of the warm, slightly crispy taiyaki with the cold, flavorful ice cream is a match made in dessert heaven.

The variety of flavors and toppings is impressive, offering something for everyone, whether you prefer traditional Japanese flavors like matcha and red bean or more classic tastes like vanilla and chocolate. The presentation is also Instagramworthy, with every cone crafted to look as good as it tastes.

The staff is friendly and efficient, making the experience even more enjoyable. If you're looking for a unique and delicious treat, Taiyaki NYC is a mustvisit. Highly recommended for anyone with a sweet tooth! Well, it's an american ice cream in a fish cone, which is pricey...
Kids love the design of the cone, the little additions gummy ears, but it's just a basic ice cream.
Small bench to sit inside, so just enjoy the ice cream while walking around. This is what life is all about perfect softserve ice cream in full bloom, sitting in a cone that is shaped like a fish and ornamented with candies. I always go with matcha and hojicha, a beguiling blend of sugar and smoke, but I feel certain you cannot go wrong here. The staffers are always super nice, efficient, even heroic when its busy. You should visit.

주소: 63 Bayard St, New York, NY 10013, USA
리뷰:
After walking around Chinatown in the hot summer weather and having a spicy lunch, my husband and I needed something to cool down. Since he loves mango, we decided to stop by Mango Mango Dessert, attracted by their cute window display. The caf is SUPER tiny, which made me feel a bit claustrophobic, so we opted for takeout. I ordered the mango strawberry smoothie, and it was incredibly refreshingjust what we needed to cool off. The dessert options look amazing, so Im excited to try more next time! I have never been disappointed! The prices are affordable and the desserts are really delicious! I love any dessert that has a mango. I love their smoothies, tiramisu, cheesecake, etc. I haven't tried the hot menu yet drinks, purees, among others I'm waiting for winter to try them for the first time.
I would recommend you try anything! Really, nothing will disappoint you unless you are allergic to some ingredient. In Brooklyn they have a place with a little more space. This location was my first time going and as I saw that the space was very small I preferred to buy to go. I hope one day they can to have a establishment with more space. I really loved the Mango Pancake!! It was super fluffy and not too sweet! The mango and the whip cream were very light the mochi skin wrapped it all together in a delicious bundle.  The staff were also very nice and got us our order really quickly. The bag we got was very cute and high quality, definitely worth our optional 2.50 tip! I always go to Mango Mango when Im in Chinatown NY! Most of the time we stop each day to enjoy a refreshing mango dessert! My favorite is the Mango Juice with Watermelon and Rice Balls. I love the texture and chewiness of the rice balls. The only reason I took away a star is the seating. There isnt a time limit for customers so you can be waiting for a long time. Personally, I dont believe they need table service where they bring out water. I never drink it and it makes you feel more obligated to leave a tip. They also have a 10 minimum for credit card use. No public restroom. This place is a great dessert spot!  Mango Mango Dessert  serves a delicious  selection of sweet desserts and ice cream!  Definitely get the Snow  White  Mango Juice  Sago  Pomelo with Mango Ice Cream!  Service is quick  and the staff  is friendly and welcoming! They have limited indoor seating  so arrive early.  I wish I came here sooner!

이름: Amorino Gelato - New York Times Square
주소: 721 8th Ave, New York, NY 10036, USA
리뷰: It was a work of art. We enjoyed our gelato there. I especially loved the Lime and Basilica flavor. Nothing would taste too sweet. I felt balanced by the sophisticated tastes. The Best Gelato ever!! The first time I tried this, Gelato was in Spain. I love all of the flavors they have. The way of serving the Gelato is unique. Great quality and service. You won't regret it.  150 recommended it  Jason was incredibly helpful throughout my visit. He kindly suggested various flavors and assisted me in selecting one that suited my dietary preferences. His friendly and courteous demeanor made the experience even more enjoyable. I ultimately chose the coconut flavor, which was absolutely delicious. Jason's artistic skills were evident in the beautiful presentation of my dessert. Delicious cool treat on a hot and humid NYC summer day.  A nice choice of flavors.  A little confusing flow to the ordering system.  Expensive for the portion they give.  The staff isn't the friendliest in the world. They weren't rude or anything, just not friendly or welcoming. I tried the ice cream at this shop, hoping to recapture the experience I had with Amorino in other countries. While the ice cream itself was decent, it wasn't quite as good as those experiences. Unfortunately, the service and ambiance fell short of expectations. Despite having a good number of staff, the service was disappointing. Staff seemed disinterested and unhelpful, barely answering questions. The place itself was extremely dirty, with overflowing trash cans and sticky floors. The bathroom was particularly unpleasant, the dirtiest I've encountered in NYC. Given the high prices, I expected a much better overall experience. While I might try their ice cream again elsewhere, I definitely won't be returning to this specific location.

주소: 204 E 10th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
리뷰:
I hosted a bridal shower for my daughter at the East Village location in Sept. 2024.  Everything about this venue was wonderfulthe service, from planning to the event itself the atmosphere the food.  Everyone had a delightful time.  Planning the party long distance was easy thanks to Katy.  I had no doubt all would go smoothly and it did.  The tea service was delicious and the extras on the buffet were enjoyed by all.  I highly recommend this venue for any special event! First time trying Prince Tea House and absolutely loved it! Their tea are amazing! They have a great variety of teas even going to cocktails and cocktails! And their dessert is absolutely amazing! Definitely recommend this place to anyone, great for a date or just having some tea time. Service was great too, they came around and asked if we needed anything just the right amount of times. 1010 for everything. Try the coconut panna cotta and their mango crepe cake! Visited Prince Tea House for an afternoon treat and it was absolutely delightful! The Afternoon Tea for One set was a journey through exquisite flavors, starting with an array of finger sandwiches of each one tasty and wellprepared, from the truffle egg salad to the smoked salmon with scallion cream cheese. And the Granola Greek Yogurt, which was refreshing and filled with a great mix of textures.

The highlight for me was the Purple Yam Souffl, served with red bean ice cream. It was uniquely flavorful, perfectly fluffy, and not too sweet, definitely a musttry! I also enjoyed the Boba Affogato, a creative twist on the classic affogato.

The Tie Guan Yin Oolong Tea paired beautifully with the meal, enhancing the overall experience with its soothing aroma and taste. Highly recommend Prince Tea House for anyone looking for a sophisticated yet comforting tea experience. Cute and chill place to meet up and chat with friends. Even though we got the wrong order of fries the waiter was super nice and switched it. The wait time for food was quite long, around 20 minutes even though the shop wasn't that busy. At least the twister fries were super good, crunchy on the outside but soft and fluffy on the inside

The salmon SLT was pretty good but they could've put more cream cheese and more filling because it was kinda dry. The salad on the side was nice but there wasn't enough dressing so some greens were dry. The salmon itself tastes fresh and had a good flavor and overall good presentation 

 The eggs benedict was alright,  the salmon became cooked since it was left out too long. But their poached eggs were sooo good, perfectly cooked with a runny yolk and very creamy which acts as the perfect sauce for the bread and greens. I had a lovely experience here with my friend. We came on a Sunday close to 1pm, and were able to secure a seat right away. We had the afternoon tea for two which cost 70 combined. I would say the price is worth it considering it's unlimited tea and a filling amount of food. I would recommend asking for caffeine free tea for anyone who is sensitive to too much caffeine. I would come again to try their other items.

Nice little spot for well presented ice cream with fun toppings.
Very allergen friendly including having a good number of gluten free options entire shop is vegan.

Bit pricey like many things in NYC but, has outdoor seating with great people watching so serves as a nice place to take a break and have a snack. Absolutely love this vegan dessert place! The variety of treats is impressive, and each one is a delightful explosion of flavors. From Strawberry Shortcake to Coffee Waffle Crunch, everything is so indulgent yet guiltfree. This vegan dessert spot is a true hidden gem!!! Was caught by surprise that this place was vegan. Casey the lady working the front was fantastic explained everything on the menu to me. She deserves a raise fantastic customer service. The ice cream was delicious and I couldnt even tell it was vegan. Would definitely recommend this place. Very affordable as well. Thank you for the vegan treat! We had the SMore ice cream and it was so incredibly tasty. The Graham crackers was crunchy, the ice cream silky, the fudge was just enough and the toasted marshmallow was a great touch. Worth the stop! The staff is really friendly and nice! I just thought this was really hyped up, I think its too expensive for the price but other than that it was fast and easy. The ice cream is as really good and its a big plus its vegan! I got smores and it was good. Perfect t portion but just should be cheaper

리뷰:
Been coming to this spot for over 10 years. Best desserts late night when craving sweets. Always order the Nutella, banana, strawberry, ice cream, whipped cream Terrible service. Came by today at 1 pm, on google the opening time is 1230. Me and my friend were told that we cannot order, I asked why and the employees covered the entrance with trash cans and proceeded to ignore us. I used to come here sometimes and the service was better, staffing needs an update. Quick and delicious. Unsure of where to get dessert we passed this place and we're not disappointed. Ordered s'mores and it was marshmallow googy and chocolaty I love crepes but this was the worst crepe I ever had! We had a crepe with Nutella and banana. The dough was dry, hard and too thin. The Nutella was way too much  not sure if they put so much to mask the badly done dough the crepe was then covered with powdered sugar  also not sure why that was on top if I didnt order powdered sugar.  On top of that it was quite pricey. Can absolutely not recommend. Save your money and go somewhere else. This is one of our favorite crepes place in the city. Whenever my best friend visit town, we go to this place for strawberry Nutella crepes with ice cream and the famous crepes, these are my favorite ones. They have other options which are decently good. We usually take out as this place is on street so sometimes its hard to eat there. This place is CASH ONLY, ensure you get cash before ordering. Service is below average as it is more like pay and get your order.

Response We specifically asked about are you guys only CASH, she was like yes always. I saw card paying machine and thats why asked, none mentioned it is cash only because of no network or whatever, they said it is cash only.

주소: 1178 Broadway, New York, NY 10001, USA
리뷰:
I've eaten Lady M cakes ever since they first opened up a shop in NYC. Their cakes are high quality. Great tasting and never too sweet.
This location is okay.
There were people sitting outside the entrance steps which was annoying because it blocks 1 of 2 pathways to access the front door. But seating inside is limited.
It's a small space with a few tables inside.
The staff is very nice and helpful.
They did not have pistachio mille crepe at this location when I visited.  And it is what I wanted.
I ended up getting guava instead.  It was a bit slimy bc of the jam layers. When did lady m cake slices get so small? Is it just me or do they keep getting smaller and smaller? It's quite pricey for such a small slice of cake imo. But very delicious. The experience here was not as great as I expected. The cake slices were too sweet for me, and it was a bit overpriced but the signature Mille crepe was really tasty. Also, even though they are closing at 6 pm, the guy started to put all the chairs on the table around us. We had the feeling we had to hurry even though we had more than half an hour before closing. Dropped by for dessert and enjoyed the lavender mille crpes. The cake was soft with a delicious flavor. The cafe's interior is very simple and modern, and made for a nice place to take a break. A delightful experience. My favorite is their matcha green tea crepe. It is layered with smooth and creamy cream and not too overly sweet. Perfect soft and moist layered of crepes with consistent cream layering. The taste is heaven. I got to try their Rose Tea Latte as well and it was pretty good with smooth creamy rosy flavor. The service is great. One lady, I am not sure if she is the manager or server, lend me an Iphone charger. They have variety offerings and very diverse on their offerings. I also tried their original crepe with very creamy layer of cream. Great birthday cake, everyone was happy.  Some friends who didnt know Lady M before ordered again after having this

I went to the patisserie to eat dessert at night and everything was very fresh and delicious. I liked it very much. Also, the tolerance and attention of the staff working at night was very good. He was very attentive and made many recommendations and his products were really high quality and fresh. Thank you for your attention and service. Hope to see you again I went to this place because of the high rating on Google reviews, but it wasn't as I expected. They have a variety of cake slices. The customer service and atmosphere were okay. We ordered Belgian Mousse Cake and Earl Grey Tea. The cake wasn't fresh to me, and the taste was average. There are some seats for dining in. While exploring the Times Square, I saw this bakery that offers macros, and I went for it. The bottom line is that the macros were below average for such a high price. Otherwise, the service, seating, and atmosphere were great. There was only one staff working does makes the wait long. 2 tables inside for dine in but has 2 tables outside for al fresco dining. A little expensive but ok once in a while .. service was good . There were a few tables inside to sit and eat . They also had ice creams ..

We ordered few stuffs  just loved the Nutella filled croissant  was reallyyyyyyyy good .. was about 89 but good for 23 of us to share . .. we also got ice creams and kids loved it . We also got few cakes   strawberry cake was really good . Wanted to give 4 stars but it deserves a 5 star ..  little pricey but good .

We stumbled upon this place after lunch in Soho, and it was such a delightful find. The guy at the counter was incredibly kind, allowing us to sample as many flavors as we liked. Highly recommended! Very unique decor and atmosphere. Mini arcade games, lots of faux greenery, funky mirrors. Gelato was delicious as well, lots of flavors to choose from. Needed to use the restroom indefinitely. Came across his place shout out to the black man that guided us to the spot. The atmosphere was outstanding the customer service was beyond excellent, and the gelato was great. Highly recommended our order consisted of one small cup of gelato, the biscotti, the next order consisted of medium cup with gelato Amazing decor !! They also have a lot of vegan options, we tried the pistachio and the coconut flavours ! The outdoor seating is amazing too  Cant wait to try more This place is awesome! Great decor, a beautiful outdoor courtyard and yummy, unique flavors. I was looking for a caf during the day to work from with WiFi. So many places in the neighborhood were packed or didnt have internet.

Bambino has WiFi and you can work from here. Its a great option instead of the overpriced cafs in the area.

This place is a great dessert spot!  Chocolate  DIP offers a nice selection of delicious  chocolatecovered sweets like fruit , crepes  , waffles , and more! Definitely get the Fruit Cup  with Strawberry  and Banana!  Staff  is friendly and service is quick.  They have some indoor seating  and the space is nicely decorated.  I wish I came here sooner!  Perfect little snack while roaming around the city. Prices are fair. I have only tried the chocolate covered strawberries and they are great every time! Also the packaging is very nice making it really cute for gifting. Small shop with a few tables. Quick service. This is literally one of my favorite desert spots I really love it. Everything is always 1010. I had the waffle stick with strawberries  banana. The employees are super chill if you like to create content! Perfect to kill the cravings strawberries and chocolate! I mean, look at that lots of non greasy chocolate with good strawberries for 9 bucks  its a deal AMAZING place!! If you have a sweet tooth, this place will be your new heaven. Hands down one of my favorite places to go to in NYC. Very affordable, 5 ONLY for a strawberry or waffle stick completely covered in milk  white chocolate!! Very rare to find these prices in the city.
Their chocolate crepes are the perfect level of sweetness  they have a good variety of menu items and toppings. This place is SO cute on the inside! Its pink and cozy with a beautiful flower wall that would be ideal for IG pics. The staff is incredibly nice and respectful which always keeps me coming back for more!!!

이름: Lady M Cake Boutique - New York City
주소: 36 W 40th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
리뷰:
I stumbled on this place after spending the afternoon relaxing at Bryant Park.  I spent 23 for two slices of cake.  More than I would have spent if I had seen the price inh.  But I'll have to say, they were both incredible.  I chose the checker and also the tiramisu.  The checker was okay, but the tiramasu was absolutely incredible.  Melted in my mouth.  The shop was very clean and had limited seating.  12 of the seats had reserved signs placed on their tables. The waitstaff was very polite and met my expectations.  I can't wait to bring my grandauggter some day soon! During our visit to New York, we stumbled upon the most delightful cheesecake spot I've ever encountered  hands down, the freshest and most delicious cheesecake I've ever tasted. It was simply PERFECT. Located in a prime spot near Bryant Park and the New York Public Library, this gem of a place offers not only mouthwatering cheesecake but also a charming atmosphere. The cheesecake was so rich and creamy, with a perfect balance of sweetness and tanginess. Every bite was like a little piece of heaven. What made it even more special was that the cheesecakes were beautifully layered, resembling a true work of art. Each layer added a unique texture and flavor, making it a culinary masterpiece. The location couldn't be better, right in the heart of Manhattan, surrounded by the bustling energy of the city. It was the ideal spot to sit back, relax, and savor every mouthful of that heavenly cheesecake. I highly recommend this place to anyone visiting New York City. Trust me, it's an experience you won't forget! good selection of layered cakes mille crepe. They have seasonal cakes. Salted caramel creamy and good but a bit too heavy. Strawberry is refreshing, sour and overall great. Lavender Matcha is good but nothing special. Price is on the higher end for NYC I did take out a slice of maroon and green tea crepe cake. So far, it was the most satisfying dessert in NYC to me Magnolia and Junior's were not my favourite. LOVED Marron as it is full of chestnut flavour. Green tea cake also had a very strong matcha flavour, so it was also great. Crepes taste a bit eggy though. As most of you know, "it is not too sweet" is the best compliment to a dessert in Asian culture. It was flavorful, fluffy, and not too sweet. Will visit before I leave NYC!

 edit I stopped by again today. The champagne cake had a hint of strawberry flavour, and the top gelatine jelly added great texture to it. The Pistachio cake had a great flavour natural pistachio flavour. I felt like both champagne and pistachio were a bit sweeter than other flavours. Tiramisu had a strong coffee flavour, and it was the sweetest among other flavours.

My favourites were Marron  Champagne  PitstahcioMatcha  Tiramisu If you've just finished your meal and are looking for something sweet to finish it off, you should definitely stop by Lady M! I like how the cakes here aren't too sweet, but it will do the job if you have a sweet tooth. I highly recommend sharing with a friend or two because I don't have a big sweet tooth myself. The staff was so friendly! The natural lighting is also great for all the food pics you may snap while you're here. The cakes are beautiful! They have a singular bathroom, but I appreciate how clean it was. Lady M is right by Bryant Park, so you could also order a slice of cake to go if you want to enjoy the outdoors. My recommendation is the early grey. Great place for dessert if you need a place to go!

주소: 1626 Broadway at, W 49th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
리뷰:
Such nice folks  excellent service! Everyone was so welcoming  friendly.

The food was OK nothing to write home about but it came fast  we were hungry. The prices are high for what you get. The fried cod was delicious, but the sides were a little bland  the ribs needed more sauce  were a little tough.

If we had kept walking just a few blocks, we would have seen many more restaurants  the prices get better as you get further away from Times Square. So you're definitely paying a premium for Junior's prime location.

Bathrooms are available  while the restaurant was packed there was no wait to eat on a busy Friday night because they had plenty of staff. We appreciate them being a welcoming place on our first night ever in New York City! We stopped by Juniors while walking through New York City and decided to try their famous cheesecake. The place looked quite full, but we got seated right away, and the staff was quick and attentive. We asked for recommendations and ended up with a raspberry cheesecake and a strawberry cheesecake. Both were absolutely amazing! The texture was creamy, cheesy, and full of flavor  easily some of the best cheesecake we've ever had.

Our waitress was very attentive, checking in on us and making sure our waters were refilled. We had no complaints at all, just an overall fantastic experience. Definitely worth five stars! We came here for dinein lunch on a Saturday and it was not too busy. We ordered the fish and chips, the corned beef sandwich, and the kids' menu linguine marinara. They were all kind of bland, nothing stood out as tasting very good. For dessert, we had the strawberry cheesecake and some of us liked it while others thought it tasted too artificial. That being said, the service was fast and friendly. Not planning to come back. First, I need to mention that our server Gregory was kind, patient and very knowledgeable with the menu. Food was great, very delicious and quality. We got the seasonal key lime cheesecake and it was light, definitely not overpowering with artificial flavors. I know its a tourist trap, but I still love their food.  It a New York, so dont expect an inexpensive meal, but its worth it.

I have to grab a slice of cheesecake every time I come here, but their sandwiches are surprisingly good too.  Service is hit or miss, but they are usually nice and friendly.  The restaurant is always clean.

The Pao de queijo is a must this every fan cheese should try here. Im a huge fan of Pao de queijo or chipa and I really liked the crunch and soft inside cheese of these. Pure cheese no excess of flour, highly recommend it ABSOLUTELY INCREDIBLE! please expand to richmond, va 

the dulce de leche coffee was perfect  the everything bagel seasoned po de queijo was too. if I lived nearby yall would see me daily, 1010, could not recommend more This was a very neat cafe that focused on Brazilian flavors. I will say I thought the food may have over shadowed the beverages but I also don't drink coffee so don't hang on my word there. I got a matcha latte I've had better but obviously I don't think that's what this place specializes in so I think it can be forgiven. I had the a croissant sandwich and my lady had these prosciutto sandwiches sorry I don't know the exact names they we're both outstanding albiet maybe on the pricey side but you're in the seaport district so it's to be expected. Such a cute bakery! Excellent Brazilian cheese bread and caramelized banana bread. The dulce de leche latte was also delicious. Highly recommend! Tiny little Cafe in this lovely area. Speciality is their little cheese breads which sold at 5 ball pieces for6. I can say they are quite delicious and came in traditional cheese, kalmata olive, and gluten free versions.

The Bacon and Egg toastie was also delicious.

The cafe is small.. seating a max of 15 people along a line of 5 small square tables but it seems to work fine with a large number of customers popping in for takeaway orders.

The staff are super helpful, friendly and even though you bus your own table, there is a jovial, familial feel to the cafe that serves it well.

Highly recommend pit stop if you're in the area.

리뷰:
Some of the products were almost out, so they were putting fewer ingredients. It wasn't worth it for the money we gave. It was flavorless. We watched how crepes were made in San Francisco for 3 minutes, so here it felt even longer when we had to wait. I ordered the shrimp avocado, and they put only 4 shrimps that were bland. And too much wasabi sauce, so I didn't taste anything else. My friend got the shrimp tempura that was way too spicy and was missing ingredients. And his drink was nothing special too. Maybe this place is way better if you get the sweet crepes, not the savory. The Litchee crepe was really good. Crispy with generous filling. The fruit was fresh. You can order at the kiosk or directly at the register. The place is small, only two tables, but waiting time wasn't too bad. I'd come back to try other crepes! Im a frequent tswirl customer at other locations. I ordered the spicy crabmeat, probably my 6th time getting it. The first thing I notice is it felt slimmer than usual.

Few bites into it I felt its lacking something. Without the crunchiness of Shallots, the texture is subpar. Edamame and Sesame seeds are nowhere to be found either. Seaweed salad? I MAY have tasted a strand or two. Not enough to tell that it was actually present and so as the sesame dressing.

If you are sold out on half the ingredients then at least let the customer know. It isnt fair asking customers to pay full price for half lacking crepe while charging extra for every  single additional ingredients.

Disappointing. I've never had a crepe before so I really wasn't expecting much. I thought they would be one of those things that look better than they taste... Boy was I wrong! These looked great but they tasted even better. I'm not sure what kind of magic unicorn tears they are stuffing in these things but it sure is good.
Unfortunately, we opted to share one, which quickly devolved into a fight to get the next bite once we realized how good these were. So get your own, or be prepared to battle for every bite. I am still carrying the scars from that mistake.
We had just eaten a fantastic lunch across the street and hopped in here for dessert. If we hadn't already eaten I would have tried one of their savory crepes, they look delicious.
I will definitely stop by here again if I ever get the chance and I will be darn sure to get my own, screw sharing! The crepes were very very good and extremely tasty. We ordered both sweet and savory crepes and both of them had sufficient filling, and tasted very good. The workers were nice and overall it was an enjoyable experience. The place is relatively small so be prepared to take out. Overall, 1010 recommend.

리뷰:
Cute place in Little Italy that we found via researching. It came highly recommended by locals for desserts. We stopped in and had coffee and dessert. The staff was super friendly and fun at the dine in section. Everything we had was amazing! Thanks to everyone who recommended it! Went to Ferrara late morning during the week when it was not too busy in the cafe.

Got a double espresso and a lobster tail,  which ran me 6.25 and 12.50 respectively.   I'm not sure if the cafe prices are higher than getting it to go,  but 12.50 for a lobster tail is beyond overpriced even for a tourist location.

This lobster tail was perfection all around.. perfect flaky shell and the cream filling was about the best I've ever had.   Made me feel a little better about that price.     Friendly service from my server Carmelo.

Overall would recommend... just expect to open the wallet I just had to try a New York cheesecake while visiting NYC, and it was fantastic  light and fluffy for a cheesecake. I highly recommend it.

However, the gelato I had there was the most expensive I've ever had, and it wasn't worth the price.

Lastly, the single aisle for takeaway was very narrow, making it hard for customers to browse and for others to pass through to pay.

There's a little sheltered outdoor bench to enjoy your delightful treats if you do not want a full sitdown service inside. If you're in New York City and have a sweet tooth or a love for Italian pastries, Ferrara Bakery  Cafe is a destination not to be missed.

Upon entering, you immediately feel like a kid again. You can order delectable desserts to go or experience a sitdown breakfast that includes all the senses.

It's a mustvisit for anyone wanting to immerse themselves in the flavors and traditions of Italian baking right in the heart of NYC. We liked the desserts we ordered, we just wished that the wait to be seated and served wasnt 1hr and 40mins, respectively. Unfortunately for us, we ordered a fruit plate and were served barely washed rotten fruits. Sometimes the service and quality of food spoils the whole experience. As such, we wouldnt be coming back or recommending this place

이름: Amorino Gelato - New York Greenwich Village
주소: 60 University Pl, New York, NY 10003, USA
리뷰:
I visited this place because my friend wanted gelato. We were both drawn to the waffles, so we decided to get a Waffle with pistachio gelato and a chocolate macaron. The rich pistachio flavor paired with the whipped cream and waffle was amazingI couldn't get enough! We finished it all and left feeling satisfied! It has a wide variety of gelatos, a section of fruit gelatos and another milkbased section. Its flavor is exquisite and it does not contain too much sugar, which is pleasant to consume, it is so good. I highly recommend the " dulce de leche " , " stracciatella " and " raspberry " flavor ! . I stopped by for a quick snack and had a crepe with tiramisu and caramel drizzle, topped with dark chocolate sauce, as well as a cone of gelato with mango, strawberry, and vanilla flavors. The taste was amazing! The ambiance is great, with both indoor and outdoor seating areas. I was on a casual stroll with my friends and we wanted to stop by a cafe to get ourselves  a quick cup of coffee and found Amorinos on our way so we passed by.

I got myself a nice flat white and some macaroons, absolutely beautiful and tasty the both. The flat white had a very good balance between the coffee and milk which really elevated my day, unlike most other places where they always overdo one of them. As for the macaroons the overall texture and creaminess was very rich in flavor which really made it melt all the way in my mouth. I got a pistachio flavored one and my friend got hazelnut.

Would definitely recommend passing by this Gelateria, ill be coming back to give their gelato a try and give another google review Gelato and macaroons are a blend of creaminess and sweetness with an indescribable element of uniquely delicious flavor. It was also nice to see the gelato being made live
That being said the cones and waffle sticks were dry and flavorless to the point where it detracted the flavor of the gelato. The must try despite looking very decadent had the only redeeming qualities of the gelato and macaroon which were a very small portion of the dessert.
I would highly recommend SOLELY getting gelato in a cup as all other elements are subpar and overpriced.
My rating would most likely be much higher if I only tried the gelato

주소: 401 Bleecker St, New York, NY 10014, USA
리뷰:
Magnolia Bakery in the West Village is a mustvisit destination for anyone with a sweet tooth! I recently indulged in their famous treats, and let me tell you, it was absolutely delicious. The moment you step inside, you're greeted by the warm, inviting aroma of freshly baked goods that instantly puts you in a good mood.

The highlight of my visit was definitely their iconic banana pudding, which is creamy, decadent, and simply divine. Its no wonder this dessert has garnered a loyal following! I also tried their classic cupcakes, and each bite was a delightful explosion of flavor, perfectly moist and topped with rich, buttery frosting. The variety of treats available makes it hard to choose, but everything I sampled was fantastic.

Beyond the delicious offerings, Magnolia Bakery holds a special place in pop culture history, particularly for fans of HBO's "Sex and the City." This charming bakery gained fame as one of Carrie Bradshaw's favorite spots, often featured in scenes where she enjoyed a sweet treat while navigating the ups and downs of life and love in NYC. The iconic image of Carrie walking down the street with a cupcake in hand has become synonymous with the bakery, making it a pilgrimage site for fans of the show.

The atmosphere in the West Village location is cozy and nostalgic, with a charming decor that adds to the experience. Its the perfect spot to sit back, enjoy a treat, and soak in the vibrant energy of the neighborhood.

Overall, Magnolia Bakery is not just a place to satisfy your sweet cravings its a slice of New York City history that continues to capture the hearts of locals and visitors alike. Whether you're a "Sex and the City" enthusiast or simply someone who loves delicious baked goods, a visit to Magnolia Bakery is an absolute delight! Delicious banana pudding. The other desserts I got were good but the banana pudding what they are known for was outstanding. Freshly made as well. The servers were friendly and took care of us quickly. They were restocking the display of vans pudding once we got there. I would recommend this place. A small, laidback bakery in West Village with wonderful desserts and the worldfamous banana pudding.

We stopped by specifically to try their banana pudding, but they also offer a wide variety of other desserts. Each month, they feature a special version of the banana pudding with unique flavour twists. You simply grab the pudding from a small fridge inside and pay at the counter. They provide cutlery and napkins, but thats about itthere are no tables to sit and enjoy your desserts.

The banana pudding lived up to the hype. It wasnt overly sweet or too rich, and the portion size was just right, making it a perfect quick dessert after lunch or dinner if youre in the area. Visit July 2024

The cafe was nice and had a wide selection of desserts. I wish there was a place to sit and enjoy it though. A little bit pricey for the desserts, but it was good. Got the key lime pie ice box. There was a strong lime taste and the creme was silky smooth. The base did a nice job to balance out the flavours and texture This Bakery does not disappoint!
As a sex and the city fan it was a must go. We started our bakery tour or Magnolia from the original location and then found them over the city.
We had a selection of bake goodies but the chocolate fudge cake  and the world famous Banana pudding exceeded expectations!
We bought the kit home but got told they ship worldwide .hopefully they do if not a trip back to NYC for this bakery alone is worth it.

리뷰:
Delicious tarts!  Creamy and full of flavor.  We were having a gathering and got an assortment of 12 tarts buy 10 get 2 free. They were wonderful and everyone loved the tarts.  Not too sweet.  Friendly staff, not a large space, mostly takeout.
Street parking The store is accessible , but located in Chinatown, on Mott Street  which is a one laneone way street, heavily trafficked with cars, trucks and people.  Its difficult to find parking and to manage the crowded sidewalks. Walked in because I wanted something sweet. Didnt know any info about this little bakery.
OMG what an absolute wonderful surprise! We inhaled all of it in minutes. The flavors were rich and delicious without overkill. Adding it to my list so I can go back and bring my friends as well. Yummy little cheesecake tarts sold in a tiny little shop. Tiny tiny space.  Only two little tables.  Low lite.  They also sell bubble tea. I had Lemon and also strawberry milkshake. Everything is very cutesy. The ube and cheese tarts were nice as was the ube cold brew.  The space and seating is limited in size so take out is the way to go. Not much to say, just some really great tarts. i tried all of them and they did not disappoint. my favorite was the ube one. give them a try!

리뷰: I went a few months ago. The server was super friendly and kind extremely patient and helpful. I got a slice of the raspberry crepe cake I believe. It was so yummy and perfectly tart balancing the sweetness from the crme and the crepes. Its a little pricier than I would like, but for the location and quality, the price is expected. We were impressed by the 2 desserts infused by Sake we had recently. The Dassai Blue Mille Crpes was light and not too sweet with delicate flavor. 주소: Inside Tiger Sugar, 197 Canal St Shop 2, New York, NY 10013, USA
리뷰: Not tasty. The syrup was weird and just was plain bad. There was practically no ice even though I ordered it with ice. Menu was tiny and options were limited. They didnt even tapioca which was weird since theres some right next door. Definitely not authentic Small Taiwanese desert shop in a shared space with Tiger Sugar. Limited seating and it can get pretty crowded with lines for Tiger Sugar. You order at the kiosk. There are 8 bowls to choose from and you can add extra toppings. Theres also few drink options as well. IMO MetFresh is a lot better. The ingredients didnt seem very fresh. The taro balls were hard and not very chewy, like it has been sitting for a while. The grass jelly was also way too dense like hard jello. The tapioca jelly and taro was ok and the soup was refreshing. My order was made really fast and the sole worker that was manning the shop was very kind. I hope they can improve. I love Taiwanese desserts and theres not enough shops that offer them. What I got today was nothing that looks like the first reviewer's filled bowl with a reasonable amount of fillings. I got very sad little pieces of taro in my taro series bowl and few red and mung beans. I took the pictures while scooping what's in the bowl otherwise it'd be just brown water. However my two stars are for the taste itself. It was underwhelming and the taro pieces and red beans and mung beans were way too sweet. The ingredients also didn't taste fresh. Best green tea ice cream in New York City. Ingredients are of very high quality. The level of sweetness is just right. The texture is perfect. Look forward to trying the other flavors! Love the herbal jelly set! Very authentic that they pair the herbal jelly with cream! Their toppings also have a good texture. My friend and I are both Taiwanese and we were obsessed.

주소: 11 W 32nd St, New York, NY 10001, USA
리뷰:
Ive been wanting to try this place for ages and its so good  such a great spot for desserts for all types of cravings. Whether its a thick french toast with ice cream, or a matcha fondant with ice cream, or a cheesecake disguised as a plant pot.

Excellent desserts all round! Shared three between four people. A great way to end a night after eating savoury foods.  Spot is located on the top floor of a really interesting Korean food court. We had the Big Orange, which was an orange chocolate mousse cake. It had an orange exterior with a nice glaze on it, a layer of mousse, some chocolate cake, and then a hard biscuit bottom. We really loved it! It wasn't really a groundbreaking flavor, but we would definitely get it again. It was really good and well crafted. Went with a few friends during the week and had a hard time finding this place. Located on the top floor inside a food mall, your senses are overwhelmed as you make your way up the flights of stairs. I almost didnt make it to the dessert bar because I wanted everything else before it.

There is a lot of hype for this dessert bar and maybe this location isnt the better of them but I dont see from where the hype comes. Ordered 5 different desserts waffle with ice cream, a potted plant, matcha green tea, and a yuzu dessert, and they were good and not cloyingly sweet but not memorable. Points are awarded for presentation and creativity, though.

Ill be back for a second time after I try all the other savory food options in this same space Desserts are definitely pricey for a cafeteria style location but the food was good. Delicious fresh and well presented. The cafeteria itself is too loud and dirty and crowded though. Should've went to St Mark's location instead. I do recommend the golden toast though. Cool place! Pretty creative desserts, nice presentation despite the fact that this place is actually one of the vendors in a food court. I tried matcha lava cake. Very rich taste and good texture. The entrance is not right on the street, so might be a bit difficult to find at first. It's located on the 2nd floor of the food gallery 32 2floors, not 1.5, so you'll need to take 2 flights of stairs. Opens at 11am but gets pretty busy by 1 or so.

주소: 20 W 23rd St, New York, NY 10010, USA
리뷰:
Overall an amazing experience. Most of the desserts are very original and well thought, yet there were one or two that although very delicious felt like you can get them at the chanson bakery up the stairs.

The theatricality and presentation are right on point, adding both flavor and experience value.

Service is fantastic and very attentive yet at times a little too much.

I am already inlove with the Chanson Bakery and thier high tea and brunch but was definitely a whole new level.

It is a must experience for every New Yorker and tourist. What are wonderfully delicious spot here on the cusps of flatiron and Chelsea.
This little spot is adorable with plenty of seating out front and in the back.
Completely handicapped accessible. And easily accessed by train, bus or car.
Wonderful little sandwiches and snacks. Plus there's coffee and beverages.
Everything tastes good!
The staff is friendly and helpful. Definitely check this place out.
desert Update 62219 Actually did the entire dessert tasting complimented with a cocktail for each dish, it is a true must do. The host Jeff is amazing in his deliverance and demeanor. The desserts were all put together right in front of you enchanting the experience so much more. They are very intricate with appealing to your sense of smell along aide taste. Its not cheap, but to enlighten you taste buds, have an amazing ambience, be entertained by cool staff, this is a must for everyone. Do it, do it do it. Very elegant dessert bar. Theres a 6 course tasting option, some might like that. A must try if u can get a table! What an experience!!! Went to celebrate my friends 30th birthday and it was such a treat! The dessert tastings flowed so nicely together, presentation was perfect and everything tasted delicious! Nice atmosphere with incredibly friendly and knowledgeable staff. Chef Rory MacDonald really knows what hes doing and I applaud him and the whole Dessert Bar team! Thank you for a wonderful experience well be back! More like 3.5 stars, but we are not allowed to give a half star...
I learned during my first visit to Patisserie Chanson that they have an eveningnight face that is even more exquisite and sexy, with tasting menu of nothing but high end, unique, creative desserts! The entrance is located right next to Patisserie Chanson, but the waiting area is actually the front part of the closed up Patisserie Chanson.

We got their 915pm reservation. We received a text from theme earlier in the day, asking us to make sure we arrive on time because they start right at 915pm. But, when we got there a few minutes before that, they were not ready to receive us. When they were finally ready, they came and took one or two couples at a time. Everyone was brought to their seat around 935pm. So, even thought the text said they start right on time, they really didn't...

Anyways, the inside is quite small, with about 10 or so bar seating, and three sofas that can seat total of six. The seat at the bar counter is where the action is, you get to chat with the chef, and also you get to see all the dessert creations right before your eyes.

When we sat down, we were giving a small ball of popcorn. It was Chili and Lime Sesame Popcorn, which is intended to make you crave some sweets. It was quite spicy!

Then, we got what I thought was some kind of plants in a pot. But no, they were some veggies and cheese, disguised as plants! Another little appetizer before the real dessert tasting course.

At the beginning, we were told a few rules. First, anything that is on the silver grate, they are not ready to be eaten yet. Don't eat until they tell you it is ready. Another thing is the use of flash photography.

Another thing we were told is that the main chef, Chef Rory Macdonald was in Paris, and that another chef will be leading a show. Since we were not notified of this, we were quite dissapointed...

Anyways, the show must go on... They will serve us SixCourse Dessert Tasting Menu for two full hours. There was an option to add Cocktail and Wine Paring to go with it. We decided to get the full experience, so we got the pairing as well.

We had to taste Gin  Tonic Sphere, which is a cocktail on a plate. EVOO Eucalyptus, an olive oil gelato. Honey Rice Pudding with local honey. Ferrero Rocher, a hazelnut mousse. Miso Pink Grapefruit, miso pudding tart with gelato. Spiced Bosc PearTonka with gelato. And then a little extra treat, alcoholic gummy bears.

We had a good time here, everyone was super nice and polite, friendly and took care of all customers really well. But, the music was way too loud, it made it difficult to hear the explanations of the desserts and drinks. Also, we were told to ask questions and have conversations with the chefs, but they were just busy making desserts and not very friendly...

The desserts were good and it is fun to watch them make them in front of us. But at the end, none of them really stood out. I wanted to be wowed by their creations, but they didn't quite live up to my expectations. They were mainly some kind of gelato, small portion and not very exciting flavors. So, good but not unforgettable.  The experience itself was really fun though, it sure is memorable. Their tasting menu do change seasonally, so you can get different kinds of desserts from here.
영업시간: no operation time

주소: 185 Greenwich St, New York, NY 10007, USA
리뷰: The Westfield World Trade Center is a stunning architectural masterpiece. Inside, it feels like you're standing within the skeleton of a massive creature, with the white design adding a bright, airy atmosphere. The clean, modern aesthetic enhances the overall experience. The center features a wide range of branded shops for shopping enthusiasts, and just outside, there are various local food stalls offering diverse options. It's a fantastic area, conveniently located near the World Trade Center Meuseum, making it a great spot to explore. Its an open space in the middle of bustling city, where you can walk your dog or playing games that provided by the redbull around, there is no toilet or water fountain visible around the are. Its a nice place to spend your evening watching the bussiness around. Westfield World Trade Center is a stunning shopping destination in NYC that offers a truly unique experience. The architecture of the Oculus is breathtaking, with its futuristic design and expansive, lightfilled space. The mall features a fantastic selection of highend retailers, trendy boutiques, and a variety of dining options to satisfy any craving. The convenience of its location, connected to major subway lines and the PATH, makes it easily accessible. The atmosphere is clean, modern, and inviting, perfect for shopping, dining, or simply admiring the beauty of the space. Whether youre a local or a tourist, Westfield World Trade Center is a mustvisit for a memorable shopping experience in the city! Definitely my favourite place to shop in the city also the best place to people watch! Always end up spending more than I should but I suppose thats the point of the mall! Great access to trains too especially the path to jersey. This is such an awesome place after the event of 911. The place was rebuilt beautifully and with purpose. I didn't get a chance to explore fully, but next time, I will.

리뷰:
This place is great. It's a food market on one side and little popup shops on the other. The food looked amazing, but we didn't try any. We did, however, buy a couple of items from the popup shops. We bought a necklace from one and earrings from another. It's a really nice spot to try multiple foods in one spot. Great for a solo visit, a date, or a group of friends. The chocolate place here run by Daniel was amazing . I had to support a young business owner and he was on Netflix school of chocolate . Check him out his chocolate is top line. the best chocolate I've ever tasted I thought this was a really cute, clean, fun, and convenient indoor market. Im glad that I found this spot. They have alot of seating in the back plus restrooms. The shopping is right next door to the food vendors. The shopping includes handmade contemporary jewelry, vintage clothes some handmade, candles, houseware etc For food they have a variety of Asian foods from handmade chocolate, dim sum, japanese sushi boxes, noodle soups, and much more. Its a great spot to chill after a long tour day and for all ages too. They also have an area for games and toys perfect for the little ones. I highly recommend this market. As a market gal this was a must on my NYC list. If youre from Melbourne Australia, the equivalent would be the Rose Street Market in Fitzroy.
This market is split in two. Stalls on one side and eateries on the other.
Featuring top retail and design concepts, along with upandcoming players, canalstreetmarket is a must for those who appreciate homemade  handmade wares.
Loved the jewellery in particular showing unique talent with both design and metal.
Add to this the variety of little restaurants next door and youve got yourself a formula that has people visiting from around the globe.
Had myself a little chicken green curry with roti from betongcaferestaurant and it certainly filled my tastebuds with delight.
Retail Market Hours
Thursday  Sun 1100AM  700PM
Food Hall Hours
Mon  Sun 1100AM  800PM
A must visit when in New York City.

thewanderingreviewer canalstreet canalstreetmarket canalstreetnyc nycmarket Canal Street is a great spot to cool off under the shade, especially during hot weather. The store offers a relaxing atmosphere with its caf, making it a good place to grab a refreshing drink and escape the heat. Definitely worth a visit if you're in the area!

주소: 151 W 34th St., New York, NY 10001, USA
리뷰:
Macy's is perhaps the most recognizable department store in New York and one of its icons.
The 9story giant has a huge amount of products for sale from many brands. Unfortunately, on several occasions I myself found nothing there for myself.
For me, it's more as a tourist attraction than a store where I would shop.
An interesting feature is the wooden escalators, on the upper floors.
Excellent location right next to Times Square and the Empire State Building. Macy's is the quintessential New York City shopping experience!  Located in Herald Square, this flagship store is one of the largest department stores in the world, offering everything from fashion and beauty to home goods and accessories. The historic building itself is a sight to behold, with its beautiful architecture and classic charm.  Whether you're hunting for the latest trends, enjoying a bite at one of their eateries, or just marveling at the window displays, Macy's is a mustvisit. Don't miss their seasonal events and famous Thanksgiving Day Parade if you're in town! A true NYC icon that promises something for everyone.  Shop until you drop! Macy's largest store has massive eight floors right in the heart of Manhattan for those of you that love shopping!
Everything from fine jewelry to luxury goods to fashion and home and even kids toys courtesy of a Toys R Us, they have tons to shop from!
If anything, wear a good pair of shoes and be ready and patient. A lovely one stop shop for most of your needs and love for brands! Shopping is shopping with Macys is iconic Lighting was bright !

The escalators were built between 1920 and 1930 by the Otis Elevator Company, which pioneered the machinery. Theyre made of sturdy oak and ash, wood thats traditionally used in hardwood flooring. The mechanical parts have, for the most part, been updated, and modern safety measures have been put in place.

They might be updated and maintained regularly as per modern standards, but the nearly centuryold escalators arent going anywhere, despite how much they might creak. Much too big for me. You can easily spend hours in here, over 9 floors. Probably around three times the size of Selfridges in London. I imagine this would be a shoppers paradise. I did make some purchases but only visited the children and kitchen area and very briefly too. Also good selection of restaurants and cafes to relax in.

주소: 611 5th Ave, New York, NY 10022, USA
리뷰:
Saks Fifth Avenue is an iconic luxury department store located in New York City, known for its upscale shopping experience. The flagship store is situated right on Fifth Avenue and offers a wide range of highend fashion brands, including designer clothing, shoes, handbags, and accessories for both men and women.

The store is also famous for its stunning window displays, especially during the holiday season, which draw in crowds from all over. Inside, youll find beautifully curated departments, including beauty products, jewelry, and home goods. Saks often hosts exclusive events and promotions, making it a great spot for fashion enthusiasts. Plus, the ambiance is elegant and sophisticated, making shopping there feel like a special occasion. If youre into luxury fashion, its definitely a mustvisit! I really enjoyed my experience here. My coworkers and I visited this location in hopes of finding a nice Colgan. Once we arrived at the upper floor, the sales pitches were flying. I must say I learned a lot  in a small window. I watched a scent I selected being made for me. It was a nice experience. Iconic store that is a must visit if in new york. It has all the designer brands, there is something for everyone. Staff were great, store was clean and very busy. My daughter was mesmerised by the fashion. Would love to go back. I recently ordered 16 expensive silk ties from Saks's online store.

To my surprise, each of the ties arrived folded in a small plastic envelope. The first thing to know about silk ties is that they should never be folded. The mere act of folding will warp the fabric, which can ruin a tie.

When I unfolded them, my concerns were confirmed each tie had huge creases running from side to side. To undo the creases, I  ironed them gently using the Silk setting of my iron. Although that undid the creases, there was nothing I could do about those areas being warped from folding.

You would think that a store as reputable as Saks would know how to treat silk ties, but as of this writing, their packing process folding them into small plastic envelopes damages the ties. It is standard when shipping silk ties to avoid folding, either by laying them flat in longer boxes, or by gently rolling them up.

I hope for the sake of future customers that Saks adopts a more appropriate way of packing ties. I will complain to management to try to get them to improve their process, which I imagine has ruined hundreds if not thousands of fine silk ties by now.

Until they do, I would advise others to not buy any silk ties online from Saks. This department store is located on Fifth Avenue, across from Rockefeller Center, and at Christmas it's worth standing on the opposite sidewalk to watch the spectacular Christmas show. The 10story facade of the Saks Fifth Avenue department store makes it a can'tmiss spot. A two minute show of LED lights, repeated every 7 to 8 minutes.

Even if you don't intend to shop, a walk inside is a mustdo experience. The windows of the department store are impressive, especially at night.

리뷰:
A place where you can shop a lot of luxury brand at the same time. When I visited I wanted to get a chanel bag. The gentleman helping us was helpful. Not very talkative and a bit sassy. But not disrespectful. So I dont really mind. I get to try some bags and finally decides on the classic. The one I tried was a bit less black so I asked if theres other options in the back and they gladly helped us find other same bags to choose. Overall it was an okay experience and we exit the place happily. Beware !!! Dont buy online from this store! Bought these Gucci slides for my husband for his birthday in May! He hasnt even had them for a year and this is the outcome in the picture below!! Ive bought plenty of pairs of these similar slides from the actual Gucci store, and they are still in good condition, after over three years of wear!  Not even sure if this company designer shoes are authentic!!!!!!!! BEWARE!!!  NEVER engage in online retail with Bergdorf Goodman!!!

I ordered a pair of shoes and tried them on in my home. As they were too big for my feet, I initiated a return in a timely manner. Bergdorf Goodman sent the shoes back saying that they saw sand on the shoes?  I spoke with a representative over the phone, and they would not accept photos showing the perfect condition of the shoes.  They would only consider allowing me to return the shoes IN PERSON to the NYC store for inspection but I would now be outside the return policy and live several states away down south.

What is sad is that I had been a happy customer of the store when I lived in NYC.  A willingness to relook at the case, a more diligent customer service may have prevented this message.

Do NOT engage in online retail with this company!!!  BEWARE! Horrible customer service!
I got this CL sandals few months back and only wore it twice and the red bottoms started peeling . Mind you , I have all kind of designer shoes for years that are still in perfect condition and I am very careful with shoes . After calling the store they told me pretty much I am on  my own fixing them . So if you have 800 to waste definitely visit  Bergdorf Goodman Very beautiful! Stunning displays. I don't know why but yesterday felt like they were renovating or something was off.

Overall, their collections aren't inclusive, not too many new or young brands. Nothing I haven't  already  seen for 2 years now. The 2nd floor shoe section was very dull and lackluster. The third floor has more variety but basically the same designers line up they seem to always have. Chanel, Valentino, Fendi, Prada, Givenchy etc. I skipped the clothing section this time cause it was a bit dull the last 2 times I went.

Nothing I haven't seen in Hudson Yard or other luxury department stores. For some reason, employees were on their phones a lot, I'm assuming Omni customer service. Some barely looked up to interact with anyone. But I mean if you're being commissioned, why bother.

The Noir room was a mess. Literally one mannequin wasn't even dressed. The head pieces were going for Alexander McQueen I think...maybe black swan, I honestly don't know what was going on. Like, it was attempting avantgarde but lost focus halfway. Tacky is the best word.

Some of the clothing that was chosen looked so random and out of season. Like they forgot that it's spring going to summer. The denim jacket and shorts in one of the windows ate tho. Literally, the only interesting things I saw in there were on the customers walking around.

리뷰:
Nicest Nordstrom location I've visited. Large selection of brands, large shopping space spanning multiple levels, and spa services upstairs. Friendly staff and wellstocked store. We were lucky to visit this Nordstrom store before, sometime ago, this time was in Summer to enjoy the super fun Shoebar
Karen served us delightful nibbles and drinks
A fun place to meet friends or chat with fellow shoppers  bar customers
We enjoyed Prosecco and a crisp lager plus vegetarian dips Very deceptive sales tactic. Sign makes it look like items are 25 off but when you get to register its really just an offer to price match if item is on sale elsewhere. Why that involves 25 is not clear.  Turns out this rack is full price and ended up buying my daughter a dress I wouldnt have suggested if Id known.  Bummer Clean, spacious and inviting. Highly recommend Jennifer for all your needs from beauty, fragrance to clothing.  Incredibly kind, honest and has absolutely zero agenda other than to listen and help you find what youre looking for or may be worth trying.

She has an incredible eye and ability to be able to recognize what will work with you that you might not have thought otherwise.

Her insight and knowledge on her linedepartment and almost every area in store is immense.

She will also put you with appropriate person if she is unaware of a specific item outside of what shes confident in and doesnt play you along.

Truly hidden gem.

For me to write a review on how ecstatic and happy I am to have met her is saying a lot. Everyone in Nordstroms is friendly and there to help but Jennifer has a genuine authenticity that is above and beyond. The store is beautiful and wellorganized, featuring many great designers. However, its important to teach your associates to bid farewell to customers with the same genuine smile they greet them with even if they chose not to purchase anything after trying things on.
