I went shopping for some beard grooming products. I received wonderful advice and service from Brian the specialist who suggested two great products and I now have a lovely soft beard.
Even though the sale was relatively small Brian still gave me lots of advice and help. I thoroughly recommend this store. The best selection with the best service. Beware of Clive upstairs. Hes gonna get you into something you didnt know you needed, but that you absolutely do. Not in a hardsell sort of way. More in that hes attuned to your needs. 1010 will return. Great men's department. Be aware that the offerings are from the best designers and luxurious fashion houses available.

The bar, tailor, and barbershop are a great addition to those who are shopping on the premises.

Much thanks to the gents in the suit department for their assistance during my visit. Saw the product is "available for pickup today" and that's the only reason I go for it.
Ordered, waited, until the day is almost over and still "preparing for pickup".
Checked with the pickup table, the black guy with a "meh" attitude be like "the order is still not ready" while the same product is right at the counter. So I checked with 1st floor again then comeback, this time a oversized white chick at the pickup table, told her to cancel the order. Then all of a sudden "Boom!" The order is ready.
Wowit must be magic huh.

If a product shows "available for pickup today", make sure its available today for customer to pickup in a reasonable time frame. Not before the store closes and the order is "still preparing" with a Kumon Learning Center face  while the exact same thing is right on the shelf. It's not the first time that happened in the same location.

I know I'm not white  it's alright but that's not the reason for the "differentiated services", work as sales in a department store is almost the bottom of the food chain, and the same thing is highly replaceable in a different store. For both reasons, there's no excuses for the dumdums to give me attitude.

We, are the people who put foods on their table, show some respect for the sugar daddy. 1. Awesome ambiance! A dj was playing on a Monday after work. The music was so good. Was very pleasantly surprised to see that it was a Brooklyn dj I recognized from some parties. Shoutout Rogue!
2. Jonathan B was a great sales associate. I spoke to him over the phone earlier that day and he was super helpful in helping me locate a suit I found online. He pulled the suit and got the tailor for alterations. I'm forgetting his name but he was wonderful as well.

주소: 88 Essex St, New York, NY 10002, USA
리뷰: Lots of cool shops and restaurants. My favourite Riverdel Cheese was replaced by Rebel Cheese. I havent been here in over 4 years. The guy behind the counter was helpful and patient. I wish they would bring back the caramalized onion. I still remember it from 8 years ago when Riverdel was in Prospect Heights just down the street from where I lived on St Johns Place. It was the impetus for me to go vegan after almost 30 years as a vegetarian. Amazing public market full of grocery vendors and quick eats places. It has lots of options for food from pizza to burgers and other unique eats. It has lots of seating space and good ambiance. A nice new building to go shopping. It is actually a kind of market but then permanent and inside. You can find everything from vegetables to fish. There are also tables upstairs where you can eat quietly with a view of the stalls or the street, which is great. A great spot with so many different eateries. I opted for the Peruvian, Don ceviche. This place is a fantastic indoor market!  Essex Market has an endless selection of delicious  food stands  offering cheese , meat , pizza , sweets , fish , donuts , bagels , and so much more alongside stocked groceries stores!  It's so fun to walk  around here and explore  the market. I wish I came here more often and had more time here!

주소: 160 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
리뷰:
The stylist department store of choice, in the best city in the world, none other than the Dover street market New York! It's always worth checking in when you're in the area to see the ongoing remodeling projects throughout the store. Thank you to all the staff many that make every experience at dover street market a unforgettable experience. Upscale fashion retail store eith a very creative design. Order placed at 10am, was informed of cancellation at 230pm  email says refunded hasnt been processed, no one available via phone until after 6 at which point I was told fraud and order cancelled with no valid reason. Poor customer service availability and transparency Walking inside, those who aren't aware of what the store has to offer and are love affordably will welcomed by a unique store with interesting clothing installation and setup. However, when climbing further to each of the seven floors, the experience quickly becomes otherworldly to the casual shopper. In passing, you may question the connections staff possess to even be given a position of employment. In that same thought, you may even question how much they paid to work here. With each advancing floor, you may quickly reconsider even looking at the socks. Oh, and be honest with yourselfif you have to ask for the price, you can't afford it.

In all seriousness, Dover Street is a highend clothing store offering only the most premium products of premium brands. The first two floors may only be within the everyday shopper's budget, but every guest with even the slightest interest should browse everything. As others have mentioned, security and staff workers who are all tasked with being attentive to their surroundings are present. But with a business selling brands like Gucci that have tshirts at 5,000, this shouldn't remotely be surprising. During my recent experience here, my group of four all carried in backpacks. Employees were more attentive to us, yet with how easy shoplifting could be, it only made sense, and this did not in any regards make us feel unwanted or targeted for any explicit reason. This store is sick, expensive, and epic. We always come here every time we visit, literally every time. We usually just come to look at the new exhibits, wear fun outfits, and occasionally buy some small things. While the clothes here are typically crazy expensive, its cool to see this caliber of fashion this close. The bakery is also pretty cool, very healthy focused food, but delicious. The staff is very friendly if you approach them, but they wont hound you like other luxury stores.

Quick tip Take the stairs! They are way quicker than the elevator and less crowded!

주소: 77 Battery Pl, New York, NY 10280, USA
리뷰: Some things very overpriced, many items without prices listed. Friendly people. My favorite neighborhood bodega with hands down the best bodega coffee ever. The bfast sandwiches are great as well. They also have a great produce section with fresh fruits and veggies overpriced but nice if you're in a rush to get something quick Deli customer service is awful. So rude. Never will come back again. I could understand if I requested anything extra, but just ordered a salad. Thats set. Guys, if you are tired, just take some rest. There is nothing to be rude with customers for that. People pay for the food, they dont get it for free. Giving 2 stars bcz cashier ladies are so nice and they have a smile. Fresh quick wraps and other prepared lunch dishes. Good selection of fresh vegetables. The soup is where it is at here. Every day the cook  has 3 new soups of the day, each being authentic in flavor and then some. Broths to each soup have their own flavor appeal without being too thick and unctuous like Hale and Hearty. Don't bother with the chicken noodle soup as it is not nearly as spectacular as the others hidden under the tops. Extremely greedy and don't know that noodles are supposed to be in the chicken noodle soup.  They need shut down, please don't go there.

주소: 128 Mott St, New York, NY 10013, USA
리뷰:
We used to like this place because they have good collections of seafood, vegetables, and fruits. However, their seafood quality has dropped significantly. Also, they really need to talk to the guys who work in the seafood area. They are not friendly and don't communicate properly. Most of them seem grumpy and pissy, and if you ask to see a fish to inspect before buying, they will start hammering and cutting it without your approval. What's the point of buying something if you can not inspect it? It's like you have to buy things at their will and mercy. We are never going to this place again. Buyer be aware and be mindful before buying seafood from this place. What a great day to spend some time in this mart. There so many variety of vegetables and seafood. There so many types of fishes and crabs. You can can most Asian ingredients here.  Also seafood veggies meats. Crowded, cluttered, claustrophobic market.
Produce must be used quickly.
Meats and seafood very fresh.
Dry goods need to be rotated.
Staff quick and efficient. Always crowded, and hard to keep clean! Get here at 730 am for freshly caught fish! I go here for the Roast Pork. The butcher lets you pick what you want if you can articulate this to him in Cantonese.  They also carry cooking supplies, Chinese groceries, and staple goods! You have to know your stuff to buy vegetables.
The fish is fresh all the time. They display an array of fish, shellfish, etc. I even saw live frogs and eels.

주소: 15 William St, New York, NY 10005, USA
리뷰:
Well priced, diverse buffet, delicious! I grew up in Asia and the Asian selection is pretty good! Also the sushi is well priced. But their sandwiches are epic too. It isn't Katz deli but their pastrami us alright for the price. Everyone working are also pretty chill and friendly, from the guy making sandwiches, to the crew manning the cashier. Also, very clean eating area and bathroom. This review is strictly for the buffet

What youre seeing here is 26 of overpriced, below average, borderline junk. The only takeaway is that the food was edible.

Im not exaggerating when I say almost nothing in that buffet tastes good. Very unflavored, unseasoned food. So incredibly bland and the worse part is, a plate that weighs 1.5 pounds costs 25.

Wont be coming back anytime soon. The buffet is really good and tasty and they have so many options for food! Cant wait to try the other stuff! If youre a tourist in NYC with a tight budget this deli is a healthy and affordable option to have lunch. Good quality food and service. They have several options.

The lasagna was very tasty and fresh, the grilled salmon was great and the greens are greens.

Plus is very close to Wall Street, metro stations and other attractions. Youve got everything you could ever hope for in his place... tacos, stir fry, sushi, burgers, a salad bar, soups, ramen.. a buffet style bar.. I mean you name it theyve got it. Sure it gets very crowded around lunch time but thats to be expected at a place like this and the lines move very quickly. Never have more than a 10 minute wait. The prices are on the higher side of things but I dont mind too much since everything is fresh and often prepared right in front of you. Plenty of space of dine inside or outside if you please. The place is well lit and clean and staff is friendly and helpful. Probably my number one go to lunch spot. Thanks Open Market... see you soon!

주소: 251 Mulberry St, New York, NY 10012, USA
리뷰:
I bought grated Parmesan from this market and when I ate it, it didnt even taste like cheese. It tasted like they cut the Parmesan with cornstarch or something else floury, and put too much, so no Parmesan flavor was left. Do not buy Parmesan from here unless its in bigger pieces where you can clearly see its cheese otherwise youll be eating some mystery powder. Nice place to get something quick, produce is a little light so you wont be doing a lot of grocery shopping but they definitely have enough stuff here and there to get something youll want  might not be exactly what you want though. They do have a good selection of drinks  got a beet juice drink here. WARNING beware of expired products.

I come to mulberry market as I live nearby. It is much more expensive than other grocery stores, but it can make do when i need an apple or ketchup.

Unfortunately, I have not had good luck with perishables. Yogurt is often curdled, milk rancid. Perhaps they have a refrigeration problem. Beautiful and super clean with an very extensive range that seems to be have everything fully stocked, which is reflective as pricing is on the expensive end of the spectrum. I recently had the pleasure of visiting Mulberry Market in New York, and I must say, it was a delightful experience. As an Indian living in New York, finding quality Indian food products can sometimes be a challenge, but Mulberry Market exceeded my expectations.

First and foremost, the store's ambiance is welcoming and wellorganized. It's clear that they take pride in offering a wide range of Indian food products. From spices to readymade meals and fresh produce, they have it all. The quality of their products truly impressed me, and it's evident that they source their items with care.

The staff at Mulberry Market were not only knowledgeable but also friendly. They were more than willing to assist me in finding the specific items I was looking for and even offered suggestions for new things to try. Their helpfulness made my shopping experience enjoyable.

I was also pleased

주소: 95 E Houston St, New York, NY 10002, USA
리뷰:
Whole Foods is a wellorganized grocery store offering a wide variety of fresh produce, meats, groceries, and household items. The store is easy to navigate, and the staff is always helpful. I particularly enjoyed their prepared food section, which offers delicious and wholesome options that feel like homecooked meals. While prices may be slightly higher than other grocery stores, I believe the quality of the products justifies the cost. Went to this whole food's as I am a local to pick up some watermelons. Whole foods were adverting it in front of the entrance. I went inside and couldn't find 1 employee. I thought I was in walmart, not Whole Foods! I had to go hunt down an employee through the entire store. I found one. He didn't even help at all. He just shrugged his shoulders and said, "I don't know if they have any," and walked away. Didn't call anyone! Then I went t to customer service same thing. No one cared to look or call to see if they had any in the back. Terrible store  customer service! I found the workers to be extremely lazy. I should have asked for a manager, but I have already wasted so much time. Management needs to really get it together with this store! They're understaffed, and no one is around to help on a Thursday evening? I will post a photo of the advertisement below. I will continue to shop at Trader Joe's, Thrive market  other grocery shops. Whole Foods customer service and quality foods both have gone downhill!

Btw, why is Whole Foods only selling seedless? What is that about! I like Whole Foods they have grapefruit and vegetables and other stuff but don't get their croissants they're terrible if you need a real croissant go to Essex Bakery Well laid out grocery store.  It was easy to find everything I needed.  Staff is helpful. Prices seemed a bit high but that could just be because I don't live in NYC Was there many times, place is clean, welllit and wellarranged. They have tons of flowers in it, beautiful flowers too. Great beer selection, like no where else. Good variety of non alcoholic beers

주소: 270 Greenwich St, New York, NY 10007, USA
리뷰:
Staff are happy and generally organized. Thats impressive considering the volume the store caters to.  But, always a but, the cleanliness of the floors and especially the second floor dining areas is awful.  Harding anybody cleaning the tables or the windows facing west, full of food.  Definitely something for the management to think about. The actual worst store. Says on their website you can call ahead to place a prepared foods order for pick up like a pizza. When I was finally able to get through to the prepared foods department after my third time being transferred they tell me I have to pay in advance. I call customer service back and then they tell me they dont do call ahead orders  apparently due to being short staffed? Huge bummer because this is the only grocery store in Tribeca  Ill just continue praying that Trader Joes finds real estate nearby soon. I wanted to give one star if it allows, this place is terribly stealing or say robbing client's money and refuse to pay back. My colleagues paid 350 dollars to buy an Amazon gift card from this place, when I redeemed it there is only 25... We didn't expect whole foods would do the "trick" as most of you could have read from the internet but they did! It is a gift card and usually ppl won't tell how much is in it to the receiver, luckily my colleague did tell me, gave me the receipt and warned me about this trick they have heard. If it is 0 I would have believed it was a mistake, but it is 25 so I would assume they did that intentionally. More dramatically, I took a picture of the receipt and amazon redeem proof but lost the physical card as the next day I moved house, guess what they insist to see the physical card in order to refund! In most of the big merchants foto copy is the same as physical copy! THEY ARE ROBBING MONEY! Product placement proved to be perplexing as I spent precious time searching for yogurts, only to discover them tucked away behind the vitamin aisle. On a more positive note, the Mediterranean and Hot bar delighted me with their wide variety and freshness. However, the average cost for a medium cup and a box amounted to 21.

My shopping experience took a turn for the worse in the selfcheckout area. There were no clear signs or instructions on how to pay for the items I had selected. In contrast to Target, where selfcheckout is straightforward, I was left baffled and ultimately abandoned my cucumbers and tomatoes at the selfcheckout station. Great market to shop organic food! From produce, meats, seafood, drinks, snacks and even clean and non toxic household products. I loved chocolate cookies and I found my only favorite healthy chocolate chip cookies in wholefoods!

Apart from that, they maintain the cleanliness of the place and offer
fresh meats ans seafood!!

리뷰:
As one of the bigger stores in the neighborhood, New Kam Man has a wider selection of goods than its competitors. The street level has packaged and prepared food while the lower level has kitchen items and a good tea selection. But bigger is not necessarily cheaper and I would encourage you to compare prices at nearby Sun Vin grocery on Mulberry Street. The basement at New Kam Man is just a fun place to go.  They have plates and bowls and teas but also a toy and stationary section.  I grabbed some fun stickers the last time I was there Small takeout food counter at the entrance to the supermarket with big portions, delicious food, and very affordable prices. I had the roast pork over rice for 6.50, and I was contently satisfied. They have some different fruits that I've never seen before . The guavas were huge and great tasting. Will definitely go back and explore. I used to visit this supermarket frequently, that was almost 30 years old. there is little change here so it brought back lots of memories !

I loved the variety of readytoeat meats from their deli department . Also there are stands outside the entrance selling exotic fruits.

주소: 75 E Broadway, New York, NY 10002, USA
리뷰:
Honestly, it's just another Asian market. Obviously you will find most Chinese products. But American products are more expensive compared to American markets. The place is typical with slightly unpleasant smells due to the fact that they sell fresh seafood and raw meats. Sometimes they have offers that I don't hesitate to take advantage of. Remember to please check the expiration date of the products and even check the product. I once found a package of turkey sausages that were not yet expired but the color and texture of the product was already rotten they probably take little care about the refrigeration of the products Because there are products that should be frozen and are simply on a normal shelf. It's not a bad store, I even shop often but it takes me an hour to check the products making sure they are not damaged before buying They used to sell  cooked soy sauce duck, soy sauce chicken, roast pork, soy sauce squid with food stamps legally, but they don't do it anymore. The prices are great. You can buy a 56oz can of Kikkoman sesame oil for about 25.00. For offbrand sesame oil, you can purchase a can of sesame oil for about 16.00.

The fish is so fresh a lot of fish are still moving.

The food is great, and the Han are superfriendly. You must go there! The place is terrifying, but praces are fine. Sea food is for good prices. Contemporary Asian delicacies ingredients produce dry foods and otherwise. Need to go need to go they don't celebrate only Chinese delicacies other and other Latino an American Just double check when ordering delivery on grocery items. They will say they ran out of certain brands and then give you cheaper brands, while claiming they will be of the same value eg. swapping out 10 bottle of rice wine for a 2 brand. Maybe they think the customers wont know any better. The items arrived in fine condition.

주소: 55 Fulton St, New York, NY 10038, USA
리뷰:
What a wonderful supermarket that has everything you want OMG I don't know how to describe my experience here. It's all really that expensive I guess it's because they accept WIC and EBT. The first time I went to buy some frozen chicken and some tomatoes. All right, I self checked out because I paid by credit card. So, all good because it was an in and out. Recently, I went to make some purchases with my WIC card. I was surprised by the price of milk. I made sure through the app that the milk was the one that has approved the wic as benefits for the month of June. Then I reviewed the UPC and the list issued by the APL WIC OF NEW YORK STATE Effective May 30, 2024 So I went to the checkout to pay, In front of me were two Hispanic women with children running around the store. They were waiting and apparently were also doing their shopping with WIC. The cashier swiped my card and declined my payment. I asked him why? If I used the app and checked the WIC OF NYS APL list, He just responded with a vague and disgusted attitude towards me I think because he thought I was Asian He simply said "I don't know" Then I asked if he could help me find the milk that the store allows me to buy with wic... He made a few movements with his arms and sighed as if I were bothering him. And I just said "thank you, I'll put back the milk on his place".
When I went up the stairs to exit I saw the cashier helping the Hispanic ladies look for the wic approved juice.  Then I saw him attending to them without the same arrogant attitude with which he attended to me. I was really disappointed and I won't come back here.  It seems like he didn't know that I speak Spanish and that I was born in a  country where speak Spanish. I guess because of my Asian appearance he disliked me and he treated me in such a rude way. The most beautifully stocked veggie wall. Always take pride in what u do and this guy def does!!!! High end for key foods.

They have a large variety of deli counter and buffet foods for those working in the area. Its in the back left of the main floor.

Ive yet to try it, but the store had a lot of other things I needed when I took these photos for future reference The issues with this particular Key Food location are the following

Quality We have consistently found expired food on their shelves make sure you always check the dates and their produce is almost always bad.

Pricing This Key Food is much pricier than all of the other local grocery stores including the Whole Foods that's a few blocks away. I found it to be double the price on quite a few items, including yogurt, pasta, and meat items. It doesn't make sense when the quality is this bad. When they do have sales, be careful of what you are getting for that discounted price.

Customer service It's pretty much nonexistent here. Employees don't seem happy here and management is not effective. Nobody seems to care about customers and everytime we come here, there are ridiculous lines.

Meat weights The meat department doesn't weigh their meats properly so be careful or you may find yourself paying a lot extra for low quality meat.

Cleanliness and Organization This store is just not clean and it's common to find things disorganized, out of place, etc.

After years of this being one of our neighborhood markets, we have decided to no longer shop here.

주소: 99 John St, New York, NY 10038, USA
리뷰: You would never  in 1 million years  expect to see a place like this. And what I mean by "like this" is the fact that it offers all fivestar, unbelievable, completely fresh prepared food in a wellmaintained buffet environment at 11.99 a pound. As you walk around the store, it's shocking to see that some of the prices are less expensive than in Westchester County. It might be because of the proximity to Chinatown, but you'll see some photos, like turmeric in perfect pieces for 5.99 per pound. Good luck finding that price anywhere. Period. The entryway makes it look so unassuming that if you dont know its there, you would probably never walk in. But please trust me, it is definitely worth the visit. Need help answering the phone.  They took entirely to long to come back to the phone so I hung up and called back.  When the young lady that answered the phone the first time picked it up again she says rudely that they are busy and I have to hold again.  She never even asked me what I wanted to order.  Terrible attitude and poor customer service.  Just be nice to people.  It cost you nothing and goes a long way.  I'll find another place to spend my money. I've been going here for years. The staff is always friendly and accommodating. Never  had a issue with my purchases. Food is always fresh and delicious. I keep coming back because it's familiar and I know I won't be disappointed. I would definitely recommend them for the food and service. Omg the Sushi rolls they have are the fresh and tasty roll I have had in NYC! So so so very yummy! If you like California roll and or any kind of rolls like that then it is a total must try. Sooooo freaken good! Yummy yummy! I am going back for more this week to clean off the plate. Happy Eating! Buffet is fresh steaming hot and usually very good albeit pricey.

리뷰:
I visited the new Daily shop in its first week. I was amazed how much product they had. Their prices are comparable to my store in Washington state. Saw a few things that were even cheaper. 29 cents for a bottle of 365 water! Never seen that in any WFM before.
The supervisor in produce was a great guy and very friendly! Even posed for a photo for me to share with my coworkers.  This was one of 4 whole foods I visited in NY and PA. I have to be honest, at the Daily Shop location, the customer service at the self checkout really lacked friendliness compared to the others. They were helpful though. I understand this was NY. Im sure the team members were tired with the new opening and the previous work of setting up. And what do I know? Maybe New Yorkers arent even bothered!?! Whole Foods Market in downtown NYC is a topnotch grocery destination! Everything here is incredibly fresh, from the vibrant produce to the wellstocked shelves. The fruits look especially amazingripe, colorful, and bursting with flavor. The store is clean, wellorganized, and offers a fantastic variety of organic and specialty items. The staff is friendly and helpful, making the shopping experience even better. Whether youre looking for fresh ingredients or just want to browse, Whole Foods in downtown NYC never disappoints. Highly recommended for quality and freshness! A very clean and versatile store. You wont be disappointed if youre looking for something healthy and fresh. And they have a cafe area where you can sit back and enjoy your purchased food! Its a nice place to go to in New York City I recently visited the Whole Foods store, and I must say, I have mixed feelings about the experience. The store itself is impressively large, with a spacious and clean layout that makes navigating through the aisles quite pleasant. However, I was disappointed by the limited options available for groceries. Despite the store's size, the selection didn't meet my expectations, especially when it came to certain staples and specialty items.

Another downside is the pricing. As expected with Whole Foods, the products are on the pricier side. While I don't mind paying a bit more for quality, the high prices here don't seem justified given the lack of variety.

Overall, while the store is aesthetically pleasing and wellmaintained, the limited options and high prices make it hard to justify regular shopping trips here. Nice, clean supermarket with good turnover of products. The ground floor has plants and food that you could pick up onthego. Nice pizza and sushi selection as well. Downstairs is more your grocery area. There's a seating area where you could eat the lunch you just picked up there's also a microwave for your use. If you have to return any Amazon packages, the return area is next to the sitting area. The grocery selection is nice though at times a little narrow and sometimes confusing almost a mini labyrinth. It's also cool that you could pick up fresh bread AND get it sliced automatically with the bread slicing machine.

주소: 107 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10003, USA
리뷰: In the middle of the Ukrainian Village is this family owned supermarket offering high quality food items at very reasonable cost.  The staff is always friendly and helpful, and they deliver to the East Village.  They are located near NYU and are known for their delicious Roast beef sandwich, and don't forget the Carrot and raisin salad. An absolute dump. One positive thing I could say is, they have a decent selection of cheeses and belobe you me I am being extremely generous here. My family and I have shopped at this supermarket for over 30 years. The owner is truly dedicated to the community and treats his customers like family. The store is wellrun and provides high quality, very local service, including quick efficient delivery up east village walkups. The staff are courteous and helpful. Many of the staff are very longterm employees, a clear testament to the owners fair treatment. We need to be supportive of our local businesses to keep the services and warmth of spirit that define the East  Village. Ive been going to this market for years and yes, it is overpriced, but its New York, its going to be, its clean and convenient for me so I still go. However their staff is unfriendly, especially the guy with brown hair, he seems like he might be an owner. Just unfriendly. It makes shopping there just uncomfortable. Ive seen him behave in a rude manner to many of his customers before and its really off putting. Id rather take the walk down to another grocery store if I have the time. Their doors to get into the market are also always broken, or move so slowly its borderline comical. With all of the extra money theyre making from charging what they charge they should make it a priority to fix their doors. Its literally the first impression of the store. Then they need to fix the owners attitude, look how they respond to reviews on here. Its unfriendly and rude. It's a complete ripoff, I bought 3 cans of Le Croix just sparkling water with a hint of fruit extract and it was 12 dollar! A single can is at whole foods for example around a dollar. A 12 pack around 6 dollar. And on the can there were a 30 cent deposit but you just get back 5, they couldn't explain me why. I am not an American so I didn't knew about the product and pricing but I learned it is way cheaper in other stores. So I don't trust this store...

리뷰:
Hello! I dont really want to spoil the rating seeing how everyone likes this place. And the attitude was fine. But I dont eat out and cook everything well since Im both pregnant and breastfeeding. Just one time when I ate something else was there and I got a not so nice case of food poisoning, still have to keep a diet, its already been 5 days. I dont know what was in this chicken as it was too wellseasoned to notice or maybe it was just some problem with work hygiene but it didnt sit well with me. So I went out of my way to write this review. Please check the quality of the products and your sanitary standards. Everything you could need in a pinch. Food is fresh and coffee is always hot. Ive been coming here for about six months now with no intentions on stopping. Im a regular here and going back here tonight lol. Theyre more than a food market, its a fresh market. Great staff, George is the makes your food hot and up to your own preference. Just tell him whatever special adding you want  he performs it over 100.
Everyone is open for conversations with their positive engagements with every customer in the store. Thank you guys all for your continuously hard work  team effort everyday. Cashiers are very welcoming, one of the best Delis in NYC, they have a wide variety of choices to buy from, and cashiers make you feel comfortable. Perfectly cooked bacon egg and cheese. Coffee was super fresh. Def recommend this joint.

리뷰:
Its always a lovely time spent here. The store is quaint with carefully curated locallysourced goods. The staff who are mainly volunteers are evidently passionate about the store and its purpose. Get fresh eggs, seasonal fruits, and health  reasonably priced sandwiches and soups.

Very dog friendly too! The nicest ladies  they even watched a customers dog while he shopped! Love the products.. a lot of homemade, organic ,  farm fresh produce  dairy This place is absolutely amazing. The Fulton Stall Market is ran by lovely individuals that go above and beyond to help one out. They have a wild range of farmers market goods from cheese, veggies, and hot sauce! I managed to find Bronx Hot Sauce here!! The baked goods are delicious. I had the apple crumb pie that was served in a mug alongside a fantastically made latte. They also have drip coffee. I believe the drip coffee was made using "Brooklyn coffee co" beans.

I love this place, and plan to come here as often as I can while I'm working in the area!!! Absolutely love this place! A colleague introduced me to Fulton Stall Market for their farm shares program and composting. They are incredibly friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable about their local community and producefood items. Im so happy I found this place. Farm shares pickups are on Thursdays and there are so many options to choose from. Hidden gem. Got honey from Soho. The lady working here will make you feel pure happiness with her silent smile.

리뷰: Great grocery store for the area. And they have a little pizza shop thats not that bad if youre hungry. Severely overpriced, mediocre food, and not particularly clean. Do yourself a favor and walk 2 blocks to Whole Foods on Broadway where you can get great hot food, fresh produce, fairly priced beer, clean environment, and save yourself at least 30 compared to City Acres. Nice grocery store! You have to bring your own bags Great variety of products as well as hot and cold food bars. They also have like a little foodcourt with different vendors dumplings, pizzas, burgers... I love this grocery store food hall.  Upstairs there are different vendors Artichoke Pizza, Vanessa's Dumpling, Beyond Sushi, Juice Brothers, Cinnamon Snail as well as hot and cold food bars, a salad station, and a deli sandwich station.  Downstairs there is a fully stocked grocery store.  The produce is always fresh and the prices are great!! From the outside it looks like a tiny corner store, but once inside there's a full grocery store on two floors. A glass enclosed industrial looking modern elevator takes you between the 2 floors. They offer good selection of quality produce. Grabbing a few grocery items before getting on the ferry was really convenient.

Even though Ive been shopping here for 7 months weekly and they have delivered to my home numerous times, I am followed around the store every single trip. If they spent even a quarter of the time removing expired produce and meats from the shelves that they spend stalking me each trip the store would be worth the insane markups. Also their membership card has yet to save me a single penny and I have thousands of unusable points lol Pretty solid place for buying all kinds of produce, meat, or other food items you typically find in a grocery store. The prices are quite decent too relative to the area. I think they redid the place in the past couple years. Last time I was there the staff was snappy and the place looked like it was falling apart.
My visit today was great! They have a good selection of products, produce, meats everything is well stocked, organized and clean. The staff is friendly a worker checked in with me to make sure I found everything I needed.
They even have fresh juices and coffee for a dollar? Im impressed.
Great improvements  What a clean, organized, great customer service support, I experienced in the New York Marketplace. I enjoyed their Beets, Orange, and Carrot Juice, that they make fresh on a daily basis. Delicious! They also have a deli, so you can order your cold cuts, ect. They have everything like a Super market! I love their freshly squeezed juice machine, super clean and delicious fresh juices every day. Great pricing and products but above all...exceptional service. Everyone in there is hospitable and welcoming. They're always routinely working to keep the store clean and organized. I shop there as opposed to the large grocery chains as I firmly believe in supporting grassroots, local establishments.

Also a good 3040 cheaper than places further uptown.

리뷰:
Overpriced even for NY. Good selections in a smaller space. Pricing on the shelves for produce wasnt too accurate. But no we do not have regular bananas, only organic for 1.29  lb. Then I found out they are owned by ShopRite. I used to work near to this market, so I started to buy my lunch everyday. Most of the time I took food from the buffet, but I also asked for fried chicken or sushi. Isnt cheap and sometimes the food tastes different even if it is the same plate than other days. Picked up a reisling and lunch. The sushi looked great, will try that next time.  Cookies were delicious and the quinoa salad was fresh and surprisingly good.  Came with a nice dressing on the side. Oh my god. I frequent this place so often that I've never bothered to write a reviewuntil today. The sheer number of times I've bought spoiled items from here is outrageous! Truffle mayo, fish, milk, eggsyou name it, they've sold it rotten. Today was the last straw. I went to pick up some hummus for dinner, and as I was leaving, I noticed blue ink all over my expensive shirt, my hands, and my arms. I had no idea where it came from until I looked at the hummus. THE LID WAS LEAKING BLUE INK!!
They claimed they'd never seen that before, but I knew they were lying. I went back to the hummus section and saw HALF THE HUMMUS CONTAINERS WERE LIKE THAT!
Absolutely horrendous. They REFUSED to pay for the damage to my shirt and the dermatologist appointments I had to schedule to fix the rashes caused by the toxic ink.
Never again. This place is a nightmare. Avoid at all costs. This place sucks, always check the expiration dates and food itself because its probably not safe to eat. Also relatively expensive and the staff are probably underpaid and dont seem to care about providing a good shopping experience.

리뷰:
Best Thai grocery store in NYC

  Well stocked store and very clean

 I picked up fresh packaged Thai basil, Kefir lime leaves, and Thai eggplant. I picked up coconut milk, bamboo shoots, oyster sauce, Thai soy sauce, black soy sauce, and fish sauce.

 Highly recommend. The store owner was very knowledgeable and gave great advice for some cooking methods and which products would be best for the dishes I was making. One of my favorite place in the city!
Definitely my go to every I have to cook a Thai dish and I always get so much stuff that I cook Thai for days!
This place is just amazing  you can find everything you cannot find in the other grocery store and I like to support small businesses

Also they are very friendly and kind
Very recommended Wonderful  well stocked Thai grocery store! As a clean freak, I love how all the fresh produce is packaged in plastic nicely 

Lots of different sauces, curry pastes, dried and fresh ingredients! I got ingredients to make a Thai papaya salad  lovely peanut snack from my childhood 

Also, the cashier Im pretty sure she was the owner was SO sweet, helpful and kind. I regret not getting her name today  but if youre reading this, thank you for your help  I will definitely return to support her local business! Best place to get your Thai groceries. Staff is super friendly. Been going here for years and still going strong. Feels great to support local businesses like this. I come here for all my Thai grocery needs. They have fresh Thai chilis, lemongrass, Laotian sausage, all the different types of Thai soy sauces, Thai tea, various curry pastes, and more.

리뷰:
Leaving this review because I want Angel M. to take this as a learning experience.

Today I decided to come to Trader Joes because I was looking for a quick and healthy snack as I havent eaten anything since the afternoon. So as I usually would, I wanted to try something new before I bought. Since Trader Joes allows it supposedly. I decided to grab something new as I always buy my usual go tos oatmeal, fruit, Greek yogurt. I stumbled and saw that Trader Joes sells macaroons so I decided Why not?

Upon checking out is where everything went downhill. I asked my cashier Angel M, if I can try the Macaroons before I bought them and he said I could not as that wasnt part of the policy. I was so confused as I was able to do this with another staff member and he didnt give me a problem about it. In fact, I also did this same request in the Brooklyn Trader Joes on Court street. Despite what he told me, I kindly asked him if he could bring his manager to figure out why I couldnt try the macaroons.

He told me no and that he said he had to do his job, which was to ring me out first so I can try. It wasnt about what he said but the WAY he spoke to me. I honestly hated it and I understood where he was coming from. I kept asking him to bring his manager and still would not want to budge. So I decided to get Matthew, the store manager, myself. And after I brought over the manager to us, Angel suddenly said that he was going to get my manager. When he clearly said that to make himself look good.

The store manager was able to resolve my issue and ended up not charging me for the macaroons. But now I feel like I was mistreated because Angel didnt want to get his manager. He simply wanted to do his job.

I hope he learns from this as I love to shop at Trader Joes. But now from this experience, I dont feel super stoked about coming into a Trader Joes store.

TLDR
Wanted to try before you buy policy but couldnt for some reason.
Staff didnt want to grab manager for me so I grabbed him myself to resolve the issue. Ive had this same burrito from here and from the TJs by my house in LI. Inconsistent taste, the one from LI is 1 less and tastes better. The tangerine probiotic drink is pretty good with ice. Convenient from my job. An incredible place to go shopping for groceries.

I was particularly impressed with their affordable organic options and the wide range of flavors that you won't find in your typical grocery store.

Whether it's their delicious frozen meals, fresh produce, or quirky snacks, there's always something exciting to discover at Trader Joe's.

Plus, the layout and organization of the store made it easy to find everything I needed.

Their privatelabel products and friendly staff exceeded my expectations, which keeps me coming back for more. It is a Trader Joes it cant do wrong!
The store is very organized and pretty busy in the evenings. There are so many varieties of products. Will recommend if interested in trying out good quality products for a reasonable price. Love love their bread selections. Spacious store, wonderful selection, affordable prices, beautiful and organized presentation, helpful and kind staff. Quality products and fresh produce. Also the restroom is convenient and location is great. Always love shopping at Trader Joes.

AMAZING experience at this NBA store. Unfortunately i was so lost in how cool this store was, i could only get a picture of the bottom two floors and not the top one  where i bought all my things . The staff here have provided me and my family with the best customer service that i personally have ever received. Especially a worker named Ryan although im not sure if i spelled his name right. He was very nice to me and my brother and helped us get our names embroidered on our hats  he also helped us curve the brim of our hats. Although it did take a while, the store is so huge and theres so many things to view and do there that I couldve waited longer. This store has merch for EVERY nba team as well as WNBA teams  a few college teams such as micheal jordans jersey in north carolina. Although it was a little crowded at times, i would say that this store is a MUST visit if you play basketball, or are a fan of the NBA, WNBA, or college basketball, they have many clothing choices from tee shirts, to shirts, to sweaters with zippers, to hoodies, to thin jackets, to varsity jackets, and basically everything. I spent at least 3 hours in this store and i rate it a 10010, definitely recommend Very cool store with clothing for men women and children with all NBA and WNBA teams. Memorabilia toys and collectibles. Customization of hats shoes and jerseys. ProsBeautiful store, very organized, three or four floors filled with inventory, elevator and escalator access

Cons they did not carry certain items we were looking for, for such a big store,. And of course, prices are pretty steepit is 5th ave.. We were told there was no restroom and we were paying customers. The NBA Store on 5th Avenue is a mustvisit for any basketball fan! The selection of products is incredible, with everything from the latest gear to a fantastic collection of oldschool jerseys that brought back so many memories. The store is wellorganized, making it easy to find exactly what youre looking for. The staff is incredibly friendly and knowledgeable, always ready to help with a smile. Whether youre a diehard fan or just looking for a cool gift, this store has it all. Highly recommend stopping by! "The store is beautiful and welllocated, with very highquality and affordable goods."

리뷰:
Quaint neighborhood caf and mini grocery with fresh produce. The egg sandwich was freshly made with wellbalanced flavors. The turkey sandwich however was premade and I found it underwhelming relative to the price at 16. Made a great choice buying the pear crme fraiche ice cream which was divine. Topped it with dark chocolate shavings and potato chips. Pretty chill atmosphere especially on a warm spring day.

Some of the staff felt stand offish though. They seem selective as to who they think deserves warmer service or youre just there because of the TikTok craze which isnt the case for me, my friend who lives in the neighborhood just told me about it.

Anyway, will keep hanging out here and try more of their soups and grilled chicken. Sandwiches are definitely a bit overpriced but the breakfast sando was delicious. Highly recommend! Def get the ones that are made to order BEC, BLT vs the premade ones. The coffee is also very good. After the 3rd visit for hot chocolate I can give the full honest review
This place is so cute and Im glad its in the neighborhood! The hot chocolate is one of the best Ive had and I do global reviews of that drink so Ive had a few and the marshmallows 
Just perfect for winter. Love it.

There was a different flavor to the chocolate itself on the 2nd visit, we think it might have happened because we came in right at closing time that day  the marshmallows balanced out the weird flavor but without them we wouldnt have been able to drink it. The taste was sour and it wasnt like that at all during the first and third visits. Still giving it five stars because when its good its truly THE BEST. I do hope the team reads this and finds out if the quality changes during specific dayshours maybe after 3pm the hot chocolate is tired and needs a break from being so amazing? so go earlier  Service at the counter was friendly. The fresh melon juice was delicious, albeit 10.50 for a small pour. But the real disappointment was the  BLT. This sandwich was one of those meal regrets where you have to have a second lunch to make up for the disappointment. Bread was barely toasted and too dense. The tomatoes were good. Bacon and lettuce decent. But the bread and poor ratios made it a mess. Saw the 1010 Score from hot cocoa girl idk her name Im so sorry on TikTok and knew I had to check this place out. Super cute with lots of fresh produce for purchase inside. Food menu looked nice and the food I saw coming out that other people ordered looked great. Had a nice cooler of drinks and spreads for purchase. We only got the hot cocoa and it was super rich and enjoyable. Definitely a lavish treat and super delicious. Staff was also very friendly!

리뷰:
This is my favorite grocery store! The store policy on purchases is very customer centric. If a customer is unhappy about a purchase, the managers will make it right either through a refund or replacement. The management and staff are friendly and helpful too. The Grand Street store is clean and spacious. There are always cart handle wipes available. They carry a large assortment of organic foods. New products are introduced every week or two. Generally, the prices are pretty reasonable. In general, I wish they carried more vegan products.

It's important to note that each store is different. The Trader Joe's on 22nd  6th Ave and 14th Street are awful! Both are very busy and small, so maneuvering with a cart is somewhat difficult. Also, the store on 22nd Street never provides cart handle wipes for customers. The dispenser is always empty or broken! This place is huge .. lots of choices on all kinds of foods and deals. AMAZING PLACE ! I LOVE IT! AND MOST  OF ALL THE WORKERS ARE PHENOMENAL AND THE CASHIERS ARE THE BEST!  THEY ARE VERY HOSPITABLE N MAKE YOU FEEL AT HOME. I WILL CONTINUE TO GO HERE EVEN IF I AM MILLIONS OF MILES AWAY! THANK YOU GUYS SEE YOU SOON! Always a beautiful, healthy, looking lovely selection of flowers to greet you as you walk in off of the elevator. Staff is always helpful, upbeat and friendly and they always have stickers or lollipops for the little ones It took some time but they finally repair the escalator going down. Not sure if they were aware but the stair were unsafe. It was difficult to see where the edge of the steps were as you walk down. I glad they finally fixed the escalator. Good selection prices have gone up for eggs and banana. Waiting for the next price increase. No mobile service in the basement apple wallet still works.

20240524
Easy return had some spoiled lemon after a few days. Came in making my purchase and was able to return and deduct the difference from my purchase. Requires manager to process transaction. I don't get this place. Going down that escalator is like descending into California lots of hypergroomed 20somethings in gym clothes. You could weigh the amount of sheer entitlement present in this store in pounds...
BUT....the food is great, the prices are very low, and the store employees are overall extremely friendly and very helpful. Oh, and the line always moves quickly.
It's great, fresh food at very low prices what are all the kids shopping here so angry about?? If you can stomach the clientele, this is a great store!

주소: 57 Bayard St A, New York, NY 10013, USA
리뷰:
I love shopping here. Its almost never crowded, the meat selection is fresh and abundant, and they carry all your basic Asian pantry items and fresh produce. Selection isnt as huge or as diverse as larger markets but I prefer the simplicity of that. Everything is also very fresh and wellpriced. Next to the meat market, they also have the fresh seafood and fresh produce.

The fresh veggies are abundant. Like the kangkung or water spinach and fresh bean sprout.

They also have lots of fresh meat as well as prepared and cooked food. Mostly spicy Cantonese food. You can buy them packed or per pound. I wanted to try cooking Chinesestyle chicken feet at home and was looking for a grocery store that sells them.  And this place does!  pics  Yay.  So yeah, if you're looking for a grocery store in NYC that sells chicken feet...they do.

The fresh veggie selection is pretty solid as well.... The best prices for pork I have found in the city. The pork is great quality as wellit has turned out excellently every time I cooked it. While I am usually the only nonChinese person in the store, the staff speaks English and the whole community is very welcoming.

Purchases under 10 must be made with cash, and you can buy a decent amount of meat for under 10, so keep this in mind.

The store often has specials going on as well and these are a nice bonus. I did buy some large chicken legs on a special and they were huge, concerningly so, almost the size of small turkey legs. Admittedly, this made me wonder where the large chicken legs are being sourced from. Small chicken legs are available, however, though I have not purchased them, but I have had the pork shoulder, pork loin, and ground pork, and they have all been great. They also have pork neck bones which are an under appreciated find! I bought soy sauce chicken pre cooked here. I got diarhea. It didn't smell right .

주소: 88 Essex St, New York, NY 10002, USA
리뷰: They have the best beer in the world here! had a summer Ale from Transmitter, a local brewery across the East River and a great example of the American craft beer movement.  The bartender deserves a 50 star rating! Whoever said the she was xenophobic against Americans, clearly had no idea what this great nation is really about. Her keen knowledge of the produce of our nations brewers and her communication of the craft of brewing, truly represents the independent spirit of our nations founders.  Washington, Hamilton, Franklin and rest would be proud and happy to be served a pint here! Stopped in to the Essex Market today after a long ish walk from Tribeca. Greeted by a rather impressive collection of craft beers, I sat down and asked the bartender, I think her name was Lauren what hazys she had on top. She responded with an unexpected yet very welcomed astuteness of beer knowledge, which led to more conversation. As a craft beer lover, this was perhaps the most pleasant part of a weeklong journey through NYC. Im from the west coast and she knew so much about even beers there plus filled me in on so many upcoming brewers and beers on the east coast, and helped guide me in my quest to find a coveted Treehouse beer which still eludes eludes me  Prost, Cheers and Salute to Top Hops and especially Lauren who made the experience review worthy.  Came in to Essex Market while visiting my son, a long time New Yorker. We stopped for a rest and a beverage. The bartender was absolutely a delight Lauren.  She happens to be from Australia but made me feel comfortable, at home, and delighted with the experience. This is the perfect place to sit and have a beer while shopping in the market. The bartender is quite knowledgeable about all their offeringslagers, ipas, stouts, sours, ciders, even wineand can suggest exactly what you're craving. While it's placed among food stalls and other shops in the large market space, it feels like your local joint friendly and neighborly. The beer was great, good local selection although the signage didnt match what was actually available  probably due to next point!. The bartender was horrible, xenophobic towards Americans and lazy, very rude not only to us but every interaction I observed her with. She made it clear we were a bother by being there.

리뷰:
My fiancs mother recently got scammed going here. She bought a 18 walnut shrimp dish that ended up having only 6 pieces of shrimp, and underneath them was a nest of orange slices, filling nearly 23 of the box.

This is just plain wrong. Go with your elders when they shop so they dont get scammed. And dont go here anymore in general lol My family has been coming here for years, which makes this even more disappointing. Not only was I given the wrong information by the employee, but I was also a sold rancid product.

Earlier this week I went to purchase some vegetarian  bean curd wraps, I asked the employee if it was vegetarian and she told me yes. As a vegan this was something I was looking forward to eating. When I come home to cook it not only do I find out that there is pork inside of it, but when my family ate it the wraps had a sour rancid taste.
I don't understand how the employees could've not know that this product had meat and was rancid.
I spent 10 on something that went into the trash. The store on Mott's street cashier's are so rude. They kept talking nonsense to each other while making customers wait? Seriously they make us Chinese people look bad. My friends from outside NYC refuse to go there because the cashier's were rude. Making customers wait 10 minutes while the cashier's talk nonsense to each other? I love going to this meat store. It's clean, well organized, and most importantly, the butchers are very friendly. I love getting prepared duck from them. It's 12 for an entire duck. Can't beat the value! This place is getting weird.
They are tricking you to buy more than what you need.
They would tell you that they no longer cut the amount of meat you want, instead of 1lb of meat you want, you end up buying 3lbs of the whole chunk.
Nasty attitude included.

리뷰:
Great prices for all the fruits and vegetables you may need. Dominican owned so you can find all kinds of root vegetables like yuca, yautia, etc, in addition to a wide variety of Goya seasoning and other products. Its also kinda hard to find loose jalapeos so I appreciate that they offer them here. Theyre often sold in bundles that are too big. Located inside Essex market. Essex Farm Fruits  Vegetables is a grocery within the new Essex Market location.

Essex Farm is a fairly grocery space within Essex Market. the grocery has a large selection of vegetables, fruits, herbs, etc. and the produce is fresh and the quality is great. finding common veggies and notsocommon ones was a nice surprise. i was able to find Persian Israeli cucumbers for a Jerusalem Salad that I wanted to make. The parsley and mint smelled so good and were NOT wilted. The tomatoes were nice and  red  and had that fresh firm taste of summer. most of the produce section  is a large are tucked in the back and spreads out from there. if you cook often or want quality veggies, then make a list and come to this spot.

beyond fruits  veggies, there are aisles and shelves of packaged and canned foods. there is a dairy and refrigerated  frozen packaged foods as well. the rest of Essex Farm can fill most of your grocery and supermarket needs.

the prices are fairly walletfriendly in terms of veggies and fruits.

the staff is pretty helpful and finding things can be a little bit of search if you are a firsttimer as the space is packed.

drops mic cuz i eat fresh This place is awesome everything you for Puerto Rican and Dominican. Ingredients for your food A little pricey but a great selection of nondairy and plant based products.

주소: 5 St James Pl, New York, NY 10038, USA
리뷰: I never post reviews unless I have strong feelings about an establishment that future visitors should know. When this place was a Ctown it had good deals. Last month I visited the new "Super fresh" for the first time, just curious how the market has changed. There was nothing super or fresh about the place. Since I didn't see anything I needed or wanted to buy, I started to exit the market. An older worker, whom I assumed was the owner or manager, stopped me at the door and asked "You didn't buy anything?" I said no. Then he accused me of STEALING  "You didn't take any merchandise?" and looked at my bag. Just because I chose not to buy anything from your lowstocked, dealless, and below average store, doesn't mean I am a thief. OMG!!!  Everyone at the registers were looking, I have never been so embarrassed and traumatized and angry obviously. I'm never patronizing this store ever again, and neither should you!!!  The cashiers are friendly, there is a variety of products but sadly they are very expensive for me. Everything is well organized but I have caught one or another expired product on the shelves  I often come here to shop because they serve well and there is an adorable child who helps bag the products which in other establishments they do not help you even if you make purchases of 300 or more I still recommend coming here because it's acceptable, they also have a newspaper with weekly offerspromotions but it's  usually products that I don't need to buy at the moment. Solid stock and selection across the board. This is the best general purpose supermarket in the immediate vicinity to the neighborhood and definitely bound to be the most well priced option since the others are much closer to the financial district. Im pretty sure their grill is open from the beginning of the day well into the afternoon so if youre looking for a breakfast sandwich or a made to order lunch youve got a good shot are getting what youre after. Good selection of produce and even some ready to eat salads make this a good stop for most peoples needs. Accepting contactless payment methods is a major plus for me as well. 주소: 1 Liberty Island - Ellis Island, New York, NY 10004, USA
리뷰:
The Statue of Liberty Museum, located on Liberty Island, offers visitors an immersive and inspiring experience that complements the iconic monument. Here's an overview of its key features and overall appeal

Exhibits and Layout
The museum is welldesigned and laid out in a way that allows visitors to explore the history, symbolism, and impact of the Statue of Liberty at their own pace. There are three main sections

Immersive Theater Experience This short film sets the tone for the visit, covering the statue's conception, design, and the complex process of bringing it to life. The audiovisual experience is engaging, providing historical context and emotional resonance.

Engagement Gallery This part of the museum dives into the various interpretations and significance of liberty and freedom. It includes personal stories and artifacts that reflect the global symbolism of the statue. Interactive displays allow visitors to connect with the statues enduring legacy.

The Inspiration Gallery The highlight here is the original torch, a stunning and iconic piece that visitors can see up close. The gallery also offers panoramic views of the statue and Manhattan, adding to the grandeur of the experience.

Educational Value
The museum does an excellent job of educating visitors about the statues origins, including the engineering marvel behind its construction and its role as a symbol of freedom and democracy. There is also a focus on the immigrant experience and the changing perceptions of liberty through the years.

Interactive Elements
Interactive exhibits allow visitors to engage with the material in a handson way, such as using touchscreens to explore different aspects of the statues history or creating digital "pledges" to liberty. This makes the experience appealing to both adults and children.

Accessibility
The museum is highly accessible, with ramps, elevators, and other accommodations for visitors with mobility challenges. Audio guides and information panels are available in multiple languages, making it inclusive for an international audience.

Atmosphere
The museums modern design and its location on Liberty Island offer an atmosphere that feels both respectful of history and forwardlooking. The surrounding views of the New York Harbor, Manhattan skyline, and the Statue of Liberty herself contribute to a reflective and uplifting experience.

Overall Experience
The Statue of Liberty Museum enriches the visit to Liberty Island, offering a deep, thoughtful, and interactive way to understand one of Americas most iconic symbols. Whether youre a history buff, a firsttime visitor, or someone looking to understand the statues place in todays world, the museum has something to offer everyone. The lady needs a bath! Other than that, beautiful scenic spot. Try to avoid evening time as the sunlight might be right behind the statue. Needs better ventilation for bathroom . Obviously it's a touristy thing to do, but my girlfriend's parents wanted to go, so we went. And it was fine. It's super narrow on the stairs, so if you're claustrophobic it may not be for you. I don't see all the hype about the torch, to be honest, but whatever. The staff was all super nice and friendly, I was pleasantly surprised. Where's Harriet Tubman's 20 bill?  You sure could use a facsimile of her bill in this store along with your other dollar bills.  There's no American who better represents our Lady Liberty than Ms. Tubman.  I'm sure it will be a bestseller.  I'd buy it.

Fishs Eddy is an unique store offers an everchanging assortment of highquality plates and kitchenware, making it a mustvisit for anyone looking for distinct and artistic pieces. The store is known for its unique art and designs, and the quality of their products is exceptional. Despite the high quality, the prices are surprisingly reasonable, making it a great place to find special items without breaking the bank. While it can get quite crowded on weekends, visiting during the week or in the evening allows for a more relaxed and enjoyable browsing experience. I had a blast browsing through Fishs Eddy! This place is a treasure trove of unique and quirky home goods and decor items  the kind of place that leaves you wanting to spend all day there. The names of items are funny, and they have an incredible selection of plates, cups, bowls and also have a section for pet posters.

Definetely recommend stopping here if in the flatiron area.

Wouldn't necessarily say this is kid friendly with all the narrow spaces to navigate through  and neither would it be wheelchair friendly. The store carries numerous exclusively amusing and unusually quirky kitchendish wares that are rare to find in NY, but theyre reasonably priced. By looking at them, some of Fishs Eddys items made me laugh. A fun place that had made my day and its totally worth a visit if you swing by the Flatiron district in Manhattan.  So happy to see this place thriving. I used to come here 27 years ago to buy platters. I still have and use the platters Ive bought.
A great place to find plates, cups, platters of all sizes! If you are looking for individual syrup containers  this is the place!
I didnt buy anything in my last visit  but I truly enjoyed just looking at everything in the store! My wife and I have been exporting stores in search of replacing our old dishes and while you might think there are lots of stores where you can go and pick them up and feel them, youd be mistaken. Of course you can find lots of dishes on the internet but  we wanted to lift them and even weigh them to make sure they would be right for us! I walked into Fishs Eddy on Broadway  near Union Square and Kalie was incredibly helpful! She helped me appreciate why Fishs Eddy is where well be buying our dishes!

He needs to be addressed on how he treats customers entering your store. Too oversecured place. An unpleasant security check when entering does not invite you to go to the museum. They wanted to take away the drawing tools, but did not offer, for example, a cabinet for storage, etc. Everyone work here seems depressed. A staff carrying a cart glared at customers in her way in a gloomy look silently instead of communicating anything. The ladies at the checkout desk also only chatting with each other and didnt greet any customer at all as if they dont want any customer there at all.  The store sells merchandise related to the art displayed in the museum, such as 'Starry Night' by Van Gogh. The store is spacious and clean. The museum gift shop sells both a large selection of items related to exhibits on display Starry Nights, Campbell Soup Cans, etc as well as a large selection of completely unrelated goods.

Overall very large selection of goods, with only small sections of the shop dedicated to MoMA brandedrelated goods.

There's also a large area in the back with a large selection of books related to architecture and photography.

"My first visit to the MM Store in Times Square with my dad was a fun experience! Even though I didnt buy anything, I enjoyed exploring the vibrant store filled with colorful MM displays and unique merchandise. The best part was taking lots of pictures to capture all the fun moments. Its a great place to visit, especially if you love MMs or just want to enjoy a playful, candythemed atmosphere!" MM World on Broadway is a candy lover's paradise. This threestory store is filled with vibrant colors, fun displays, and an incredible selection of MM merchandise. From personalized MMs to unique souvenirs, there's something for everyone. The staff is friendly and helpful, adding to the joyful shopping experience. The interactive elements and photo ops make it a fantastic destination for families and tourists. Whether you're a fan of MMs or just looking for a fun place to visit, MM World on Broadway is a mustsee. Highly recommended! When you are in Times Square , this is a must visit , if u have small kids .. fantastic location. .so many varieties of MMs which you generally dont get in regular shops . 2 floors full of chocolates . Of course , everything is pricey here .  About 10 for 12 pound !  They also have merchandise but it is expensive and we didnt buy it .

Service was slow . Billing was also very slow . Its just over crowded on weekends and summer evenings ..  colorful and kids loved everything here ..  very close to Times Square .. good experience overall .. 4 stars   Visiting the MM store at Times Square was such a fun and colorful experience! The vibrant displays and the sheer variety of MMs really set the mood. One of the highlights was getting my niece's face printed on MM candies  it made for a unique and personalized gift. The staff was helpful, and the process was super easy. A mustvisit for anyone who loves MMs or wants a memorable NYC souvenir! The MMs Store in Times Square, New York, is a delightful and vibrant experience that is a mustvisit for candy lovers and tourists alike. Spread across three spacious floors, the store is not only massive but also incredibly wellorganized, making it easy to explore every colorful corner. Each level offers something unique, from lifesize MM characters perfect for photos to an incredible variety of merchandise, including mugs, coffee and water tumblers, pillows, and tshirts.

One of the highlights is the mixandmatch MM section, where you can create your own blend of candies. The price is determined by weight, so you can grab a little or a lot, depending on your sweet tooth. The elevators make it accessible for everyone, and the availability of restrooms is a thoughtful touch for visitors who might be spending a lot of time shopping and exploring.

The staff at the store are exceptionally friendly and add to the overall positive experience. Theyre always ready to help with a smile, whether youre picking out the perfect MM blend or choosing the right souvenir.

Overall, the MMs Store in Times Square is a fun, interactive, and engaging shopping experience that appeals to all ages. Whether you're a fan of the candy or just looking for a unique NYC experience, this store is worth the visit.

Cute little store in Chinatown.  Middle of the block, it's so small you might miss it if you blink.
It's a delightful store with lots of colors.  So much to look at in such a small space.
They have a great selection of chopsticks from just a couple dollars to expensive.  Some sets come in beautiful boxes for gifting.
They also have a few small ceramic tea service sets and fans and chopstick stands.  The chopstick stands were all different styles.  Some were cute animals and butterflies, and some were mother of pearl or abalone.  Also they have chopsticks for children that are attached at the top.
If you want several of the same, they have more in the drawers if you ask. The salesperson was very nice. Great store, like a chopstick museum, I always come here when I have a chance. You can buy beautiful chopsticks from 5 to 500. Handpainted and carved chopsticks, silver chopsticks, so much selection. Also, great chopsticks for kids too. I noticed recently, theyve started to sell handpainted silk fans and beaded bracelets. All great quality! One of the best stores in Chinatown. Love this place. Beautiful and cute chopsticks . Some cheap, some expensive. Bought a hairpin as well. Staff is friendly. Be aware there is a charge to use ur card. I had an urge to pick up some nice chopsticks since I want to eat food in a traditional japanese fashion so I went to Yunhong on the advice of someone. I like the store it had a large assortment of chopsticks from 520 and more plastic and metal and wood as well. They had chopstick holders too I never knew there was such a thing go figure. I picked up a nice looking set of 4 chopsticks for 8 and I was very happy with the look and the price of the chopsticks. Great for gifts or just for yourselves, everything is really beautiful and high quality!

It was cool to stop in this place and see the variety of items in the store from nostalgic to modern candies and items. Glad we stopped in and picked up some now and then items. Definitely worth a visit. wall to wall, floor to ceiling CANDY!!!! its kinda like a Willy Wonka feeling. you can eat everything in there  the smell is scrumptious 
we found parking right out front,  went in for our candy haul!!!! our bag was filed to the top! how could we not?! the candy selection was beyond satisfying. if youre in the east side area, 108 rivington st. to be exact GOOOO INNNN! youll thank me a ton of calories later  Economy Candy is a true gem in New York City, serving as the oldest retail candy shop in the Big Apple. As soon as you step inside, you're surrounded by candy in every direction, filling the air with a sweet aroma. The shelves are adorned with nostalgic knickknacks, offering a glimpse into the past and adding to the shop's charming ambiance. Established in 1937, Economy Candy has been delighting customers with its wide selection of candies from not only the United States but also from around the world.

Visiting Economy Candy is an experience in itself, with so much to see and tempt your taste buds. However, be prepared to exercise some serious selfcontrol, as it's nearly impossible to leave without making a purchase.

While the overall experience at Economy Candy is delightful, there was a slight disappointment regarding pricing accuracy. Some prices didn't match what was indicated, and unfortunately, there was no flexibility at the checkout regarding the prices listed on the items I am not referring to the tax which is added at checkout. This left a sour taste in our mouths, especially when the discrepancy caused some unexpected budget constraints for the children. Despite this minor hiccup, the staff were friendly and helpful when we had questions.

Overall, Economy Candy is a mustvisit destination for candy lovers in New York City, offering a delightful array of treats and a charming atmosphere that will leave you with sweet memories. incredible large collection of candy from all over the world. if you are looking for something special as a gift or to treat yourself just go there! from Korea to German candy you can find everything there. also the place is quite unique with its looks and the old signs etc. oldest candystore in NYC! I found out about this place through a FB reel that popped up on my feed. Had to check it out.

Surrounding area  Located in lower Manhattan. Parking is a challenge. The one perk is that it's very close to Katz. Who wouldn't  love a GREAT pastrami sandwich, hahaha?

Store The store is a true candy heaven. Upon walking in, you are transformed into a Willy Wonka candy world!!!  I saw candy that took me back to my childhood years.  They have EVERY type of candy you can imagine. The physical aspect of the store definitely needs an upgrade. It is not accessible to all.  Wheelchairs and walkers  wouldn't be able to maneuver around the tight aisles. The aisles are cramped, and walking freely is a challenge. If someone is in the aisle already, there is no space to get by.

The shopping bags are really cute  costs 1.00

Customer Service  Upon checking out, the gentleman that rang me up was either mad to be there, just over everything, or wanted to go home. For working in a candy store, the disposition was definitely off.

I'm not sure I would return.

"My first visit to Hershey's Chocolate World in Times Square with my Dad was amazing! My inner child was loving every moment, surrounded by all the chocolatey goodness. I tried the Hersheys smore milkshake, and it was absolutely deliciousrich, creamy, and perfectly sweet. I also had a blast taking lots of pictures to capture the fun atmosphere. It's definitely a mustvisit spot for any chocolate lover!" Hey is Hershey's, they've got tons of treats for everyone! Chocolate and pretzels and shirts and more! You can get a sundae or print your face on a chocolate bar wrapped or get a smore and more! We got two stuff your cup Reese's, not knowing how huge they were, but wow! It's like an ice cream place where you get mixins smooshed in on a marble counter, but this is peanut butter filling and you can get chips and Reese's bits and marshmallows and more mixed in, and it's dolloped into a huge chocolate cup. You shouldn't eat it in one go, but it's hard not to, it's so yummy Go visit if you love chocolate.
There are things you could see only there. And you get one chocolate for free on entrance and the environment is simply nice.
Huge and unique chocolates. And with affordable prices as well. Highly recommended. The sign is bigger than life. They have everything you could think of in here. They even give you a free piece of chocolate when you walk in the door. The staff was amazing. For being in times square, the store was clean. I felt like such a kid. The Hershey store was amazing! So much chocolate.. The prices for the chocolate are pretty good, and the staff there was so friendly and helpful.  The station to make your own peanut butter cup is amazing, there are so many items there to fill your chocolate cup with... The smores station is also great,  they have options of smores, sundays, and milk shakes that are all inspired by different Hershey chocolates. I will definitely be going there again..
