Almost too much to take in! Employees were wildly helpful and sincerely nice. Loved browsing through the amazing selection of merchandise. So many activities like wand personalizing and broom flying. Everybody in the store looked happy to be there and enjoying the experience. So many fun installations and real props from the movie. Great stop! Tourist trap store, well executed with some great items at top dollar prices 40 for a plastic wand, a must see for any Harry Potter fan.
Had the Butterbeer ice cream, I can honestly say it was one of the nicest ice creams I've ever had, but for 10 I should hope so.
There's a mantle piece with framed photos of cast members that have passed away, which I found particularly moving.  All the displays were fantastic. Its a great place to visit in New York. It has a wide selection of souvenirs and exclusive official merchandise from the store, meaning you wont find it in any park.

There is a special section for Butterbeer and themed sweets.

Downstairs, there is an area dedicated exclusively to different versions of the books and the art design of the entire franchise. It's a great HP shop experience on 2 levels. Awesome coffee!  Found it by accident when visiting the Friends experience and flat iron building, Gramercy Park is around the corner so make it a morning sightseeing. Your welcome.  Nothing much else to add that hasn't already been said.

If you love HP like most millennials and my daughters do, this is an amazing store. Got butter beer soft serve and a hedwig  pram suit for my future baby. Fantastic decor and it was cool to see adults so happy to relive their childhood.

I stumbled upon this place while exploring the area and decided to check it out. The window decorations caught my eye, so I went inside. They have a great selection of unique birthday cards, wrapping paper, diaries, and other stationery items, all organized by theme. It was fun to browse through everything!

I didnt buy anything since I didnt have an immediate need, but Ill definitely consider coming back in the future. Thanks for the warm welcome! Really cute store! Great prices on the stickers, I got two of the smaller individual sheets and they were only 3. Theres a 5 card minimum. There are a lot of cards here for every occasions, and some smaller items like notebooks too. A good selection of different color pens but I wish they had some washi tape too. I love stationary stores, and this one is a new favorite. It's so great and weird. Their card selection is insane a great range of classy crowd pleasers to wonderfully odd. They have a great supply of things everything from a tinned fish candle to some tiny wizard stickers. If you're looking for a place to get a friend a gift, a card for any occasion, or just something nice and cute and funny for yourself, take yourself to this wonderful shop. It'll put a smile on your face. Wonderful little shop. Incredibly decorated  so cute. Great place to pop in for a gift for someone or some cute knick knacks. Prices were a tad high, but expected when going into a shop where most things are made by smaller artists.

Does not seem wheelchair accessible as there are about 5 or 6 steps up to get into the shop.

Overall would recommend! Cute to even just stop in and browse. I didn't know I needed the perfect 2023 Christmas cards, but somehow Greenwich Letterpress did! The store is chockfull of notebooks, Le Pens!, gifts and the best stationary and desk gear. I also bought a French turtle tape dispenser at this delightful store. You'll find something for everyone at this NYC gem  shop there today!

리뷰:
Its certainly meant to draw tourists in in what is a very tourist heavy part of town and it does its job well. Lego stores are always fun to visit and this is no exception.

The inside is full of large scale builds of things like cityscapes, large scale minifigs and more. What was really cool for me to see is that some of the builds from Lego Masters were even featured in this store. Its really cool to see builds from TV in person.

One of the things people seemed to love was the create your own minifig station setup. There were lots of people creating their own custom minifig. In addition to that it seemed like the staff were also doing some live demos of sets at stations setup within the store.

This was a really cool store to visit. I didn't buy anything this time but I had a blast checking out all the cool stuff packed within.

As a heads up this is a twostory store. If you are mobility challenged there is an elevator that will take you between both levels. If you can handle stairs they are worth taking once if only to see all the cool builds up the stairwell. Of all the Lego stores I have been to, this was by far the COOLEST experience!! This place was awesome! We went here mostly to see the Lego Masters Finale winners build which was so freaking awesome! We were not let down! This place displays some of the coolest builds I have ever seen! Including a whole staircase full on your way to the second level! Best Lego store in town!!! Skip the other Lego stores.

We designed our own mini figures. The only downside was that there werent enough variety in pants type andor accessory type to suit the ones that we designed so we settled on a couple of things. Overall a great experience though. The LEGO Store on 5th Avenue in New York City is a mustvisit destination for LEGO enthusiasts of all ages. Located in the heart of Manhattan, this flagship store is an impressive blend of creativity, fun, and retail excitement. The first thing you notice upon entering is the incredible LEGO displays, including largescale models of iconic NYC landmarks like the Statue of Liberty and the Empire State Building, all crafted from thousands of LEGO bricks. One of the coolest Lego stores I've ever been to. It had a lot of fun decor and the employees were very friendly. One even helped me make a mosaic of myself didn't buy it tho. There's also a LEGO brick made of a meteorite which is pretty epic.

The Disney Store in Times Square is a magical experience for fans of all ages! The store is beautifully designed, featuring stunning displays of beloved characters and immersive themed sections. Theres a fantastic selection of merchandise, from plush toys to apparel and collectibles. The atmosphere is lively, and the Cast Members are friendly and helpful. Dont miss the enchanting staircase and the giant Disney character sculptures they make for great photo opportunities! A mustvisit for Disney lovers and a fun stop for anyone exploring Times Square Oh to feel like a kid again! Maybe Im too biased to leave a review here, but all these smallest details, all these characters, so many cute and nostalgic characters I loved the store and bought many things here. One can spend hours and hours here, so much to see and so much to enjoy  magic was definitely in the air Terrible experience if going for limited items, waited on line for 4 hours, managers allowed and assisted line cutters, and anyone behind them ended up with nothing.

There was 0 compassion or empathy from a handful of the staff.

Less than 170 that were on the actual line got the d23 set. I was 193rd on line and there was probably another 200 behind me. What a terrible experience. Why even bother advertising with less than 200 stock. Every other place had much more.

Could have said the first 200 will get one instead of making potentially 300 people wait for hours and for nothing.

Again such a bad experience to go through with Disney and leaves a bad taste in your mouth We love this Disney Store located in Times Square, New York! The moment you stepped into this large and elegant store, it felt like you have been transported to an enchanting and magical world of Disney! We visited during Christmas and we love the wonderful atmosphere with all the gifts and toys displayed neatly on the shelves. Adults and kids alike were walking around choosing their favourite toys. Love the beautiful and magnificent castle inside the store, with its big chandelier! Truly a fun experience for the young and old. Its so amazing to watch the Disney store and reminisce on childhood memories. They have a great collection of toys snd swaggers from all the Disney movies from all times. Some of the characters I didnt recognize because theyre Gen Z TV shows that I havent watched lol.

Its a perfect place to buy souvenirs from, but you definitely need to watch it cause you can easily get carried away and spend hundreds of dollars in the store.

FAO Schwarz is a fantastic place to visit, especially if you're a fan of toys! I initially went there for dinner with Jellycat, but I quickly realized its one of the best toy shops Ive ever been to. If you have children, they will absolutely love it here, and be prepared to spend a good amount of moneythere are just so many amazing options! From playing astronaut in the space shuttle upstairs to choosing candy with his daddy, to building a bear downstairs, we all had an incredibly happy time! We were there celebrating the end of my husbands chemo treatments and the whole atmosphere of the store was such a calm and happy vibe. Thank you for sprinkling in a bit of magic into our lives during such a difficult time for my son and for creating a space where we could all relax and escape for a few minutes!

Visiting the Jewish Museum in New York City was a truly enriching experience that I highly recommend to all. The museum beautifully showcases the rich history and culture of the Jewish people through a diverse collection of art, artifacts, and exhibitions. From ancient artifacts to contemporary works, there is something for everyone to appreciate and learn from.

The following are some 

Tips and Tricks
1. Plan your visit ahead of time to make the most of your experience. Check the museum's website for current exhibitions and special events.
2. Consider taking a guided tour to gain deeper insights into the museum's collection and history.
3. Don't miss the museum's shop, which offers unique gifts and books related to Jewish art and culture.
4. Take your time exploring each exhibit and allow yourself to soak in the rich stories and symbolism behind the artworks.

Cost
 General Admission 18
 Seniors 65 12
 Students 8
 Children under 18 Free

With its thoughtful exhibitions, knowledgeable staff, and welcoming atmosphere, it's a mustvisit destination for anyone interested in Jewish history and culture. Five stars without a doubt! We didn't feel comfortable. It's like we were the odd ones if you know what I mean. My daughter is always interested in knowing about different cultures and religions but it's not always so welcoming. And I checked in my jacket and when I was ready to go it was toss to the side on a rail. The person had no other excuse but to say that it fell on the floor and instead of hanging it back up on hanger 97. She tossed it to the side with plenty of coat hangers. It's wasn't packed. I am not interested in going back there again. But I'm glad my daughter still got to explore and read about the different art. Just sad how we still live in a world where even though we bleed the same color we are STILL not comfortable with one another. Thanks anyways. It was free so at least I'm not that disappointed. I digress.  I love his museum. Always something new and intetesting! Went to see Gaby Aghion  Chloe exhibit. We took a tourpublic tour at no cost offered by Museum. It was very intetesting and informative and provided an intetesting view on the whole concept of Chloe. And of course a stunning collection of clothes by different designers who worked for Chloe.
Also went through the other parts of museum. Saw lots of new art objects. The permanent collection rotating every few month so that visitors are able to see as many onjects as possible. And the museum store is like a continuation of museum. I went today and did the 1 hour tour, which was excellent.  The docent really knew her material and loved her Jewish history. On my own, i toured the museum, which had a nice arrangement of artwork and artists. I was happy to go to this beautiful place as a Christian and learn some new things. I visted for Mood of the moment Gaby Aghion and the house of Chlo. The exhibition itself is well collected of the history pieces from each designer period with the story of each designer in that timing. Another floor also has others exhibition as well for 3 floor in general.

Long overdue review but my nowhusband bought my engagement ring from Jangmi last year. Ive gotten so many compliments from friends, family, coworkers and even strangers on my ring. We were so impressed with the ring that we even bought our wedding bands from them. The quality of their rings are impeccable and the staffs commitment to finding our perfect rings are commendable. They were able to work with our budget and explained the differences in sizes, colors, clarity, cuts, settings, and more in detail. They also offered to clean our rings each time and we left feeling like . They went above and beyond in providing us with the best service and the best rings. Lya was especially helpful on multiple occasions when we were there. Highly recommend anyone who is looking for engagement ringswedding bands to check out Jangmi! This is a long overdue review! My husband and I have been coming to here since before we officially got engaged. I first stopped at Jangmi with my best friend to figure out what I wanted for my engagement ring. Jangmi was one of four stores I had appointments at, and it was the only place that I felt valued us stopping in. I got the sense that most sales reps dont take women who dont come in with their significant other very seriously and felt brushed off by the employees at the other stores well reviewed and all throughout the city. I wish I could remember who helped me that first visit, but he was really warm, informative, and not at all pushy. I sent my now husband to have my engagement ring done there, along with a list of wants for the ring. He worked with Mrs. Kim to design the engagement ring I wanted. We both had such good experiences there that we knew wed go back when it was time for our wedding.

Since my engagement ring, my husband and I have unofficially made Jangmi our diamondfine jewelry spot. It started when we went back for our wedding bands. I ended up buying James two different bands. He wanted a simple band, but then spotted a ring that not only suited him really well but also fit him perfectly. We felt like Mrs. Kim was kind, informative, and not at all pushy during this time, so we asked for pricing on other pieces as we still needed earrings and necklaces for the wedding. Weve since gone back for some other pieces after our wedding. Everything weve purchased yes, we have a lot of Jangmi pieces now lol prioritizes combining structural integrity with aesthetics.

Mrs. Kim will let you know if she thinks something wont work well and gives other helpful suggestions, and, no, I dont mean more expensive options. Mrs. Kim has always tried to show me what I ask for and also make her own suggestions. I havent been led wrong yet! Shes picked out pieces for me that I wouldnt have chosen for myself that end up looking great, but has never once pushed me to purchase anything. Both Mrs. and Mr. Kim are just really passionate about their jewelry, and you can tell they love to share that with anyone who is interested.

My husband and I cant seem to leave Jangmi without extra pieces even when we are just there to get something serviced or pick up one thing because of the excellent variety in styles and, of course, how gracious the Kims are. Obviously, I cant say enough good things, but Ill stop here and just leave some photos. My husbands studs and my two necklaces in the wedding photos are all from Jangmi, and you can see how they pop even from further away. So grateful to have found Jangmi through super positive reviews from Reddit  Google  insta. Im so so so happy with my ring and am so grateful to Mr and Mrs Kim. Mrs Kim knows exactly what to suggest to elevate every design, has such an excellent grasp of all things diamonds and I just loved seeing them every time  Ill have to visit frequently because theyre such a delight. Theyre both so nice!! You can really trust them  you really need to go to Jangmi for engagementwedding rings. I plan on going to them for anything diamond related in the future  thank you so much Mr  Mrs Kim for making this experience so special! I LOVE my rings!

The staff was wonderful and made sure to give us their undivided attention while we picked out the rings we wanted. They even offer free services if there is anything you need done to make sure it's exactly what you want.

We needed the rings VERY quickly and they were able to get them done in time for our trip!

Thank you so much for such beautiful rings and excellent customer service! Thank you so much Lya and the owners for helping me selecting this wonderful diamond  proposal ring. The ring came out much better than I imagined and my gf now finance absolutely loves it! Great service and very thorough in explaining various options. They were very patient in answering all my questions and highly responsive whenever I reached out. I would highly recommend this place over any other places in the diamond district!

주소: 60 W 8th St, New York, NY 10011, USA
리뷰:
Great staff  friendly, welcoming and knowledgeable! This is the only See's Candies store on the East Coast, with product flown in weekly from Los Angeles to ensure freshness! This store feels like a classic oldfashioned candy shop with checkerboard flooring and an elegant presentation of candy and truffles in display cases  a huge variety. My favorites are the Peppermint Krispies, Dark Molasses Chips, Dark Nougat, and Raspberry Truffles  so delicious! This place is legendary.

Growing up in California, every mall had a Sees Candies store  Its a California tradition with a very loyal customer base and a history that goes back generations. This definitely takes me back to the best of my childhood. There are very few of these stores on the East Coast and I do appreciate how rare and special it is to have this store here. See's Candies is a wonderful place to visit. The decor takes you back to a special time that is warm, magical and full of cherished family memories.
The chocolate is amazing!! So fresh and delicious, with so many flavors to choose from. Great for gifts, and great to treat yourself! I love it!!
The staff were very pleasant, the manager is kind and informative, they know their candy.
This is also the only See's on the East coast.
I got a 1 pound box of chocolates, I let the team know what kind of flavors myself and my husband typically like, and they built a box with great suggestions in mind.
My favorite is strawberry cream, everything was so good.
Thank you, I will be back! A friend loves Sees, so tend to pop in to buy him a box when I'm in the area. Cute little place, with nice ambience on entering  despite the small size.

Chocolates are good but wildly expensive. They only very rarely seem to have the Mixed Milk box, the one I actually want, but will make up a custom box if you ask. Not as good for travel, however, and works out more expensive.

Service is hit and miss. It's always been either quiet and deserted when I've gone in and still can't predict. One guy with kind of auburn curly hair has been there a few times and may be a manager? He's great and makes you feel like an actual person, not an inconvenience. Others can be nice or disinterested.

A peculiarity that drives me crazy is their insistence on saying "you don't want a bag, do you?" and "you don't want a receipt, do you?". Apparently the franchise owners demand it and it rankles. Maybe I DO want a bag andor receipt? Minor thing, but it comes across as a bit paternalistic, patronising and miserly. Such a bizarre approach to customer service. I just spent over 100 on chocolate, so I'd prefer you didn't become dismissive as I hand over the money. This place is more expensive than the web site and other shops in the West.
Also, you cannot use gift cards at this shop.

Staff told me that its more expensive because its in NYC. Lol..

Just to give you an example, the toffee ettes 1 lb can is 33 at this shop but the rest is 29.

Staffs were friendly and nice. They were patience to answer all my questions. They wrapped my chocolate boxes nice.
